items.title: Senior Angular & Node Developer
items.content:
*
Senior Angular & Node Developer

Recordsure

At Recordsure we pride ourselves on our development professionalism, using as
many modern practices & tools as suit the things we need to build.

Agile practices are our norm, whilst we organise ourselves on Jira, Atlassian
and GitHub, keeping in constant daily contact with one-another on Skype.

We love delivering, innovating & collaborating and support each other in our
individual learnings and group challenges.

You will work remotely for us, probably from your home in Eastern Europe or
the APAC region, and we will do everything possible to make you feel part of
the team... including a trip to London once or twice a year. 

You will be expected to work 8 hours per weekday. To ensure effective
communication with the rest of the team, and also to take part in required
agile ceremonies and meetings, your working day must include the hours 10:00 to
14:00 GMT, including during British Summer Time.

About the job

You’ll be joining our front-end team, working primarily with Angular.js on our
web portal application. Strong experience is required in this area along with
its underpinnings: JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

The web portal enables users to access and search records, listen to
recordings, perform administration tasks, configure and view reports, view
dashboard metrics, and see the results of our speech, semantic analysis and
other machine learning system outputs. Some of the features you’ll be building
will be straightforward CRUD, while others will involve rich and highly bespoke
functionality.

We also have a server side component written in Node.js for performing
administrative functions relating to organisations, users, authentication, etc.
You must have at least an intermediate level of Node.js experience. We’ll
provide you with the support necessary to build your experience to an advanced
level if necessary.

About you

You care about quality: not just in the end product, but also in delivering
code that other developers can maintain.

You wouldn’t dream of working outside of a continuous integration environment
and whilst you’re self-sufficient in the areas you know, you also aren’t afraid
to ask for help when you need it.

Your skills

* Angular.js: strong experience with Angular 1.x.
* Node.js: intermediate level or better.
* MongoDB.
* Frontend testing: Mocha / Jasmine / Karma or similar.
* Asynchronous coding techniques: callbacks / Promises / the async library.
* Using JavaScript build tools: grunt / gulp / webpack.
* Using JavaScript package managers: npm / bower / yarn.
* Javascript: you’re an expert, but also know when to rely on CSS to save a
CPU cycle or two.
* HTML5 and CSS3.
* RESTful JSON APIs.
* Refactoring skills: you know how to improve code that is out-of-date and
not well maintained when necessary.
* Clean coding and documentation: you write code that is easy for others to
understand first and foremost, only adding comments and documentation when
truly necessary. You avoid writing clever or elegant code at the expense of
readability.
* Excellent browser debugging and troubleshooting skills - primarily on
desktop browsers, but this may expand to mobile devices should our business
requirements change.
* Security ingrained: You know your CAPTCHAs from your SQL injection from
your brute force attacks, and how to specify and develop to mitigate them.
* English: not only did you understand this advert, but you could write it
too - and more importantly, you can debate your technical solutions with
developers and business people around the world.
Desirable skills

* Experience with the LESS CSS preprocessor (or Sass).
* Express and Connect middleware.
* Graphic / design / UX skills.
* Experience using Docker and Vagrant.
* OAuth 2.0 APIs and passport.js.
Who are Recordsure

Genuinely the leader in providing face-to-face recording solutions in
Financial Services, we have also now started providing solutions to government.

Our new approach to evaluating sales conversations and interviews using
Artificial Intelligence is gathering steam - and has enough wow factor to start
taking on the $billion companies that provide 'customer contact analytics' - as
we have a world class speech, language and data science team and some amazing
developers, testers and technical operations experts to wrap it all with
product.

items.title: Senior C# Desktop Developer
items.content:
*
Senior C# Desktop Developer

Recordsure

At Recordsure we pride ourselves on our development professionalism, using as
many modern practices & tools as suit the things we need to build.

Agile practices are our norm, whilst we organise ourselves on Jira, Confluence
and GitHub, keeping in constant daily contact with one-another on Skype.

We love delivering, innovating & collaborating; and support each other in our
individual learnings and group challenges.

You will work remotely for us from wherever your home happens to be, and we
will do everything possible to make you feel part of the team... including a
trip to London once or twice a year. 

You will be expected to work 8 hours per weekday. To ensure effective
communication with the rest of the team, and also to take part in required
agile ceremonies and meetings, your working day must include the hours 10:00 to
14:00 GMT, including during British Summer Time.

Your first and future projects

You will be working on enhancements to RecordSure Capture: a unique solution
for recording the audio and other media for face-to-face interviews.

Depending on when you join, your initial project is likely either to be
integrating PhantomJS to convert our CEFSharp forms into PDFs, for writing to
local USB devices as a record of the form data captured during an interview, or
integrating C++ libraries written in-house for audio conferencing into the
existing C# WPF application that communicates with a self hosted WCF service.

Once that is done, there will be a host of other interaction recording
facilities to be designed and developed, be that Skype command-and-control,
video capture integration, desktop/screen recording or helping build some real
time streaming capabilities.

About you

You’re a self-starter: a  highly enthusiastic and motivated C# developer used
to agreeing design patterns, technology and architecture decisions, coding
frameworks and standards with other senior developers.

You will have a solid knowledge in C# 5.0 or above and can have robust
discussions about WPF, MVVM, Prism, WCF and its operation contracts and
callbacks.

You care about quality: not just in the end product, but also in delivering
code that other developers can maintain.

You should be up to speed with modern TDD practices, working in an agile
environment, with excellent unit test coverage, and be familiar with continuous
integration and deployment practises. You should have the ability to own a user
story from start to finish. 

Your skills

* C#: Visual Studio keeps you warm at night, whilst type safety and Generics
makes you feel content.
* WPF: you know your data templates from control templates and dependency
properties from attached properties. 
* WCF: you know which binding to use in what situations and you know how to
design a scalable server 
* Multi-threading and async: you know your critical sections from your
mutexes, semaphores and locks; and your brain works like the Windows scheduler
so deciding between thread or and process based design is as natural to you as
breathing
* Unit testing: you visualise how to unit test it before you even create a
class for the business feature
* Design patterns and SOLID: you know that you don’t have to re-invent the
wheel but instead look for design patterns and practises that will help you
look good among your peers.
* Wix, Reactive Extensions:if you’ve got any experience, we’ll gladly use it.
If not, then we’ll be asking you to learn it!
* English: not only did you understand this advert, but you could write it
too - and more importantly, you can debate your technical solutions with
developers and business people around the world.
Who are Recordsure

We are genuinely the leader in providing face-to-face recording solutions in
Financial Services, and we have also now started providing solutions to
government.

Our new approach to evaluating sales conversations and interviews using
Artificial Intelligence is gathering steam - and has enough wow factor to start
taking on the $billion companies that provide 'customer contact analytics' - as
we have a world class speech, language and data science team and some amazing
developers, testers and technical operations experts to wrap it all up in a
product.

items.title: Tech Lead
items.content:
*
Tech Lead

Clevertech

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Develop
world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

*
75% of your time coding the riskiest requirements and leading the technical
strategy;

*
25% of your time project management.

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients.
You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated
successful product launches.

___

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code.
You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an
effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the
client’s concerns as well as a colleague’s concerns. You are always learning
and are transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Technically, you are senior developer yourself and you have over 3 years of
experience in leading software development teams. New tools are great, but
fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are
what deliver projects. Our standard projects use Full Stack Javascript, however
we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or
C++ .

Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries
and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your
capabilities.

BENEFITS

OWN YOUR TIME

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust
and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and
commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people
in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at
a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would
expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail -
we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of
Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech
skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development.
CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry
exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and
then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz
.

items.title: Senior Software Developer - Rails, React
items.content:
*
Senior Software Developer - Rails, React

GovPredict

About Us

We are GovPredict, an exponentially growing, Y Combinator-backed startup
in Washington, DC. Our software+data product helps companies predict what the
US government will do. We work with Fortune 500 publicly-traded
companies, Ivy-League universities, and United States House and Senate
offices. Our culture is “build fast and ask questions later.” But we value
rigor and best-practices too. Our team of powerful engineers is building the
software that no government has ever seen before.

Our team of top-tier software developers is distributed around the world and
our sales + business development is in the USA.

Our Stack

* Ruby on Rails backend
* ReactJS front end
* Python scrapers
* AWS
If you’re a strong engineer but haven’t used these technologies, we may
still interview you!

About the Job

As a senior developer at GovPredict, you will be responsible for
architecting software, providing technical leadership, writing smart+scalable
code, and helping grow our team. You will be a team leader working with data
nobody has ever worked with before.

You will work on frontend and backend features. Our product pulls in data
from structured APIs or from unstructured sources with our python scrapers. We
then manipulate, organize, and display it in never before seen ways to our
customers.

Other Facts

* Remote work
* Full time
* Competitive pay
* NOT an agency or outsourcing company — you will work only on one product
Requirements

* Strong engineering background
* 4+ years industry experience
* Comfortable with automated software testing (such as RSpec)
* Desire to work with Ruby, Javascript, and Python
* Can take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
* Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally in English (other
team members speak Russian, Romanian, Spanish, Polish, German, and Portuguese
in addition)
* Eager to learn new things and apply them quickly
* Ability to mentor and guide fellow team members constructively
* Willing to work full-time with some overlap on US business hours (8am to
6pm EST)

items.title: Mid/Senior Software Developer - Python, Data, Scraping
items.content:
*
Mid/Senior Software Developer - Python, Data, Scraping

GovPredict

About Us

We are GovPredict, an exponentially growing, Y Combinator-backed startup
in Washington, DC. Our software+data product helps companies predict what the
US government will do. We work with Fortune 500 publicly-traded
companies, Ivy-League universities, and United States House and Senate
offices. Our culture is “build fast and ask questions later.” But we value
rigor and best-practices too. Our team of powerful engineers is building the
software that no government has ever seen before.

Our team of top-tier software developers is distributed around the world and
our sales + business development is in the USA.

Our Stack

* Ruby on Rails backend
* ReactJS front end
* Python scrapers
* AWS
If you’re a strong engineer but haven’t used these technologies, we may
still interview you!

About the Job

As an engineer focused on Python, data, and scraping, you will be responsible
for the life-blood of our company. Our product pulls in data from structured
APIs or from unstructured sources with our python scrapers. We then manipulate,
organize, and display it in never before seen ways to our customers. We take
data integrity seriously because that's why our clients love us. 

You will help to improve our data flow, build our data pipeline, write new
scrapers, maintain existing ones, and improve the architecture our various data
import tools. You will apply best practices and write smart+scalable code. You
will be working with data nobody has ever worked with before. 

Other Facts

* Remote work
* Full time
* Competitive pay
* NOT an agency or outsourcing company — you will work only on one product
Requirements

* Strong engineering background
* 4+ years industry experience
* Comfortable with automated software testing (such as RSpec)
* Desire to work with Ruby, Javascript, and Python
* Can take a task from gathering requirements to deployment and maintenance
* Able to communicate effectively in writing and orally in English (other
team members speak Russian, Romanian, Spanish, Polish, German, and Portuguese
in addition)
* Eager to learn new things and apply them quickly
* Ability to mentor and guide fellow team members constructively
* Willing to work full-time with some overlap on US business hours (8am to
6pm EST)

items.title: Clevertech: Tech Lead
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Develop
world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

- 75% of your time coding the riskiest requirements and leading the technical
strategy;

- 25% of your time project management.

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients.
You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated
successful product launches.

___

REQUIREMENTS:

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code.
You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an
effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the
client’s concerns as well as a colleague’s concerns. You are always learning
and are transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Technically, you are senior developer yourself and you have over 3 years of
experience in leading software development teams. New tools are great, but
fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are
what deliver projects. Our standard projects use Full Stack Javascript, however
we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or
C++ .

Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries
and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your
capabilities.










BENEFITS


OWN YOUR TIME

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust
and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and
commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people
in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

FOCUSED WORK

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at
a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would
expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail -
we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of
Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

LEARN AT YOUR EDGES

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech
skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development.
CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry
exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

RECHARGE TIME

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and
then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz
.



Apply:

items.title: Fuel Made: Front End Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(North America)

We're a small remote team focused 100% on building the best ecommerce
experiences on the web using Shopify. We're engaged in interesting projects for
nationally recognized brands, rapidly growing ecommerce startups and lots of
folks in between.

Leading out with strong design, a tight and friendly development process, and
an attention to quality is how we have delighted our clients, and grown our
agency. Our quality-driven approach has led to success, and opportunities we
couldn’t have imagined.

Today, our clients are successful, established merchants with specialized
shops and complex needs. The opportunity to service these clients is
challenging and exciting.

We are seeking an experienced front end web developer to join our small team
to help us continue this tradition, leading our clients (and our agency) into
the future.


Why you might enjoy working with us:


* Freedom to really care about what you're doing (we're focused on quality)
* Freedom to work. We get out of your way and trust you to do what you do
best.
* Freedom to own projects from a development standpoint
* Freedom to focus and get really good at what you do (we're focused 100% on
ecommerce and the Shopify platform)
You:


* Deep appreciation for, and understanding of good web design
* Expertise in HTML/CSS/Sass/JS
* Familiar with OOCSS, SMACSS, or BEM
* Well versed in RWD techniques and mobile performance
* Write well-structured (vanilla) JavaScript
* Write your own jQuery plugins
* Comfortable with building front-end templates using JSON APIs
* Take pride in clean, readable code
More importantly -


* Desire to learn (curiosity)
* Passion for all things web
* Willingness to do things the right way (especially, late in the game when
it's hard)
* Easy and enjoyable to work with
* Have obsessive attention to detail
* Communicate well in writing
If you also have experience with Shopify and/or Liquid that's a big plus. If
you don't, but are a quick study, we'll help you get up to speed.

The position: You’ll work with our designers who will provide design
direction. You’ll typically be the sole developer on your projects, taking full
ownership of a project from a development standpoint. We are craftsmen/women.
This is a position where your attention to detail and desire to do things right
will be encouraged and rewarded.

Location: You must be located in North America. You must be willing to work
west coast hours.

items.title: Milkshake Studio: Junior/Mid Full Stack Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(New York)

About the Position

Milkshake Studio is looking for an experienced, design-savvy Full Stack
Engineer to join our team. As a Milkshake developer you will be working on both
large complex products and smaller whimsical sites. You will be responsible for

We are a small team of creatives, technologists, strategists, and doers. We

Some stuff about you:

JavaScript, Gulp, LESS)

Laravel)
* You have 2+ years of responsive development
* You are experience with cross-browser compatibility

* You are detailed oriented and care about clean code

Bonus Points:

* You have experience working with mobile apps

Compensation:

* Competitive Salary
* Snacks, coffee, tea, beer
* Freedom to work from anywhere
* Flexible schedule
* Unlimited Vacation


Job Perks: Snacks, coffee, tea, beer Freedom to work from anywhere Flexible
schedule Unlimited Vacation

Apply: Please send us a resume, git account, and anything else you want to
share.

items.title: Too Pixel: PHP/MySQL/Laravel/Wordpress/e-Commerce web developer
items.content:
Full-time

(We research people from eastern Europe only)

Job Description :


* Creating web application, back-end orientated, with also ability to
understand how to integrate the front-end part into your apps
* Projects from scratch (web applications for example), but also maintenance
tasks on existing websites and applications we did in the past
* Collaborate with and support other team members (we use Asana as project
management)
* Javascript, CSS and Javascript skills are really good to know even if
that's not what we ask you primary
* Strong MySQL skills are required, you must know about Database relations,
foreign keys, indexes and all of that to make performing web apps

is required

you the same quality that we want to deliver
If your experience and skillset match our needs and you're interested in
working on projects like those found atwww.toopixel.swiss
we'd love to hear from you.



Apply: Send us concrete examples of your experience with links to websites you
created or created with other agencies or companies, and also send your salary
expectations. Every candidate will have to pass a concrete and short test of
1-2 hours of real coding, will be something simple but we need to see what
you're able to do before hiring you. We will hire only freelancers from
European countries (eg. Lithuania, Croatia, Latvia, Ukraine, Hungarian, etc.).

items.title: Cosmic: Front-End Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Santa Cruz, CA)

Cosmic is looking to add an outstanding Front-End Developer to join our team.
We seek that rare someone with a strong understanding of developing for the web
who also has a careful eye for design.


Must Haves

* Extensive knowledge of HTML/Sass(SCSS)/JS
* Exceptional ability to translate designs into semantic, accessible
front-end code
* Strong understanding of modern web technologies and workflows
* Strong understanding of mobile & responsive design & development practices
* Solid understanding of GitHub/Version Control and working with a team of
developers
* Solid understanding and appreciation for color, typography, and composition
* Ability to work directly with designers to implement designs and provide
design feedback if necessary
* Solid understanding of designing in the browser
* Ability to defend and explain your technical recommendations to other team
members, Creative Director, and clients
* Solid understanding integrating front-end code with CMS’s (ex: Craft CMS,
Expression Engine, Wordpress)
* Ability to work in an iterative and flexible environment
* Good communication skills, a positive attitude, enjoy working in a central,
visible downtown location with an open studio space
* Enjoy in-person collaboration and respectful of other team members opinions
and perspectives
* A self-starting attitude with the ability to thrive in a nonhierarchical
and self-directed organization
* Ability to dive in and learn new things and find solutions to technical
problems
* You’ve got to be into beautiful design and awesome user experiences to be a
good fit
Nice To Haves

* Experience with modern front-end javascript platforms (node.js, angular.js,
etc.)
* Experience with modern backend languages (Rails, Python, etc.)
* A deeper understanding of web / UI design.
* Experience (1-2 years) in either a creative agency or the internal
development department of an established company
* Direct Experience with Craft CMS
* An appreciation of music, art, the great outdoors, and good food is a plus
Perks & Benefits

* We work a 4-day work week. Enjoy 3-day weekends every week.
* 401k Plan + employer contributions after a year on the job
* 2 weeks paid vacation
* Paid Holidays include most major holidays
* The Studio closes for the last two weeks of the year as an additional long
paid holiday
* Studio located in Santa Cruz, CA
* Beer from local breweries on tap
* Join a humble, collaborative team with a flat hierarchy
Community Involvement

* We’re helping to shape the local design, tech, and coworking communities
* We host monthly events related to design, tech and our local clients,
paired with local brewers and vineyards
* We rotate through who gets a turn at hosting, so you’ve got to be okay with
mingling and representing Cosmic with crowds of 200+
What We’re All About

Cosmic is a full-service creative agency powered by designers, developers,
storytellers, and strategists who create strategically-focused brands,
websites, and applications.

To Apply

Please send a link to your recent work, resume, or GitHub profile and your
standard hourly rate to hello@designbycosmic.com.



Job Perks: We provide a Retina MacBook Pro and 27-inch Apple LED Cinema
Display 4 day work week (we work 4 x 10's) 5 weeks paid vacation 401k Craft
Beer on Tap / Artisanal Coffee Located in the heart of downtown Work for a
company that values a healthy work/life balance

Apply:

items.title: First+Third: Front End Developer
items.content:
Contract

(Anywhere in the US)

Front End Developer

We're looking for an eager front end developer willing to help on a variety of
projects, big and small. As a small development company we do a mixture of
client work and our own projects. Some of our work is high profile and some are
pet projects but all of it is done with cutting edge tech and with a high
attention to detail. All of our team keeps up with the latest trends and
innovations in the development world and we try to incorporate and experiment
with new tech whenever it makes sense for the project.


This is a four month contract position with the opportunity to extend or
become full-time. We are looking for someone that can commit to at least 75% of
their availability during our normal work hours, 9 AM - 6 PM PST. Number of
years of experience isn’t as important as finding someone that can figure
things out by themselves but knows when to ask for help. Most importantly we
want to find someone that works well remotely, is communicative, and interested
in new development trends and design styles. (Did we mention that we love to
experiment?)





What you need to be awesome at


* Javascript (we do a TON of Javascript development)
* CSS (Preprocessors like Less, Sass, or PostCSS)
* Mobile / Responsive development
* Styleguide / Modular / Atomic based development
* Turning SketchApp files into HTML / CSS / JS
* Task Runners (Grunt, Gulp, etc.)
* Proficient in Command Line / Terminal
* Git / Github
* Experience with ES6 / ES2015



Other tech we use (not required, but the more you know the better)

* Node.js
* Wordpress/PHP
* Asana
* Slack
* Harvest
* Mongo
* SVG and SVG animation
* YAML
* AWS
* Docker


Please send us your GitHub username, resume, something you’re proud of
building, your availability and your billing rate.


About Us

First and Third is a web agency in Hermosa Beach, California. Our passion is
user experience. We are obsessed with turning complex problems into intuitive
solutions and use the newest tech trends and open source libraries to create
simple, user-friendly and attractive websites and apps. We value each client's
vision, while providing guidance through the design and development process
with efficiency and expertise. First+Third has worked with organizations like
LeanIn.Org , Facebook , Slickdeals
, Simms/Mann Institute
, and CuddleBright
. You can view our Github profile at
https://github.com/firstandthird .



Job Perks: Remote, cutting edge tech, casual work environment, variety of
projects

Apply: Please send us your GitHub username, resume, something you’re proud of
building, your availability and your billing rate.​

items.title: Modern Tribe: Senior WordPress Frontend Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Modern Tribe is looking for a talented WordPress frontend
developer in North America to join our team as a part-time employee. (If you
are in Central or South America and think you’d be a good fit – lets talk).

Do you have a dog eared copy of ‘Secrets of the JavaScript Ninja’
beside your
bed? Would you be excited to work on large scale WordPress projects that
actually require your JavaScript skills? Would you be stoked to push the limits
of where JavaScript and WordPress can play nicely together?

The opportunity calls for a mixed set of skills. We need someone with expert
level CSS skills, impeccable WordPress experience, and solid JavaScript, PHP &
MySQL skills. Experience building sites with extremely large loads is a plus.
We like our stuff to run fast and smooth. We are looking for a unique snowflake
– maybe it’s you?

Who We Are

Modern Tribe, Inc. is a rapidly growing software & design
company. We develop custom solutions for some of the world’s largest companies,
government institutions and smaller growing organizations. We pride ourselves
on our ability to bridge people and technology and to bring the passion and
dedication of an entrepreneur to every project. Our team is composed of
talented employees and freelancers around North & South America (and a
smattering across the globe).

Who You Are

We love working with each other because we have built a culture that suits us
well. We work primarily with freelancers and coordinate their talents for large
projects. To be on our team, you must be:

* Happy: Where there is a will, there is a way. Having a positive disposition
allows us to achieve great things and to support each other.
* Helpful: Always looking for ways that you can help others.
* Curious: It is essential that you have a passion for learning. Technology
changes daily, and life has a way of constantly raising the bar.
* Accountable: Our clients expect us to get the right thing done on budget
and on time. Communicating expectations and meeting them is the cornerstone of
success.
We’re currently working on high-profile WordPress implementations that range
between conventional to seriously bleeding edge. We will want to see plugin
code examples – public plugins are ideal. We want people that are able to
develop code that can withstand high profile sites and intense loads. You
should be comfortable working as part of a team – your code will have to
integrate into an existing architecture. If tightly optimized code get’s you
excited – you’re probably a good fit.

Responsibilities

* ARCHITECT: Work with design team to architect and document theme solutions
using best practices
* ADAPT: Integrate code into existing theme architecture
* COLLABORATE: Coordinate with designers, back-end developers and other theme
devs
* PERFORM: Produce code solutions that load quickly and smoothly
* REVIEW: Be a part of QA team and optimize / review other team members’ code

Personal Competencies


* Strong communication skills
* Experience working as part of a remote team
* Self-motivated, detail-oriented
* Strong organizational skills
* A methodical approach to all tasks
* Ability to prioritize workloads and meet deadlines
* Fluent English speaker
Required Knowledge & Experience

* Knowledge of WordPress theming best practices
* Experience with LESS or Sass
* Comfort in advanced JavaScript projects
* Mid level to advanced PHP Skills
* Basic LAMP / LEMPS skills
* GIT
* Proficiency at local environment development
* Experience with extending and customizing the WordPress media manager and
other JavaScript in the WordPress admin
* Experience with API requests and parsing responses in JavaScript
Additional Experience (Bonus Points)



* Examples of plugins / code that you’ve released to the open source community
* Experience with es6 and Babel
* Advanced WordPress debug skills
* Apple Mac dev environment
* Experience with JavaScript templating. We like: Angular, Backbone,
Handlebars, React and Underscores templating. Basically we hope you will be pro
at one of the many different templating options out there right now.

Location




Work from anywhere in North, Central or South America. Please do not apply if
your timezone is outside of the US range and if you are not totally fluent in
English. You just need a computer and a strong wifi signal to support daily
video chats with the Tribe.

Compensation

Pay range is between $35-$50 US per hour commensurate with qualifications and
experience. The gig is about10-15 hours a week of work. This opportunity is for
apart-time job, though we are always seeking longer relationships with kick-ass
people.






Job Perks: We believe distributed working is a way of life. We offer
consistency in expectations, payment, and support. We believe in learning from
each other and fostering personal growth. Also, if you work enough with us,
we’ll bring you on the team trips (see http://tri.be/blog/team-trip-2016/).

Apply: BEFORE APPLYING, please read this gig listing carefully. So many people
seem to apply without actually reading it. Once you’ve read the listing in full
and are confident you’re ready to rock, hit the “Apply” button and fill out the
form.

items.title: Ben Kinney Companies Tech Division: Software Engineer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

You will be joining a diverse and talented team of engineers. Your
responsibilities will include maintaining and implementing new features in a
monolithic Rails application.

The primary responsibility for this position will be to design and develop
applications for Ben Kinney Tech and to coordinate with the rest of the team
working on different layers of the infrastructure. We are a company
experiencing exciting growth. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may
change at any time based on organizational need.

Job Responsibilities

- Implement and maintain readable, reliable, and tested solutions in Ruby.

- Design robust, scalable, and secure features.

- Integrate user-facing elements developed by the product and development
teams.

- Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems.

- Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.

- Act as a coach and mentor to teammates. No formal supervisory experience
needed.

Competencies

- A commitment to collaborative problem solving, simplistic design, and
building quality products.

- Expertise with the Ruby programming language and the Ruby on Rails framework.

- Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript, HTML5,
and CSS3.

- Experience with test-driven development including mocks/fakes/stubs.

- Experience with RSpec and Capybara a bonus.

- Understanding of fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.

- Competency with JavaScript. React experience a bonus.

- Strong database design and administration skills.

- Familiarity with continuous integration.

- Experience with version control (Git).

- Understanding of web service architecture design (e.g. REST).

- Alignment with core values of Ben Kinney Tech.

- Desire to learn and grow with the company.

Education and Experience

-CS/Engineering degree, Computer Science degree, or demonstrated equivalent
experience.

-Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with
disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Ben Kinney Companies Tech Division: The Ben Kinney Companies is a family of
SAAS companies headquartered in Bellingham, WA. We serve thousands of clients
in the US and Canada. Our software products are advanced tools to help real
estate agents manage and grow their businesses and teams.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify
identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the
required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. As a
policy, the Ben Kinney Companies company does not sponsor employment visas.

Ben Kinney Companies Tech Division is an Equal Employment Opportunity
employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment
without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.








Job Perks: -Unlimited Vacation -Medical Benefits -Paid Time Off

Apply:

items.title: Entermotion: Web Developer
items.content:
Contract

(Anywhere)

About Entermotion.
Entermotion is a creative design and programming studio. We work on a variety
of projects for our clients, from identity design to application development.
We're a dispersed team, and we're comfortable collaborating remotely.



What's the Job?
We're looking for a PHP web developer with strong skills, and diverse
experience. Would like an individual willing to commit 40 hours a week.
Contract work would extend a minimum of 6 months assuming competency. Possibly
extending to full time employment with the right candidate.



Skills.
We know that web developers have different strengths in different areas. Here
are some of the categories we would assess candidates based on. Strength in one
area can offset weakness in another. Call out any specific skills you have, and
talk to us about them.


* CSS3
* HTML5
* JS/jQuery
* Responsive interfaces
* Turning PSD mockups and wireframes into living interfaces
* General PHP knowledge
* Targeting mobile devices
* CSS3 Animations
* An eye for detail. Every 1px matter!
* PHP by hand.
* PHP in libraries.
* Experience working in a team.
* Experience in application development.
* Experience building account controls, billing, etc.
* Knowledge of 3rd party API integration like Amazon AWS, Twilio, Twitter,
Facebook,
* Front end development. If you have specific skills in front end work, -js,
css, etc. we want to hear about it.



Position.
This is a remote position. We're used to working as a dispersed team so it's
important that you're cool with collaborating mostly online. We're flexible on

How to Apply.
Apply via Authentic Jobs interface.



Include 5 bullet points about why you would be a good fit, your salary
expectations, and a link to past work. We would rather have a short email than
a long resume.



Please feel free to apply again even if you have in the past.



ATTENTION!
Individuals ONLY. No recruiters or agencies please.



Job Perks: Great group of people. All the benefits of remote working and
setting your own schedule. Paid maternity and paternity at full time
employment. Potential for revenue share on some projects.

Apply: Individuals ONLY. No recruiters or agencies please.

items.title: Upskill: Full-Stack Javascript Developer
items.content:
Freelance

(Anywhere)

Overview

Upskill is seeking a full-stack Javascript web developer for curriculum design
in a flexible role (see below). This is your chance to influence the next
generation of software engineers by helping to design a curriculum and training
program that sets the foundation for great programmers. Our goal at Upskill is
to create rigorous training programs and online courses that push students
beyond their limits with a learn-by-building approach.

We DO NOT aim to push students through a "get-skilled-quick" 12-week program.
Instead, we focus on creating well-made courses that guide our students through
every step of the way to becoming top quality software engineers, no matter how
long it takes. This means teaching students to think like engineers and
empowering them with critical thinking skills - with emphasis on sound
programming techniques (and of course, LOTS of practice).

Your Role

Your work will directly impact our 50,000+ students and their careers. You
will work closely with our content creation team to design training programs
based on tools and techniques used in a Javascript web developer's day-to-day
work. You'll teach students programming fundamentals like algorithms and data
structures. You'll also teach them how to use tools like text editors, the
command line, Git, React, Angular, Node, and how to design and build
applications with vanilla Javascript.

This role involves zero "busy work" or administrative tasks - all of your time
will be focused on the type of work described above, in a fun, flexible
environment. We value enjoyable work experiences and do not tolerate
bureaucracy or egos.

Job Requirements

You must meet the following requirements to qualify for an interview:

* Mid- or Senior-level software engineer with 3-5 years of experience
* Preferably 3 years of full-stack Javascript development experience
* Expert level knowledge of vanilla Javascript (ES5, ES6, and beyond)
* CS degree strongly preferred (or equivalent knowledge of data structures
and algorithms)
* Professional experience with large-scale applications built with React,
Angular, Node, Express, and MongoDB
* Experience with Vue.js is a plus
* Passion for educating future programmers - many of them will go on to do
great things
Other Details

This job is flexible. You can work from home or in-person with our team in Los
Angeles, CA (Santa Monica area). You can set your own hours, and you do not
need to leave your full-time or part-time job (you can work after hours if you
prefer). Compensation is highly competitive - simply put, we'll make it worth
your time and more, if you're the right candidate.

Please drop a few lines (or a cover letter) telling us why you're the right
fit for the job. Also include your portfolio and Github profile.



Job Perks: Choose your own hours. Work from home or in sunny Los Angeles.
Highly competitive compensation. Impact the future of thousands of programmers.

Apply: No agencies, only individuals who are senior level Javascript
developers. All others will be ignored.

items.title: Hireology: Front End Engineer
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

As part of our User Experience team, you would be joining a small but
passionate group of individuals who work daily to improve our user’s
experience. We work with Product to help scope, design, and test new features
and interfaces. We work with Engineering to help breathe life into those
interfaces and bring them to our users. We work with Customer Success to
understand and address existing pain points.

Your job? To be an integral part of that team, understanding the value of user
experience while getting your hands dirty in the code.

Hireology is based in Chicago, but our Engineering and UX teams work remotely,
so you’ll have the option of working from the comfort of your home or right in
our office if you’re local. Compensation is very competitive, and we offer a
full benefits package.

The things you will do:

* Work with the Product and User Experience team to identify new features and
functionality
* Work with Engineering teams to develop new features with HTML, JavaScript,
and React on the front end, integrating with Ruby on Rails on the back end
* Work with Engineering teams to convert prototypes to working views in the
application
* Refactor HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to follow front-end standards
* Pair with both Engineering and User Experience teams to solve problems
collaboratively
* Be passionate about growing professionally
* Handle hotfixes for any front end issues that may be discovered
* Work to improve how we write and test Javascript
* Investigate new front end technologies and how they might be applied to
improve the user experience
* Manage global CSS/SASS to ensure it follows BEM conventions and is clean,
consistent, and efficient.
What you need:

* Minimum three years of experience in a software development role (Engineer,
Designer, QA, Project Manager)
* Passion for creating great user experiences on multiple devices
* Solid understanding of HTML, CSS/SASS, and responsive development
* Understanding of JavaScript design patterns and frameworks (in particular
React)
* Knowledge of Node.js, npm, and webpack
* Knowledge of Git (or other source control systems)
* Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States
Bonus points for experience with:

* Interaction Design
* Front-end testing solutions
* Ruby on Rails
* Working remotely


Job Perks: Competitive Compensation Annual Education Budget Unlimited
Discretionary Time Off Great Benefits Work with great people doing great things
High growth startup environment, with opportunity for personal and professional
growth

Apply:

items.title: Clevertech: Front End Javascript Engineer
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is looking for a Front End Javascript Engineer to join our global
team. We are looking for team members to help us develop world class software
products for the most exclusive organizations in the world. We have been at
this for sixteen years, and continue to grow off our best asset, our people.

In this role you will have significant front end responsibility in one of our
project development teams to ensure client satisfaction by using modern design
patterns, and cutting edge development thinking including isomorphic code,
stateless components, and functional concepts.

---

REQUIREMENTS

Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code.
You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an
effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and
colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator
even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek
to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

Well qualified applicants will have deep experience in the latest libraries
and programming techniques. You will have accomplishments that showcase your
capabilities by their success and technical depth. You can expect to work on
Angular, React with Redux, and Webpack. You might also have a chance to use
React Native, Electron, Bootstrap and D3.

---

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust
and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and
commute avoiders love working here. We are a collective of like minded people
in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at
a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would
expect in world class product delivery teams. And keep your eye on the mail -
we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of
Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech
skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development.
CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry
exposure are all on offer here.

And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and
then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out
[why.clevertech.biz](http://why.clevertech.biz).

items.title: American Poolplayers Association: UI/UX Designer for web/mobile App
items.content:
Part-time

(Anywhere)

The American Poolplayers Association, the world’s largest organization of
recreational pool leagues, is currently seeking an experienced UI designer to
help us put the finishing touches on our projects which include a new member
website and mobile app that will help our members have fun, meet people and
play pool around the world.

You can expect to:

* Take on a myriad of project types including responsive websites, mobile
apps, desktop applications, WordPress, social media integrations…. that combine
the best parts of sites like ESPN and Facebook into a custom experience to
accentuate our brand.
* Help us establish a consistent UI across all of our platforms.
* Work with a team of talented and experienced individuals across every
spectrum of the organization.
* Partner with our Creative Director to clarify image and function.
* Be a part of a tight development team who only focus on solving problems.
* Use tools like Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch and XD to create interactive
features and layouts.
* Implement desired layouts to actual finished projects being used by
hundreds of thousands of engaged users.
* Perform revisions based on user the feedback of those engaged users.
The main focus of this UI position is to take technical and experiential
information and transform it into a delightful and functional experience.

Skills we are looking for include:

* Expertise in UI/UX design.
* A great portfolio that highlights similar successful projects.
* Excellent design skills.
* Photoshop/Sketch/XD expertise.
* Fantastic communication skills.
* Proficient with HTML, CSS and Javascript to put together UI/UX prototypes
is a plus.
* Knowledge with JIRA and Git is a plus.
* Familiarity with Cordova/PhoneGap hybrid apps
* A great attitude and desire to work in a true team atmosphere.
If this sounds like something you are interested in, send your resume, rate
and any other appropriate info todevteam@poolplayers.com




Apply:

items.title: Advant Interactive: Full-Stack Web Developer with WordPress Experience
items.content:
Freelance

(Long Beach, CA)

We are Advant Interactive , a group of design
and developer nerds. We’re a small bunch so far but we have plans for world
domination. We’re based in Long Beach, just a Kobe 3-pointer from the beach,
and a taxi ride from the heart of LA. We are on the lookout for an individual
who seeks a position at the cutting edge of web development. All candidates
must work with speed and enjoy sweating over tight deadlines. They must live to
code and not be happy until they’ve seen a project through from insemination to
birth to that first day at kindergarten.

Who are you? The dude (or dudette) for the role should have a minimum of two
years in the world of web development, with a portfolio that’s likely to blow
our socks off.

Because we live in the virtual world, it does not matter where you reside, as
long as you are available during business hours. Still reading?

Can you tick these boxes?

● You are a Wordpress Whiz and have extensive knowledge/experience with
front-end work.

● You’re a dab hand in JavaScript/jQuery (If you can write plugins as well
then that’s a bonus, but you must be able to write and implement
small-to-medium scripts at least)


● You’re an old pro in writing raw HTML and CSS (especially HTML5 and CSS3)

● You are experienced working with PHP tasks

● You’re used to developing in a LAMP environment

● You’re on-the-button with current Web standards, optimization techniques and
best practices

● You’re full of knowledge regarding Twitter Bootstrap and Foundation

● You’re a web developer with two or more years of professional industry
experience

And it goes without saying You can both talk the talk and walk the walk. You
have 20:20 vision when it comes to fine details. You consider missing a
deadline one of the seven deadly sins. If you’ve gotten this far, you could be
just what we’re looking for. Send us your portfolio and we’ll talk.



Job Perks: Work remotely!

Apply: 1. Send us links to your best work online. 2. Let us know your
location. 3. Please indicate your freelance hourly rate. 4. Provide your
current availability.

items.title: Fracture: Remote Javascript/React Developer
items.content:
Freelance

(Gainesville, FL)





Our web development team is growing and we’re looking for a talented front-end
developer with very strong Javascript & React skills. If you’re self-driven,
have a passion for developing user interfaces and a history of working remote
then this may be the perfect opportunity for you to work with our internal team
on an exciting, modern project.

Our existing team members will provide all of the graphics, prototypes and
assets and then you’ll turn it into a functioning desktop and mobile web
application.

Do you have all of these capabilities?

* Expert level competency in front-end development with a strong emphasis on
javascript
* Proficiency with:
* Express, Jade or comparable framework
* React
* Mustache, Handlebars or comparable templating engine
* CSS Preprocessors (e.g. LESS)
* Gulp or Grunt
* Experience with Node.js a bonus
* Working knowledge of API integrations
* Nuance attention to code documentation
* Experience with version control using Git
* Basic bash experience a plus
If you check out with the qualifications above, make sure this is you too:

* US applicants only
* Preferably Eastern or Central time zones
* Minimum 5 years of experience in a working environment
* Must have prior experience working remote
* All applicants must include a link to an online portfolio or repo of work.
Submissions without this information will not be considered.
Fracture is a company that believes in the power of the printed image. At our
Fractory in Gainesville, Florida we print digital images directly onto glass.
Our handcrafted product provides our customers a unique, modern way to display
their images. We’re passionate about photography, customer satisfaction,
employee happiness, earth friendliness and making things with our own hands
here in the United States.

# No phone calls or direct emails. Please apply online.




Apply: # No phone calls or direct emails. Please apply online.

items.title: Phuse: Front-end Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Toronto)

We’re looking for an experienced front-end developer to join our remote team.
We work with all sorts of clients—from startups to government agencies—to build
engaging sites and applications. We love to work with people who are as excited
to create clean, functional user experiences as we are. Our ideal colleague can
help us bring everything from brochure site designs to end-to-end JavaScript
applications to life.

Who Is Phuse?

Phuse is a remote team of creatives who craft websites, interfaces and brands,
from concept to completion.

The person who fills this position will:

* be in EST or CST
* have excellent communication skills
* be motivated to learn and constantly improve
* have plenty of web development industry experience
* be adept at HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* know their way around Git, Slack and Trello
* be able to meet deadlines and interface with clients
* be considered more seriously based on experience with server side languages


Job Perks: This position pays $49,000 - $52,000 annually. At Phuse, everyone
enjoys: • 30 hour work weeks • a flexible schedule • annual Phuser gathering •
company-supported growth and learning opportunities • an open vacation policy •
home office stipend

Apply: If you believe you would be a great fit for our team you should send an
email to work@phuse.ca with the subject “[Your name] – Application for
Front-End Developer” and include the following: • a link to your portfolio and
your GitHub profile if you have one • a personal cover letter • your Resume/CV,
with a concise list of your proficiencies • a funny raccoon-related gif, please
• your location • where you found this posted Let your enthusiasm shine
through! We’ll get back to you ASAP to schedule an interview if your
application seems like a good fit. Phuse welcomes diversity and encourages
applications from all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will
receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion,
sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status,
protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are
committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring
process. At any stage of the hiring process, Human Resources will work with
applicants requesting accommodation. Please, no recruiters, agencies, or those
unwilling to accept an assignment leading to full-time employment.

items.title: Clevertech: Tech Lead
items.content:
Full-time

(Remote)

DESCRIPTION:




Clevertech is looking for a Tech Lead to join our worldwide team. Develop
world class software products for the most exclusive companies in the world.

75% of your time coding the riskiest requirements and leading the technical
strategy

25% of your time project management.

You set the mood on the team. Not only internally but also with our clients.
You get excited about getting the best out of team member and have demonstrated
successful product launches.




REQUIREMENTS:




Clevertech looks for craftsmen developers who take ownership of their code.
You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an
effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about the
client’s concerns as well as a colleague’s concerns. You are always learning
and are transparent communicator even when it is challenging.

Technically, you are senior developer yourself and you have over 3 years of
experience in leading software development teams. New tools are great, but
fundamentals of data structures, design patterns, and programming practices are
what deliver projects. Our standard projects use Full Stack Javascript, however
we also other technologies such as Python, Clojure, Go and on occasion Java or
C++ .

Well qualified applicants will have deep experiences in the latest libraries
and programming techniques. You have accomplishments that showcase your
capabilities.

___

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust
and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and

in over ten countries, and our global perspective shapes our every move.

a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would
