items.title: Creative WordPress Developer - Remote
items.content:
Description:
Pixelsmith is a web development company based in Minneapolis. We work closely
with designers and creative agencies to bring projects to life with true
digital craftsmanship.
At Pixelsmith, we are constantly evolving with technology and trends Ã¢Â Â so
we can bring even the most challenging ideas to life. Together, we'll build
something amazing.
Job Overview:
Looking for an insightful, personable and flexible team member to join our
terrific team at Pixelsmith. 
Do you enjoy cutting apart design files and making beautiful CSS/JS
animations? Do you like running through custom post types and taxonomies in
WordPress?
Our mission at Pixelsmith is to craft custom themes. If you typically pull a
dozen plugins off the shelf and spend more time in the admin panel than in
code, then this isn't the job for you.
We focus on a progressive enhancement where our sites will function in older
browsers but we'll leverage Modernizr and CSS3 to enhance interactions for
users devices that support it.
Skills and Expertise or Requirements:
* 5+ years working with HTML, CSS and Javascript to create rich interactive
content
* 3+ years experience with WordPress, PHP and MySQL
* Developing cross-browser compatible solutions
* Experience with modern front-end tools (e.g. Sass, Grunt)
* Experience working with version control systems (e.g. Git)
* Building responsive pages that are mobile-optimized
* Experience developing AJAX interfaces with libraries and frameworks (e.g.
JQuery, Angular)
* Experience developing eCommerce
Plus: 

* Experience using 3D Javascript libraries (e.g. ThreeJS)
* Experience testing with BrowserStack and Litmus
* Experience with layout and design applications such as Adobe CC and Sketch
* Experience implementing tracking events such as Google Analytics
What We Offer:
* Ability to work remotely from home, coffee shop or even bed
* Work with nationally known clients on high caliber designs
* Casual attire
* Opportunities for company sponsored learning events or continued education
* Partner with clients that understand a high quality product is a blend of
great design and development.
Sound like you?
Apply now and have some stellar work examples ready to showcase your skills
along with salary requirements.

To apply: Send a resume to work@pixelsmith.co

items.title: Ruby on Rails Developer for Email Startup
items.content:
Hi, weÃ¢Â Â re looking for a Ruby on Rails developer with 4 years+ development
experience to join join Sendicate to help make email newsletters better. 
About Sendicate
Sendicate.net is our start up thatÃ¢Â Â s fixing email newsletters. WeÃ¢Â Â re
focussed on a simpler, better user experience for people sending email
newsletters, from sign up and on-boarding to sending. WeÃ¢Â Â re growing fast,
and now send 40 million emails a month!  WeÃ¢Â Â re build with Ruby on Rails,
using sidekiq to process the background jobs.  Our customer base is growing,
and are very keen for more features. We are a small remote team of two in
Melbourne and one in Adelaide, two in Europe and one in the Philippines.   
We're looking for a developer with at least four yearÃ¢Â Â s experience in
either Ruby on Rails full stack development, or in other related languages who
want to get into RoR development. 
Key Responsibilities:
Ã Â·         Full stack development of new features on Sendicate, under
direction from our Lead Developer
Ã Â·         Code reviews of our other developers commits, and suggesting
improvements 
Ã Â·         UI implementation of new features
Ã Â·         Bug fixing and Support 
We want someone who is:
Ã Â·         Experienced in Full-Stack Ruby on Rails development in a team
setting
Ã Â·         Passion for excellent UX for all things web and mobile
Ã Â·         Experience using Git version control
Ã Â·         Great communication in English (we use Github, Slack and Trello)
Ã Â·         Friendly, with an interest in the latest tech, and a passion for
learning 
Why Join?
Ã Â·         Grow an awesome product that people love
Ã Â·         Friendly, flexible team and work environment
Ã Â·         Improve your Rails knowledge and experience using cutting edge
development 
Full Time ongoing (though we are flexible if part time is required)
Location: Melbourne or Adelaide (Australia) or Remote
Remuneration: Pay based on Experience 
 

To apply: Please send through a hello to george@sendicate.net
with CV and
github profile, and some example projects youÃ¢Â Â ve worked on.

items.title: Senior Mobile Developer
items.content:
We're looking for an experienced mobile developer to join our remote dev team.
We need someone with Android (using Java) and iOS (using either Objective-C or
Swift) front-end development experience. This person will be completely
responsible for coding our native mobile clients, working with the back-end
lead, QA and product manager and designer to ensure we have high quality Jibble
mobile apps that are produced to specification using GUI prototypes.

REQUIREMENTS
* A minimum of 7 years coding experience and at least 4 years in iOS/Android
development
* Experience with continuous integration and deployment (we use Travis)
* Peer code reviews
* Producing high quality maintainable code
* Agile (Kanban) software development
BENEFITS
* Competitive Salary
* Equity - we want everyone to share in the success and it's worthy to note
we have a seasoned founding team that have previously made successful exits
from other startups and built highly profitable companies
* Work almost whenever you want and wherever you want, whilst aiming for 35
working hours a week. Most of us work most weekdays.
* Take time off almost whenever you want - be courteous so that your time off
is not disruptive to other team members and try to be fair to yourself and the
company. We want our team members to avoid burnout, we want them to be happy.
We want them to love their work and love their life!
To apply: http://jibble.workable.com

items.title: Java Chief Software Architect
items.content:
Java Chief Software Architect - $50/hr


Are you ready to hit the ground running in a dynamic leadership role within
our fast-paced environment?


Do you want to develop for developers in a company that believes in empowering
software development and creating higher quality code?


Do you enjoy developing solutions to complex architectural problems?


Do you get excited at the idea of building the future of innovation, designing
and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers, and being
a hands-on peer leader of top development resources?


Are you eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the
world while earning $100,000 USD, all from the comfort of your home?


If you said yes to any of the questions above, this role is for you.

Company Description:

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are
history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams
collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition
to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of
finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our innovative contractor
based model, does not mean temporary - it means flexibility with global teams.
Everyone is a contractor, your managers, your peers, etc. Our platform connects
customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs.
But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and
relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

Job Description:



As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million
dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work
as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from
lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to
technical team leader and solution evangelist. Its your responsibility to
ensure that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and
quality of the product. We want to give you the ability to look at code in ways
it has never been looked at before, to understand the interdependency in the
code.


We are empowering software development and creating higher quality code by
using the latest technologies and toolsets. We are excited about using data to
make decisions, we are bringing big data and analysis to software development.
We are on the cutting edge of software development, and we innovate
improvements on the newest technologies. We want people who are adaptable and
can learn new things, and can use new ideas and concepts to solve business
problems.



Key Responsibilities:


*
Developing expertise in one or more of our proprietary enterprise software
products.

*
Leveraging your broad technology capability set and maintain a level of
excitement in using various technologies to architect, develop, and iteratively
deploy real enterprise class software.

*
Achieving an expert level understanding of our customers environments and
their use of our products.

*
Architecting and leading weekly technical delivery of one or more products in
a way that maintains an unyielding focus on quality while matching the needs of
the target customer base.

*
Creating solutions architecture, algorithms, and designs for solutions that
scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements

*
Leading a small team of Software Engineers to apply software engineering
practices and implement automations across all elements of solution delivery

*
Manage accountability of team members, with pinpoint focus on quality;
Personally accountable for resolution of the most technically challenging issues

items.content:
Ready to make $60,000 USD while working from the comfort of your home? Eager
to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this
role is for you. Work through Crossover, and youll earn the most competitive
wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and

ensure quality and productivity by implementing automation wherever possible.

items.title: Front End Web Developer
items.content:
We’re looking for a Front End Web Developer to develop and own the consumer
facing website and mobile web presence for Knock. We’re looking for someone
with strong views who is passionate about creating great products and can drive
themselves without lots of supervision.


We are a distributed company with employees in multiple different states, so
location is not an issue as long as you have good experience with Slack and
Trello.


Responsibilities



*

Building compelling experiences and features for the web client



*

Collaborating with design & product on new interfaces and interactions



*

Implementing product features, releases, and fixes



*

Maintaining build tools, tests, and overall healthy architecture

items.title: Senior WordPress Developer
items.content:
Themify is Toronto based commercial WordPress theme development company. Our
international team of designers and developers are driven and passionate
towards building and enhancing exceptional products for a growing community of
users. We are currently looking for full time senior developer, either in
office or remote, to expand our vision to make the web better. We provide
competitive salary based on experience.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently onlyseeking
candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.


We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both
on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is
passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to
have a real impact on a product used by over265,000users from 190 different
countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is
also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.


 What skills are we looking for?


As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on
developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS,
Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production gradeJavaScript and
Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to
handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process
driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will
also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate
issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

items.title: Senior Media Software Engineer
items.content:
Senior Media Software Engineer


At Railroad19, we develop customized software solutions and provide software
development services. We are currently seeking a talented senior level  Media
Software Engineer with strong back-end development experience in JavaScript and
Python in a Rhino environment. You will be responsible for developing software
related to media asset management systems, automated metadata management and
media delivery capabilities. This role requires the ability to customize
workflows for their Global Media Operations globally.


As a Railroad19 employee, you will be part of a company that values your work
and gives you the tools you need to succeed. Our headquarters is in Saratoga
Springs, New York, but this position can be remote. Railroad19 provides
competitive compensation and excellent benefits.


Core Responsibilities:


* Customize workflows for their Global Media Operations (GMO) around content
prep and delivery for US domestic & international content delivery.


* Develop software related to media asset management systems, automated
metadata management and media delivery capabilities.


* Integrate various software platforms through vendor APIs.


* Work with vendors on API implementation and troubleshooting, suggesting
necessary features and identifying enhancement opportunities.


* Engineer integrated software solutions to anticipate and enable business
growth, productivity, and reliability.


* Identify automation opportunities within media workflows, and develop
appropriate software solutions.


* Coordinate with internal operational & technology and vendor support teams
to isolate issues and drive resolution.


* Configure test, QA and production environments with proper packages and
dependencies to enable development.


* Work with client user groups to ensure operational needs are being
appropriately met.


* Provide 24x7 On-Air systems support and daily operations support; some
overnight shift-schedule support will be required during on-air roll-out and
special broadcast events.


* Other duties as assigned.

items.title: Security Appliances Developer
items.content:
Assist in design,development and delivery to QA of a wide range of high
performance, feature-rich next generation security appliances in a commercial
environment of regular release cycles. Individual will be collaborating with
product management, supply/chain operations, sales engineering and customer
support teams through all stages of design process.  


Needs to be self-motivated and able to implement everything from
close-to-metal packet pickup to high-level object-oriented concepts. Willing to
add to GUI. Will be required to work quickly with little impact on product
stability and performance without daily guidance from superiors.


WE DO NOT ENGAGE WITH OUTSIDE RECRUITERS

items.title: Front End Web Developer
items.content:
Bricata’s mission is to develop innovative, extensible security solutions that
deliver superior long-term value to our customers. Our vision is to be
recognized as the most reliable technology partner for effective, sustainable
security as well as a respected contributor to our industry and social
communities.


We are searching for someone to start out as an individual contributor,
ideally growing to lead the team that will design and implement the
browser-based user interface for a range of cyber security applications used to
both manage and analyze results from security sensors. Individual will be
expected to design, code review and test complex, highly technical software
within a commercial environment of current release cycles. As a team lead, one
will assist in growing the local team, becoming manager or director of CMC
development team.


WE DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES ENGAGE WITH OUTSIDE RECRUITERS

items.title: Software Developer
items.content:
ITG is an independent broker and financial technology provider that partners
with global traders and portfolio managers throughout the investment process,
from investment decision through settlement. With 15 offices in 9 countries and
multi-asset capabilities that support the needs of institutional investors and
hedge funds, we combine the power of global reach with the precision of local
vision.


We founded ITG in 1987 with the launch of the POSIT® crossing network, along
with an unwavering commitment to provide actionable investment insights and
improved outcomes for our clients.  Over the years, we’ve deepened that
commitment by creating a powerful network of intellectual capital, true
industry experience, and market-leading technology. We bring together
award-winning tools and high-touch expertise to help clients understand market
trends, improve performance, mitigate risk, and navigate increasingly complex
markets.


We are your trusted, strategic partner, offering objective insights and
guidance through complicated and changing global market structures. Our clients
know they can count on us to put their interests first.


Our liquidity offerings deliver quality matches before others know they exist.
Our platforms provide fast, open access to a broad universe of global brokers
and providers. Our research and analytics access data is derived from exclusive
proprietary sources, delivering in-depth insights other research sources can’t
provide. And our trading desk offers deep local knowledge around the globe.


For more information on ITG, please visit www.itg.com


We are currently hiring multiple positions for Software Developers within the
London office, offering from junior to senior levels.


Responsibilities





We are looking for an exceptional software engineer with outstanding coding
skills and the ambition to play a major role in our company; you would join our
talented team of developers and finance experts, to help us build our next gen
products. Your work will have a direct impact on the way thousands of people
trade billions of dollars’ worth of financial products on a daily basis.


Expertise in object oriented language (C# or C++) is absolutely mandatory, and
knowledge of other development tools/language/techniques that we use, such as
SQL Server, Python, Lua and Event Sourcing, would be a plus.






* Working with large scale high availability data warehouses and servers

* Working on both real time and end of day reporting/compliance solutions.

* Designing application architecture, interfaces, user interfaces and storage
strategies

* Seeing the big picture, help steer the company in the right direction and
keep-up to date with best practice

* Working on a Global projects with global teams

* Ability to help as first line support in GMT time zone

items.title: Frontend Data Visualisation/Plugin Developer
items.content:
About UsStreamhub is a London based video analytics startup with a worldwide
customer base. We provide big data analytics reporting tools for media
companies helping them target, grow and monetise loyal video audiences. Our
dashboard simplifies complex data insights offering a range of visualisations
that helps discover key patterns and trends. ItÃ¢Â Â s all about giving a great
user experience and researching new ways to express information.
We are looking to strengthen our remote team with an experienced frontend
developer that loves analytics/data visualisation and has experience building
plugins using analytics APIs, especially for video apps/players.
Role and responsibility
This is a part-time contractor role where you will join a fast-paced team to
work on deliverables every week. Two very important modules of our product are
the player plugins/APIs which collects granular events and the Frontend
application used for report generation. It would be ideal if you can cover both
areas effectively. To summarise:

* Develop various features for the frontend of our analytics app written in
Angular, which consumes REST APIs and generates reports laid over a
customisable dashboard.
* Develop plugins for video players to post player events to our analytics
APIs.
Required Skills

* Rock solid proficiency (3 years+) in javascript / angular.js version 1.3 or
higher
* Experience in D3.js / Highcharts or other data visualisation libraries
* Strong understanding of REST APIs
* Good CSS/HTML skills
* Proven experience in building analytics plugins for video players for
Android, iOS, video.js, Roku, Playstation, Chromecast, STBs, Smart TVs etc.
Find out moreher e.
Javascript plugins experience a must.
* TDD and writing tests for FE apps and plugins is second nature for you
* Understanding of online video platforms systems such as Brightcove,
ThePlatform, Kaltura, JW Player is a bonus
* Proficient in English speaking and writing
* Must have at least 5 years of professional experience in production-grade
software development
Package

* About 3 days per week for proven remote workers
* Circa $160 per day depending on experience and length of contract
* Length of contract from 1 to 6 months depending on results
* Initial assignment
* Flexible working hours as long as you can overlap 3 working hours with our
London working hours (9am - 6pm GMT), on the days you work

To apply: To apply, please send your CV, Github link and/or LinkedIn link to
hiring-fe@streamhub.co.uk

with the position tile in the email, stating relevant experience and interests
that make you the right fit. If you have direct links to past or existing
frontend / plugin projects then please include. We will then get in touch via
email for an interview if we believe youÃ¢Â Â re the right person. No
recruiters.

that make you the right fit. If you have direct links to past or existing
frontend / plugin projects then please include. We will then get in touch via
email for an interview if we believe youÃ¢Â Â re the right person. No
recruiters.

items.title: Ruby Developer
items.content:
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: this role is not suitable for people who do not want to
live in Australia. You can work in our head office in Melbourne or may be able
to work remotely while located in Australia. All applicants may be considered
for all open engineering roles across the Envato (Envato Market
, Envato Tuts+ , Envato Studio
, etc.).





* Unique scale for an Australian business, world's 4th largest Ruby App by
traffic

* Continuously deployed up to 20 times a day!

* Work from anywhere in Australia or from HQ in Melbourne at one of the Best
Places to Work in Australia



We're continuing to grow our team and we're looking for developers who would
love the opportunity to work at Australia's premier Ruby development company.
We work in small cross functional teams with a variety of skills and experience
so, whether you're a passionate Ruby newbie or you've worked at our scale
before, we'd love to hear from you.


Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, Envato  is the
leading marketplace for creative assets and creative people. With more than 270
staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers
earn more than $300 Million

. Millions of people around the world choose our marketplace, studio and
courses to buy files, hire freelancers, or learn the skills needed to build
websites, videos, apps, graphics and more. You might be surprised to know that
not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also
growing really fast!


Recently, JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for
Women and Diversity (2015
 and 2016
). We were
also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the2015

 and2016
 BRW Awards.



Can you Meet the Expectations of Envato's Engineering Team?


At Envato, our Engineers expect certain things of each other. Not all of these
are easy to uphold. Are you ready to join the team and meet the expectations of
your peers at Envato? Read aboutthe expectations
 and how they were developed by our
team onour technical blog

. 



What you'll be doing



* Writing clean, well thought out and reliable code

* Participating as a member of a small cross functional team containing
members with different skills and experience

* You'll work on big projects, small maintenance tasks, server management
tasks and anything else that makes software our customers love

* Taking lots of responsibility for your work as most teams don't have
analysts, testers or system administrators

* Taking part in our 24/7 on call rotation supporting one of the biggest web
sites in the world




Essential Requirements



* Be a nice person who cares about their work

* Communicate well in person and in writing

* Be a curious person committed to continual learning

* Be capable of writing clean, well thought out, and reliable code

* Be comfortable working on a project from the original fuzzy brief through
development and deployment and beyond with minimal oversight required

* Be comfortable in a Linux software development and deployment environment



Preferred Requirements



* Have commercial Ruby on Rails experience

* Have solid TDD/BDD experience

* Have experience of other high volume/scale web apps

* Contribute to Open Source projects

* Past experience in other agile environments

* Excellent Linux knowledge



What We've Got


A Great Team and Culture



* Developers are responsible for features from inception through to them
being in the hands of customers. The devs talk directly to customers about what
they're working on

* We do continuous delivery properly: any team member can deploy, and we
regularly do several deploys a day

* We publish portions of our code as open source
, and contribute back to open source projects we
use

* A fantastic culture  of
creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and
being part of its growth and success

* Flexible working conditions
 – we want you to
love your work but also your life outside of Envato

* We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from
discrimination

* In addition to hiring for our Melbourne CBD office, we will also consider
applications from experienced Ruby Developers who would like to work remotely
(Australia wide)

* Future career progression will be available across the entire business -
we're big on internal opportunities and professional growth!



Who should apply?


We care deeply about diversity
 at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If
you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd
like to hear from you.




What next?



Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the
application questions. Good luck!




We care about your privacy. By submitting your application you are agreeing to
our Privacy Policy. If you're into reading legal documents or you're keen to
know more about how we handle your personal information read ourPrivacy Policy
before you submit your application.

items.content:

* Huge scale: Envato has one of the world's largest Ruby apps by traffic! 

* Be part of the team responsible for our most valuable asset - our community!

* Work from anywhere in Australia or from our Global HQ in the Melbourne CBD




What you'll be doing


Envato is split into four major groups, Customer, Content, Small Business and
Platform. This exciting new role is within our Content Group. This group is
responsible for looking after one of our most important assets, our community
of creative sellers who earn a living through our sites, and also for making
content available for customers onEnvato Market  and
Envato Elements . Without content, there can be
no customers, so the group work hand in hand with the Customer Group to build
on Envato's continuing success.


Along with working at Australia's premier Ruby development company, you'll get
to work with a fun and modern tech stack. Whether you're a passionate Ruby
newbie (with experience as a developer) or you've worked at our scale before,
we'd love to hear from you.

* Write clean, well thought out and reliable code

with different skills and experience

tasks and anything else that makes software our customers love

* Excellent Linux knowledge



What We've Got

being in the hands of customers. The devs talk directly to our community and

* We do continuous delivery properly: any team member can deploy, and we

use

* A fantastic culture  of
creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and
being part of its growth and success

* Flexible working conditions
 – we want you to
love your work but also your life outside of Envato

discrimination

* In addition to hiring for our Melbourne CBD office, we will also consider

items.title: Code Expert
items.content:
As a software engineer, you will bring solutions that change the lives of
millions of users. Here at Tokopedia, you will work with a small team and can
switch team or projects depending on business needs. We need people who are
willing to learn and always eager to tackle exciting problems at a huge scale.


Responsibilities



* Hands on with code in either of GoLang, C, C++, Node.js, Ruby, Python.
Multi-programming-lingual. The more the merrier.

* Comfortable working in a *nix environment, using cli.

* Eager to learn new tools, techniques, languages, and technologies.

* Passionate about making a difference to the world.

* Be able to contribute to system architecture and design.

* Be able to debug non-trivial application code.

* Be able to write clear, concise source-code documentation, unit and
integration tests.

* Be able to think beyond code to architecture and user experience.

* Be able to communicate and coordinate within a team.

* Build a features, systems

* Solve technical problems

* Create scalable back-end

items.title: Backend Software Engineer
items.content:
CareMessage is looking for a Software Engineer with Ruby on Rails experience to
help build and maintain our web platform that streamlines care management and
delivers interactive mobile programs to improve health outcomes. YouÃ¢Â Â ll be
working on exciting projects like optimizing our Sidekiq queuing system,
improving and building new integrations with Twilio, building our customer
analytics code, and helping improve and maintain our own API. Our engineering
team follows agile principles in a test driven development process. We are a
remote first team that values open collaboration and shared ownership.##
Responsibilities* Design, build and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable
application code* Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and
responsiveness of applications* Apply scalable application fundamental design
principles as needed.* Collaborate with engineering, QA and product to ensure
we provide a quality user experience for clinic staff across our apps, and
ensure our app scales as our user base grows## Requirements* 4+ years of
professional web application engineering experience with Ruby on Rails,
PostgreSQL* A solid understanding of Ruby and object-oriented programming*
Familiarity with important development concepts including MVC, ORM, functional
programming and RESTful APIs* Experience with Agile development methodologies*
Ability to implement automated testing platforms and unit tests##Desired, but
not required* Experience with JavaScript and Elixir * Familiarity with the
healthcare industry and enterprise level application development* Familiarity
with continuous integration tools

items.title: Senior Server Side Developer
items.content:
We have a preference for someone with experience handling stream processing,
and
building an API for internal and external use, that lowers maintenance and
development
costs.


As a key member of our server side team, you’ll specifically be expected to:
Work as part of a team to build complete, high-quality, end-to-end solutions
Document and communicate designs to others on the team
Contribute to guidelines and coding standards used for building reusable
application
components that are easy to maintain, troubleshoot, and test
Participate in peer design and code reviews
Perform system integration and testing, problem troubleshooting and resolution
Maintain and build core competency of technological knowledge, staying in
touch
with emerging technologies, and share this knowledge with colleagues
Demonstrate teamwork to foster strong team dynamics and a highly collaborative
working environment, which includes mentoring less experienced colleagues

items.title: JavaScript Developer Join Small Team Make A Difference From Day One
items.content:
Forcefield, a company based in Los Angeles, is seeking a full-time Javascript
engineer located in the United States (no international candidates). Qualified
individuals will be just as passionate about enhancing the user experience as
they are about creating clean, well-tested, efficient, and extensible code.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



* Work independently on the maintenance of our existing Safari and Chrome
extensions and implement new functionality

* Implement a JavaScript Framework on our Parent Dashboard, in coordination
with the server-side (Rails) developers

* Collaborate with development team to come up with the best solutions for
each project

* Estimate relative work-effort of solutions

* Manage time appropriately and communicate clearly (often in non-technical
terms) to help manage work expectations

* Ensure that new code is maintainable through code-reviews and provide
feedback to other developers

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
Alpha Exchange is the first open network and institutional knowledge exchange
for the capital markets community. We are transforming the way institutional
participants interact, share knowledge and discover investment insight. To
continue doing so, we're growing our team and looking for a Software Developer
who will be responsible for:* Lead the development of new functionalities*
Review work done by your peers* Design scalable and secure software

items.title: Full Stack Javascript Developer
items.content:
Email on Acid is dedicated to building an industry leading SaaS application
using the most up-to-date and current technologies available. We have a team of
world-class engineers who are constantly pushing the envelope. The team is in
the midst of a number of site-wide initiatives and we need your help to shape
the future of our platform!


We are a looking for a talented software engineer to assist in developing and
upgrading our web platform from a LAMP stack to a MEAN stack. In this role,
expect to be involved in migrating current features to Node.js while also
expanding our product. The right candidate understands modern software design
and can break down complex tasks in clear and concise ways. They should have a
strict attention to detail and be comfortable learning and applying the newest
development methodologies. Candidates should be able to quickly jump into our
tech stack (Node.js / NoSQL / Redis / PHP / MySQL) and make a difference. We
work with many different programming languages and thrive on the cutting edge
of technology. There are no manuals or blogs written to build our product and
the right engineer will help define the path of innovation.

items.title: Front End Web Developer
items.content:
Linchpin is looking for a rock star front end developer!
Are you a Front End Web Developer with a passion for clean, semantic HTML/CSS
markup? Do you know your way around Magento? Are you into WordPress and
creating custom WordPress themes? Are you well versed in responsive web design
principles and frameworks?
Ã¢Â Â¦If you answered yes, then check out our open position.
Potential candidates must submit a portfolio to be considered and be able to
explain their specific contribution to each project. This is full-time
position. Freelancers and contractors will not be considered at this time.
 Your Qualifications

* Understand the basics of wireframing
* Know the ins and outs of HTML, CSS & Web Standards
* Ability to create custom WordPress themes
* Understanding of Magento skins/theming
* Knowledge of responsive design, using frameworks like Foundation and/or
Bootstrap
* Show extreme attention to the details
* Able to work independently and collaboratively
* Ability to juggle multiple projects at once
* Inquisitive & unafraid to ask questions
* Open to learning new tricks
Great to have

* Experience with Icon Fonts
* Understanding of SASS
* Familiarity with HTML Emails using platforms such as MailChimp, Constant
Contact and HubSpot
* Experience with WordPress Plugins
* Ability to debug code
Nice to know

* GIT and/or SVN
* JIRA or other management tools
* Basic knowledge of WordPress Multisites
* Understand jQuery and how to implement
* Familiar with Terminal & running Grunt, Gulp or Compass to compile code
Know someone who might be a good fit for this position? Please share this
position with them!

To apply: Apply on the Linchpin website:
https://linchpin.agency/careers/development/front-end-developer/

items.title: Android Developer - Part-time or Freelance
items.content:
ABOUT USCREENUscreen is a video platform, companies use our platform sell &
distribute videos online.  Our customers range from major fitness companies
such as Zumba & Wanderlust as well as online training companies who sell videos
online using our platform.  Uscreen is growing & doing some innovative things &
currently works with over 1000 customers globally.
POSITION TYPEPart-time or freelance to start.  As you work more with our team
we will bring you on full time after the first 1 year.
JOB DESCRIPTION & RESPONSIBILITY- To Build a tested & solid functioning
Android app for our customers to use to stream videos & view the content
catalog.  The Android app will be published per customer for a series of
customers, this app will stream videos, as well as view documents, end users
can take quizzes & swift through the catalog as well as do in-app purchases for
other videos & content.  A NetFlix like app but with more functions is what we
need.
We already have an Android app but its weak in functions, we are looking to
develop a new app that is clean in UI & UX and has all the functions our
customers need.  We already have the requirements for this app, we are looking
for someone to build it with clean code and maintain it.
BENEFITS- Working with an awesome growing company that is doing some very
interesting things.- Good long term potential & Pay with Uscreen.- Paid classes
so you can improve your skills and learn online.- Working remote- Working with
a very cool team spread all over the world.
REQUIREMENTS- Good English speaking skills- Ability to work remote- 2+ years
experience building in Android- Familiarity with Android frameworks & languages
such as Java/Kotlin & Retrofit

To apply: Please apply by emailing pj@uscreen.tv
.

items.title: WordPress PHP and CSS Developer
items.content:
About Red Earth Design, Inc.   https://redearthdesign.com/
Red Earth Design, Inc. is a woman-owned
distributed company - there is no office and all team members work remotely.
The team consists of six full- and part-time project managers, PHP and CSS
developers, and graphic designers, several of whom have worked together for
more than 10 years.
We specialize in supporting creative agencies, non-profits, such as
environmental education organizations and animal rescues, and small businesses
- organizations on a budget. We help people helping the world.
Our main focus is building out WordPress websites and providing ongoing
support and maintenance. Our most important values are really caring about the
people we are working with and our tenacity in solving problems. We listen,
we're accessible and patient, and we make things work. We train clients on how
to use their website in an empowering way.
Work/life balance is a top priority. We share the work amongst our team so we
all have enough time and flexibility for the most important things in life.
Job DescriptionWe are looking for a WordPress-oriented PHP and CSS programmer
/ web developer to join our team for 30-40 hours a week. Contract work (no
benefits, will receive a 1099), but not temporary. Starting hourly rate $25/hr.
with opportunity to increase with added responsibility.
Work from anywhere. No office, no commute. Team communication is done via
email, Slack chats and a project/task management tool. We also hold video
conferences three to four times a month to touch base as a team along with
bi-monthly check-in calls with the Red Earth Design founder/owner. Hours are
flexible, but the majority of your available time needs to overlap with US
business hours for timely client interactions.
Your main responsibility will be to work with WordPress, WooCommerce, CSS, and
various plugins to create reliable results for our clients. Red Earth clients
are creative and passionate and come up with all sorts of interesting ideas and
ways to do things Ã¢Â Â itÃ¢Â Â s never boring. Our job is to listen to
clients well, figure out the best tools for the job, make things work for them,
test thoroughly, and document the process so itÃ¢Â Â s repeatable. Our first
priority is caring about people Ã¢Â Â both clients and team members, and the
code is just a tool to do that.
This position is open to anyone, anywhere.  No computer science degree
required. PHP, CSS, and WordPress proficiency is required. Our team would like
to work with a programmer who is modest and easy to get along with.
The majority of your tasks will be ones that are delegated from a project
manager based on a request from a client or will be from fellow team members
requesting your help figuring something out.We prefer that developers also work
with one client directly so you have a consistent view into the customer
service aspects of our work and have perspective and insight when we discuss as
a team on how we can continue to improve how we help our clients.
The position begins with a 2-week paid orientation and trial period with a
check-in at the end to decide if it's working for you and working for us.
Either party reserves the right to end the trial period at any time.
Required Skills/Experience
* Experience using WordPress: editing pages, posts, widgets, menus, plugins
* HTML, FTP
* CSS, Responsive CSS
* PHP arrays and foreach loops
* MySQL
* Access to Photoshop for opening of design files
* Ability to solve problems with minimal direction
* High degree of learning agility / fast and interested learner
* Ability to interact with clients and team in a kind, respectful and
professional manner
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Self-motivated, self-starter
* Uses time efficiently
* Patient, positive and supportive attitude with clients and team members
Preferred Additional Skills/Experience

* Experience with WordPress installations, configuration, child themes,
security
* WooCommerce
* Troubleshooting plugin bugs and conflicts
* Email account POP3/IMAP connections/set-up
* JavaScript/jQuery
* SASS
* XML, JSON
* APIs
Initial Responsibilities

* Editing content on a WordPress site
* Plugin installation and configuration
* Setting up a child theme on an installed WordPress site and editing the
templates and CSS to match a design example
* Testing a series of custom features in a site
Target Responsibilities

* Part of the time, youÃ¢Â Â ll work with a project manager to make updates
or help on a project. Another part of the time, youÃ¢Â Â ll work directly with
a client to make updates.
* Project lead/main contact for one project. Back-up contact for some
projects when a project manager is out for for an extended time.
* Delegation of project tasks to other team members if you need help testing,
review, or approaching something
* Plugin troubleshooting/problem solving
* CSS/template builds Ã¢Â Â take a Photoshop file and apply the styles to a
WordPress child theme, work with PHP and WordPress child theme templates to set
up custom features as needed
* Taking screenshots and writing out steps/instructions in Evernote for
clients to file for doing updates on their site specific to a plugin or other
non-standard functionality
Examples of tasks:
* We receive a Photoshop file of a design for a website. The site is already
installed and a child theme set up. You would update the theme settings, child
theme stylesheet, and template files to match the design.
* Client has WooCommerce installed and would like the SKU to display on the
category page in addition to where it shows on the product detail page. You
would check our Evernote internal knowledge base and do other searches if
needed to find a WooCommerce filter and function and add it to their functions
file.
* Client needs a way to display additional information blocks on a webpage,
such as tabs. Each tab has a title and then content they see once they click on
the tab title. You would install a plugin like Advanced Custom Fields and set
up a flexible content or repeater field group for tabs and assign it to the
specific page or post type. Then you would update the child theme template to
display these fields for that page or post type.
* WeÃ¢Â Â ve added a custom post type Ã¢Â Â PeopleÃ¢Â Â to a clientÃ¢Â Â s
site so they can maintain bios and information about their staff, speakers, and
others involved with their organization. WeÃ¢Â Â ve added the main People
archive page link to the navigation menu, but when you go to the page, it
doesnÃ¢Â Â t show as the current page and highlight it or the parent page in
the menu. To solve this, you would find another example in our internal
knowledge base or research it or write it and update the jQuery to work for
this site. Or if youÃ¢Â Â re not familiar with jQuery, you would create a new
task for a RED team member who is familiar with jQuery to handle this update or
to mentor you in learning how.
* Client or team member posts that X is broken, and you first try to
replicate the problem, and then track down the issue and fix it.
* Team member posts a task to our Ã¢Â Â task swapÃ¢Â Â Slack channel for an
extra task they donÃ¢Â Â t necessarily want to do. You can grab it if
youÃ¢Â Â re interested, or let someone else pick it up You can swap tasks you
have, too.
* YouÃ¢Â Â re ready to launch a website. First you go through our pre-launch
checklist and involve other team members in a peer review and cross browser
check, then you go through the launch checklist. At the end of any process, if
you notice places in documentation or steps that could be better, you discuss
with the team and we integrate improvements as we go.
* Participate in our Professional Development site, where we each take the
opportunity to learn about something weÃ¢Â Â ve been wanting to or learned
while working on a project or listening to a podcast or reading, and share it
back to the group.
* Join the regular team video call, 3 times a month on average, where we
catch up, share highlights and lowlights from what weÃ¢Â Â ve been working on,
and learn something new from a team memberÃ¢Â Â s presentation or project
debrief, or talk through ideas or business development.
Required Tools

* Internet connection
* Phone number clients can call with professional voicemail recording and
quiet background environment (email account will be provided)
* Photoshop CS 5.x or any version supporting grouped layers
* Text editor or IDE capable of editing WordPress code 
Please answer the following application questions:

* Name
* Email
* Location
* What about working with Red Earth Design intrigues you? Why are you
interested in this job in particular?
* Tell us one thing you did that seemed impossible, and what happened.
* Tell us about some of your experiences with WordPress, WooCommerce, PHP,
and CSS, and/or share examples of your work.
* What are your hobbies outside of work?
* Attach a resume.Accepting application responses and resumes at
jobs@redearthdesign.com

To apply: jobs@redearthdesign.com

items.title: Python Developer
items.content:
DESCRIPTION
Quantoro (Crederia) is an exciting and early stage business providing lead
generation services in the financial sector. We have been operational for
around 6 months and weÃ¢Â Â re looking to expand to new territories in Europe.
We are looking for an experienced full stack Python developer to join our team.
You will be heavily involved in the development of the business in new
territories and your role will include development (80%) and general
support/assistance for the team (20%).
This is your opportunity to make your mark on the direction of an exciting and
fast growing company.
REQUIREMENTS

* Excellent command of written and spoken English
* Great Python coding skills - your programming ability is above average
* HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript (Intermediate or above)
* Django and Django REST Framework
* PostgreSQL
* RabbitMQ
* Git
BENEFITS
Working flexibility - Quantoro is a distributed company so you can work from
wherever you are in the world, or join us here in our Loughborough office.
Unlimited leave - We trust our team to be responsible and self regulating so
we focus on milestones rather than clock watching, giving you the flexibility
to work the hours that suit you and take the holidays you need to.
Remuneration is competitive, and dependent on experience.
To apply: Please visit - https://quantoro.workable.com/jobs/409017
. Scroll to the bottom, and click
"Apply for this job".

items.title: Web Application Developer
items.content:
Curiosity, Competence, Humanity, Ruby on Rails, Javascript, SQL


We are looking for a values-driven individual with experience in Rails, SQL,
Javascript and CSS to provide technical leadership and contribute code every
day in our fast moving small team environment.


Projects running right now offer challenges in user interface design,
statistical analysis/machine learning, scalability, continuous delivery, GIS,
e-commerce, data visualization and secure handling of personal and financial
data. We’re constantly evolving our approach to software development as new
best practices emerge.


Please send a cover letter (yes, a cover letter is required), résumé, and
links to recent work with a description of your role in that work to
jobs@greenriver.com


We look forward to hearing from you.

items.title: Full Stack Software Architect
items.content:
Company Description:


Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are
history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams
collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition
to find and engage with that talent. Crossover has developed a unique method of
finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects
customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs.
But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and
relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.



Job Description:


Our team is all about getting stuff done. We are pragmatic problem solvers who
pull from a diverse technology tool set.

*
Write killer code in many languages solid and robust

*
Test before, during, and after TDD on steroids

*
Core tech stack is JVM/Java/Groovy, JS/AngularJS and SQL

*
Thirst and passion for raising the bar and making it better than it is now

*
Social team players in a real open space environment with music and
significant shenanigans

*
Have a large tool box: Ruby/Chef/DevOps, Sinatra/Rails, hardcore shell
scripting, high performance C++ engines, SQL datamarts, sproc-ing and data
pumping; you must have enough tools to use the right one for the job

*
We are real-deal Agile: good design, heavy testing, continuous delivery, pair
programming in an open space environment, and lots of communication

*
Embrace the inner, twisted technologist hackathons, side projects, open source


We currently have additional specialized opportunities for candidates with
experience in Javascript, specifically:

Back End: Node.js

Databases: MongoDB, NoSQL, or Couchbase

Front End: Angular.js, Bootstrap, or React



Total compensation: $60,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

items.title: Software Engineer Web
items.content:
Develop user friendly, cross platform, lightweight, and mobile interfaces to
robotic and autonomous systems. Join our team to help build the next generation
of web applications for robotic systems.


Our team has a deep background in embedded devices, robot simulation, and
control software. This experience will combine with your knowledge of web
technolgies to create a seamless ecosystem of software for robot control,
planning, analysis, and simulation.

items.title: Rust Developer
items.content:
[Ethereum Classic](https://ethereumclassic.github.io/) is an Open Source
project maintained by a community. We develop a next gen implementation of
_blockchain_ platform with the main focus on flexibility and Smart Contract
execution on blockchain. We're trying to change how distributed applications
will work in a decentralized world, join us to be part of something special.
Ethereum Classic is an independent community driven blockchain continued after
_EF_ (a company which originally started Ethereum blockchain) moved to a
separate fork by introducing censoring transactions into their blockchain.
Ethereum Classic community opposed that fork and kept original chain, because
it believes in Blockchain Immutability and Code Is Law principles of
blockchain. Since the fork Ethereum Classic clients and tools are supported by
community developers.YouÃ¢Â Â ll be committing and sending Pull Requests to
Open Source repositories for Ethereum Classic and related projects (such as
Ethcore Parity, which is maintained by an independent organization), as well as
develop new Open Source projects from the scratch. YouÃ¢Â Â ll be working close
to Ethereum Classic community and participate with other members on daily
basis.WeÃ¢Â Â re maintaining and adding new features to
[Geth](https://github.com/ethereumproject/go-ethereum) (written in Go) and
[Parity](https://github.com/ethereumproject/parity) (written in Rust) Ethereum
clients, but main focus would be on new projects build on top of Rust
programming language. __Requirements__* 7 years of software development
experience with computer languages such as C/C++, Java, Python, Go, Haskell or
Ocaml (at least one)* 1 year of Rust programming experience* Experience with Go
is a plus* Familiar with Git and Linux* Proficient with spoken/written English,
excellent communications stills* Good practices documenting, writing and
maintaining clean code* Solid understanding of Networking, Databases,
Cryptography and Blockchain* Degree in Computer Science preferred with projects
connected to this space* Track record of Open Source contributions* Experience
of building distributed applications* Self motivated, can take initiative and
feel comfortable both working alone and part of a teamThis is a paid full-time
remote position.

items.title: Experienced Java Developer For Elastic Search Flume Big Data Analytics
items.content:
You design and build a cutting edge analyzing and reporting platform for our
network data security products and work in close collaboration with our product
management. The role requires strong Java knowledge.


We are developing a high performance solution for securing and optimizing
computer networks. To this end, we analyze user and threat data using real time
stream processing and big data solutions. The result of this analysis enables
the protection even against novel, previously unknown threats.
Your part in the team is the optimization and continuous development of both
our components and the data storage, handing and analysis algorithms used.


Join us to serve for network security.


You'll be free to work on a Mac or Linux PC for development and to use
up-to-date tools like Mattermost, Status Hero and git.

items.title: Full-Stack Developer (Rails/React)
items.content:
What is Kolau
Kolau is a SaaS company that is building the marketing of tomorrow - and
itÃ¢Â Â s doing it today.
96% of all businesses have 0-9 employees and KolauÃ¢Â Â s is their solution to
rank in the 1st page of Google. Why? They have no time to do it, knowledge to
do it right or money to pay marketing agencies, thus Kolau. Simple, quick,
effortless, Kolau.
WeÃ¢Â Â re a distributed team, working remotely in the United States and
overseas.
Our backend tools are fairly standard - Rails, Postgres, Redis, Rspec,
Sidekiq, AWS & Heroku
What you would be working on?
With Kolau, we are building a platform that makes it easier for anybody with a
website and without any time or marketing knowledge to have it ranking on the
1st page of the search results. Kolau is not just software, though. We have an
amazing tech support team that is available in case users need some extra
assistance and are as much a part of the Kolau product, success and experience
as the platform itself.
REQUIREMENTS
* 2+ years experience with Ruby on Rails and RSpec
* 2+ years experience with React
* A product-first approach to building software and great attention to detail
* You ship quality code quickly with great coding skills.
* You enjoy the fast-paced nature of a startup and look forward to joining a
company that is shaping the digital marketing world
* Experience with SaaS development and API development preferred
BENEFITS
* Competitive salary: Competitive compensation package based on experience
and location.
* Opportunity: Ground floor opportunity to shape the direction of the company
* Getaways: Company retreat around the world 1x year - Barcelona, anyone?
* Tech: Brand new Mac Pro and $250 stipend for anything that helps you be
more productive
* Continuing Education: $250 for anything youÃ¢Â Â d like to learn. Also, we
ship a new book monthly within your category of interest!

To apply: https://kolau-carrers.workable.com/jobs/411919

items.title: Senior software engineer (Ruby, Rails, Postgres)
items.content:
How is this job different?
Well, it's not that different, but people working at Codeable are.

We're a bunch of proud nerds - be it tech, design or business wise - who have
a great sense of humour and also manage to get work done.
What do you even do?
Codeable is a leading outsourcing platform in the WordPress market. We're 4
years old and experiencing sustained growth each month since day one. In March
2016, we became profitable which enabled us to buy-back shares from our main
Danish investor that summer.

So, we are a premium outsourcing platform for all your WordPress needs. Think
UpWork, Elance or oDesk but as a Mercedes-Benz (great quality and very
reliable). We actually interview people (freelancers) who want to work for us,
check their coding skills and equally importantly their communication skills.
We turndown 97% of all applicants, so the ones we have working through our
system are the real deal. We currently have 255+ WordPress developers on our
team and adding more every week.

Quality is the DNA of our service and we're well known for our awesome
customer support. WeÃ¢Â Â re in fact replying all tickets in less than 3 min in
average (we had 21,900 customer support replies the last 90 days). Our experts
are all following our strict guidelines and they are only taking on projects
they know they can solve. WeÃ¢Â Â re turning down 40% of all projects posted
but 98% of all completed projects get rated with highest rates and we have more
than 78% returning clients.

We currently have around 10 permanently involved people (programmers,
marketing ...) a few working for us part time (UX, Design) and 2-3 agencies to
whom we outsource some development and marketing stuff. That said, we are
currently lacking power in the backend/API "department".
What am I going to do?
The things you do the best. We believe that we can get the best out of our
people if we focus on the things they do best. If chosen, you will have a
month-long (or two month) testing period where we see how you fit in the team
and how you perform at your work.

Proactive approach is most wanted since we're not a big company and we don't
have a development/programming department. Meaning if you see something that
should be fixed or made better and you can do it, then do it.

If you know you can improve something, just do it.
Now to the real business...
Our backend code needs a bit of a "face-lift" and some optimization and
refactoring. At the same time, we would like to change a bit how we are
building our application.

We are very keen on approaches that would allow us to extract some of the code
from Rails so we could manage it better and at the same time speed up our most
valuable tests.

We're not aiming for the "big rewrite". What we have in mind is a gradual
approach to improving our code. An evolution of some kind.
What do I need?

* Experience of growing and sustaining software over several years
* Solid knowledge of Ruby
* Solid knowledge of Rails
* Productive with CI and continuous deployment
* Understanding of REST
* Experience in designing and implementing APIs
* Great relationship with Git (we use feature branches approach)
* Previous experience with refactoring code (preferably not just your own)
* Curious gene (you have to love testing new stuff and doubting and improving
old)
* Openness to other platforms and approaches/methodologies
What will make me cut the hiring line? (Any of the skills below so we can
become more cross-functional)
* Extraordinary refactoring skills
* Extraordinary speed optimization skills (Rails, PostgreSQL)
* Some front end development experience (AngularJS, React)
* Google Cloud (Kubernetes + Docker) knowledge (AWS wonÃ¢Â Â t hurt either)
* Experience with scaling apps in the cloud
* Experience with data collection/warehousing/storing for analytics purposes
* Experience with R and Python for analytics/machine learning/data science
* Experience writing SQL for analytic purposes
Your responsibilities a bit more detailed

* Developing new and maintaining existing features
* Designing and shaping the new version of API (v1 is getting old)
* Designing, shaping and integrating services in good OO manner
* Collaborating with frontend developers to find the best solution for
improvements or new features
* Some manual (DB, console, ...) number crunching work to satisfy our
spreadsheet gods   
* Helping us all develop a good programming/development culture (freedom of
choice and sense of responsibilities/ownership)
* Participation on dailies (every working day at 10AM (GMT+1)
What am I going to get?

* An option to work remotely (duh!)
* Freedom of choice: right tool for the job (but own it - if it breaks it's
your responsibility)
* Flexible working hours: only our 10am daily is mandatory - can be skipped
on occasions if requested
* Competitive salary: If you are that good, then you deserve it!
* Team building/meetups: Since we're all working remotely we have the need
for human touch once in a while, this is when we meet together, eat some nice
food, do some cool activities, talk, walk around and work together
* Working environment where people care about what they do
* An opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing company, which is changing
the world of online outsourcing. The market is enormous and so are the
opportunities!

To apply: Send a resume and a cover letter to matjaz@codeable.io
with subject
"hiring application" and CCsinclair@codeable.io
.

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
We are on a mission to break down the barriers and inefficiencies that separate
people from the healthcare they need. Our market-leading online scheduling
system is used to improve patientÃ¢Â Â s access to health care in hundreds of
hospitals and other healthcare facilities around the United States.
We are dedicated to making a positive impact on how health care is accessed.
Our team has an inclusive culture with competitive compensation, flexible work
schedule, a focus on results, and a good work/life balance. You should be an
experienced, self-motivated, and opinionated developer. You should value
testing, enjoy what you do, have a willingness to challenge decisions, and a
desire to become part of our family of talented people.
This role will mostly involve Ruby, with some exposure to JavaScript and
Elixir.
We might be looking for you, if:
* You are a talented and experienced full-stack developer with expertise in
part of our stack.
* You have passion for developing and maintaining stable and secure web
applications.
* You are comfortable participating in architectural decisions.
* You enjoy collaborating with other developers to solve problems and refine
ideas.
* When you hear Ã¢Â Â automated testsÃ¢Â Â it makes you happy, not sad.
* You have desire to learn and grow, individually and as a team.
* You have strong communication skills, online and in person.
* People that know you would consider you direct, honest, and not afraid to
speak your mind.
* You want to work somewhere that lets you make a direct and positive impact
on people's lives.
Our engineering team is geographically spread out, with the majority of us
being on the west coast of USA and Canada. We value communication a lot, and
utilize things like Slack and Screenhero to work together.
To apply: jerrett@inquicker.com

items.title: Programmer analyst
items.content:
Programmer/analyst



At TLT, we are looking for a Ruby on Rails developer to help us imagine and
build things that spark incredible teaching and learning experiences. As part
of a small, agile development team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape a
product from its earliest days in a fun, flexible environment. You should be
able to show us that you’ve built, tested, optimized and scaled Ruby on Rails
applications and web services that are a delight to use in every way: fast,
straightforward, elegant and powerful.



You should be prepared to deal with: RESTful JSON APIs; semantic HTML;
JavaScript frameworks (AngularJS, Backbone); CSS/SASS; SQL and relational
database systems (PostgreSQL, MySQL); and test-driven development. Bonus points
if you light up when you think about one or more of the following:
micro-credentialing, reputation and recommendations systems, social learning
systems, complex taxonomies, learning platforms, web accessibility, and the
details that make or break the user experience. You put metrics to work for
you; you can tell an actionable metric from a fluffy one. You have experience
with other languages and frameworks and may have even developed for platforms
like iPhone, Android, and Facebook. This position is eligible for working
remotely, relocation to central Pennsylvania is not necessary. This job will be
filled as a level 2, or level  3, depending upon the successful candidate's
competencies, education, and experience. Typically requires an Associate's
degree or higher plus two years of related experience, or an equivalent
combination of education and experience for a level 2. Additional experience
and/or education and competencies are required for higher level jobs.
Bachelor's Degree and additional experience preferred.



CAMPUS SECURITY CRIME STATISTICS: For more about safety at Penn State, and to
review the Annual Security Report which contains information about crime
statistics and other safety and security matters, please go to
 http://www.police.psu.edu/clery/ , which will also provide you with detail on
how to request a hard copy of the Annual Security Report.



Penn State is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is
committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants
without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender
identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.



Job URL: http://apptrkr.com/942921

items.title: Lead Mobile Developer
items.content:
Creatubbles™ is the safe global community for creators of all ages. It is the
perfect space for children, families and teachers to save, share, discover and
interact with multimedia creativity portfolios. It lets anyone share their
experiences and creations safely in more than 50 countries, whether they are at
home, school, an event or activity.


We recognize creativity is a critical life skill to be developed and nurtured
like any other form of expression. We believe in the importance of finding and
developing your individual voice by being able to express thoughts and ideas
freely.


Creatubbles™ is an integrated creativity ecosystem with a growing list of
partners that believe in nurturing creativity through a safe and supportive
environment.


With 'Share with Creatubbles', any company, organization or individual can
very easily connect to and use Creatubbles™ to engage in meaningful (and
creative!) ways.



*        Main site: https://www.creatubbles.com

*        Blog: https://stateoftheart.creatubbles.com


*        Partners: https://partners.creatubbles.com



About our company


We are an ambitious team of around 20 people, covering 12 nationalities and
operating as a network of virtual teams around the world. After closing a
strategic partnership in Japan we are quickly building out our team in Tokyo.


Having recently raised a total of $10+MM from private and strategic corporate
investors, we have plenty of fuel in the tank to build out our product, our
team and to fund our global expansion.


To fulfill our mission to nurture the original creativity of children around
the world, we are constantly exploring new ways to incorporate the latest
ideas, approaches, and technologies into our products and services.


We are now looking for a world class team lead to manage our mobile app
engineering teams.


About our development Team and Technologies



* Our development team is headed by an experienced CTO and has 3 senior iOS
and 2 senior Android developers, in addition to 3 front-end developers, 4
full-stack developers and two test engineers.

* We start the day with a Scrum call and organise our work in 2-weekly
Sprints.

* Github, CircleCI, Jenkins, Heroku and Amazon AWS are just a couple of the
many friends we rely on every single day.

* ScreenHero allows us to enjoy pair-programming sessions, even when members
are located on the other side of the world.

* Our team is small and flexible, and everyone participates in the
decision-making process.

* With our web apps we support desktop browsers, smartphone and tablet
devices and keep pushing the boundaries of responsive web and CSS techniques.
At the same time we are rolling out a range of native mobile apps with
simplified and very robust navigation.

* Our focus is building and keep iterating on universal experiences and
interfaces that work for and delight users between ages of 1 and 99.

* The back-end is made available to our web app, our native mobile apps and
our partner's applications as a simple REST API.

* Security is extremely important to us and we regularly work with experts to
review our security strategy.


About you



* You are excited by the potential of mobile technology to transform the
lives of creative minds around the world

* You eat, drink, speak and breathe iOS and Android, and are a guru in one or
more object orientated languages (Objective C, Swift, Java, Kotlin, C#, ...)

* You are extremely hands-on, technically excellent with solid engineering
principles.

* You are proficient in automated testing (jUnit, Appium, ...).

* You have a strong eye for beautiful design and are passionate about smooth
user experiences.

* You have shipped a range of popular consumer focused apps (please include
references in your cover letter).

* You have experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B
testing, etc

* You take quality and testing very seriously. Very very seriously. Obviously.

* You take full responsibility for the product - from early planning stages
to deployment and maintenance.

* You are fluent in spoken and written English (knowledge of Japanese is a
big plus).

* You have a pro-active personality, are a real team player and feel
comfortable working in a fast-paced tech startup environment.

* You exhibit strong leadership and people development skills and know what
will make your engineers go the extra mile.

* You have a fundamental interest in what we are doing and show empathy for
our users.

* You have a general curiosity and an ability to embrace complexity


What we offer



* A full time job opportunity, but part-time contractors are also welcomed.

* We prefer remote work but relocation to Tokyo, Japan can also be arranged.

* Super-flexible work schedule: we work across time zones and allow everyone
to work when they are the most productive.

* A very competitive salary and possibly stock options.

items.title: Full Stack Web Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a full-time, full stack web developer with 4+ years
experience.
Our flagship apps - Zombies, Run!, Racelink, and The Walk Ã¢Â Â combine
innovative real-world interaction and gameplay with captivating stories and
design. In short, we make exercising fun. We want to find someone who can help
us improve our existing apps and develop new experiences that are just as
revolutionary and innovative.
As web developer at Six to Start, you will be primarily responsible for
sustaining and improving the infrastructure that powers Racelink and Zombies,
Run!, apps with over 3 million downloads.
YouÃ¢Â Â ll be enabling the native mobile clients, along with maintaining and
developing independent user-facing applications. YouÃ¢Â Â ll need to be able to
work independently and be happy taking initiatives on features. Most
importantly, itÃ¢Â Â ll be very important to manage complexity and technical
debt with confidence while developing at a rapid pace.
While there is a lot of responsibility in the role, you will have an abundant
amount of freedom in implementation and if wanted, a strong voice in the
outcome of finished products that will roll into the arms of the productÃ¢Â Â s
many fans.
Responsibilities and Requirements

* Comfortable developing functional websites using modern JavaScript practices
* Experience implementing and consuming traditional REST services
* Strong knowledge of RDBMS (Postgres is used primarily), and some knowledge
or a keen attitude to learn noSQL databases
* Must be comfortable administering and caring for Linux servers
Pay is competitive, and dependent on experience.
To apply: Get in touch at hello@sixtostart.com
with the
subject Web Developer and your CV attached. No recruitment agencies.

items.title: Software Engineer Data Ingestion Infrastructure
items.content:
Logstash is a popular, open source data processing platform and an important
component of the Elastic Stack. People choose Logstash for its simplicity and
extensibility. Over the last few years, Logstash has evolved to become a
powerful server-side data processing platform responsible for ingesting
terabytes of data into Elasticsearch and other systems.


The Logstash team is responsible for developing the core data processing
infrastructure and its thriving plugin ecosystem. As Logstash matures into
being a ubiquitous data ingestion pipeline, our team is building new features
to make it , faster, easier, and more reliable, to drive our next wave of
adoption. You'll work with a geographically diverse, distributed and fun loving
team. The Engineering organization at Elastic is spread across 30+ countries,
and we have a flexible, family-friendly work schedule. We make great software,
love autonomy and collaboration, and most importantly, love our users.

items.title: Software Engineer Data Ingestion Infrastructure Jruby
items.content:
Logstash is a popular, open source data processing platform and an important
component of the Elastic Stack. Users have downloaded Logstash millions of
times for its simplicity and extensibility. Over the last few years, Logstash
has evolved to become a powerful server-side data processing platform
responsible for ingesting terabytes of data into Elasticsearch and other
systems.


The Logstash team is responsible for developing the core infrastructure and
its thriving plugin ecosystem. Most parts of Logstash is written in JRuby, but
recently core components have been implemented in Java. As Logstash matures
into being a ubiquitous data pipeline, our team is building new features to
make it resilient, faster, and easier, to drive our next wave of adoption.
You'll work with a diverse, distributed and fun loving team based in North
America and Europe. The Engineering organization at Elastic is different — we
are spread across 30+ countries, have a flexible, family-friendly work
schedule, make great software, love autonomy and most importantly, love our
users.

our ride to success!


Our development team has centers in Cape Town, South Africa (Rondebosch) and
