items.title: Lead Software Developer
items.content:
Production Systems is seeking a highly experienced Lead Software Developer to
lead our team to create, enhance, test and support our software product. We are
offering top pay for the top performer required for this position.


Our product, TotalRod, is licensed by oil and gas companies to help manage
their operations. This includes drilling, completions, well servicing, well
failures, production gauging, well tests, fluid levels, pumping unit
inspections, and much more. We are a small business with big goals. We want
someone who is eager for a challenge.


Job Responsibilities



* Provide the personal leadership and technical expertise to:



* Develop and test new features in our desktop and web applications

* Document and maintain software functionality and knowledge base

* Interact with customers to deploy new software versions

* Support sales team with product demos and technical expertise

* Consistently deliver results on time

items.title: Backend Python Developer
items.content:
Teleomed Labs is a small development group that specializes in healthcare
solutions for vulnerable populations, including low-income seniors, veterans,
and people in developing nations. We are currently working on web-based tools
to help social workers and care coordinators manage care for vulnerable seniors
and identify those at-risk for a variety of life-threatening conditions.
We are looking for an experienced contractor (full-time or part) to join our
backend team. You'll be working on things like notifications (SMS/email),
activity streams, fine-grained user permissions, search/autocomplete, caching,
and chat. Our backend uses the latest Django, hosted on Heroku with a Postgres
backend. Our front-end communicates with the backend entirely via JSON API, so
no HTML/CSS or UI/UX experience is required.
Requirements

* Fluency in Python and at least one Python web framework (eg. Django, Flask) 
* Self-directed with excellent English communication skills
* Experience working remotely in the past
* Experience with Git/GitHub and modern development practices (pull requests,
code reviews, TDD, etc.)
* 5+ years of programming experience (internships included), at least 2 years
with Python
Preferred

* Experience designing and building JSON APIs
* Experience integrating third-party services (Twilio, PubNub, S3, etc.)
* An interest in healthcare or security
Why work with us?

* Work remotely from anywhere in the world
* We are a small, easy-going team with very few meetings or rigid processes
* Flex your engineering muscles working on a modern stack (Django 1.10) with
modern tools (AWS, Heroku, Slack, Github)
* Make a difference in the lives of thousands of elderly patients

To apply: Does this sound like you? If so, please send your resume and a cover
letter tohello@teleomed.com

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
We're on a mission to accelerate science, and our platform is transforming how
technology gets to market. Resolute is the leading marketplace for patents,
inventions, and technology, offering powerful AI-driven tools to aid in
discovery. Our software annotates hundreds of millions of scientific documents
from around the world, then cuts through them in milliseconds to deliver
actionable insights to our users.  
  
We're looking to bring on experienced engineers who have fresh ideas from all
areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, artificial
intelligence, natural language processing, and UI design. There is a lot to do,
no red tape, and no limit to the impact you can have.

As a member of the Trackmax team you'll be given the latest tools in a relaxed

do what they do best!

items.title: Software Engineer - Full Stack
items.content:
ABOUT USAt Close.io weÃ¢Â Â re building the sales communication platform of the
future. WeÃ¢Â Â ve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data
entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are hiring engineers to help
us unify the world's sales calls and emails into one beautiful workflow.
Our tech stack includes Python/Flask, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis,
Puppet, & AWS with the frontend as a single-page web app in JavaScript, React,
Backbone.js, HTML5, & CSS/LESS.
We Ã¢Â Â¤ open source Ã¢Â Â using dozens of open source projects with
contributions to many of them, and released some of our own: 
https://github.com/closeio
ABOUT YOUWe're looking for great developers to join our core team who have a
strong understanding of web technologies and want to help design, implement,
launch, and scale major systems and user-facing features.
YOU SHOULD...
* have 8+ years experience design, implement, launch, and scale major systems
and user-facing features.
* have demonstrated experience in several of the technologies we are using,
but you donÃ¢Â Â t need to be an expert in all of them. WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for
someone who is already comfortable across various layers of the web stack and
eager to learn additional technologies as necessary.
* enjoy designing, scaling, and optimizing systems to make them super fast,
while still being nicely maintainable.
* care a lot about product and user experience and take responsibility for
thinking like a user. WeÃ¢Â Â re looking for people who donÃ¢Â Â t rely on a
designer or product manager to figure UX stuff out for them.
* be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a small and talented team.
BONUS POINTS IF YOU...
* significant open source work in Python or JavaScript
* have great product sense or an eye for designing beautiful and usable UIs
* experience with VoIP telephony
WHY WORK WITH US?
* For the personal growth experience of helping build a truly successful SaaS
company with a stellar team where you can have a huge impact.
* Above market salary, healthcare, dental, and retirement benefits package
* Work remotely from anywhere in the world. Just be willing to do a bit of
traveling twice a year for some face-to-face time with the whole team: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cxXCZkC_UrY

To apply: APPLY HERE:
https://jobs.lever.co/close.io/f7a2313f-33eb-4e7b-9c5b-b8cbcc55fab9/apply?lever-source=WWR

items.title: Senior Ruby Developer
items.content:
Our sophisticated web crawler helps some of the world's top companies improve
their web sites by giving them deep, comprehensive insights into their problems
-- and solutions. Companies that make their business on the web depend on
DeepCrawl to improve user experience, manage change, and improve indexability.


Your role is to bring your passion for Ruby and other open-source technologies
to build better tools for improving web sites. In the end, it’s all about
making the web a nicer place for users -- with fewer annoying gimmicks and more
genuinely useful, well designed, easily found resources.


We’ve built our stack on AWS and leading open source technologies: Ruby,
PostgreSQL, MongoDB, AngularJS.  As a Ruby developer, you’ll be writing backend
code with our core team, and will have ample opportunity to learn new skills
and evaluate leading-edge technologies as we seek the most powerful ways to
reach our users.


This position is available to remote candidates anywhere in the UK, and to
London candidates who can work in our London office.



Responsibilities will include:



* Work with a small but growing team of developers who are passionate about
improving design, usability, reliability, scalability, and clarity of code, all
with the end goal of satisfying our many users and making the web a better place

* Help improve the scalability and performance of our crawler’s data
processing pipeline, and improve your understanding of performant and scalable
design

* Run benchmarks for performance- and resource-sensitive features

* Help improve test coverage and testability of code

* Work with product owners to write technical specifications for new features

* Help improve internal tools for monitoring, testing, bug fixing, and
administration

* Provide mentoring and architectural guidance for other devs (architectural
planning, code reviews)

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
You are a passionate, experienced, digitally savvy, Full Stack Developer with 8
+ years’ experience who enjoys being surrounded by likeminded and talented
individuals in an environment that lets the best ideas emerge!


We dream, create, and deliver digital solutions that transform what’s possible
for enterprises, government institutions and organizations and partner with our
clients through every stage of digital transformation: from strategy, to
activation, to delivery to decrease risk and increase speed-to-market.


We are Remotely Awesome! We understand that quality of life directly impacts
quality of work, and we know that talent is all over the place. Our team is not
limited by geography, and seeks top talent where it exists. Our remote work
model encourages independent thinking, requires professional discipline, and
contributes to a high quality work/life balance.


What’s does this mean for you? Each team member has the flexibility to work
from anywhere, and is provided the tools and infrastructure to successfully
collaborate across the globe. We will continue to grow and evolve with the
market and provide an environment where creativity, leadership, mentoring,
planning, and resources are in place to achieve our shared goals.



Job Description



Full Stack Developer will serve as part of a team supporting established
projects and creating from the ground up. The ideal candidate is leader, a team
player and is passionate about learning and applying their technical skills and
experience to solve real-world problems.

regular social activities.You'll be using a top notch MacBook Pro, and be
provided with any other gear or software you need.We encourage all our team
members to suggest suitable events and conferences to visit, with all expenses
paid for.We also have an awesome perks programme where you can get access to
amazing offers including discounts for gym membership, free mobile phone
insurance, the Apple employee discount program, Ã Â£5 cinema tickets and much
more.__Location__This role is for someone based in the UK. You may be located
with one of our existing team members if location suits, alternatively we
support remote and co-working arrangements.__Job hours__This is a full time
position working Mon Ã¢Â Â Fri, 09:00 Ã¢Â Â 17:30 with occasional on call,
travel and weekend work when required.

items.title: Creative Interactive Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a friendly, creative native digital to enrich our team in
the area of creative coding. You‘ll be in charge of front-and backend
development, of interactive projects, technical research and conception, but
foremost of pushing interaction and web technologies together with a very
skilled and passionate team of designers and developers forward.


You‘ll have the chance to bring in your own ideas and not only develop
websites, but interactive experiences of all sorts and integrate into an
international team, who all share the same goal, creating the best possible
experience.


You created medium to advanced frontend websites, played around with physics
engines and games, did your part about creating webGl experiences, focused on
creating touch enabled experiences - and are always open to learn new languages
and playing around with new technologies. We digg performance, we embrace it,
only a super silky smooth website is one people will look at, so be ready to
squeeze every bit of frame out of that CPU and see that 60FPS counter blinking.


Over here you won‘t be working in a dark corner, but together with a group of
international creative‘s who are just waiting to see what you‘ve been up to. If
you like travelling - we got projects and clients all over the globe.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer Integrations
items.content:
__Who are we?__JOOR seeks to revolutionize the wholesale industry. Founded in
2010 and backed by top VC firms, JOOR's innovative mobile and web marketplace
improves the way brands and retailers do business. JOOR has developed
cutting-edge technology to facilitate wholesale transactions, attracting the
best brand and retailers - creating the wholesale industry standard.__Who are
you?__* You are a passionate full stack developer who writes beautiful,
advanced, readable, re-usable code.* You focus on long-term best practices and
coding standards.* You test your own code before it gets to a QA engineer.* You
improve legacy code and optimize code (yours and othersÃ¢Â Â ) for application
performance.* You recognize the importance of usability and focus on
consistency.* You know your users and always build with them in mind.* You work
well with others.* You are comfortable working in an Agile environment.* You
have a strong attention to detail.* You love to learn.* You know how to get
things done.__What will you do?__The Integrations team work with our clients to
import and export data from JOOR system. This is a strategic role and it
touches upon various parts of the system:* Collaborate with the Integrations
team to understand the client requirement and scope the changes. * Improve our
custom integrations - refactor the current custom integrations (in PHP) and
move this over to the API system (Python).* Building solid, well tested
libraries that can be used across many features * Architect and build the next
generation integration service. This encompasses the front-end and the REST
API.* YouÃ¢Â Â ll tackle complex problems and identify new ways to build
extensible technology platforms that will support global transactions.*
YouÃ¢Â Â ll recommend system solutions by comparing advantages and
disadvantages of custom development and existing alternatives.__What skills do
you have?__* 6+ years extensive experience in full stack development* Expert
knowledge in PHP* Experience with Python and Javascript.* Experience with a big
relational database (PostgreSQL preferred).* Self starter with a Collaborative
mindset* Experience in generating Excel files programmatically is a big plus.*
Experience with API design, and working with complex data structures.* Interest
in solving real-world business problems* Extremely resourceful* Curious

items.title: Experienced Ruby On Rails Developer
items.content:
We're looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer to join our scrum
team of multiple developers, QA and DevOps Engineers. This is a remote position
for US/Canadian candidates. Our platform features a responsive front-end built
with Ember.js, and a well-designed Rails API that combines semantic databases,
natural language processing, machine learning and search. 


You will be doing some or all of the following:



* Developing scalable, highly-performant, customer-facing we applications
with Ruby on Rails.

* Building RESTful APIs. 

* Improving system performance and reliability.  

* Writing clean, efficient and maintainable code.

* Helping us scale our rapidly growing web application. 


Ideally, you'd be local to our beautiful Upper Valley located on the border
between Vermont and New Hampshire where we'd welcome you to our fancy new
offices. We have a ping pong table, and are really excited about the craft
brewery that just opened up the street. If you're not within a daily commute
(we're about 100 miles northwest of Boston), we'll entertain applicants who
wish to work remotely. We'd ask you to travel to our offices (at our expense)
once a quarter so we can get everyone face-to-face for some bonding and
planning.

items.title: Freelance Drupal 8 Front end Developer
items.content:
Digital Pulp is seeking a passionate and talented Freelance Drupal 8 Front-end
Developer with superpowers to create exemplary interactive brand experiences
for our clients. We are seeking someone that has had a significant front-end
development role with Drupal.


You can assess and solve complex visual or functional issues with Drupal as
they arise, and work within the Drupal guidelines to come up with better
solutions when necessary. You have battled with preprocess functions and won,
and can bring to life our meticulously designed visual layouts and elegant user
interactions within the world of Drupal.


This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who would like to be part of an
experienced development team at one of New York's most well respected digital
agencies.

items.title: Intermediate Software Developer
items.content:
Why FuneralTech?


This is not your average software position. You’ll be developing solutions
used by funeral homes all over the world to help people through the most
difficult times in their lives.  What you create will have a positive influence
on a global scale.


We’re growing fast and there are a lot of opportunities to have a real impact.
Want to eventually move into DevOps? There is an opportunity for that. Want to
move into an architect role at some point?  No problem!  Have an idea that you
think is great and will help our clients? We want to hear it.


The coding standards, technology and processes we use belong to the dev team,
and we allow the dev team to have a say.  Nobody wants to work in an
environment in which they have no control.  Our developers are responsible for
the quality of our software, so they have input into our processes.


Quality


Our number one priority is quality. We know all too well how painful it is to
be responsible for a badly written piece of software. This is why we:



* Peer review all code before it can go into production.

* Put security first in all the code we write.

* Collaborate on all designs and project plans.

* Write Unit and/or Functional tests for all bug fixes and new features.


Continuously improve and refine our processes.


Job Description


As an intermediate developer, you’ll work alongside industry professionals and
experienced senior developers to create web-based software solutions for the
funeral home industry. The quality of our software is of the utmost importance.
As such, we are seeking candidates that take pride in what they develop, while
continually striving to improve the quality of their work and expand their
skillset.

items.title: Front-end Developer with React/Redux Experience
items.content:
WeÃ¢Â Â re hiring a full-time front-end developer with expertise in CSS,
JavaScript, and React/Redux application development. This position requires 30
hours per week of client billable work usually dedicated to a single project,
and another 10 hours of learning, communicating and making the web a better
place for everyone through open source contribution and knowledge sharing.
Lullabot is a fully distributed company, which mean you can work from wherever
works best for you.

items.title: Front-end Developer with React/Redux Experience
items.content:
Company Overview
Lullabot is a prestigious digital agency doing bleeding edge Drupal and
JavaScript development for large entertainment media companies. We deal in
Ã¢Â Â big content,Ã¢Â Â helping companies like NBC Universal, Turner
Broadcasting, Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia, and George Lucas Educational
Foundation achieve their digital marketing dreams.
Chances are good that working for Lullabot will be like nothing you've ever
done before. Lullabot has been a leader in Drupal-focused web development since
our founding in 2006. WeÃ¢Â Â re a distributed company without a central
office, and we hire the best talent wherever those people may live. Our team is
spread out across the US, Canada, and Europe. Most of us work from home. We are
masters of communication and our tightly-knit team works closely despite
geographical separation. In fact, most new employees say they feel more
connected to their co-workers at Lullabot than they ever did at a conventional
co-located company.
Lullabot hires humble individuals who strive for excellence and lifelong
learning with the ultimate aim of helping others.  
Job Summary
WeÃ¢Â Â re hiring a full-time front-end developer with expertise in CSS,
JavaScript, and React/Redux application development. This position requires 30
hours per week of client billable work usually dedicated to a single project,
and another 10 hours of learning, communicating and making the web a better
place for everyone through open source contribution and knowledge sharing.
Responsibilities and Duties
The ideal candidate will be willing and eager to:

* Work in service of LullabotÃ¢Â Â s clients, team members, and the
web-at-large, while embodying our core values
 in their work.
* Collaborate openly with designers and back-end developers to translate
visual designs based on business and functional requirements into well-crafted
front-end components.
* Apply front-end design patterns and best practices to ensure sites are
performant and cross-browser compatible.
* Write, write and write some more. Lullabot hires individuals who write
well, believing that good writers are good thinkers and tend to flourish in a
distributed company where communication is often asynchronous.
A typical day might begin with a Lullabot team call or some written
communication time, followed by a project scrum, and then finish with
four-to-six hours of writing, testing, and documenting code, usually for a
single project.
The chosen candidate will report to the front-end development manager, Sean
Lange , and also be accountable to
the project manager on their specific project. But fear not, these
relationships are not meant to be hierarchical or controlling, but rather
mutually beneficial, supporting your development and growth. Also, you
wonÃ¢Â Â t find better colleagues to learn from or a more receptive audience to
teach.
The chosen candidate must be willing and able to travel, up to one week per
month. Also, the candidate must actively participate in communicating with
other Lullabots in tickets, Yammer, Slack, through articles, and on calls. 
We have flexible hours, but we tend to schedule meetings during the North
American workday and expect employees to be online and available during most of
this time.
Areas of focus for this position will include:

* Front-end Architecture: Helps make the decisions that lead to a
sustainable, component-based architecture that minimizes technical debt and
allows others to navigate the codebase.
* Responsive Design: Make sure our mobile first designs look good on every
conceivable viewport. We think of breakpoints not so much in terms of mobile,
tablet, desktop, but rather as the point where a design starts to break as the
viewport expands.
* Accessibility: Which involves ensuring that a website appears correctly on
all devices and browsers, including for those with limitations. For more on
LullabotÃ¢Â Â s work around accessibility, visit our accessibots website
.
* Usability: Strive for simplicity. Make inviting websites that work for
ordinary users rather than websites that overwhelm.
* Performance: We work on high-profile, high-traffic websites and a deep
understanding of front-end performance is essential.
Technical Qualifications
While some of these qualifications may be aspirational, this list reflects the
general skill-level we expect: 

* B.S. Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or related field, or 2+
years working experience as a front-end developer or related field.
* Knowledge of current front-end design patterns and best practices.
* Experience with responsive design.
* Expertise in cross-browser compatibility and progressive enhancement.
* Experience with version control systems.
* Familiarity with CSS/JavaScript code-quality tools.
* Experience with preprocessors: Sass.
* Knowledge of front-end performance techniques.
* Familiarity with Drupal development and coding standards.
* Experience with enterprise-level deployment and build processes.
JavaScript Knowledge
* Active knowledge of the JavaScript ecosystem over the last 18 months.
* Use of ReactJS (ideally having launched large-scale applications).
* Flux or similar data-flow architectures (We use Redux).
* Gulp, npm, Webpack, Babel, Eslint, Mocha, PostCSS are all JS tools that we
use on a daily basis.
* Knowledge of video streaming techniques. Many apps that Lullabot works on
are made purely to stream video. Although we often don't write the video
processing logic ourselves, it does help to have a general understanding.
* Experience with BrightScript and Roku app development a plus.
Attributes

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Thorough attention to detail, quality, and precision.
* Ability to keep your cool, or, put another way, the ability to manage
multiple, time-sensitive tasks, while attending to the next right thing.
* Experience working with large, distributed software teams is a plus.
Benefits and Perks
Lullabot is distributed, but not a "virtual" company. The majority of our
workers are full-time employees, and we provide a great benefits package
including health, vision, dental, and life insurance; a retirement plan; a
generous tech stipend for employees to purchase computers, cell phones, etc.;
and a stock options package once you reach your two-year anniversary. We offer
new employees 15 paid-days-off per year plus holidays, which goes up to 20 days
on your two-year anniversary. And did we mention there's no commute? Your time
is flexible as well, so if you're a night-owl and do your best work after dark,
or you need to take a break to pick the kids up from school, it's usually not a
problem.
Optional Video 
As a distributed team, we frequently use video calls and the like to stay
connected. This is your first chance to try it out with us! Create a brief (2
min or less) video introducing yourself and talking about your interest and
experience for this job. We recommend creating a password protected video on
Vimeo, but feel free to choose whatever method suits you best. Take a look at 
one -of
-these
-videos
 to see what some Lullabot employees have submitted
in the past.
Salary Range
$65,000 - $85,000
Pay will be commensurate with experience. Full-time, exempt position.
One More ThingÃ¢Â Â¦
A quick read through Lullabot.com will show you that we grow very deliberately
and take our time hiring. Our hiring process can be lengthy because we want to
get it right.  We try to be transparent about our timeline and welcome you to
reach out tohr@lullabot.com and touch base on your
application at any time.
Lullabot, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate
against applicants or employees because of race, color, religion, national
origin, sex, age, or membership in any other class protected by law. Applicants
who require reasonable accommodation to complete the application and/or
interview process should notify Human Resources athr@lullabot.com
.

To apply: https://www.lullabot.com/jobs

items.title: Rails developer
items.content:
Inside.com is a network of email newsletters. We publish high quality roundups
that curate, summarize, and analyze all of the most important news in many
different verticals and industries. Some examples are cybersecurity, electric
vehicles, virtual and augmented reality, artificial intelligence, drones, and
more.
Inside's founder and CEO, Jason Calacanis, is an investor in 150 companies
including Uber, Thumbtack, and Wealthfront, and he previously built and sold a
media startup to AOL.
Over the past 10 months, we doubled our entire subscriber-base. Then we
doubled it again. Then we doubled it a third time. And weÃ¢Â Â re just getting
started. We also track net promoter scores and all of our newsletters score
between 66 and 89 Ã¢Â Â  which is right on par with world-renowned products
like the iPhone and the Tesla Model S.
We made most of this progress using off-the-shelf tools like Mailchimp, and
recently worked a development shop on a CMS that our writers can use to write
and manage our newsletters. We're looking for someone to take this to the next
level with us. Upcoming projects include:
   - New CMS features to help our writers move faster   - An ad server with a
self-service front-end for purchasing "classified ads" across our various
newsletters   - A CRM that helps us better understand our readers   - Lots more!
Here are some key requirements:

* A product mind. You'll be the main technical person on the team, and need
to be able to develop product ideas and direction on your own as well as in
collaboration with the team.
* Full-stack experience. Nothing we're doing is deeply technical, but we need
a well-rounded generalist who can handle every aspect of building and shipping
a responsive web app.
* Communication. This is a remote position and will require the ability to
stay in lock-step with the team.
* Curiosity. To excel in this role, you need to be excited about the business
we're building and the problems we're tackling.
We'd like to start this out as a contract role, probably about 30-40 hours per
week, and can go from there.

Apply for the role here: https://insidedailybrief.typeform.com/to/oWrWYI

Questions? Austin@inside.com
To apply: https://insidedailybrief.typeform.com/to/oWrWYI

items.title: Senior Software Developer
items.content:
The Carina team is looking for a full stack developer to help us build the
next platform for Managed Containers at Rackspace. We need a leader to help
drive decisions and implement significant portions of the API, control plane
and underlying data models for our managed container offerings. Working
effectively as a remote employee in a collaborative environment, especially on
open-source software, is an absolute must-have skill. Ideal candidates should
have experience with contemporary web frameworks like Python with Flask or
Django or Node with Express or Restify. Candidates should also be comfortable
with CI/CD pipelines, integrated testing and have a passion for delivering
quality products. Experience with modern data stores, including but not limited
to Redis, Mongo, MySQL/PostgreSQL/etc, Cassandra, or others is required.
Candidates must be able to articulate strengths and weaknesses of different
datastores, and be able to express how to define and design schemas in
accordance with business objectives. We also expect candidates to have
experience leveraging tools like Ansible, Chef, Puppet, for configuration
management and provisioning automation. We make heavy use and need our
candidates to be forward-thinking with how we automate our platforms.

items.title: Senior Front End Developer
items.content:
We are looking for a Senior Front-End Developer with a strong eye for design
that is an advocate for the user. This individual will write well-crafted,
high-quality and easy to maintain code. They will work closely with our
customers, as well as our back-end developers to craft valuable solutions for
our users. If you enjoy creating functional code that provides an exceptional
experience, we encourage you to apply!


Essential Job Functions:



* Create mockups, wireframes, and layouts that promote ease of use and
optimize how customers interact with all new products and features

* Able to work with core front-end and middleware technologies, including
HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery and UI MVC frameworks

* Prepare prototypes for the new product applications and features

* Capable of programming and working with APIs and Restful Web Services

* Understand HTML/CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, responsive and mobile with
direct experience optimizing design concepts around these technologies

* Strong experience with UX design

* Able to maintain attention to detail while working in a fast-paced
environment

* Think creatively and justify concepts

* 3 years experience with JavaScript and HTML

* Java, Linux, and OSX experience

items.title: Skilled ColdFusion Java Developer
items.content:
We are an Innovative and Established young tech company, in Austin TX, that is
continuously developing applications, software, and solutions to better lives.

We are seeking a talented programmer that wants to learn and grow with a team
in a fast-paced environment. This is an employment position with solid pay and
lots of room for growth. This individual must be a motivated self-starter,
hardworking, and should work well with a team as well as on their own.

An ideal candidate should be a fast learner of new tools and technologies. The
candidate should be comfortable with Enterprise Java, ColdFusion, and the
Spring Framework. Strong analytical skills are a big plus when working with
relational and document databases. The candidate should be familiar with
front-end and back-end development, and be able to follow requirements
documents while voicing his/her opinions on possible improvements and
innovations.

Position Responsibilities:

* Responsible for developing, enhancing, modifying and/or maintaining
applications.
* Design, develop and maintain high-performance and high-availability
software products.
* Work with other development team members to implement designed solutions.
* Take ownership and accountability for the deliverable in all phases of the
development lifecycle.
* Proactively participate in platform design and review activities.

Skill Requirements:

* Minimum 4+ years of overall development / technical expertise.
* Proficiency in ColdFusion, Java, JavaScript, HTML5, PHP, and the entire
development stack.
* Experience with jQuery and JavaScript frameworks.
* Knowledge and experience with Agile and test driven development practices.
* Working knowledge of Git.
* Experience in MySQL.

Desired Traits

* Experience using Java Frameworks, preferably Spring. 
* Experience using ColdFusion Frameworks, preferably ColdBox.
* Experience with OAuth for clients and providers.
* Experience with Amazon AWS and working in a cloud environment.
* Experience developing PHP applications and Wordpress plugins.
* Experience in continuous integration and build processes (Jenkins, Circle
CI).
* Experience with Docker and Vagrant.
* Experience with caching technologies (Redis, Memcache, AWS ElastiCache).
* Knowledge and familiarity with Big Data technologies.
Education:

* Minimum education requirement: Bachelors degree in computer science or
related field.
Please provide salary requirements in application.

Job Type: Full-time

Required experience:

* Software application development: 4+ years

items.title: DevOps Back end Developer PeerJ
items.content:
PeerJ is looking for a DevOps / Back-end engineer who is happy to get their
hands on a production environment and get stuck in. Our application is built on
the Symfony framework, with some other toys in the background to help the
application along its way.


We’re looking for someone who can work on our DevOps side and build on our
current back-end services to improve performance, security, features and
integrations and the way it talks to the front-end Symfony framework.


You’ll definitely have the ability to liaise with other team members in order
to establish requirements, you’re able to work autonomously and along side
other team members to build new features and solve problems, and you’ll
understand what a production system is and what to do and not do on it.

current back-end services to improve performance, security, features and

other team members to build new features and solve problems, and you’ll
understand what a production system is and what to do and not do on it.

items.title: Senior Ruby Developer (London office or Remote in UK)
items.content:
Overview
Our sophisticated web crawler helps some of the world's top companies improve
their web sites by giving them deep, comprehensive insights into their problems
-- and solutions. Companies that make their business on the web depend on
DeepCrawl to improve user experience, manage change, and improve indexability.
Your role is to bring your passion for Ruby and other open-source technologies
to build better tools for improving web sites.  In the end, itÃ¢Â Â s all about
making the web a better place for users -- with fewer annoying gimmicks and
more genuinely useful, well designed, easily found resources. WeÃ¢Â Â ve built
our stack on AWS and leading open source technologies: Ruby, PostgreSQL,
MongoDB, AngularJS.  As a Ruby developer, youÃ¢Â Â ll be writing backend code
with our core team, and will have ample opportunity to learn new skills and
evaluate leading-edge technologies as we seek the most powerful ways to reach
our users.
This position is available to remote candidates anywhere in the UK, and to
London candidates who can work in our London office.
Your responsibilities will include:

* Work with a small but growing team of developers who are passionate about
improving design, usability, reliability, scalability, and clarity of code, all
with the end goal of satisfying our many users and making the web a better place
* Help improve the scalability and performance of our crawlerÃ¢Â Â s data
processing pipeline, and improve your understanding of performant and scalable
design
* Run benchmarks for performance- and resource-sensitive features
* Help improve test coverage and testability of code
* Work with product owners to write technical specifications for new features
* Help improve internal tools for monitoring, testing, bug fixing, and
administration
* Provide mentoring and architectural guidance for other devs (architectural
planning, code reviews)
Requirements
Essential:

* Solid professional development experience
* A deep knowledge of Ruby
* An ability to understand and design complex application architecture
* Experience with two or more of the following: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis,
RabbitMQ, MySQL, AWS, RSpec
* Solid experience with modern testing practice
* Excellent spoken and written English
Desirable:

* Experience working with data at scale
* Deep experience with PostgreSQL or a no-SQL data store, eg MongoDB or Redis
About DeepCrawl
DeepCrawl is a sophisticated crawling service, used by the worldÃ¢Â Â s
largest brands and SEO agencies to find and monitor many problems with their
sites -- ultimately making them easier to find and use.  We believe that by
providing powerful tools to improve web sites, we make the web a better place
for everyone.  WeÃ¢Â Â ve got big ambitions to continue our fast growth and
expansion into new markets, and be the tool of choice for SEO, digital
marketing and beyond.
To apply: To apply, send a CV to careers@deepcrawl.com
.

items.title: Senior Full Stack .NET Web Developer
items.content:
Summary


Outreach, Inc has a mission to equip the Church to reach people with the
Gospel of Jesus Christ. Over our 20 year history, we’ve equipped tens of
thousands of churches to reach millions of people. Large and small
organizations alike have partnered with us to change the world for the Church.
But as the medium for reaching people changes, and the world becomes more
digital, we need more people with technical skills and experience to join us in
our mission.


Becoming a member of the Outreach software development team means that you’ll
help shape the future of how we equip the Church. We’re a small team of
software developers and designers, responsible for a wide variety of
applications and services. Every day we’re presented with new ideas and new
opportunities which our team approaches using an agile mindset. So if you’re a
senior full stack web developer that can help us grow our team and appreciates
working on a wide range of projects, we’d love to hear from you.



How we build software


Our product design and software development processes are grounded in Agile
principles and informed by LEAN Startup and SCRUM methodologies:



* We put our customers at the center of every decision - life is way too
short to build something nobody wants

* We design and build to learn, then we build to scale - experimentation and
learning are central to our approach

* We measure our results and test our assumptions - data informs our decision
making, not the loudest person in the room

* We're constantly learning and growing as individuals and as a team - a
growth mindset and strong drive for continuous improvement is a must


Our tech stack and tooling is pretty awesome, but we’re always looking for
ways to improve:



* We use SQL Server as our data store, accessed through Entity Framework.

* On the back end, we’re using .NET Core.

* On the front end, we’re using React.js.


We've been leveraging virtualized environments since the early 2000's, but in
2017 we'll be moving to the cloud by:



* Embracing DevOps as a discipline

* Defining our infrastructure as code

* Migrating from monoliths to microservices

* Running our apps in containers

* Automating our entire process


To Apply


In addition to your resume, please submit a cover letter explaining why you
are interested in the company, the position, and software development in
general. In your cover letter, tell us which you use - tabs or spaces - and
tell us why you are right. Most importantly, include an online portfolio (e.g.
GitHub) that shows some of the projects that you’ve worked on. Without a
portfolio, your application may not be considered.

items.title: WordPress Developer
items.content:
About Our Company



ElegantThemes.com is a leader in WordPress Theme & Plugin Development. We have
been building the top premium WordPress themes and plugins for the past 8
years and we maintain the largest customer bases in the ecosystem. 350,799
users, freelance developers and web design agencies depend on our beautiful
designs and we work hard everyday to make sure we are creating the best
WordPress products on the web. Divi, our flagship theme and page builder plugin
is pushing the boundaries and has inspired an absolutely amazing community to
form around it. A focus on community is a core part of our culture and it makes
our work environment is a truly rewarding one.





Job Description



As a WordPress Developer at Elegant Themes, you will be working with a small
and agile team made up of talented devs from all around the world. We work with
git, chat on Slack and our team structure is flat and open. Self-motivated
individuals tend to thrive best here, and we are looking for someone filled
with inspiration and who isn't afraid to take initiative.



This position is for someone with a deep understanding of WordPress. You have
built your own themes and plugins before and possibly even contributed to
WordPress Core. You enjoy finding elegant solutions to complex problems and are
familiar with the WordPress motto - 'code is poetry.' You are up-to-date with
the latest and greatest trends and technologies because you are engaged in the
open source community and you enjoy building software that pushes the web
forward. While WordPress is a PHP-based application, our flagship product uses
a front-end interface built with React.js and Flux. A good amount of your time
will be spent developing with Javascript.



This is a full time position available to both on-site and remote employees.
Employment includes full benefits, paid vacation, a competitive salary and
unlimited espresso brewed from our Rocket Cellini Premium Plus v2!

 



Responsibilities




* Be creative and contribute based on your own merit.

* Be a positive, humble and contributing member to our small team. 

* Take the initiate to better yourself as a developer and to apply that
knowledge to better our products and help our team succeed. 





Required Experience




* Complete understanding of the WordPress core software and its functions at
the code level.

* Experience building WordPress themes/plugins.

* Mastery of WordPress coding and security best practices.





Required Skills




* PHP

* CSS

* HTML

* MYSQL

* JAVASCRIPT

* GIT





Bonus Qualifications




* REACT

* JQUERY

* BACKBONE

* REDUX

* GRUNT

* GULP

* SASS

* A history of open source software contribution



Learn More



Learn more about life at Elegant Themes, including our full list of perks and
benefits: http://www.elegantthemes.com/careers/

items.title: Full Stack .NET Software Developer
items.content:
Inteligenz is hiring 3 new team members! Both junior and senior developers are
invited to join our current team of 8 talented developers and analysts. Being a
small company, we offer flexibility, a lack of bureaucracy, and variety in
day-to-day activities—with an opportunity to work with many of the most
important modern technologies.


Specific job responsibilities depend on experience and areas of interest but
include a subset of the following:


Responsibilities



* Interpret and implement performance metrics from written specifications to
C# and SQL


* Quickly isolate discrepancies between expected and actual results


* Refactor and improve customer-facing web applications to be cleaner and
more performant


* Includes conversion of some ASP.NET MVC to Angular SPA


* Advance our DevOps environment; improve & automate everything! Make it
easier to develop, test, and deploy high quality software

* Troubleshoot existing code: Quickly identify bugs

* Improve performance of systems: Find inefficient code or data
representations in C#, SQL, or JavaScript

* Develop and improve offline metrics build process

* Create or updated custom file importers written in C# (in most cases, these
are fairly simple)

* Interact with customers

* Assist with special projects as needed / other duties as assigned


Misc stuff we use



* C#, SQL, HTML+CSS, ASP.NET MVC, Web API, AngularJs, MS SQL Server, MS
Analysis Services, JavaScript/TypeScript, AWS, X12, TeamCity, StyleCop, Visual
Studio, NUnit, Selenium, git, Stash, github, Fisheye, Octopus Deploy, FogBugz,
PowerShell, OAuth

items.title: Spring Boot Java Software Engineer Pizza Wine
items.content:
Granbury Solutions is building a next generation technology stack for our
restaurant and winery management platforms and we need your help.  We're
looking for Java Developers of all experience levels to help change the world
of food and wine forever.  If you're hip to Spring Boot and wish the higher ups
would give you a chance to use it, it might be time to get some new higher ups.


We have a number of positions available on our restaurant point-of-sale and
direct to consumer wine teams.  Our new tech stack isSpring Boot on top of
Couchbase, Rabbit MQ and Elastic Search.  


You'll work with people who are as nice as they are smart.  You'll get the
guidance you need and you won't be shamed when you stumble across a problem you
don't know how to solve on your own.  You'll deal with a minimum of corporate
nonsense and getthe freedom to do things right.  


And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote
position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.
 We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical
conference or in person design confab.  But most importantly, you'll give hard
working locally owned businesses a real chance in theirstruggle against the
empire.  Seriously.

items.title: Angular 2 Software Engineer For Pizza Arms Race
items.content:
Front End Javascript is the Wild West, full of visionaries, trolls, and rival
gangs trying to off each other one subtweet and Hacker News flame war at a
time.  You've flipped the table in disgust and switched toTypescript.  You've
thrown your lot in with Google and figure even thoughAngular 2 is still in
Beta, that it's the safest bet out there.  We agree with you.


You also love pizza and yearn to know everything about it.  How it's priced,
how it's ordered, and how that touch screen thingy the cashier is looking at
works.  You're in luck.  We make thosetouch screen thingies and the next
generation of them will run Angular 2.


Pizza delivery has turned into a technology arms race and you'll join a real
David and Goliath struggle against the major national pizza chains.  We're
building a technology arsenal that independent pizza restaurants and mom and
pop operations can use to compete toe to toe with the big three.


We're looking for you, a solid front end web developer looking for an excuse
to use Typescript and Angular 2 on a real project, maybe even in a full time
job situation with features likepaychecks and health benefits.  You'll work
from home with a remote team full of smart people who aren't jerks about it. 
We have high technical standards and we expect a lot, but we'll treat you like
a human and you'll work with cool stuff like fingerprint readers, cash drawers,
chip card readers, LED pole displays, digital signage, and thermal receipt
printers.  You'll get a shiny new Macbook Pro and an O'Reilly Safari
subscription.  Your team includes nice people with names like Danny, Gillian,
and Muhit.  You'll meet them in person every so often at a tech conference or a
client site.
