items.title: Front End Developer
items.content:
Alliance for a Healthier Generation


Title: Front End Developer


Department: Technology Team


Location: Open/negotiable


Hours: Full-time, exempt


OVERVIEW OF THE ALLIANCE


For more than a decade, the Alliance for a Healthier Generation has worked to
empower kids to develop lifelong, healthy habits, by ensuring the environments
that surround them provide and promote good health. The Alliance, founded by
the American Heart Association and Clinton Foundation, operates as an
independent 501c3 non-profit organization guided by its own Board of Directors.
As one of the nation’s largest children’s health organizations focusing on
combating childhood obesity, the Alliance utilizes the best available
scientific evidence of programs, policies and practices that positively impact
healthy eating and physical activity behaviors among youth. The Alliance’s
current work directly impacts more than 25 million children, with a focus on
low-income and minority populations who are at increased risk for poor health,
obesity and other diseases.  To learn more and join the movement, visit
www.HealthierGeneration.org . 


It is the goal of the Alliance to fill employment vacancies with the most
qualified applicants, whether recruiting internally or externally. Strong
consideration will be given to qualified internal candidates. All internal and
external candidates must comply with application requirements.


JOB SUMMARY


The Alliance is seeking a skilled developer with front end development, broad
system design and implementation experience. This position will be responsible
for defining, developing and deploying custom code to deliver high quality,
high impact solutions. This position will work on the Alliance’s web products
that include:



* Alliance website: https://www.healthiergeneration.org/


* Schools: https://schools.healthiergeneration.org/


* Out-of-School Time: https://host.healthiergeneration.org/


* Let’s Move! Active Schools: https://myactiveschool.letsmoveschools.org/



The Alliance’s custom code is built within Clockwork’s Active Media Manager,
on LAMP stack with significant javascript. Data captured online syncs with
Microsoft Dynamics CRM. In addition, there are three SSO integrations with
third party sites.


The ideal candidate will be an experienced front end developer, comfortable
with complexity, detail-oriented, forward-thinking and passionate about
children’s health and social change.

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
Software Engineer (Multiple Openings)

Join our team to build a next-generation community management solution that
clients already use to manage their communities all around the world.
Scope
The product team is in startup/growth mode so you will likely get to wear many
different hats and enjoy making a direct impact on our products and engineering
culture. The team is fully distributed and as a member of the team you are
expected to:

* Take ownership of development projects to implement new features
* Collaborate with your colleagues on design and implementation
* Constructively participate in code reviews
* Help scale out our platform
* Support on-boarding of new clients
* Always strive to help the team become better
Requirements

* Must live in the United States or Canada
* Excellent communication skills
* Work effectively on a distributed team
* Well-versed in effective software engineering practices
* Strong desire to learn and expand upon your technical foundations      
Some of the following

* Heavy experience in Python and Django code bases
* Experience with containerization using Docker
* Strong experience with usage and setup of configuration managements
systems, such as Salt, Puppet, Chef
* Strong frontend development experience with modern Javascript frameworks,
ideally React
* Strong understanding of HTML,CSS, JavaScript, templating
Preferred

* BS Computer Science or equivalent experience
* Strong experience in distributed software development teams
* Strong experience with tech startup environments
* Experience building large web applications
* Passion for startups and desire to become part of a startup success story
* Experience with automated testing
* Experience with the GitHub development flow and code reviews

To apply: jobs@startupgrind.com

items.title: Front End Web Developer
items.content:
Required
Able to write responsive mark-up/CSS that works across browsers, operating system and form factor
Able to write components in vanilla JavaScript (no frameworks)
Strong communication skills
test frameworks (Selenium / Phantom JS)

Ideal
Experience supporting a marketing function (common design language, etc…)
Experience consuming back-end API/services
Understanding of open source software licenses
Comfortable in an Agile environment
Understanding of front-end frameworks (React)

Summary
We’re looking for someone who obsesses over details, thrives in a collaborative environment and jumps at the opportunity to take on new challenges.
You will be involved heavily in building UI/UX for an asp.net core frontend. The site is entirely responsive, so experience with mobile, tablet and desktop form factors (and their appropriate design patterns) is a must.

Location: Brixton, London. You will be required to work at least part time in our office in Brixton.

Salary: £55,000 pa or equivalent

Start date: Immediate

items.title: Innovative startup looking for talented UX/UI Rockstar
items.content:
*UX/UI Rockstar*

*About us*

BlockEx is a Digital Asset eXchange Platform (DAXP) - built for creation, issuance and exchange of digital assets. It’s the world’s first true HFT capable exchange for next generation financial assets built using Blockchain technology. BlockEx also offers custom Blockchain solutions and digital asset creation for governments, regulators and FIs. BlockEx Labs works with trading firms, financial institutions and governments providing managed services for its tool kits and bespoke blockchain implementations.

*Who we need*

We are young and ambitious start up, with a clear vision of our product offering. Due to continued expansion we are looking to recruit a highly talented, creative and experienced Front End Engineer to work on the continuous development of a flagship product using the latest of technologies, whilst working alongside some highly skilled developers.
We wouldn't be at the cutting-edge of blockchain technology without a talented technology team to implement, develop and maintain our infrastructure. We are looking for a confident Engineer who is full of ideas. Not only will you deliver UI/UX designs loaded with aesthetic class for our Blockchain based financial systems, but you'll drive forward improvements by contributing towards our Core Technology and Product roadmaps.

*About you*

You're a credible UX/UI leader who has designed and delivered robust product solutions for high profile clients in the past. Here, you'll be surrounded by people who are passionate about their craft and you'll be their "go to" person for technical guidance and planning. Bring us the product quality we need to impress our sophisticated user base target, giving them the confidence from first impression that they are engaging with an organisation for whom excellence is a way of life.

*Skills and Knowledge:*
* Full command of HTML, CSS, SASS/LESS and Node.js
* Deep experience of building complex JavaScript applications using ReactJS or AngularJS
* 5+ years’ experience designing and architecting high volume consumer facing applications
* Practical experience of the core XP practices of TDD/BDD, Pair Programming, and CI/CD
* Responsive design
* Excellent communications skills
* Positive and proactive attitude

*Opportunity*

The role offers high level technical challenges and growth potential. This is an established but early stage Blockchain startup and joining now gets you in at elevator level. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to progress within the role and department and gain numerous benefits including a share incentive scheme, IP innovation scheme and an internal accelerator scheme, to name a few.

items.title: PHP Software Engineer
items.content:
Here at Mindera, we are building a world class team and would love it for you to join us.

As a PHP Software Engineer you’ll interact with the client to guarantee you deliver an awesome product.

We’re looking for developers with a solid web development background; comfortable working on and learning about any part of the software stack (a solid understanding of PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Apache/NGINX). Your focus is to develop with high standards having operational aspects in mind (metrics collection, tracing, etc.) with an holistic view.

Expected travelling time (PT and USA): 0%-15%, varies according to project/client.

*REQUIREMENTS*

*You are good at*
* Working directly with the client to ensure the technical feasibility of the requirements.
* Service oriented architectures, design patterns and data structures.
* Test-driven development and continuous delivery.
* Metrics, performance, and operational aspects that show you care about your code.
* Configuring and maintaining Apache/NGINX servers.

*You rock at*
* Building server-side and client-side application using PHP Symfony framework, Javascript and HTML.
* Create and maintain MySQL Databases
* Understanding of security and performance concepts when developing and deploying modern web applications

*We offer*
*Fantastic working environment built on the principles of lean and self-organisation;
* Fun, happy and politics-free work culture;
* Competitive salaries and benefits;
* Potential to international travel;
* Working with high profile clients in consultancy environment;
* No dress code, corporate speak or middle managers.

*About Mindera*

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera. We partner with our clients, to understand their product and deliver high performance, resilient and scalable software systems that create an impact in their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog: http://mindera.com/ and our Handbook: http://tinyurl.com/zc599tr

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA

UK: Think IT Solutions Ltd is part of the Mindera Group

items.title: Front End Developer
items.content:
Flexy was designed and built by a crack team of psychologists, recruitment gurus, and razor-sharp digital architects. Disillusioned with the old fashioned temporary employment sector, the team worked tirelessly day and night to revolutionize the casual labour market. One year on and Flexy was born.

Our nifty little service cuts out the middle men and directly connects employers with vetted, fabulous temporary workers. We provide an extremely useful management dashboard for employers, we take care of all the boring paperwork and tax stuff for workers, and we use clever psychometric algorithms to perfectly match up workers and employers (with a little bit of nudge analysis in the mix to provide that extra spark of motivation).

We are looking for a frontend specialist with experience building single page applications, intricate knowledge of HTML5, CSS (with LESS or SASS) and JavaScript and who has an eye for UX & visual design. The right candidate will be able to design and implement frontend wireframes and workflows from end to end.

Your knowledge and experience:
• 2 - 3 years’ experience in a software development environment.
• Strong mobile experience, incl. responsive design and cross platform app development.
• Strong interest in UX / UI design, preferably with experience.
• Demonstrable understanding of OOP fundamentals.
• Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS, JavaScript.
• Exposure to CSS a pre-processor like LESS / Sass.
• Exposure to an SPA framework like AngularJS or React. Angular 2 preferred.
• Exposure to or interest in ES6 / ES7, TypeScript.
• Proficient with industry standard graphic design tooling.
• Proficient with GIT SCM.
• Understanding of TDD / BDD, CI & CD principles.
• Excellent communication skills and ability to work as part of a team.
• Exposure to working in an Agile environment.

Nice to have:
• Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, GCE.
• Familiar with microservices architecture & containerization tech like Docker.
• Understanding of type systems (dabbled with C#, C++, Java?)

Job benefits:
• Competitive salary
• Equity share options
• 25 days of holiday
• Central London office with relaxed and vibrant atmosphere

This really is a fantastic opportunity to work for a unique start-up at a very early stage in our development. We are incredibly ambitious, and have the drive and determination to ensure Flexy meets the aspirations we have for the company. If you’d like to play a key part in our journey, then please send us your CV along with a short cover message. We will respond to all applications.

items.title: Back end web/app developer - ArtBrowser
items.content:
Website: www.artbrowserapp.com

ArtBrowser is a global marketplace for art lovers to discover artworks by a selection of independent artists and galleries. Art lovers can browse artworks using our unique Tinder style like/dislike button; view the most trending artworks; follow their favourite artists or galleries and receive personalised invites to events and exhibitions.

ArtBrowser solves a number of problems for art lovers, artists and galleries. It provides a unique browsing experience for art lovers looking to browse artworks by hundreds of artists and galleries in one place. They can connect with their favourite artists and galleries and save on commission (50%) by buying directly from the artists.

For artists and galleries ArtBrowser provides a great platform to cater to the rapidly growing online art industry which is already valued at over $2.64 billion and expected to triple in the next 5 years. For small and emerging artists ArtBrowser will also help democratise the world of selling art which is controlled by art galleries and it is often very difficult for them to enter.

The most innovative feature of ArtBrowser is the unique Tinder style swipe like/dislike browsing experience. Art lovers can also view the most trending artworks across different categories (Portraits, Photographs, etc.) They can follow their favourite artists and galleries and receive announcements (via their personal feed) inviting them to events and exhibitions.

Another aspect which distinguishes ArtBrowser from other online galleries (Artfinder, etc.) is the fact that it is a genuine marketplace playing host to a huge number and wide variety of artists and galleries. There are other marketplaces which sell art (for example Etsy) however they do not specialise in selling art and thus unlikely to attract serious art lovers. Also ArtBrowser is perhaps the first mobile platform for promoting artworks and events in the visual arts industry. The mobile app industry is growing rapidly and by being a mobile platform ArtBrowser can distinguish itself from competition.

Skills & Requirements:
Problem solver & able to think on your feet.
Incredible passion for web/app development
Experience with User Analytics
A basic understanding of UX

items.title: Full Stack Junior contract developer
items.content:
Who are we?

DynaRisk’s mission is to help people protect themselves online so they can reap all the benefits the internet has to offer. We’re a fast-moving start-up with a team that is operating at the forefront of Cyber Security.
We are looking for an experienced full stack junior PHP developer for a short to medium term contract to build standalone modules and to refine some of the existing UX elements of our suite of products based on agile practises with well-defined specifications.

Who are you?

Industry experience in software development with a minimum of 2-3 years, ideally in a start-up environment. Any greenfield experience will be highly valued.
Full-stack contract engineer with excellent PHP and front end skills in HTML/CSS BootStrap, Yii/JQuery / Angular etc.
You should also have experience in software development practises such as patterns, object-oriented design, unit testing, continuous integration etc.
You have already developed some RESTful endpoints for mobile apps using a modern backend framework and you have worked with both relational and NoSql Databases.

You are legally able to work in the UK without visa sponsorship requirements.
Most importantly, you have a passion for innovation.

What we offer:

You will have competitive day rates and flexible work hours and the ability to work from home a few days per week.

Our hiring process

Send your CV and a (brief) cover letter.
We will start with an initial chat over skype or a coffee and take it from there.
Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters unless we have specifically asked a given recruiter to submit candidates for this role.

items.title: Full Stack Mid-level contract developer
items.content:
Who are we?

DynaRisk’s mission is to help people protect themselves online so they can reap all the benefits the internet has to offer. We’re a fast-moving start-up with a team that is operating at the forefront of Cyber Security.
We are looking for an experienced full stack PHP mid-level developer for a short to medium term contract. You will be building standalone modules and refine some of the existing elements of our suite of products based on agile practises but with well-defined specifications.

Who are you?

You have experience in open source software development with a minimum of 4-6 years, ideally in a start-up environment. Any greenfield experience will be highly valued.
You have experience or deep interest in multi tenet user centric product development.
You’re work history shows excellent full stack PHP development skills with MVC architecture and you have worked with both relational and NoSql Databases creating API level Isolation.
You have worked with OAuth implementations at client and server levels.

Your front-end skills includes HTML/CSS BootStrap, Yii/JQuery / Angular etc with PHP MVC.
You have already developed RESTful endpoints using a modern framework and have experience optimising performance, scaling and load balancing.
You should also have excellent software development practises such as patterns, object-oriented design, unit testing, continuous integration etc. You have experience working with code quality analysis tools such as SonarCube or Ripstech.

You are legally able to work in the UK without visa sponsorship requirements.
Most importantly, you have a passion for innovation.

What we offer:
You will have competitive day rates and flexible work hours and the ability to work from home a few days per week.

Our hiring process
Send your CV and a (brief) cover letter.
We will start with an initial chat over skype or a coffee and take it from there.
Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters unless we have specifically asked a given recruiter to submit candidates for this role.

items.title: Full Stack Junior Software Engineer
items.content:
Who are we?

DynaRisk’s mission is to help people protect themselves online so they can reap all the benefits the internet has to offer. We’re a fast-moving start-up with a team that is operating at the forefront of Cyber Security.

We have a small, highly technical, energetic team based London. We get things done quickly, set optimistic objectives and work hard to hit them. We are technology enthusiasts, working at the cutting edge of the cyber security revolution.
We are looking for an experienced full stack open source developer to join as a key member of our technical team to assist our CTO. You will build new and refine existing elements of our suite of products and take responsibility for hands on coding and implementations.

Along with our existing team of developers, you will build and test at lightning speed, and implement cutting-edge solutions to create a best-in-class product.


Who are you?

Industry experience in software development with a minimum of 3 years, ideally in a start-up environment, any additional experience will be highly valued.
Full-stack engineer with a deep interest in multi tenet user centric product development.
Language agnostic approach to programming with excellent software development habits such as patterns, object-oriented design, unit testing, continuous integration etc.
You also have great Front-end web application development experience in JS frameworks and toolkits such as Bootstrap or Yii along with Angular or Knockout or similar.
You have already developed some RESTful endpoints for mobile apps using a modern backend framework.
You are able to learn new frameworks on the fly when needed.
You’re obsessed with how your applications will hold up in production, with real users doing bad things to them.
You can work well in a team and contribute solutions to problems when needed and measure impact.
You feel comfortable in agile development and rapid iteration environments and are excited about working with a mix of deeply technical people.
You are legally able to work in the UK without visa sponsorship requirements.
Most importantly, you have a passion for innovation.


What we offer:

You will have competitive salary, employee options, flexible work hours and the ability to work from home a few days per week.
You will be surrounded with and supported by our expert advisors in the cyber security, insurance and technology.
The opportunity to learn and grow by working closely with our CTO. You’ll also own some of the most strategic and challenging efforts from concept through implementation and evolution.
Whether you’ve built APIs or scaled to cater for billions of requests daily, we have a lot of different problem spaces that you will enjoy.
You will be a key hire in transforming our current technical development process. This role could evolve to have you lead your own platform team as we grow.

Our hiring process

Please send your CV and a (brief) cover letter.
We will start with an initial chat over skype or a coffee and take it from there.
Please note that we do not accept applications or résumés from recruiters unless we have specifically asked a given recruiter to submit candidates for this role.

items.title: Entrepreneurial Mobile Developer / Co - founder
items.content:
Georical is a location based platform (social network) that lets you access the world around you and at large via the ‘Centerlink’. Tap into the live local and global collective consciousness and contribute to it yourself.

I am looking for an experienced mobile developer to join me in London as a Co-founder on an equity basis initially, working together on an ambitious venture.

What if we could access the world… A digital version of it? What if we could organise and make sense of it and make it interactive for the world to use in different ways? What if we could create a sort of digital singularity?

Join me and let’s build a platform which aims to reinvent the essence of the web by extending it, organising the world, and letting anybody access it in different ways whereby Georical is a more people centric based web organised around a literal digital version of the real world which can be accessed and interacted with in multiple different ways.

For the average user it will act as an inter-personal and connected life companion and as a window in the real world. But at large, Georical is an idea that aims to serve the world in different ways by being a unifying platform for other people, businesses/startups, government, enterprises, news, media, information, content, IoT brands, products, services, tools, other platforms, the web and everything in between.

You would help drive further development of the current iOS app and spear head the development of the android app.

If you’re inspired by the possibilities of this vision and are interested in finding out more, drop me a line and let’s connect!

About Georical

Our mission:

To organise the world, make it accessible and interactive.

Our Vision:

The big idea behind Georical is to let you access the world like the World Wide Web lets you access the internet and to essentially become an extension of the wider web; a world without barriers and a web of connections. A digital version of the real world.

items.title: Front End AngularJS Developer
items.content:
AngularJS role working on a rebrand/rebuild of an existing booking platform.

A Manchester based company is looking for a talented AngularJS Developer. Responsibilities will include implementing visual elements and their behaviours with user interactions. Working with the back-end web developers and existing REST API you will also be bridging the gap between the visual elements and the server-side infrastructure. Designs and html elements are already in place so your responsiblities will solely be with the Angular development side.

Contract work offering a competitibe rate of £300-£400 a day, depending on experience, with an initial term of 3 months and a good chance of it being extended. You will be working remotely so this vacancy is open to all in the UK.

Responsibilities
Implementing visual elements and their behaviours with user interactions.
Build reusable code for future use.
Optimise applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Collaborating with other team members
And more.

Skills
3 years + using JavaScript and or JavaScript Frameworks.
Strong understanding of JavaScript, its quirks, and workarounds.
Great understanding of AngularJS 1 or 2
Excellent HTML5 & CSS3/SCSS skills.

No recruitment agencies unless we contact you!

items.title: Android Developer
items.content:
From start to finish, our Android apps are you all over.

Bink is a FinTech start-up business that’s shaking up the loyalty card sector. This is your chance to get in on it. Whether you’re just starting out or have years’ experience under your belt, as an Android Developer, you’ll imagine, develop and roll-out apps that are adding value to our customers – both consumers and brands alike. And as we’re only at the beginning of this adventure, you can make of us what you will. Learn. Push for better. And get well-rewarded for your efforts too.

The role
Developing a range of mobile, easy-to-use, intelligent apps, you’ll:
- work across the whole app lifecycle – creating best-in-class apps that are content based and powered by an in-house API.
- get involved in everything from information architecture and debugging to analysing data to inform decisions, as well as scoping and estimating.

About you
We need android developers at all levels. Whether you’re looking to grow, or show us how to do it, if you’re a passionate Android purist you’ll fit right in. You’ll:
- impress us technically: Java for Android and SDK, SQLite DB; HTML, CSS JavaScript; JSON; a familiarity with Android Design Principles; strong UI and UX; knowledge of APIs and external data sources; excellent unit testing / QA skills; integration to analytics, crash reporting and performance profiling providers, as well as secure coding practices are all on our wish list.
- work well in a team, be a great communicator, be organised, know about emerging technologies and media, can multi-task, have great time management, can work using agile methodologies and are flexible through and through.

Life at Bink
Bink is poised to change the world of loyalty forever by linking payment cards to loyalty programs – ensuring customers never miss out on the rewards they deserve. Founded by two serial entrepreneurs, things happen quickly around here. It’s fast-paced, inspired and fun. Our offices are a two-minute walk from Ascot Train Station (just 50 minutes from London) and close to the M3. It’s a space that’s bright and relaxed, but buzzing with excitement. We pay the kind of salaries that make our people feel valued and offer 25 days’ holiday, pension, healthcare and discretionary bonuses. We also genuinely like each other – which means we throw in lunches, drinks, fruit, game nights and other socials. After all, we like to say thank you too. Bink is heading for exceptional things. Bink or miss out.
To apply…

items.title: Python Developers
items.content:
Behind every great app is a sharp-as-you-like Python Developer. You.

Bink is a FinTech start-up business that’s shaking up the loyalty card sector. This is your chance to get in on it. Whether you’re just starting out or have years’ experience under your belt, as a Python Developer, you’ll work across the whole lifecycle on cutting-edge projects that are revolutionising the industry. Get ready for accelerated learning, to push for better and to be rewarded well for it too.

The role
This is not a follow-the-rule-book kind of development role. What we’re doing is great. What we’re capable of doing is jaw-dropping. You’ll:
- get involved from concept to launch, working on various back-end services in a Linux environment to support the kind of mobile and web applications that will make our customers smile.
- bring our next generation of ideas to life – from information architecture to debugging and from analysing data to inform decisions, to scoping out and estimating a new service or overseeing the roll-out.

About you
We need python developers at all levels. So, if you’ve got some experience, but want to learn from the best, or are chomping at the bit to challenge what we’re doing – there’s a place for you. You’ll:
- need to have bags of technical skills: developing web services using Django and Flask on Ubuntu/Debian; working on server side projects with online-databases (PostgreSQL a must); GitLab with Ansible and Docker; creating and maintaining TESTful APIs; a knowledge of Nginx and Uwsgi and unit testing / QA skills, following TDD will all serve you well.
- have great attention to detail and work well in a team, be a great communicator, organised, know about emerging technologies and media, can multi-task, have great time management and are flexible to the core.

Life at Bink
Bink is poised to change the world of loyalty forever by linking payment cards to loyalty programs – ensuring customers never miss out on the rewards they deserve. Founded by two serial entrepreneurs, things happen quickly around here. It’s fast-paced, inspired and fun. Our offices are a two-minute walk from Ascot Train Station (just 50 minutes from London) and close to the M3. It’s a space that’s bright and relaxed, but buzzing with excitement. We pay the kind of salaries that make our people feel valued and offer 25 days’ holiday, pension, healthcare and discretionary bonuses. We also genuinely like each other – which means we throw in lunches, drinks, fruit, game nights and other socials. After all, we like to say thank you too. Bink is heading for exceptional things. Bink or miss out.
To apply…

items.title: Junior or Intern iOS developer
items.content:
We are looking for a Junior or Intern iOS developer to join our team

ABOUT US

YesWeStock is an ambitious start-up passionate about making self-storage easier, based on the Airbnb model.  We’re all about finding the right person who shares YesWeStock’s vision for what’s possible in this industry.

VALUE

Working at YesWeStock means taking ownership from day one and giving everything for our projects to make a meaningful and sustainable impact. For our businesses to go from zero to launch, we remain focused while being confident.YesWeStock makes self-storage easier through great people, smart processes and starts of the art technology.

We are looking for smart, ambitious people who are excited by the prospect of rolling up their sleeves to help an early stage, fast-growing start-up to continue its growth and become the world leader of the self-storage!

We are looking for someone who is passionate about entrepreneurship and wants to learn how to grow a business and gaining exposure to all areas of the business.

THE ROLE

As a IOS Developer, you will be responsible for the development of an IOS application to support the website and offer new services to our clients! We already have a first prototype of the app, we need now to push it to the next stage, and being able to release it on the App Store!!!

MUST HAVE

- Application development experience and solid understanding of good software engineering design principles – knowledge of Objective-C (Swift is a bonus) – Experience with AWS services and/or MEAN – Strong analytical ability – Experience with AWS or other cloud/backend service – Fluent English

WHAT WE OFFER

In return, YesWeStock offers you the opportunity to work at an office with colleagues from various international backgrounds, in central London. The access you get to latest technologies, knowledge sharing and training will allow you to develop rapidly during your time at YesWeStock.

EQUITY

Absolutely on offer – we want this to be a beautiful long term relationship!

LOCATION

Camden, London (5 mins walk from Warren street, Euston-square, Euston or Mornington Crescent)

Are you interested?

We welcome your application in English or French to join our team!

items.title: Polyglot developer (with Ruby experience!)
items.content:
About the company:

We have the ambitious goal of protecting enterprise networks against new and intelligent cyber threats, making it impossible for sensitive information to end up in the wrong hands.

Through advanced machine learning and natural language processing (NLP), our platform prevents breaches in real-time, outsmarting traditional rule-based, admin-intensive approaches which can only report a breach after it has occurred.

Founded by a team of Imperial College engineers, we’re backed by some of the world’s leading technology investors. We work with international clients in the financial, legal and professional services sectors who trust us to find the most intelligent ways to keep their data secure.

We’re looking to work with the brightest minds to help us accomplish our goal and tackle the biggest cybersecurity problems.

The tech:

We are looking for an engineer with previous Ruby experience, who is looking to expand their skill set and become a polyglot focused developer, working on micro services architected applications.

* Ruby
* Golang / Python
* Docker / Kubernetes
* Postgres / DynamoDB
* Kafka
* AWS

If this challenge sounds like something you'd like to get involved with, get in touch, we'd love to hear from you!

items.title: Software Developer (Ruby, JS)
items.content:
We’re looking for a capable and experienced generalist to work on interesting problems and shape the future of LoyaltyLion. You'll be working across our entire platform, from our merchant-facing web apps to our third party widgets used by millions of shoppers around the world.

Our primary languages are Ruby and Node.js, with a mix of Backbone, React & Redux on the front-end. We use chatops and Docker for deployments.

*Some of the things you'll be doing:*

* Writing really clean, well-tested code
* Developing our JS/Ruby codebases and integrating with ecommerce platforms and partners
* Scaling our apps to work with the largest ecommerce stores
* Turning lots of data into useful insights for our merchants
* Dreaming up and implementing awesome new features

*What we’re looking for:*

* A proven track record in software development
* Ruby and/or JS expertise
* Believes in testing and CI
* Comfortable working across the entire technology stack
* Experience with databases, especially PostgreSQL
* Other nice to haves: AWS, Docker, affinity for lions and other big cats

*What we offer:*

* Relaxed working environment and flexible hours
* Remote work friendly
* Free team lunch on Monday, Cupcake Wednesday and free beer Friday
* Chance to look silly cool playing VR in the office
* Your own desk at our private office in Farringdon, London

*Salary:* £45k+ plus options, based on experience

*About us:*

LoyaltyLion was founded over three years ago by Charlie (ex-Deloitte) and Dave (ex-Sun and Oracle). We spent 12 months doing some serious bootstrapping – using a friend’s lounge as an office, renting the cheapest accommodation (it had no bathroom!) and taking government loans to make LoyaltyLion a success. Happy to say it paid off.

LoyaltyLion powers the loyalty programs for over 650 brands worldwide, is VC backed, has a great loft office in Farringdon, grows 30% a month and now we’re looking for our 10th team member.

items.title: FRONT-END DEVELOPER​
items.content:
*JOB DESCRIPTION*

As part of our team, you’ll work side by side with our Lead Designer and other Senior Developers and contribute to building web and mobile experiences that transform the way we interact with our customers using your unique skills and perspective across a wide range of digital channels.

*RESPONSIBILITIES*

* Research and develop hand coded front-end web designs
* Collaborate with the design team to understand client needs and provide a clear and thought out UI/UX
* Create responsive user interfaces using JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3 and Sass
* Keep up-to-date with latest technology trends
* Communicate results and ideas to key decision makers
* Develop web components to help make our products self service
* Build and maintain products using cloud based hosting services
* Develop new user-facing features

*REQUIREMENTS*

* GIT/BitBucket and experience with version control

* Excellent understanding of design principles
* Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as as Gimp or Photoshop is a plus

* Good understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them
* Great communication skills
* Experience with JIRA

*BONUS POINTS*

* Degree in web development/engineering/design/creative field

* Experience with SVG animation

items.title: Senior Ruby Backend Engineer
items.content:
We need another smart brain to join our development team. You are expected to be already skilled and experienced in the main parts of our technology stack. We also need experience in mentoring juniors and middle devs, very good code review culture, business awareness and overall friendliness.

Our team

Less than a dozen developers, both frontend and backend, divided into sub-teams. Our workflow and practices are based on shared culture rather than on red tape, which means that you will be also responsible for keeping, maintaining and conducting the culture. We are still a relatively small team, so your contribution will be significant.

Our backend technology stack

Backend is separated from frontend and plays a role of RESTful JSON API. We communicate with dozens of 3rd party APIs and our own separate services. A lot of asynchronicity is involved, with the vast majority of work being done in background queue processors. We use:
* Ruby as an imperative language

* Elixir as a functional language
* Rails and Phoenix as web frameworks
* Postgres as a relational database
* Redis and Memcache as key-value storages
* RabbitMQ and Redis as message queueing solutions
* Sidekiq and Sneakers as background job processing frameworks
* ElasticSearch as a full-text search engine

Required experience

* Developing and maintaining large mature Ruby applications
* Writing and maintaining all kinds of tests
* Mentoring junior and middle developers
* Keeping technical debt low
* Working in a distributed team, being absolutely comfortable working with remote teammates
* Being able to maintain open-source project is preferred

Technical skills required for this job

* Ruby at a very high level of knowledge. Metaprogramming skill is strictly required.
* Backend parts of Ruby on Rails
* SQL, particularly Postgres

Who are you?

* You're a person who writes clean code that not only works, but is also maintainable and easy to change
* You’re self-organized
* You want to make the best UI for great experience of our customers
* You have a patience and strong will to invigorate teammates
* You want to build a career in a global company
* You thrive in a fast-growing, always-changing environment
* You want to be challenged every day

What do we (as a development team) practice:
* TDD (obviously)
* Continuous integration
* Continuous delivery
* Infrastructure as code
* Well-defined planning process
* Regular team retrospectives
* Non-blocking code reviews
In short, we do our best to shorten feedback loops from any change of the system.

Benefits

* Be part of a fast growth start-up and make a difference.
* Our company highly supports personal and professional growth so it’s a great opportunity to became a team lead
* We have an open business culture, so you’ll be able to see all aspects of the start-up growth
* Work in a friendly, cross-functional team, with people who aim to be the best and love to tackle problems
* Remote first - we believe in quality of work, not sitting in an office for 8 hours
* Explicitly allocated time every week to learn new technologies and hacking
* “The No Asshole” rule is applied

About Veeqo

Veeqo is an award winning high growth tech startup company which has customers around the world and an ambition to become the best software platform for online retailers to manage their business. It helps online retailers sync their stock between their website, retail stores and marketplaces like eBay and Amazon.
Veeqo is growing at an astonishing 300% per year and is expanding globally. Joining Veeqo is a unique opportunity to get involved in a world class start up. Our company is based in London and Swansea and is expanding internationally rapidly ( US, Germany …)

items.title: Senior Frontend Developer
items.content:
Because our frontend was fragmented and carries some legacy, the team recently started to make things right: never write new code without tests, practice modularity, devote time to do technical debt, etc. We need someone **smarter than us who will lead this movement in frontend**.

Our team

Less than a dozen developers, five of which are frontend/fullstack. Our workflow and practices are based on shared culture rather than on red tape, which means that you will be also responsible for keeping, maintaining and conducting the culture. We are still a relatively small team, so your contribution will be significant.

Our frontend technology stack

* Marionette.js, Backbone.js, CoffeeScript, JavaScript, SCSS, Rails assets pipeline
* Some legacy plain Backbone javascript parts and even several legacy rendered Rails views
* Jasmine, Sinon and Capybara are used for testing
* RESTful RoR-based backend API (you can consider it a blackbox if you wish)

Required experience

* Building and maintaining large frontend applications
* Writing and maintaining unit, integration and functional tests for frontend behaviour
* Keeping technical debt low
* Leading [at least a small] team of frontenders
* Working in a distributed team, being absolutely comfortable working with remote teammates

Required technical skills

* Perfect knowledge and experience in Marionette.js, CoffeeScript
* Perfect SCSS skills
* Profound knowledge of Backbone.js
* Good TDD skills with Jasmine or Mocha, Sinon
* Good skills in writing tests with Capybara or similar tool
* Good OOD skills, knowledge of OOP patterns
* Familiarity with BEM approach

We expect that you will:

* Come up with a strategy of gradual improvement of our frontend codebase
* Deliver new features as a part of our usual iteration workflow
* Judge many trade-offs: advantages of a hot technology vs adoption cost, perfection of code vs speed of development, etc.
* Support existing code and perform refactoring gradually making architectural improvements
* Share your knowledge and experience with the rest of the team and significantly contribute into the developer's’ culture
* Implement best frontend development practices
* Give and receive a lot of code review

Who are you?

* You're a person who writes clean code that not only works, but is also maintainable and easy to change
* You’re self-organized
* You want to make the best UI for great experience of our customers
* You have a patience and strong will to invigorate teammates
* You want to build a career in a global company
* You thrive in a fast-growing, always-changing environment
* You want to be challenged every day

What do we (as a development team) practice:
* TDD (obviously)
* Continuous integration
* Continuous delivery
* Infrastructure as code
* Well-defined planning process
* Regular team retrospectives
* Non-blocking code reviews
In short, we do our best to shorten feedback loops from any change of the system.

Benefits

* Be part of a fast growth start-up and make a difference.
* Our company highly supports personal and professional growth so it’s a great opportunity to became a team lead
* We have an open business culture, so you’ll be able to see all aspects of the start-up growth
* Work in a friendly, cross-functional team, with people who aim to be the best and love to tackle problems
* Remote first - we believe in quality of work, not sitting in an office for 8 hours
* Explicitly allocated time every week to learn new technologies and hacking
* “The No Asshole” rule is applied

About Veeqo

Veeqo is an award winning high growth tech startup company which has customers around the world and an ambition to become the best software platform for online retailers to manage their business. It helps online retailers sync their stock between their website, retail stores and marketplaces like eBay and Amazon.
Veeqo is growing at an astonishing 300% per year and is expanding globally. Joining Veeqo is a unique opportunity to get involved in a world class start up. Our company is based in London and Swansea and is expanding internationally rapidly ( US, Germany …)

items.title: Senior iOS Developer
items.content:

items.title: ★ WTB Front End Javascript Developer ★
items.content:
Kout.io is a revolutionary e-commerce website where users play free games for a chance to win their shopping!

We work with some of the largest brands like Amazon, Samsung, Nike, Virgin, backed by UK best 'madtech' accelerator and now looking for a talented Front End Javascript Developer to join our team.

Following our second funding round, we have just completed a significantly upgrade of the Game API. We now require help to update the GUi to match this newly acquired functionality. Effectively you will take the lead on all things design and front end and work directly under our CTO.

The role will involve:
• Improving the general user interface of the website.
• Designing and integrating components and interactions to the game page.
• Developing a payment page that handle several payment methods.
• Implementing a new onboarding process.
• Working with ReactJs, ES6 & Grunt.
• Helping evolve the current codebase, bringing in fresh ideas and a new perspective to the team.

Desired Characteristics:
• Bachelors / Masters in Computer Science (or related subject)
• Advanced level using Photoshop or other design software.
• Strong understanding of user centred interface design. 
• Ability to bring new ideas to life that will improve the users experience. 
• Agile framework
• ECMAScript 6 — Javascript
• React + redux/flux
• SASS, LESS, SCSS or CSS
• Grunt

Bonus Skills:
• Git Experience
• Continuous Integration
• W3C Standards + web optimisation 
• AWS experience
• Linux command-line experience 

Kout is located in Farringdon, London - we have an empty desk waiting for you!

Interested to change the way people shop forever? Apply today and send us a portfolio of things you've build or designed. Impress us and we will call you in to meet the team!

items.title: Freelance full-stack web developer, PHP, MySQL, Lavarel, HTML
items.content:

*About*
We are in the process of developing a number of tools and require a Full-Stack Developer to help to specifications and prototypes into reality. The role offers a high degree of autonomy and would suit someone who is able to take a specification and develop a solutions.

This would be an ideal opportunity for someone starting out as a freelancer or looking to take on some additional work outside of their 9-5.

Work can be performed remotely but you must be available for occasional meetings in London in person.

items.title: Lead Frontend Developer (react.js)
items.content:
We believe hospitality & events workers deserve a better rate of pay, a more flexible approach to choosing
shifts and direct contact with interesting & varied employers too – Syft delivers on that. Clients like The O2
Arena, Tate Modern, Morgan Hotel Group, and Gordon Ramsays love the transparency too.
Having raised £2.65 million from Profounders Capital and the founders from Bebo, Velocity, and more, Syft is
one of the fastest growing startups in the UK in a very exciting space. The team at Syft are hugely
passionate about change and innovation having worked for some of the world’s best known startups.

The role

We're looking for a great sr. frontend developer with a feel for design and user interaction. You'll be
responsible for building and maintaining ReactJS-based web applications alongside coworkers. You should
be able to write high quality code that utilizes modern best practices, and be able to translate UI/UX design
to an actual application that is easy and intuitive to use.

About you

You’ll fit right in at Syft if:

• You’re flexible – you’ll muck in and help with anything.
• You’re proactive and always willing to learn.
• You prefer the start up environment because you want to have an impact and love being in a fast paced
company.
• Our company culture is really important to us but we’re young, so we want someone who loves what we
do, and help us shape the culture for the future.

Skills and Experience
• Proficiency in ReactJS, Redux and modern ES6 code
• Proficiency in HTML and CSS (preprocessors like SASS or PostCSS is a plus)
• Experience with unit testing
• Familiarity with modern best practices and HTML5 technologies
• Good understanding of asynchronous programming and Promises
• Experience with Git
• Familiarity with tools such as Photoshop is a plus

What we provide
We are located in Holborn, WC2, with great travel links and access to fantastic range of restaurants, which
the team frequently visit together.
Competitive salary plus equity in fast growing start up.
Regular team building events, such as mini golf, or good old regular drinking sessions
Benefits such as free mobile phone insurance, discounts on gym membership, health insurance and plenty
more!
We’d love to learn more about you, so please do send us a cover letter explaining how you would be great fit
for this role and Syft and if it looks like a good fit we’ll be in touch!

items.title: Wordpress Frontend Developer to Join Fun Team!
items.content:
Hi everyone,

We are a company dedicated to developing professional Wordpress websites on behalf of design agencies around London and throughout the UK.

We are looking for a frontend web developer who is experienced in Wordpress and has high level CSS styling skills, to join our small start up team.

We are open to people looking for both full-time or part-time work.

Looking for someone in London to join our start up team based out in Wimbledon.

Usage of Divi Theme (by Elegant Themes) is a BIG plus, as ALL of our websites are created in these.

The following skills and attributes we are looking for:

- sound knowledge and skills in design of websites through using core Divi elements (trying to code as little as possible, using mostly just the Divi options), CSS and html
- excellent knowledge and understanding of Wordpress best practices
- basic design skills for overall look and feel

It's also a big plus if you are a self motivated worker, have a good sense of humour, and really good if you love coffee.... mmmmm coffee....

Pay is depending on experience between 25,000 to 30,000 £ per year (pro rata is part time). Plus options for extra incentives via stock options and business turnover bonuses.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Thanks!

Steve

items.title: Experienced iOS Developer - social media

FabLook is the Chinese equivalent of Intagram, based on photo/video sharing etc. The app is already on the market and have received good user feedback. However, to take it to the next level, we would need excellent people to join the team.
