items.title: Full-Stack Lead Developer
items.content:
Experienced Full Stack Java Developer

Java, TomCat, Javascript/Angular, HTML, REST, Spring, Hibernate, SQL, Gradle

This is a unique opportunity to work on projects developing apps for the third sector. Our charity, non-profit, social start-up clients have limited funds but deserve good quality software. We want to build apps of the highest quality and, at the same time, give college/sixth-form students an opportunity to work with you, our professional lead. Please visit our website to see what we do. Your work with us will really make a difference.
Your role
• Communicate with clients (charities/non-profits/start-ups) to ensure that any project we take on is feasible within the capabilities of the student team.
• Work with students and clients to establish a clear set of requirements for each project
• Have a technical oversight of each project to ensure that students have achievable tasks, clear goals and realistic deadlines
• Develop code, have your code reviewed by students, pair program on occasions
• Identify when volunteers are needed to bring in vital skillsets and work with the volunteers to ensure that their contribution is valued and adds value
• Ensure the quality of the code produced to ensure that all apps developed, although low cost, are of high quality and meet their purposes
• Use and encourage the use of current working practices and methodologies for managing software projects.
 
Key qualities
You will be:
• passionate about developing the next generation of software developers
• a great coder who cares about the quality of code
• able to demonstrate your experience in developing mobile apps for customers
• able to demonstrate your experience in winning business, scoping projects and delivering successful products
• able to demonstrate your experience of working effectively in a development team
• passionate about quality
• able to enthuse and motivate
• able to give, and accept, constructive criticism and positive feedback
• able to ‘let go’ and give young people room to make mistakes and learn from them

Please note: You will be required to work on Saturdays with a day off during the week (students can attend more easily on a Saturday).

Benefits include 5-6 weeks annual leave and the knowledge that you are making a real difference.

This is, initially, a six-month contract.

items.title: Full Stack Developer ( .NET / React)
items.content:
About us
Founded in 2010, Checkout.com is an international FinTech company providing end to end e-commerce solutions for payments on the Internet. Built on 100% proprietary technology Checkout.com’s online platform offers all credit and debit cards as well as alternative and local payment methods through a single integration. With clients such as Deliveroo, Virgin, Adidas and many more, Checkout.com’s 120+ talented team members serve a list of true tier one global retailers and leading mobile applications from its London, Dubai, Singapore and Mauritius offices.

At Checkout.com we strive to create a unique working environment where each of our employees are empowered to take their responsibilities, solve complex puzzles and deliver value accretive solutions for the Company. We believe an individual maximum yield can only be achieved through a dynamic corporate culture that focuses on personal growth and exciting career development paths.

This experience is offered in a fast paced and innovation-focused office space ideally located in the heart of London.

About the role
Does the challenge of solving complex engineering puzzles to delights millions of shoppers around the world with the most forward-thinking online payment technology sound appealing to you?

Checkout.com is actively seeking a driven and talented Full Stack Developer to join our excellence-driven Engineering Team and contribute to enhancing our online payment technology across various channels (web, mobile, etc.) to make sure it’s the most innovative, lightning-fast and user-centric possible. Evolving in an agile and collaborative environment and exposed to the entire SDLC, you will bring your solid full-stack coding perspective and experience to all projects that you’re involved in (from specification, design, coding, testing to deployment). The ideal candidate is a passionate programmer who lives and breathes Agile and firmly believes in creating clean, testable code.

You key responsibilities will be:
- Collaborate with the Software Development teams on the design, development, and delivery of new features on our RESTful API and related services
- Collaborate with Front End Developers on key projects such as the migration of our Front End framework from Angular to React
- Engage in the entire product development cycle to understand business objectives, user goals, and create solutions that delight our customers
- Assist in requirements identification and in producing specifications
- Assist QA to define acceptance tests
- Work with designers to promote brand and interface guidelines
- Participate in team knowledge management and make recommendations for continuous improvement of the SDLC

About you
- 5+ years full-stack software development experience
- Mastery of C# and ASP.NET Web API
- Solid knowledge of JavaScript (vanilla) with code patterns
- Previous experience with React and/or any additional modern JS frameworks
- Practical knowledge of OOP concepts and SOLID principles
- Experience with TSQL and SQL Server appreciated
- Experience with Unit testing (NUnit, Moq, Autofixture, FluentValidation)
- Experience with Git (Git flow and pull requests and code reviews)
- Experience with Continuous Integration and Deployment workflows
- Fluent in English

items.title: Full-stack JavaScript Developer (NodeJS + Angular)
items.content:
*About Oscar & Owl*:

No agencies or outsourcing companies thank you.

Oscar & Owl is the easiest way to book a trusted babysitter from your local community. Founded by a tech entrepreneur and experienced babysitter after witnessing how difficult it is to find ad-hoc childcare, and parents fear of stranger danger when finding childcare online. We highlight trusted recommendations, so parents can view babysitters who their friends, colleagues, neighbours and local school parents recommend.

We believe in streamline UX, high quality customer service and building a great community. It is a business model proven in the US, and there is demand for a similar service in the UK, Europe and beyond.

Our MVP (a simple directory of your local recommended childcarers) is live, and we are currently developing our core product - our online booking system. We currently have two AngularJS web applications (parent and childcarer) and a NodeJS API.

The team currently consists of a Product Manager (who is also trained in Digital Marketing and Product Design) and a Full Stack Developer. We are looking for a second Full Stack Developer to accelerate our growth and development.

You'll be joining a team who love what they do, work fast and smart. Oscar & Owl is based in Us&Co Offices in Monument, London. You're welcome to join in the office or work remotely.

*Skills we’re looking for*

* 2-4+ years of full-stack JavaScript / web development experience
* Strong knowledge of JavaScript; we’re full-stack JS, and we’re likely to use React Native to build our mobile app.
* Our stack consists of Angular 1.5 & Webpack, Node, Hapi, and Postgres. The web apps run on Heroku and uses AWS services.
* Startup engineering experience is desirable.
* Someone who is fully comfortable with implementing features from front to back
* Self motivation, clear communication and enthusiasm about making a great product and making parents lives easier in the UK and beyond!


*What we can offer you*

* £35,000-45,000 + generous equity
* A happy and passionate place to work - we’re improving a really important part of parent’s lives
* 22 days holiday + day off on your birthday
* Free access to Oscar & Owl for friends and family.
* The knowledge that your ideas will always be listened to.

items.title: Full Stack Engineer (Ruby on Rails)
items.content:
We’re looking for an exceptional full-stack engineer who will make a real impact on the web application at the core of our business.

*---- About Us ----*

ClickMechanic is a marketplace for mechanics that is bringing trust and transparency to car repair. The platform enables customers to acquire real-time industry standard quotes (a first in Europe) and quickly book a vetted mechanic online.

Founded in 2012 by EF alumni Andrew Jervis and Felix Kenton, the company has grown quickly to offer nationwide coverage and is backed on its mission by such institutional investors as 500 Startups, and Forward Partners as well as angel investors including the former CEO of JustEat and Chairman of Treatwell.

*---- The Role ----*

We’re looking to hire a full-stack engineer to join our small engineering team (currently one engineer plus our CTO Founder), who will provide a significant boost to our ability to innovate, deploy new features, and improve existing ones. You’ll get to work across all aspects of technology stack, including our Ruby on Rails web application, online quoting engine and mechanic app.

Technology underpins our entire business, and we’re constantly working to improve our core product and add new features. You’ll have the opportunity to work on projects such as improving our quoting engine using machine learning, developing integrations from new parts suppliers, or building a new mobile app using React Native.

This is a full-time, on-site role.

*---- Responsibilities ----*

You’ll be responsible for:
* Developing new features and updating existing ones, sometimes working closely alongside our CTO Founder and working with full autonomy at other times.
* Building cutting-edge technology that will disrupt an entire industry, to the benefit of drivers all over the country (and hopefully further afield!).
* Working on any and all parts of our web application and mechanic app.
* Helping to overcome any roadblocks to planned development in collaboration with the product owner.
* Engineering solutions to any issues we face as our business scales, applying new technologies and approaches as appropriate.

*---- Our Technology ----*

We’ve built an online quoting engine that can generate quotes for all kinds of car repairs, servicing and inspections, drawing automotive data from numerous sources and transforming it to be accessible to consumers. It’s already the best automotive quoting system in Europe, however there’s still a lot left to do to fulfil our mission of bringing trust and transparency to all drivers.

Some of the technologies we’re currently using are: Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Sass/SCSS, CoffeeScript, JavaScript, elasticsearch, Memcached, jQuery Mobile, Zurb Foundation, Minitest, RSpec Mocks, git, CircleCI.

*---- Requirements ----*

You’re our ideal candidate if you:
* Have previously created applications using Ruby on Rails (or have experience of similar web frameworks that will enable you to hit the ground running).
* Love implementing features from start to finish, following them through all the way to deployment.
* Are comfortable working with SQL, preferably PostgreSQL.
* Have experience of full stack web development using the MVC pattern (or similar).
* Love Test Driven Development (TDD)
* Feel a deep satisfaction when you see a neat, coherent git history.
* Aren’t afraid of getting stuck in and working across the complete technology stack.
* Enjoy problem solving and engineering solutions that will make drivers’ lives easier.

items.title: Senior Front End Developer
items.content:
About City Pantry
City Pantry is at the forefront of transforming the way businesses view culture – helping companies work better, by eating together. We believe that good food makes a great company, and that sharing a meal creates an environment where better communication,
productivity and health are nourished.
After two years, we’re growing (quickly) and are delivering thousands of meals each day across the heart of London to some of the world’s newest and most exciting brands – Google, Facebook, Spotify & Buzzfeed (amongst many, many others). Working with the best independent chefs, street vendors, specialist caterers, restaurants and supper clubs in London, we give companies access to varied and exciting food providing an easy and reliable way to organise lunches, meetings and events.
We’re a friendly group, passionate about our work and serious about creating a great user experience with awesome food, useful tech products, and best-in-class service. We have a fantastic work environment that encourages creativity, risk-taking, growth and autonomy. You will be a great fit if you love to get stuck in, learning new things and get a kick out of making things better.

The Tech Team
As a small team, we believe in agile engineering culture and are naturally motivated by autonomy and a strong sense of project ownership. Everyone participates in feature planning, implementation decisions and shaping our practices to get a good balance of challenging work and fun. We follow scrum but believe that rules are only a good start and should be broken when needed. We deploy new feature almost every day, celebrate success and love to learn from mistakes that take us forward.

Who we’re looking for
Maybe you once worked for a smaller company and miss the feeling of being on an exciting growth trajectory? Or you’re a die-hard computer science grad who taught yourself to code during your GCSEs? Great! We have a lot of big ideas in the pipeline that we can’t wait to work with you on.
We are looking for developers hungry for a challenge, with strong opinion but keen to learn from others. Developers that “won’t sleep until that bug is fixed”, ones that inspire product and strive to innovate to provide a seamless user experience.

Our Tech Stack
Our backend ecosystem consists of Symfony, Mongo and a series of Node microservices deployed on Docker. Front end is an Angular SPA. We develop on Vagrant and are enthusiastic about “dockerizing” our stack and fully automating our deployment pipeline, step by step. As a team, we are constantly on a lookout for tools that can do the job better, faster and make the dev experience more enjoyable.

We want a developer who:
• is up-to-date with the latest front end technologies – Angular (or React, Ember, etc.), HTML5, Bootstrap, automation tools, unit and e2e testing, you name it!
• can demonstrate strong knowledge of industry best practices
• writes a high-quality code and helps others improve their code
• gets excited about teaching other less experienced devs in the team
• wants to innovate in the technical space
• is comfortable working in Agile startup environment
• holds our customer values at heart of what they do

You’ll have:
• extensive experience with JavaScript and Node.js
• track record of projects in Angular, React or Ember
• experience of integrating front end solutions with various services
• great software design and architectural skills
• experience of automated testing of frontend solutions
• strong knowledge of OOP concepts
• track record of interesting side projects
• experience of mentoring other engineers

A taster of what you’ll be doing:
• introduce engineering excellence into our frontend solution
• help to build every aspect of the new City Pantry product, including apps, website… the whole circus
• drive architectural decisions around frontend-backend integration
• actively contribute to the discussion about what is being built and why
• work with the team to ensure efficient delivery of every software project
• lead the choice of our frontend dev tools and frameworks
• contribute to the architecture and design of the backend solution
• mentor less experienced members of the team

What are the perks?
• competitive compensation package, plus performance-based salary increase and equity
• free team lunch each Monday, Wednesday, and Friday
• £2000 learning allowance
• monthly tech innovate day (mini-hackathon)
• unlimited holiday
• flexible working hours

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
SideStory is a growing community of peer reviewed creative experts around the world and we're excited about the potential of building on our new movement in travel

SideStory was built by believing that 'travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer'. We want to encourage you to take on new experiences over the years.

Do something good: we are making a product that creates real memories from their experiences and allowing people to share and focus on their creative passions - we also donate some of our profit to local causes.

Be part of our journey: we are an ambitious company taking on a fragmented market but in a rapidly growing sector with international expansion in our sights. Be part of a growing enterprise with great prospects.

Job Description

Our tech platform is central to achieving our mission to help connect travellers and local creative experts around the world and will be the multiplying force that allows us to scale our offering.

We use our direct relationship with our guests and our partners (OneFineStay, Mr & Mrs Smith, Secret Escapes, Black Tomato, Truffle Pig, Four Seasons, Hyatt etc) to help them find unique creative experiences.

You will be in charge maintaining, improving and interrogating our digital offering. Focusing on friction-less sign-up flows, multi-channel sales and effective data collection and analysis. As our major route to market - you will be a linchpin of our company.

As the first full-time technical hire your role will be all-encompassing so a can do, problem solving attitude is important. You will be working closely with the founders and will be involved in product discussions to define the tech strategy.

Must have:
Passion for writing great, simple, clean, efficient code
Experience with Ruby on Rails
Experience data mining to draw business led conclusions
Experience with responsive builds using: HTML5, CSS3 and JS (for example)
Experience with Wordpress, APIs and Plug-ins (our existing platform)
Experience with A/B testing techniques

What's our mission?

All the main travel and consumer trends points towards "experiences, not things" and SideStory is designed to meet the growing demand for ‘experiences’ within the travel industry.

Recent statistics show that 82% of people are more interested in making memories than money, and that 91% would prefer to focus on meaningful experiences than their own careers so we started SideStory as a way to fulfil the needs of discerning travellers.

Our mission is to help connect travellers and local creative experts who provide unique half or full day experiences in their city. An example experience could be spending time with one of our award-winning photographers, or spending an afternoon behind the scenes with a leading London-based Fashion Stylist.

“For those landing in London and wanting to plunge right in, SideStory is your new go-to” Financial Times
“[SideStory is] one of 5 best London walks” The Telegraph
“No better way to uncover a destination and enrich a journey” DestinAsia

items.title: IOS developer for London based startup
items.content:
We are a small startup based in Central London and have a number of important projects that require a junior IOS swift developer to assist with in supporting the team. We are a social marketplace app that has featured in the Metro UK, Daily Express, Daily Mail, TechCrunch Disrupt and Huffington Post.

Responsibilities:

1) Write Good Code in Swift (Managing day-to-day app changes)  
2) Maintain quality standards by performing code reviews
 3) Fixing bugs, writing tests, and profiling code – GitHub source control

Must haves: • Proficient in English • Ability to multitask and prioritize daily workload • Knowledge of Objective (Bonus) • Experience with Google services • Quick learner

Immediate start Includes a travel/trip opportunity

items.title: Junior-Mid C# .Net Web Developer
items.content:
You will support our senior developer in the design, build, and deployment of our ASP.NET web application. You’ll get to work across the full development lifecycle in a truly agile environment.

All development is done in-house from scratch, so you will face technically complex problems and devise elegant solutions. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious junior to mid-level C# developer to join a small, talented team based in central London (Southwark).

Attitude matter more than experience for this role. We don't need you to have years of commercial experience, but we do need you to have a passion for learning and a positive attitude to problem-solving and discovery.

We've built a world-class online assessment application which is used by thousands of people every day. We're improving the application on a daily basis and we're looking for you to help us.

Test Partnership:

We serve online assessments to clients all over the world. Our psychologists design the science behind them while our developers make sure the application runs smoothly across browsers, collects respondent data, runs statistical analyses, and communicates via API with third-party applications.

Because of our small size we naturally work in an agile environment with continuous deployment. We're all passionate about slick, stable, user-friendly online assessments.

You:

If you love coding we’d love to hear from you. You don't need to know everything, but you should be self-driven and hungry to learn. If you're the kind of person who spots something that can be done better and gets on with it, you're probably the kind of person we're looking for.

What you'll be working on:

C#, ASP.NET MVC 5, WCF, SQL Server, IoC
Support (and learn from) our senior developer;
Understanding functional requirements from our psychologists and turning them into code;
Deploying and maintaining production systems;
Test-driven development and bug fixing;
Support clients who are using our API;
Code new views for clients who want a white-label service;
Troubleshooting and optimising the existing application

What we need from you:

Strong C# skills and knowledge of .Net design patterns;
Some experience with SQL Server;
Some experience with IIS, HTML, and CSS;
Experience with JavaScript and JQuery beneficial

Start Date:

Any time from now, to suit you.

items.title: Front-End JavaScript Developer
items.content:
*SUMMARY*
Build experiences that delight, inspire, amaze and give confidence to both kids and parents alike. Work in an agile and flexible way with a modern JavaScript stack: Node.js, React, Redux…

We're a small team that likes to make big things happen. Last year we built a digital learning platform that brought together all of our products, together with a desktop app and a coding interface for kids.

This year our plan is to grow the platform community and continue to create new products and experiences. This is more than just a coding role. We expect you to join us in working out what we build and how we do it, to join us brainstorm, research, prototype and test. We need to solve some very hard problems, together.


*TECHNOLOGY WILL SAVE US*
Technology Will Save Us is an award-winning, innovative, technology and product business based in the vibrant area of East London. We create make-it-yourself kits and digital tools that help kids all over the world to make, play, code and invent using technology. We started in 2012, packing kits on a kitchen table and have now sold over 85,000 kits in 97 countries! Our kits are in the MoMA in New York and the Design Museum in London. We’ve collaborated with Google, Code Club, The Prince’s Trust, and most recently with ARM, Microsoft and Samsung to create the BBC micro:bit—a microcontroller designed for children and given to all year seven students in the UK.

Our studio houses a team of 25 designers, engineers, marketing gurus, educators, content producers, production specialists, support reps, financiers and sales people. We’d love for you to join us in building the most accessible and entertaining brand for the maker generation.


*ROLE*
We’re looking for a front-end web developer excited about the opportunity to build experiences that delight both kids and parents. This is a great opportunity to have a direct impact on the way people—both young and old—learn using technology.

As the only front-end focused role in the team, we’re looking for a person interested in:

* Building engaging, easy-to-use interfaces that feel natural and empower users
* Owning the relationship between the dev and design teams
* Making sure our user interfaces work correctly on all major desktop and mobile platforms
* Helping build new digital products
* Continuing to support and develop new features for existing products
* Helping define the technology that will drive our growth
* Contributing to building a quality code base
* Learning, sharing and challenging the rest of the team—we are always looking to improve our processes, practices and technologies
* Contribute to brainstorms, research, prototyping and testing

We’ll also count on you to be comfortable with and support back-end work.


*TECHNOLOGY*
Modern JavaScript is important—a solid understanding of the language, being up to date with new features and having experience building interactive web applications. For the rest, we believe it’s more important to be able to adapt and learn than to be an expert in any specific technologies.

For your reference, these are some of the technologies we currently use:

* Our learning platform is built with React, Redux and Sass. We use the latest JavaScript features and tools like Webpack, Babel and Immutable
* The back-end is built on Node.js with Express and MongoDB. The front-end communicates with the back-end via a REST API and WebSockets
* We use continuous integration and automated deployments, combining GitHub, Docker and AWS. Our test suite uses Mocha and Chai
* We also have a desktop application for Mac and Windows, built using Electron
* The coding environments we build enable people to program for Arduino and other hardware, using languages based on C++
* Our e-commerce site is built on Wordpress, with WooCommerce (managed by a freelance developer)

Work that may be coming our way this year: growing community features on our learning platform, creating a mobile/tablet app for one of our kits, redesigning our e-commerce platform, creating new coding environments, expanding our learning tools…


*TEAM*
You’ll be joining our full-stack developer and team lead, and work within the product team. The product team consists of digital and hardware designers, engineers and content creators.

Our process is agile. Our iterations are weekly. We use pull requests to review code, maintain quality and learn from each other. We use TDD and pair programming when it makes sense. We use continuous integration tools to automate testing and deployments.

We are heavy users of Trello and Slack.

We believe in simple, maintainable, clean (and lean) code.

Finding the right cultural fit is very important to us. We’d like you to bring something new and complement the team. We expect you to:

* Care deeply about building great products and services and putting users at the centre of your work
* Focus on priorities and as much as possible, use data to drive decision-making
* Provide and accept feedback, share your opinions and experiences and when appropriate, educate other team members


*BENEFITS*
A chance to work with an incredibly talented group of people fundamentally doing good work in the world and build an amazing company—if you want to look back on your career and know that you were a vital part of building a great company, this role is for you.

On top of that:

* Ownership—you will be part of the company’s stock option plan (EMI scheme)
* Free delicious wellness lunches with the full team every Monday
* A professional development fund (for conferences, courses…)
* A constantly growing technical library
* Flexible work hours
* A top of the range MacBook Pro or Air
* A bright and fun workplace in Hackney, next to the canal and a short walk from Victoria Park, Broadway Market and London Fields

items.title: PHP WordPress Developer
items.content:
Creatify helps businesses reach their customers by creating incredible websites. Using human powered artificial intelligence, we’re able to deliver a traditional agency service and create websites faster than ever before with no upfront costs.

We’re a small entrepreneurial team based in Glasgow, with a culture that puts customers at the heart of everything we do. We pride ourselves on innovation, implementing principles we’ve learned from some of the world’s biggest tech companies and startups we’ve previously founded. Meet Creatify, the smart new way to get your website built.

Our PHP Website Developer will be responsible for creating and managing the new Creatify website system built on top of WordPress.


*WHAT YOU’LL DO?*
• Develop a lean admin dashboard.
• Map various datasets to the WordPress database.
• Work with the product manager to optimise our WordPress setup.
• Test, select and implement third party plugins to be used in our system.
• Use APIs to integrate 3rd party content.
• Implement automated testing platforms and unit tests.
• We’re a startup, you’ll do a little of everything!


*WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR?*
• A WordPress expert – you know the platform inside out.
• PHP/MySQL, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery.
• Responsive web design methods and frameworks - Bootstrap or other frameworks.
• Server Administration - ability to use Cpanel and PhpMyAdmin.
• You keep up to date with the latest trends in web design.
• Used to working in a fast-paced web development environment.
• Ability to provide accurate development estimates.
• Self-motivated. A self-starter, passionate and a hustler.
• Innovative. You challenge the status quo and make your own ideas known.


*WHAT WE’RE OFFERING?*
• Work with a highly motivated, skilled and fun team of young entrepreneurs with experience in delivering major tech products.
• Professional training and development.
• Insight into building a scalable startup, with access to global entrepreneurial networks.
• Competitive contract fee (potential for full time contract thereafter).
• Equity options (if full time contract offered).
• Monthly gym membership.
• Blinkist subscription (check it out)!
• Monthly team lunches.
• Be based in a fun, creative co-working space around other entrepreneurs and startups.

To apply please send us an email and we'll be in touch with our application.

Thanks!
Rory Skinner
Cofounder & CEO of Creatify

items.title: Junior Software Developer
items.content:
*About LOVESPACE*

LOVESPACE is transforming the storage market. With £5.2m in venture backing, and 13,000 customers who have already stored 100,000 boxes, the business is growing fast.

*About Us*

LOVESPACE is the UK’s first storage-by-the-box service. We collect things (mostly in boxes) from people’s front doors; look after them for as long as they want, and then return them whenever and wherever they want, anywhere in the UK. We’re their virtual loft, garage or store-cupboard.

We’ve raised £5.2m to date, have seen exponential growth in the past years (picking up a few awards along the way!), and are about to embark on another considerable and exciting stage of growth in 2016.

*The Team*

We’re a tight, close-knit team with experience at some of the most exciting companies in the world. In this role, you’ll be working closely with our Director of Technology who has built up a large amount of experience growing startup businesses, their technology teams and the under pinning technology after moving from developing and deploying large scale technology projects for Ministry of Defense, telecommunications companies and major TV networks.

*About the role*

LOVESPACE are looking for a highly motivated, self-starter to join our Dunstable team in the technology department as a back-office systems software developer.

The position will be heavily involved with the whole development life cycle of our systems, through working with the whole company.

*Job details*
Job title: Junior Software Developer

Reporting to: Senior Software Developer

Key relationships: Technology Director, Product Manager

Key responsibilities: Ensuring we have the cleanest code possible, with lots of tests to act as a bed-rock for future development. Documenting and helping to plan a gradual migration from our current technology system into a more flexible and cutting edge RESTful API Micro Services based system. Making sure the Continuous Integration system is tuned to perfection.

Essential skills: You must know how to ship code, work as a DevOps guy as well as being a developer. You need to have a solid understanding of C#

(MVC would help) and MS SQL. You also need to speak, read and write fluent English.

Great skills to have: We’re a logistics based business and we use geo-spatial data structures, data warehousing and data reporting, knowing about those will certainly help. We’ve got customers from all over the world, so any extra languages you know would help.

Technically knowing about MVC and RESTful APIs will score you big points, as well as knowing about Version Control (specifically GIT).

Essential education level: Having a 2.1 or higher bachelor’s degree in a technical subject is a must, but having a masters in engineering or science with honours is preferred, as would any post-graduate qualifications related to software development.

items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt Winner seeks Inspiring iOS Engineer
items.content:
Seenit is growing! On the back of winning TechCrunch Disrupt Europe, we’re growing our product development team and are looking for an experienced iOS engineer to join us.

Using Python and Couchbase as a backend, HTML5 with JavaScript for the front-end, all running on Google’s Cloud Platform along with native iOS and Android apps, London’s Hottest Startup, Seenit, are helping brands like the BBC, HSBC, Unilever and The Body Shop tell their stories through collaborative film with our multiple-award winning mobile video platform - we’ve won quite a few of those in the past year, including Startup of the Year at the BIMA awards, and we’re even winning awards for our clients, including Innovation in Mobile at the Melcrum Awards.

We’re now looking for an iOS Engineer with strong native experience to help us take the app to the next level. You’ll be working with a great team who come with years of experience from companies like Spotify, Google, Picsolve, Pearson, and IBM, and our Founder started her career at Working Title Films.

Ideally, you’ll have:

* A successful run of releasing commercial-grade iOS apps written natively in Objective C
* Strong understanding of object-oriented software development principles
* Full exposure to the app development cycle
* Passionate about UX and love implementing beautiful designs and responsive with Auto-Layout
* Extensive experience integrating with RESTful web service APIs
* Strong understanding of unit testing and related techniques
* Excellent communication skills working across multiple disciplines, and generally getting stuck in to whatever is required.

Bonus points if you have:

* A good knowledge of core data

Take a look at our "website":https://seenit.io if you’d like to find out more, and feel free to drop us an email if you’ve got any questions or think you’re the right candidate.

*About Seenit*

Founded in January 2014, Seenit is an award-winning video collaboration platform that enables companies to produce high impact video at scale by engaging their own communities of employees, customers and fans around the world. Everyone today has a camera on their phone and people are turning to video as their default means of communication. Seenit enables companies to capitalise on this shift in behaviour by creating authentic and reactive content with their communities. We’ve worked with over 100 brand across the broadcast, retail and corporate markets including the BBC, BT Sport, Vevo, Clinique, Benefit, Accenture, Rolls Royce and HSBC. In December 2016, Seenit won the coveted "TechCrunch Disrupt Startup Battlefield trophy":https://techcrunch.com/2016/12/06/seenit-wins-startup-battlefield-disrupt-london-2016/

items.title: Senior Software Engineer
items.content:
Founded in 2009, The App Business runs fast and lean, creating awesome products and services for ambitious clients ready to rethink their business around mobile-enabled users. Based in the heart of London’s thriving King’s Cross, we work in an environment built to help us - and our clients - excel. We invest heavily in this vision, placing the support and development of our teams, as well as our culture, at the heart of everything we do.

As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer, who is excited about delivering great products that push the boundaries of mobile technology and improve the lives of billions of people.

You will be working in a world of Agile, Lean, TDD, BDD, protocols, data, UI, UX, cloud, caching and scaling. You will be surrounding by the brightest and the best and given real autonomy to maintain the highest standards of delivery possible and mentor your team.

You are:

- A skilled engineer, who is always looking to further your craft
- An experienced advocate of XP practices, cloud architecture and deployment automation
- Passionate about technology and thrive when dealing with the cutting-edge and unknown
- Able to solve challenging technical and non-technical problems independently and autonomously
- An excellent communicator, who can work effectively as part of a collaborative team
- Knowledgeable and experienced in at least one of: C#, Ruby, Java, JavaScript
- An experienced and trusted adviser; willing to support and mentor your team to success

We are:

- Technology agnostic, polyglot engineers - always seeking to use the right tools for the right job
- Working on server-side development, as well as cutting edge areas of machine learning and IOT
- Continuously solving complex programming problems in a clean and test-driven way
- Working as part of cross-functional Agile teams, alongside Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Designers
- Working closely with our enterprise clients, leading organisations in industries such as automotive, retail, transport and finance

items.title: Java Engineer
items.content:
Overview

The opportunity to work for one of the coolest hyper-growth companies in technology – Anaplan.

Originally founded in York, UK and now headquartered in San Francisco, Anaplan has offices all over the world. In fact we may be the most successful company you’ve never heard of. We are a slice of Silicon Valley in the heart of both London and Yorkshire, on a mission to revolutionise how companies analyse and plan their businesses. And it’s working – we are already trusted by hundreds of Fortune 2000 companies and we’ve only just begun.

We need experienced Java Engineers to be part of our rapidly expanding global engineering effort!

We are hoping for:

A passion for engineering – You are an experienced server-side developer with a proven track record of delivering great software.
Extra points if you’ve delivered online/web/SaaS applications or have particular strength in multi-user and multi-threaded scenarios.
Even more kudos if you’ve experience of handling large multi-dimensional data structures in-memory.
An understanding of testing – You write code that is tested and testable and you take responsibility for the quality of the code you produce. If you’re an advocate of TDD, even better.
Experience of back-end development, preferably using Java 7/8 and knowledge of the major development tool sets but strong skills in C++ or C# or Scala would also be great!
You can write code from the ground up without needing frameworks….if you’re a full-stack developer and have skills on front-end too – even better!
– Positive energy and enthusiasm – cultural fit is a big deal for us, we’re looking for smart people who are excited about solving big problems and are self-motivated to get things done.

WE OFFER:

Big technical problems to solve – You’ll have the chance to push boundaries and learn from an excellent team.
The opportunity to work for one of the coolest hyper-growth companies in technology.
We already have an award-winning working Software Development environments in York, Paris and San Francisco….Continued growth and success mean we are investing in creating a significant Software Development environment in London (which we hope will win awards too).
A long list of incredible benefits worthy of a leading Silicon Valley tech firm. We offer highly competitive packages – we’re serious about attracting the best technologists in the industry.
A rewarding career with a company that values diversity and invests in you.
You’ll be working with super smart people who are pushing Java to its limits.

items.title: Back End Developer
items.content:
British Pearl is an online property investment platform for share and loan-based investment in UK property. Our site is helping to revolutionise the way people invest in property by facilitating investment in buy to let and development projects for as little as £100, as either shareholders or lenders, while also enabling developers to raise equity and debt funding from the crowd.

Our mission is to become the preferred online marketplace for property investment and development capital by:

1. Providing access to unitised property ownership and investment.
2. Creating a trading exchange for property shares and loans.
3. Improving access to capital for SME property developers.

British Pearl is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (asset management and P2P).

For more information on us and our management team please go to https://www.britishpearl.com/team

The Role

British Pearl seeks a talented and experienced Back End Developer with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in relevant technologies and a special interest in Scala. The primary objective of this role is to be the product lead for development of the back end platform to help power the property investment trading platform.

The successful candidate will have had recent hands on experience using Scala to build web based applications and will have had experience in either online financial services, gambling or property based web applications.

The candidate will be expected to own the back end functional aspects of the platform and will therefore have the opportunity to mould a team around their experience with new and established technologies and processes. They will also need to own the relationship with their agency counterparts and make decisions on the best course for platform build. They will need to follow established standards, have an eye for detail and write accurate documentation. The candidate will need to be commercially aware with first class communication and presentation skills, be highly motivated, driven and professional in their approach.

The role will report directly into the Head of Technology and be responsible for ownership of the back end of our platform.



Main Responsibilities

• Deliver the back end software.
• Solving complex problems using the most appropriate polyglot architecture.
• Using the latest technologies and tools on modern hardware at scale.
• Working on challenging and varied business domains.
• Developing your technical understanding to support and build your career.

Required Skills & Attitude

• Demonstrable working experience with the Lightbend Reactive Platform; in Scala, Java, Akka & Play.
• Experience creating scalable and reactive web applications with modern frameworks such as: Play, ScalaJS, AngularJS, ReactJS.
• Experience with micro services architecture
• Knowledge in applying object-oriented and functional programming styles to real-world software engineering problems.
• Experience with AWS and it infrastructure components.
• A deep understanding of strongly-typed functional programming principles in Scala, Haskell or OCaml.
• Experience in SQL and Cassandra.
• Demonstrable understanding of high quality coding and testing practices.
• A strong understanding of continuous integration and continuous delivery practices.
• An appetite to learn new technologies and a drive for continual improvement.
• A keen interest in technology and personal professional development. Examples include having an active Github account or completion of relevant Coursera courses.

Desired Skills

• Test Driven Development / Business Driven Development.
• Experience with version control (Git preferred).
• Unit/Integration testing.

Why Join?

We are entering a new age of finance where innovative and flexible financial products will be coupled with evolving technology to deliver convenient financial solutions to the consumer on a global level. Our goal is to create universal access to property investment.

At British Pearl you will be at the forefront of technology and finance, working in a friendly and fast paced environment with talented and inspiring colleagues. You will experience huge variety in your work and, with our focus being on delivery, you will be more involved with a broader role than almost anywhere else.

items.title: iOS Software Engineer
items.content:
DESCRIPTION
Launched in 2014, Peak is a brain training app developed with the help of neuroscientists that offers fun and challenging games to help improve and assess cognitive skills. Peak is based in central London and was founded by entrepreneurs from Google, Amazon, Playfish/EA and academia with a mission to revolutionise education through mobile, games and science.
We were named one of the “Best Apps Of the Year” by Apple in 24 countries and we’re a Google Play “Editors’ Choice” App. We recently raised $10 million in VC funding, in part from Spotify-backers Creandum, and currently have millions of users around the world playing our games.
You'll be joining our engineering team and working alongside game designers and neuroscientists to bring exciting games and content to millions of users worldwide.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Own and build new features and games on the Peak iOS app.
Build challenging algorithms and solve client performance issues.
Use expert knowledge of the iOS platform to help guide design and engineering decisions.
Improve unit testing and continuous integration processes.

REQUIREMENTS
Degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience building consumer - facing web or mobile software.
Fluency with Objective - C and Swift
Software architecture experience and database design experience.
Strong OOP, good knowledge of pattern and anti-pattern design.
Experience with Instruments, Unit and UI Automation testing, continuous integration & deployment.
Eligible to work in the UK.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US
We set our hiring bar really high - you will be working with the best.
The company is growing fast; you'll have a lot of opportunity to make a real impact on our app and our brand, and learn loads from day one!
Competitive salary and loads of perks including healthy snacks all day long, gym membership, your choice of hardware and a fun and friendly working environment.

items.title: Senior Frontend Engineer - London (@ well funded, fast growing startup)
items.content:
We are an ambitious and silicon valley backed startup looking for top engineering talent to make connecting software services a breeze. Many software services we use every day are distinctly separate and difficult to use together - we intend to fix that.

You will:

items.title: Python/Django Developer
items.content:
*Hello*

Thanks for your interest in our Python/Django Developer role here at Open Utility. We’re a London based startup shaking up the energy industry. We build well designed digital services to support the transition to a decentralised energy future.

*About Us*

Off the back of our successful trial of Piclo® (our Peer-to-Peer matching service) we launched a commercial SaaS solution with Good Energy here in the UK. This initial service gives business energy consumers complete transparency and choice in where their energy is produced. We are receiving interest across Europe and further afield with other energy retailers who want to offer this service to their customers, so we’re looking to scale up the development team to support growth and further innovation in 2017.

*The work*

We need an experienced backend developer to join our production team. The role will be to work closely with Andy our CTO as well as the rest of the team to maintain and build up our backend systems. We receive a growing amount of energy consumption and production data which we process through our matching algorithm to provide our end users with transparency of where their energy came from / went to. This role would cover everything from updating how we match and process data to building out APIs to facilitate scaling of our service to more users in new markets. New features will need to fit alongside ongoing maintenance to continue providing the high customer satisfaction we pride ourselves on. You’ll need to be familiar with large data sets, data structures as well as working collaboratively with a mixed discipline production team. Communication is key to our working processes and we’d expect candidates to demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills.

*Required experience*

* Minimum 4 years relevant experience in backend dev roles.
* Advanced knowledge of Python, Django, and SQL
* Good knowledge of Javascript, HTML, CSS
* Best practices, TDD, git

*Bonus experience*

* AWS, EC2, S3, ECS
* Microservices
* Blockchain, DLT

*Job details and application process*

* Role offered on an initial 6 months contract (ongoing position dependant on company fundraising).
* Full time position in our London (Shoreditch) office.
* Candidates must already have permission to work in the UK (EU resident or working visa).
* No relocation support available.
* Salary up to £45K (pro rata) depending on experience.
* Contract or PAYE considered.
* Job starts ASAP.
* To apply, please send us an email that details; why you want to work for us, how your experience has prepared you for this role, a link to your online CV or LinkedIn and your GitHub or similar.
* A development task and a 15 min Skype call will take place before second interviews at our London office with the CTO.
* No recruiters or agencies please.

items.title: Backend Engineer
items.content:
CHECKRECIPIENT

CheckRecipient uses advanced machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) to make it impossible for sensitive information to end up in the wrong hands. We protect enterprise networks against new and intelligent cyber threats by preventing breaches in real-time.

Founded by a team of Imperial College engineers, we’re backed by some of the world’s leading technology investors. We work with international clients in the financial, legal and professional services sectors who trust us to find the most intelligent ways to keep their data secure.

CHECKRECIPIENT'S RECENT AWARDS

Winner - WIRED Security 2016 Best Startup Award
Winner - LegalGeek Best Machine Intelligence Start Up 2016
Finalist - Info Security Product Guide’s Global Excellence Awards 2017 for the Best Security Startup

ENGINEERING AT CHECKRECIPIENT

Dealing with massive datasets at scale requires ingenuity and strong analytical skills. We build quickly and follow both agile and continuous delivery paradigms.

As a member of the CheckRecipient engineering team, you will have the autonomy to work on your own projects, and be a part of our regular round tables to bounce ideas around as a team. We believe in regular and continuous development and we will seek to create opportunities for you to evolve. You will work closely with our data science team building out new threat modules as well as re-architecting our application into microservices allowing us to scale horizontally.

Here are some of the technologies we’re working with / interested in:
-Ruby, Python, Go
-Kubernetes, Rancher, Docker
-Kafka
-Postgres, DynamoDB, Cassandra
-Redshift, Spark, AWS, Microservices architecture

REQUIREMENTS

You should apply if you:

-are a great problem solver who takes pride in their work
-are comfortable with the unknown and love to experiment
-can construct good arguments for methodologies or practices
-have a passion for learning new skills and technologies
-have good knowledge of either Python, Ruby or Go (but ideally you’re language agnostic and will use the best tool for the job)
-are interested in working on a microservices architecture

BENEFITS

Competitive salary and meaningful equity options
Choose your own kit
Central London office location
Regular team socials and activities

We look forward to hearing from you!

Important Notices:

-We do not accept applications or résumés from 3rd party recruiters.
-We are currently unable to sponsor applicants who do not have a right to work in the UK

items.title: Front End Developer Intern
items.content:
About us
Founded in 2010, Checkout.com is an international FinTech company powering the most comprehensive cross-border payment solution for the Internet. Checkout.com offers all credit and debit cards as well as alternative and local payment methods through one single integration and one single platform. Checkout.com’s 100+ talents team serves ecommerce merchants worldwide from its London, Dubai, Singapore and Mauritius offices.

At Checkout.com we believe that the greatest innovations are fostered by a corporate culture supporting personal development and career growth. We offer a modern, engaging and innovation-friendly office space ideally located in the heart of London.

Summary
If you are a driven student/graduate and passionate JavaScript developer who is eager to join a fast-growing company and shape the future of online payments, then this role is for you!

Evolving in an agile and collaborative environment, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary and excellence-driven team and bring your fresh coding perspective to all projects that you’re involved in.

You will have the opportunity to work across the entire Web stack and alongside talented full-stack Developers towards one goal: provide millions of online shoppers worldwide with the best possible payment experience.

The successful candidate will join one of the most promising and forward thinking FinTech companies in the market and be part in our little revolution.

Key Responsibilities
- Create and maintain Web Apps using VanillaJS, Node.JS and complementary frameworks
- Build cross- platform, cross- browser, responsive HTML and CSS
- Engage in the entire Product Development lifecycle to understand business objectives and user goals
- Deliver high-quality solutions that will enhance or simplify existing processes
- Work with Designers to promote brand guidelines
- Contribute to team brainstorm and scrum stand-ups

Skills & Experience
- Excellent OOP Javascript (VanillaJS) and HTML5 / CSS3 skills
- Good understanding of UX and Responsive Web Design
- Knowledge in Node.Js, ExpressJS, Grunt, Gulp, Jasmine is a plus
- Online portfolio (or screen grabs of previous work) appreciated
- Studies in Computer Science or related fields
- Fluency in English

items.title: Senior Front-End Engineer
items.content:
*Simply put; Skimlinks is a big data technology and product startup, building cool stuff, at scale.*

We build highly transactional, high throughput platforms that connect publishers, merchants, and audiences; which allows some of the most popular sites in the world to efficiently and easily monetise their curated journalistic content. We partner with companies like Huffington Post, The New York Times, The Independent and Hearst to diversify their content monetisation strategies; which helps them create more of the journalistic content that we all consume and enjoy, without relying upon additional banner advertising.

We’re also leveraging our massive amount of anonymous behavioural data to create greenfield data platforms. We employ a diverse array of advanced Machine Learning and Classical Statistical methodologies to interrogate our dizzying amounts of data. Though our platforms, we have a direct view of the browsing and shopping behaviours of over 650 million users; amassing over 1TB of data daily across over a billion incoming events.

On the front-end, We are building beautiful user interfaces on top of a world-class, big data platform. A single page analytics suite to give our merchants and publishers actionable information about campaign performance, user engagement and conversion. We are helping merchants and publisher connect to run more successful campaigns and better monetise content.

You will be part of a cross-functional team including front-end, big data engineers and back-end engineers.

*Responsibilities:*

* Working with multiple technologies in JavaScript (and associated frameworks), HTML5, CSS3.
* Re-architecting and building our core feature Skim.js - the JavaScript we inject into Publisher sites. This is a complex and elegant piece of JavaScript that is at the core of our business.
* Creating new interfaces, reporting suites and APIs
* Collaborating with the design team to create responsive, fast and cross-browser interfaces used by merchants and publishers.
* Connect and use Skimlinks APIs to process and visualise data in the browser using JavaScript and charting libraries.
* *For the right person, this could be a Lead / Staff Level role - if so, then leading the team and architecture of our front-end products will be key.*

*Requirements:*

* Advanced knowledge of JavaScript, as well as associated frameworks (such as React, Redux etc.). Having said this, you should know what's going on "under the hood" in JavaScript.
* Some Back-End Engineering experience; preferably with a statically typed language, or Python
* Excellent experience with front-end technologies - HTML5, CSS3 and associated preprocessors.
* ES6 / ES7 knowledge would be desirable as we’re using it in production.

items.title: iOS Developer
items.content:
Stratajet is the world’s first real-time private jet booking platform, changing the way people travel. With Stratajet, it’s easy to search, compare and book a private jet straight from your computer or smartphone.
Stratajet is a likeminded meeting of individuals - all of whom believe in making private aviation faster, simpler, and more accessible to more people. Founded in 2011, Stratajet has since grown to a company of 50+ employees with offices in London, California and Singapore.

We are looking for an iOS Developer to help us evolve our existing app into a best-in-class solution. We are looking for someone who watches WWDC videos over the weekend to perfect their skill with new frameworks; someone who is comfortable navigating Core Data and developing thread safe code in order to provide the best possible user experience; someone who has integrated with external frameworks and knows when it is more appropriate to code solutions from scratch. In a nutshell, we are looking for a passionate iOS developer to join our team!

Requirements;
Help define the mobile roadmap: work with product and technical managers to scope and estimate feature improvements
Escalate development concerns which must be accounted for at sprint level
Refactor and improve legacy code to conform to industry best practices, while making steady progress against the bugs and features in the product roadmap
Work with internal developers to ensure consistency of contracts and resources (e.g. API endpoints, API logic, brand assets)
Aid testing of platform components; champion TDD approaches to development; work with QA Lead to ensure optimal development and deployment of apps
Constantly work to evolve our app into a world-class offering

The person;
Driven by a burning desire to own and improve products
Degree in Computer Science
Authorization to live and work in the UK
5+ years post-university, production-level, iOS development experience
Understand iOS design patterns for building maintainable apps
Demonstrated experience working with teams of mobile developers using both Obj-C and Swift
Unrelenting passion to develop industry-recognized product; desire to champion UI and product development best practices
Proud of ability to accurately estimate projects and deliver results

Life at Stratajet
Pioneering: Be part of a movement to fundamentally change an industry, opening it up to more people than ever before
Ownership: Enjoy the independence and responsibility required to allow you to deliver quickly and effectively
Passion and talent: Work with a nimble, passionate and dynamic team capable of lightning quick maneuvering and execution
Rewarding: We are a tech start-up, we're unique in the industry and we reward with equally exceptional benefits

items.title: Backend Software Engineer
items.content:
Here at Mindera, we are continuously developing a fantastic team, and would love it for you to join us!

As a Backend Software Engineer you’ll be part of the development of the core service-oriented architecture.
We’re looking for experienced Backend Engineers (Java focus) who have the appetite for solving complex and interesting problems.

Our focus is to develop with high standards having operational aspects in mind (metrics collection, tracing, etc.) with an holistic view on the backend platform in the back of your mind.

*REQUIREMENTS:*

*You are good at*
* Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban;
* Service oriented architectures, design patterns and data structures;
* Test-driven development and continuous delivery;
* Metrics, performance, and operational aspects that show you care about your code.
* More than one programming language such as Java, Scala, Javascript or Python;
* Working with mysql, springboot and mongo (although not essential)

*You rock at*
* Building highly concurrent, transactional and resilient services;
* Being self-driven, self-organised and working with little supervision towards a common team and company purpose;
* Building highly concurrent, transactional and resilient services.

*We offer*
* Fantastic working environment built on the principles of lean and self-organisation;
* Fun, happy and politics-free work culture;
* Competitive salaries and benefits;
* Potential to international travel;
* No dress code, corporate speak or middle managers.

Expected travelling time (PT and USA): 0%-15%, varies according to project/client.

*About Mindera*

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.
Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.
We partner with our clients, to understand their product and deliver high performance, resilient and scalable software systems that create an impact in their users and businesses across the world.
You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.
Our culture reflects our lean and self management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.
We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog: http://mindera.com/ and our Handbook: http://tinyurl.com/zc599tr

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA
ThinkIT Solutions Ltd is part of the Mindera Group

items.title: Tech Lead
items.content:
Job Description:

Flock is looking for an experienced tech lead to take its advanced prototype to market. You will become a key member of a small, highly technical team. You will work alongside our extensive network of partners and advisors, build and test at lightning speed, and discover cutting-edge techniques to create a best-in-class technology in the drone space.

Together with Flock’s Product Lead you will define key elements of our go-to-market product (an on-the-spot analytics and insurance platform), taking responsibility for architecture and development, and working closely alongside our two in-house developers.

You will help us build and lead a world-class team, who will work under you going forwards to realise Flock’s lofty visions.



Who are we?

We are a small, highly technical, energetic team based in Clerkenwell, London. We get things done quickly, set optimistic objectives and work hard to hit them. We are technology enthusiasts, working at the bleeding edge of the drone revolution.

We are building a Big-Data driven risk analysis platform for drones, aggregating and analysing real-time data to make drones safe and smart in cities. Our first product is an on-the-spot insurance solution for drone flights.

We recently closed a funding round lead by London VC Downing Ventures, alongside the London Co-Investment Fund and a syndicate of highly specialised angels (including big names in the automotive, Big Data, insurance and startup worlds). We are supported by Innovate UK, and we are now working in collaboration with the Ordnance Survey. We’ve been featured in the Financial Times, TechCrunch, The Guardian, Mashable, and more, we’ve pitched to Her Majesty The Queen, and we’ve travelled around the world to present Flock globally. If this sounds like the environment you’re looking for, we want to chat!



Who are you?

You are a full stack developer with 5 years or more commercial Back-End experience, and a solid grasp of application and systems architecture.

Experience with NodeJS and extensive Javascript knowledge is a must.

Other Big-Data friendly languages (Python, R) are a plus.

You have experience developing on top of Front-End frameworks, RESTful APIs, and cloud platforms. You understand the collaboration tool landscape.

You are good at managing your workflow and you feel comfortable in agile development and rapid iteration environments. You are excited about working with a mix of technical and non-technical people, and you can see yourself competently leading a tech team.

Legally able to work in the UK.

Most importantly, you have a passion for data, maps and/or drones.


What we offer:

We’re a fast-moving startup, and a small (but rapidly growing) team that operates at the forefront of drone safety software globally. You will play a key role, influencing the design and direction of our product, and of the drone industry itself!

You will be surrounded with and supported by Flock’s expert advisors in the drone, insurance and tech spaces. You will learn and grow with them.

You will work at one of the swankiest offices in Clerkenwell, London (with a great history; Karl Marx used to write here!) alongside a range of innovative startups, all working at the cutting edge of urban innovation in the Geovation Hub.

Competitive salary and remuneration in stock options.

A fun and friendly work environment, trips and day outs, talking on stage at conferences, shows, the possibility to travel abroad, and generally just a bloody good time!


Our Process:

Send your CV and a (brief) cover letter (or click ‘apply using LinkedIn’ above). If possible, please share your github/bitbucket account too.

We will start with an initial question send-out, which shouldn’t take more than a few minutes to complete.

Initial 15 minute skype conversation.

We will then send a short coding exercise.

We will invite you for interview with Ed (CEO) and Antton (Founder) at our offices in Clerkenwell, where you can ask any questions you might have, and we can discuss the role in detail.

Meet the entire team over a pint (or coffee - you choose!)

Like how it sounds? Then come fly with us!

Ps: No agencies please. All agency emails will go unanswered.

items.title: Appetite Agency - Developers needed!

Appetite Agency is a UK based mobile application hub. With the team spread across the UK, we are looking for 2 developers to come on board and be part of a young, fun and vibrant company.

Feel free to check us out: www.appetiteagency.com

items.title: Software Developer | Back End focus | Cloud
items.content:
*Software Developer | Back End focus | Cloud*
*at DevicePilot in London*

*Internet Of Things*

*London*

*Circa £50,000 – £70,000 depending on technical skills and experience PLUS SHARE OPTIONS in a high profile well-funded start-up*

DevicePilot is an award winning start-up designing a key component of the Internet of Things. We’re looking for a Software Developer with experience of cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure to collaborate in the design of systems for massive scale.

You’ll have experience in JavaScript and a second language such as Java or Scala or C++ or C#. We use modern CI/CD deployment tools, 3-tier client-server architecture, and streaming/distributed architectures such as serverless (lambdas). We value a range of experience in other stacks, frameworks and languages, and the experience you’ve gained from any side-projects too.

You have the chance to get in on the ground floor and make a real impact as the company becomes a leader in the global IoT infrastructure. There is an opportunity to obtain share options in a company founded by serial hi-tech entrepreneurs who have previously achieved multiple $100 million+ exits. With big plans for the future, we offer the ideal environment in which to hit the ground running and work at the forefront of technology.

To be considered, you must have:
* At least two years’ development experience either delivering or working as part of a team delivering a cloud based system
* Development experience using modern languages and architecting for large, scalable web services e.g. Java or C# or vb.net
* Some experience of Javascript or similar i.e. TypeScript, node, node.js, io.js
* Experience of a cloud platform such as AWS or Azure
* Knowledge of the design, implementation and use of REST APIs
* An understanding of both SQL and NoSQL database technologies
* Experience of web service development using Node.js and Scala or Akka would be useful.

As a Software Developer with an understanding of the full stack, you’ll be easy-going but assertive when you need to be. Professional and calm under pressure, you’ll love building maintainable software systems with clean code and will have a keen eye for modern web development best practices.

If you have the technical skills and abilities required for this role and desire to work in a dynamic fast paced start up then we’d love to hear from you. If you would like a confidential discussion about your suitability or to discuss the Device Pilot opportunity in more detail please get in touch ASAP.

items.content:
We are looking for a back-end software engineer with experience building highly scalable cloud services that also consume machine learning and big data. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of building world-class cloud-hosted services, enjoys collaborating with a team, and is obsessed with building a consumer product that customers love.
