items.title: Frontend Developer - Winner of 'Best UK Company to Work for' 2 years running!
items.content:
*Simply Business – We are looking for a Frontend Developer (Mid level and Senior positions)*

If you’re smart, passionate about technology and enjoy solving complex technical challenges then you should apply to join our best-in-class tech team. We believe that people are our most important asset and one worth protecting. As such, we’re known for creating an enviable working culture to keep our employees smiling on a day to day basis.

*In fact, our impressive and enjoyable working culture has earned us 1st place winners in the 'Sunday Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work for' - two years in a row for 2015 and 2016!*

*The role*

* Working on our responsive website & various projects and pushing the boundaries with modern technologies
* Collaborating with tech and business teams to deliver customer focused products
* Working alongside product and UX teams to analyse business requirements
* Helping us continually improve by suggesting new technologies, tools and ways of working
* Taking ownership of projects and driving them forward


*Some things we believe in*

* Agile / Lean / TDD / BDD / Continuous Delivery (we release software to production about 14 times a day on average) / cross functional teams working together on projects (Dev/QA/UX/product) / Active participation in open source
* Never chaining ourselves to a technology – always experimenting and ‘using the right tool for the job’
* Thought leadership – we host meetup groups and present talks in our office and the community
* Creating a great working environment and culture (modern open plan office, flexible hours, remote working, regular team events, paid company holidays abroad, afterwork clubs – like UX, Robotic, Data science clubs, ruby coding challenges over pizza, lunchtime TED talks and lot’s more!)
* Continuous learning – we look to pay for conferences and courses. Recently we have sent some of our Devs out to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for tech events and conferences (paid for).

*What we are looking for*

*Essential:*

* Experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Awareness of users/customer-focused
* Interest in good front-end architecture & practices
* Able to communicate well with tech & non-tech colleagues
* Ability to analyse & discuss business requirements and ask the right questions
* Understanding and appreciation for Agile practices
* Mobile/device awareness

*Desirable:*

* Experience with SASS
* Full stack development skills
* JavaScript testing experience (Jasmine, Mocha etc)
* Git
* Experience with React and ES6


*Our tech stack*

We are currently using technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, SASS, HAML, JavaScript, React, JQuery, CoffeeScript, Ruby on Rails, MongoDB, RabbitMQ, Puppet, Boxen, AWS, Cucumber, RSpec, Jasmine, amongst others. *You do not need to be experienced in this entire tech stack to apply.*

*What we can offer*

* Flexible working hours and working from home
* A multi-award winning working culture and environment
* Life insurance, 5% pension scheme & childcare vouchers
* A ‘pick & mix’ benefits package consisting of:
- Gym membership
- Private medical care
- Dental cover
- Extra holidays, and more!
* Money back on daily well-being costs (massage, contact lenses etc)
* A fun & social working environment
* The opportunity to work with a best-in-class team who are at the forefront of tech providing thought
leadership and hosting meetup groups in our office and presenting talks on the subject
* Company trips abroad (paid for!) - We’ve been Brussels twice and Barcelona over the last few years!
* Career development – we look to fund relevant training courses and conference
* Free daily breakfast, snacks & hot & cold drinks
* A company that drives continuous innovation with forthnightly and annual hackathons


*Awards and Achievements*

* Winner of the ‘Top 100 Best Companies to Work for 2015’ – Sunday Times
* 3 Star (highest) accreditation in “Best Small Companies to Work for” – Best Companies Ltd 2015 & 2016
* Business Intelligence Project of the Year – Tech, Data & Analytics Awards 2015
* ‘Best Use of Audience Insight’ – Digi Awards
* “Use of Organic Search (SEO)” Dadi Awards
* Accredited “Geared for Giving employer” – outstanding contributions to charity
* “Most Agile Aware Organisation Award” – Agile Awards
* “Best Use of Mobile Technology Award” – Technology in Insurance Awards
* Named in the “Deloitte Technology Fast 500 EMEA”
* Listed in “Sunday Times Tech Track 100” for fastest growing technology companies

*Where we are*

Down the road from Old Street and Tech City, we’re located in Moorgate.

*How to Apply*

Please apply for this role though this workinstartups website please.

Due to the volume of applications we receive across the entire business, we unfortunately cannot respond to each applicant with individual feedback. If you have not heard from us within 5 working days then please assume you have been unsuccessful.

items.title: Python Developer
items.content:
We are looking for an experienced Python developer to join our existing engineering team to help us build the next generation of the Opsview product. This role provides a real opportunity at the start of an exciting period of change and growth where your dynamism and vision will have a direct influence on the success of the company. You will be joining a high performing Python team building the future of the Opsview product suite and will be expected to deliver code to an exemplary standard. You will be implementing key architectural improvements and new features working within a Scrum/Agile environment. Training will be provided in Opsview Monitor and associated technologies, but prior knowledge of other monitoring solutions would be advantageous.

The successful applicant will have the opportunity to help build the Opsview business and progress with the growth of the company.

Required skills:

• A minimum of 2 years experience in Python development
• Experience of asynchronous frameworks for high-performance applications
• Experience with SQL for MySQL
• Strong Linux knowledge
• Experience in version control systems, such as Subversion or Git
• Passion for improving coding and development practices
• Proven ability to quickly assimilate new technologies and skills

Desired skills:

• Exposure to large-scale web applications
• Experience with writing web applications
• Experience in code profiling and writing unit tests
• NoSQL databases
• Experience of working within an agile scrum team
• Prior experience of working for a small, high-growth company
• Shell programming

You must be a high energy self-starter, able to work with minimal supervision and comfortable working within a framework of objectives without the need for day to day guidance and direction.

This role is a full time position offering great benefits including Health Care plan, Dental & Optical cash back Plan, Life insurance and Income Protection. For the successful candidate, we offer a competitive salary, benefits and a great, socially active office.

items.title: Mid/Senior iOS Engineer
items.content:
Aludio is an Altpoint Ventures backed start-up based in central London (currently just off Tottenham Court Road). We’re looking for smart, friendly iOS engineers to help us build out a new marketplace app for a vastly underserved market. We’re a small team so you’ll be able to work on a broad range of things right from the start and you’ll have a big say in how our systems are architected and run.

Responsibilities:
You’ll work closely with our designers and the rest of the engineering team to build a product that’s both beautiful and easy to use; one which we hope will become a daily habit for our users. This is a brand new app so we’re looking to kick off development in Swift rather than Obj-C. We’d love to integrate the more interesting parts of the iOS experience too (Apple Pay, 3D Touch, Widgets etc) – this won’t be a cross platform port, it’ll be a fully iOS native experience.

We’d love to hear from you if the following apply:
* You want to help build out not just a product, but a company
* You take pride in building beautiful products
* You can take a pragmatic approach to technical debt
* You have experience collaborating with backend engineers on defining robust APIs
* You have at least 2 years experience writing iOS apps commercially

items.title: Senior Go Developer (m/f)

Our highly scalable soft-real-time messaging cloud for management and backoffice capabilities sets us in the league of cisco and ubiquiti.
Work in an experienced team from hardware to cloud engineers on the core of a platform that enables 15,000 network access devices across central Europe.

Our stack:
- Golang Backend on AWS with docker
- Microservice infrastructure handling several thousands of messages per second
- Check out our github: https://github.com/superscale

Your tasks:
- Develop the backend of a massive scale M2M Backend for distributed hardware
- Work together with the frontend team to create in house tools
- Work together with the hardware team to shape the api
- Have significant input in the architecture and planning process

Your profile:
- You have already 5 years of programming experiences (Ruby, Python, Java, C++ or similar) and some experience in Golang
- You are an Open Source enthusiast
- You already worked with AWS on a professional level
- You have experience in massive scale Backend
- Experience in real time bus systems such as mqtt. Rabbitmq, etc. is a plus

Benefits:
- Contribute in building up the product from the very beginning (entrepreneur spirit)
- Full-time, above average compensation, office in Berlin/Kreuzberg
- Well funded from scratch development, massive opportunity and flat hierarchies
- Very flexible office hours
- Diverse team with incredible technical depth
- Directly report to a hacker with a track record in building hardware startups

If you are interested in this challenging position and environment, please get in touch with us and include a CV, GitHub profile and/or work samples/ references.

items.title: Java/Spring Developer (full stack with react optional)
items.content:
Do you want to work on a genuinely innovative product, helping millions of people do better things with their money? What about for a company with personality and presence, using modern tools in an environment where your voice is heard?

If all that sounds good read on.

*Why is this role important.*
You’ll be looking after the logic, integrations, and clever proprietary stuff that allows us to offer a cutting edge investment service. You’ll be making sure our customers information is captured reliably and stored securely. Building the interfaces to our own front end and others APIs. You’ll be solving difficult technical challenges while ensuring that we value and strive for simplicity and maintainability in our codebase. Your contribution will be critical in ensuring we build a high performance, scalable and functionally accurate system that people can feel confident trusting with their money.

*What you’ll learn*
You’ll improve your technical skills by working with other great engineers
You’ll develop a good understanding of the financial industry
You’ll work closely with all levels of the business
Training will be provided for new tools and technologies
We’ll encourage and support your attendance at relevant events, talks and conferences.
You’ll improve your own financial literacy and learn how to manage and plan your financial future

*What you’ll be doing* (not an exhaustive list)
Collaborating with teams made up of UX designers, developers and business product owners.
Writing high quality (functionally correct, testable, efficient) code to meet business goals
Looking at what is new and worthwhile and keeping our platform relevant and maintainable.
Looking at how we can deliver more content faster to more users.
Refactoring for security, speed and maintainability
Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle.
Preparing and producing releases
.
*Key Requirements*
* Java / Spring with at least 2 years industry experience
* Unit Testing / Continuous Integration
* Creating Restful JSON APIs
* Security and Performance
* Relational Databases / SQL / JPA / Hibernate / Liquibase
* Git / Command Line familiarity

*Also helpful but nor required*
* AWS / DevOps Experience (Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, RDS, S3, Elasticache, Route53, SES)
* Sector knowledge (e.g, Investments / Banking / Financial Advice)
* Front End JS especially React & Redux
* FIX protocol
* Build tooling (Maven, Gradle)
* Other JVM language experience (eg Groovy, Scala, Clojure
* Maths / Financial Modelling

*About Moola*
Moola suggests and manages low-cost optimised investment portfolios on your behalf. We do all the hard work in selecting the right mix of investments for you. You'll often hear us mentioned in industry discussions about "Fintech" and "robo-advice".
Because of scale, modern software and a lack of expensive premises and infrastructure we can do this incredibly cheaply and effectively when compared to people’s existing options. We also take away the complex jargon and make the experience of getting started simple and intuitive.
We’ve a great founding team, substantial funding and a very big vision.

*The Benefits*
If you’ve worked in Financial Services before you’ll find Moola a little different. We focus on empowering our employees to make good choices about how (and often what) to implement and the technology that best delivers to the company vision.
We’ll offer competitive industry salaries, a great working environment, training, including time in our London office. As we grow we’ll add to this list with the things that matter to you.

*The Practicalities*
The role is full time (Contractors who would consider permanent considered) in Belfast but we’re flexible when it comes to occasional remote working from home and ensuring a good work/life balance.

*Direct Applications only please – no recruitment or outsourced development agencies.*

items.title: Full Stack Javascript Developer [Interested in Meteor a big plus!]
items.content:
Looking for proficient JavaScript developer who knows/ or who is interested in Meteor.

*Your Responsibilities*
• Work 1:1 with company’s founder to reach common goal.
• Take an active role in building our search engine for user generated content. We aim to be the market leaders for sourcing, and licensing, user generated content from social networks. This will enable marketers and media professionals to curate visual content, whilst providing social media users across the world an opportunity to make money.
• Increase our website’s visibility in search engines
• Enhance our core system using collected data points
• Communicate daily with founder; including challenges and wins
• Celebrate success and enjoy the journey along the way


*What Pixey Looks For*
• Foundation in computer science concepts and web application architecture.
• Understanding the importance of delivering value rather than merely completing tasks to specs.
• Experience working in all stages of production cycle from prototypes to live production
• Familiarity with the technologies that we use: MongoDB, React.js, Meteor.js, Node.js, JavaScript, and Amazon AWS.
• Fluent English speaker
• The ability to work with own initiative


*About Pixey*
Pixey is the online marketplace for finding, and licensing real time user generated content images and videos.

User generated content is changing the landscape of content marketing in the same way that stock photography online libraries did back in early 90’s. User generated content is a must for any 21st century businesses looking to connect with a millennial audience.

Pixey has developed a powerful social media search engine, enabling users to quickly find content and obtain the digital rights to reuse user generated content. Our software leverages the fastest growing social network in the world, with TONNES of ideas for future development.

*Benefits*
• Happy to investment in ideas which would mean we could innovate, and move quickly [within reason]
• The founder is an experienced digital marketer with key understanding in software development and passionate about online marketing. Meaning you won’t be wasting time explaining the fundamentals of software, instead we will be spending all our time doing cool sh*t
• Opportunity to go with the company next year to Web summit. We have been accepted into the alpha programme, and would be happy to showcase any innovations that you have helped produce.
• Opportunity to work with new technologies
• Actively looking for a CTO to join the company on a full time basis (which would include a share option scheme and competitive salary on investment). This could be an option for the right applicant.
• Work in amazing RBS headquarters building based in Gogarburn
• Free coffee

*How to apply Application process:*
Before applying I believe that work should be fun, challenging and exciting — I am invested in something that I truly love. Therefore, I would expect applicants to be interested in user generated content and/ or social networks.

If you would like to apply, please send a copy of the following to:

• Your favourite meme
• a link to your GitHub/ Bitbucket
• Link to current side projects
• A small note on why you would like to apply for the role
• 3 examples of web apps you think display the best user experience, whilst not compromising on technology

items.title: Full Stack Developer (Part Time & Equity on offer)
items.content:
About Us

We’re a technology driven start up, building a highly scalable innovative platform from ground-up, and are looking for a tech savvy and highly motivated individual to join us!


About the role

The role will involve working on a part time / remote basis (around 6 hours a week) alongside the co-founders from idea generation through to product launch. Ultimately, you will form part of the key team that is responsible for turning the business vision into reality.

This is a rare and great opportunity to be part of the founding team and secure equity in a highly scalable business.


Your responsibilities

- Work in an agile environment with the Co-founders to ensure all product functionality is delivered.

- Translate UI/UX wireframes into visual elements and develop interfaces from scratch.

- Develop the overall functionality of the product to ensure a great user experience.

- Define technologies and architecture for the web and mobile platform.

- Develop scalable and robust data driven models, with reusable code and libraries.

- Manage the interchange of data between the server and the users.

- Integrate front and back-end functionality.

- Implement a robust set of services and APIs.

- Implement security and data protection.

- Optimise for maximum speed and scalability.

- Take smart risks and champion new ideas.


The Deal

The role will initially be for equity, and in contrast to many other start-up ventures, the right individual will be given the chance for a future full-time position with a salary.

If you feel the above could be of interest and would like to find out more, we’d love to hear from you, so please don’t hesitate to get in touch!

items.title: Full-Stack Developer at Car Quids
items.content:
Car Quids is looking for a full stack developer to join our team in London. This role will work directly with the founders and we’re looking for someone who’s up for a challenge, with a view to making them CTO in due course.

We are *funded by Seedcamp and Oxford University* and prominent angel investors from the marketing/advertising sector.

We work with brands such as *Papa Johns, JustPark, Bloom & Wild, Makers Academy, Travelex, eMoov, easyCar.*

We *crowd source advertising space by turning peoples’ cars into spaces that brands can advertise on*. Car owners get paid in return and they really like us (NPS of 92)!

*Our tech is the core reason brands choose us*. Using GPS we can show them a heatmap of where their branded fleet has been seen. Our planning algorithms mean our clients can estimate how many people will see their ads and how often with just a few clicks. The next stage of our technology will change the way outdoor advertising is bought and planned.

*Our tech is built on MEAN stack* (MongoDB, Express, Angular and Node.js). The ideal candidate will be able to quickly accustomise themselves with our existing tech as well as suggesting new technologies to use.

You will have a great deal of autonomy, even by startup standards. In addition to being a resourceful developer, we’d love it if you had an eye for design.

*Requirements:*
* Node.js
* Angularjs
* HTML 5/CSS 3
* Mongo DB
* Grunt/LESS
* Git

*Nice to haves:*
* Adobe CS experience, particularly Illustrator
* Responsive Web Design experience
* Big data experience
* AWS experience
* Bootstrap
* Likes cars!

items.title: Back End Developer
items.content:
Altus Analytics, a business of Altus Group, is the leading global technology partner to the commercial real estate industry and is poised for significant growth and expansion over the next three years.

Altus Analytics brings together the collective expertise of ARGUS and Voyanta as the leading provider of CRE solutions worldwide. Our technology and industry expertise empowers commercial real estate clients and partners to work collaboratively to enhance decision making, drive performance and optimize transactional efficiency. From property budgeting, making strategic decisions about acquisitions or working with different teams, different organizations and different data, we can bring it all together.

Our tech, our stack.

We build our platform on Amazon AWS cloud infrastructure, using Agile processes, managed with Jenkins and Maven. We use Java, Hibernate, and Spring as our primary back end technologies; with JavaScript - Backbone and jQuery frameworks - on the front end. We use primarily Linux platforms and MySQL databases, ElasticSearch and data virtualization for data persistence and access. We run automated testing using Cucumber and Runscope as well as framework testing with Selenium.

What we need.

At Voyanta, we’ve worked hard, and quickly grown past the start-up phase. But as an established company that continues upwards, we continue to retain the fast-pace, minimal red-tape, Agile approach of our early days. And we want a Back End Java Developer who shares our mindset. Someone who thrives in a fast-moving tech world where the work changes daily. A Back End Java Developer seeking the autonomy to define their own career path and grow with the company. This is a young company using cutting edge technology where everyone is expected to take ownership, and be involved in the direction of the product and the company.

We need a Back End Java Developer who wants to be challenged, and make an impact. Someone who wants to work with minimal process, the best tech and complex data. A Back End Java Developer who wants to move beyond churning out small fixes and simple repetitive code. Someone who is tired of propping up their colleagues who just aren’t as quick as they are.

Our Back End Java Development team is made up of six, fun, super smart, international members who, learn and work fast. A group constantly challenging themselves to improve their output. They pride themselves on clean code, testing, logical progression, and a pragmatic Agile methodology. This is team that will help you be a better programmer and will both teach you and learn from you. They will keep you mentally sharp, on the cutting edge of what is new and awesome, and invite you to join them for “wine o’clock” on Fridays.

If you are excited to work in Java 8 building solutions on AWS and you are ready for rewarding challenges, in a collaborative environment, this is the Back End Java Developer opportunity to consider.

Here’s what our Back End Java Developer will do:

• Produce. You will produce quality coding of advanced features and fixes for our platform.
• Execute. You will work independently and as part of a team on the full lifecycle development of advanced cloud based systems. From brainstorming and technical design through to architecting, programming and unit testing.
• Perfect. You will review code line by line to ensure we maintain and improve our standards.
• Innovate. You will actively contribute new ideas, tools, and methodologies to our design and development process.
• Keep up. You will work hard and fast with a group of the best developers around. And you will love it.

Who you are

• A university graduate. You have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related discipline.
• An experienced Back End Java Developer. You have 2+ years working in Java (most recently Java 8), Spring, and Hibernate. Bonus points if you have hands on experience with ElasticSearch, Amazon Web Services, Backbone.js and/or jQuery.js.
• A coder. You live and breathe coding.
• A well-rounded Dev team member. You have experience using MySQL, knowledge of Business Information systems, and exposure to tools such as Jenkins, git and Maven.
• A contributor. You are results-driven, with initiative, and highly capable of meeting deadlines. You are company-focused, and self-motivated.
• A techie. You have an interest in new technologies, tools and methodologies. In fact, you create new tools and processes, just for kicks.
• A stickler. You insist on keeping up with industry standards and trends. You pride yourself on being detail-oriented.
• A puzzle solver. You want to apply your understanding of related technologies to create solutions. You are a logical thinker; yet you are incredibly adept at thinking of all possible answers.
• An outstanding communicator. You are concise, on point and effective.
• An energetic and ambitious go-getter. You want to join a team of peers who are smart, have drive, and create amazing solutions. You want a place to grow, to learn, and to make a difference.

Who we are:

Voyanta, now part of Altus Analytics, is the leading global technology partner to the commercial real estate industry and is poised for significant growth and expansion over the next three years. Our solutions empower commercial real estate clients and partners to work collaboratively to enhance decision making, drive performance and optimize transactional efficiency.

Joining Altus Analytics now means joining a team of excited and involved leaders building bright and energetic teams. We want self-starters who want to make significant contributions to the development of our solutions and the growth of our company.

Need any more reasons to want to work with us?

As we continue to grow, the possibilities for the people that join Altus Analytics are significant. From professional growth to innovation to collaboration we are committed to continuing to foster the right environment to help our people realize their full potential. We give our people the freedom and responsibility to take charge of their career path, bring new ideas to the forefront and work on critical projects that will shape the success of our clients.

items.title: Lead Developer
items.content:
*About EdPlace*
Launched in 2012, we're a growing EdTech business helping parents across the UK support their child’s learning journey. We help thousands of children aged 5 to 16 with maths, English and science. We believe every parent should have access to quality educational support that effectively helps their child succeed. As parent champions, our mission is to be the most trusted partner for parents with the the biggest impact on a child’s education. We’re looking to build on the great success we’ve had to date and want you to be part of it.

You’ll join a small, friendly team based in Clerkenwell.

*About the role*
As our Lead Developer you will have responsibility for maintaining and leading the full stack development of our product, including our PHP website and web services and our native iOS app. You’ll set EdPlace’s technology agenda and help us deliver our product roadmap at high quality, identifying new opportunities for improvement and innovation along the way. Most of all you’ll be helping children learn by using the best technology available.

You’ll manage the relationship with our offshore development team of two dedicated PHP developers plus QC, front end and iOS resources and we’ll expect you to lead the recruitment and development of a small internal engineering team in the near future. In other words, you’ll have complete strategic control but won’t be expected to write every single line of code.

We’re looking for someone who isn’t afraid to get their hands dirty or try new things. Maybe you’ll want to rebuild some of what we already have or introduce new technology into the stack. We’re interested in machine learning, mobile frameworks, data visualisation and chat bots right now but you’ll have plenty of ideas of your own and have the vision and ability to deliver these.

As well as our public-facing services you will be responsible for improving our operational systems - reporting, analytics and payments - ensuring that they run smoothly and securely.

You will have overall responsibility for our AWS infrastructure, supported by IT resource at our offshore partner, including performance and security.

You will work closely with our marketing team, helping to define campaigns from a technical perspective and seeking out opportunities to improve customer conversion and retention. You’ll support our customer support team, helping to resolve problems for the thousands of parents who rely on our service.

*About you*
This role is a leadership position and you’ll work closely with both our CEO and CMO. As well as being a first class technologist you’ll be able to hold your own in discussions about product and business development. You’ll be a self-starter, a problem solver and have great attention to detail.

You’ll definitely have:

* Deep knowledge (5+ years at a senior level) of PHP/MySQL plus at least one other language (Python, Ruby, C# etc.)
* Knowledge of PHP frameworks (we aren’t using one right now but one of your jobs is likely to include introducing one)
* Solid knowledge of front end languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
* Knowledge and experience of build and deploy processes (Git, Jenkins etc)
* The ability to pick the right language and the right tools for the job, even if that means trying something new
* Sound knowledge of AWS or other cloud infrastructure service including cloud databases, containerisation and object storage (e.g. S3)
* Knowledge of payment systems (ideally including Chargify and/or Stripe)
* Knowledge and experience with security best practice
* A willingness to learn and constantly improve
* Experience of working in an agile environment (Kanban, Scrum, XP etc)
* Experience using a project management tool/issue tracker (ideally JIRA)
* Enthusiasm for and belief in EdPlace’s mission
* A willingness to pitch in across the whole organisation
* A sense of humour

It would be nice if you have some or all of:

* Knowledge of front-end frameworks and tools (Bootstrap, Angular, D3 etc)
* Experience in e-commerce, particularly subscription billing
* Experience in a small business or start-up
* Experience of working on product development
* Knowledge of the education sector or of child-centred products
* Experience working with (and probably refactoring/rewriting some of) a legacy codebase
* Experience with Objective C or Swift and/or cross platform frameworks (Xamarin, React Native etc)
* Working knowledge of application performance monitoring (e.g New Relic)


The EdPlace Way
Our values run through everything we do here at EdPlace.

* Problem Solve: We don’t settle for ‘this is how it has always been done’ or ‘no that can’t be done’. We look for solutions.
* Results-focussed: We work towards clear actions to get results.
* Helpful and supportive: We’re a small team, so it’s important to help and support one another to make EdPlace the best it can be.
* Adaptive: We ensure we’re adapting to the needs of our customers and quick to respond.
* We care: We take pride in helping parents support their child’s education.


If reading this gets you excited, we’d love to hear from you.

items.title: Full-stack PHP developer
items.content:
*SmarterQueue* is a ground-breaking social media scheduling tool. It solves the problems that people are still facing with time-consuming manual tasks, and low engagement. Ultimately, the platform saves users over 5 hours per week, and increases the effectiveness of their social media content up to 300%.
The product is officially launching in Feb 2017, but we already have hundreds of paying beta customers, and thousands of people on our waiting list, all from word-of-mouth referrals.

*Our ideal person - is this you?*
Attention to detail - that’s primarily what has made SmarterQueue successful - when adding new features, you can write code that handles every possible case.
Regular communication - you must communicate effectively and in a timely manner. Responsive to messages, and send regular updates.
Ability to work independently - you’re welcome to ask questions as often as necessary, but should be able to complete work on time without having to be chased, or set expectations.
Good UX awareness - so that features are easy to use and follow best practices.
Stable code - You’re as excited about bug-fixing and keeping the product stable, as you are about adding new features. You’re open to conform to our coding standards, even if it’s not the way you’re used to.
Remote worker - you’re happy being part of a remote team, with weekly team calls, Skype and Slack to keep you connected with the rest of the team.

Our roadmap is full of exciting features and improvements that our users are eagerly waiting for.
You will be involved in designing and developing new features, specifying how they will work, and coding them all the way through from the database structure and PHP, to HTML and JS.

*Required Skills*
PHP & MySQL
Ability to write procedural PHP without depending on a framework (there is a bespoke framework and library of helper functions, similar to developing for Wordpress)
HTML, CSS, jQuery
Working with Git/similar

*Bonus Points*
Working with AWS (esp. deployment)
Unit testing, and automated in-browser testing
RESTful APIs (creating them, and integrating with 3rd party services like FB/Twitter/etc)

*Work*
1-3 month contract (20-40hrs/week), with potential for a long-term contract role.
You will report directly to the CEO, alongside other developer(s).
You can work remotely, from any timezone.

*Salary*
£20-£40/hour, depending on location/expertise

*How to apply*
Send an intro email, along with your CV.
You must include the following details, or your application will be ignored:

* what your hourly rate is, and number of hours you can commit to each week, for the initial trial period
* why you’re interested in working on SmarterQueue, and how you would improve the platform.
* what relevant experience you have, including links to your work and online presence. We're looking for expertise with DOM manipulation, SaaS applications/functionality, and procedural PHP.

Don’t just send a generic cover letter or a lone CV - we want to know a little bit about who you are!

We're currently a small team, spanning London, Canada, USA, and Australia, and have built a product that people LOVE, and shout about.
We’re actively looking for a diverse and gender-balanced team.

Visit "SmarterQueue.com":https://smarterqueue.com for more information about the product

NO RECRUITERS
ABSOLUTELY NO OUTSOURCED TEAMS/AGENCIES - we are looking for an individual to work within our team

items.title: Java Software Engineer
items.content:
h1. Job summary

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing, innovative, employee-centred business in the space industry. We are looking for an experienced and motivated Java Software Engineer to join our team developing the next generation of spacecraft ground software and software tools. As a key member of our team you would be responsible for helping developing elements of our spacecraft ground control software suite but also there is opportunities for working with the European Space Agency to develop their Open Source software suite. The primary implementation language is Java, although a working knowledge of Python and/or other scripting languages would be useful as these are also used in our tooling.

h2. Essential technical skills

We see the following as essential to the job:
* Good Java skills, ideally demonstrated in a commercial environment
* A good understanding of Java concurrency concepts and constructs
* Development and debugging of high quality code and adherence to best coding
practices
* Broad working experience; ranging from user interface to database optimization
* Ability to work in a Linux environment using a range of standard development tools

h2. Personal skills

We're looking for a dynamic and motivated engineer to join our team. We're especially looking for someone who:
* Enjoys problems solving and balancing the pragmatic and practical with the abstract
and elegant
* Works well both independently and in a team as part of a fast-paced technical
environment
* Possess strong verbal and written communication skills, both for internal and external, customer facing, interactions
* Is interested in learning new skills and is open to new ideas and ways of working

h2. Desirable technical skills

The following skills would definitely be a bonus:
* Knowledge of, or exposure to, space systems in either a commercial or academic
context
* Experience in planning and executing all stages of software engineering, from design to documentation according to a specified development process
* Experience in performing requirements analysis and elicitation based on formal and informal inputs
* Experience of model-based and/or component-based software engineering
* Experience with a range of development environments, frameworks or libraries such as Java EE, Spring, network programming/messaging, persistence etc.
* Experience with databases, either RDBMS or NoSQL
* Apache Maven
* JavaFX
* Use of version control systems such as mercurial, git and SVN
* Agile software development
* Software development and test automation, including continuous integration

h1. About the job

We're ideally looking to employ someone full time, although this is negotiable. Salary will be in the range of £20k-£40k+, depending on experience, with 30 days of holiday per annum and a 6% employer's pension contribution. We have offices in Edinburgh and Dundee and this role could be filled in either location, although a certain amount of inter-site travel may be required. All applicants should have the right to work in the UK.

As a member of the Bright Ascension team you would have a stake in the business through our Employee Benefit Trust which will own 20% of our business. We are in the process of establishing this structure, with completion expected in March 2017.

h1. Bright Ascension

We are a young, innovative company changing the way that software is developed in the space industry. With customers across the world, ranging from universities and space agencies, to commercial organisations and start-ups, our core technologies enable our customers to develop and operate space-based systems and services faster, cheaper and more reliably. Innovation is at the heart of what we do and it is our team which drives that innovation; this is reflected in our commitment to being an employee ownership, which gives all of us a voice, and a stake, in our current and future success.

items.title: Spacecraft Software Engineer
items.content:
h1. Job summary

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing, innovative, employee-centred business in the space industry. We are looking for an experienced and motivated Spacecraft Software Engineer to join our team developing the next generation of spacecraft flight software and software tools.

As a key member of our R&D team you would be responsible for developing elements of our spacecraft flight software, especially those involved in data handling, communications, automation and guidance, navigation and control (GNC). The primary implementation language is C, although a working knowledge of Python and/or Java would be useful as these languages are also used in our tooling. A crucial part of the role is the analysis and generation of software
requirements based on mission requirements and operational concepts (ConOps); for this reason space systems knowledge and/or experience in the space industry could be important.

h2. Essential technical skills

We see the following as essential to the job:
* Strong C skills, ideally demonstrated in a commercial environment
* Knowledge of, or exposure to, space systems in either a commercial or academic
context
* Development and debugging of quality code and adherence to best coding practices
* Experience in planning and executing all stages of software engineering, from design to documentation according to a specified development process
* Experience in performing requirements analysis and elicitation based on formal and informal inputs
* Strong understanding of concurrent programming constructs
* Ability to work in a Linux environment using a range of standard development tools

h2. Personal skills

We're looking for a dynamic and motivated engineer to join our team. We're especially looking for someone who:
* Enjoys problems solving and balancing the pragmatic and practical with the abstract and elegant
* Works well both independently and in a team as part of a fast-paced technical
environment
* Possess strong verbal and written communication skills, both for internal and external, customer facing, interactions
* Is interested in learning new skills and is open to new ideas and ways of working

h2. Desirable technical skills

The following skills would definitely be a bonus:
* Experience of model-based and/or component-based software engineering
* Experience with a range of development environments, frameworks or libraries
* Use of version control systems such as mercurial, git and SVN
* Experience developing embedded/real time software
* Agile software development
* Software product/quality assurance, especially ECSS-E-ST-40C, DO-178B/C
* Software development and test automation, including continuous integration

h1. About the job

We're ideally looking to employ someone full time, although this is negotiable. Salary will be in the range of £30k-£40k+, depending on experience, with 30 days of holiday per annum and a 6% employer's pension contribution. We have offices in Edinburgh and Dundee and this role could be filled in either location, although a certain amount of inter-site travel may be required. All applicants should have the right to work in the UK.

As a member of the Bright Ascension team you would have a stake in the business through our Employee Benefit Trust which will own 20% of our business. We are in the process of establishing this structure, with completion expected in March 2017.

h1. Bright Ascension

We are a young, innovative company changing the way that software is developed in the space industry. With customers across the world, ranging from universities and space agencies, to commercial organisations and start-ups, our core technologies enable our customers to develop and operate space-based systems and services faster, cheaper and more reliably. Innovation is at the heart of what we do and it is our team which drives that innovation; this is reflected in our commitment to employee ownership, which gives all of us a voice, and a stake, in our current and future success.

items.title: Embedded Software Engineer
items.content:
h1. Job summary

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing, innovative, employee-centred business in the space industry. We are looking for an experienced and motivated Embedded Software Engineer to join our team developing the next generation of spacecraft flight software and software tools.

As a key member of our R&D team you would be responsible for developing elements of our spacecraft flight software, especially those that interface directly with hardware or the operating system. You would have a key role in shaping the direction of our platform abstraction framework and integrating our code base, framework and drivers with our autocoding tools. The primary implementation language is C, although a working knowledge of Python and/or Java would be useful as these languages are also used in our tooling. Experience of ARM-based platforms would be useful, as we are seeing an increasing number of flight computers using ARM cores.

h2. Essential technical skills

We see the following as essential to the job:
* 5+ years experience of developing and debugging embedded/real-time systems
* Experience with a wide range of hardware platforms and operating systems
* Strong C skills demonstrated in a commercial environment
* Development of high quality code and adherence to best coding practices
* Experience with a range of interfacing technologies (e.g. RS232, RS422/485, I2C, SPI, MILBUS, SpaceWire) and communications protocols
* Ability to interpret datasheets, interface control documents, protocol definitions, design specifications etc.
* Experience with the use of test equipment such as logic analysers, oscilloscopes etc.

h2. Personal skills

We're looking for a dynamic and motivated engineer to join our team. We're specially looking for someone who:
* Enjoys problems solving and balancing the pragmatic and practical with the abstract and elegant
* Works well both independently and in a team as part of a fast-paced technical
environment
* Possess strong verbal and written communication skills, both for internal and external, customer facing, interactions
* Is interested in learning new skills and is open to new ideas and ways of working

h2. Desirable technical skills

The following skills would definitely be a bonus:
* Space industry experience, in either hardware or software
* Hardware design experience, including FPGA development
* RTOS experience, especially FreeRTOS and RTEMS
* Experience with ARM Cortex-M0/M3/M4 (especially Atmel, Cypress, Microsemi), MSP430, OpenRISC, SPARC/LEON
* Agile software development
* Software product/quality assurance, especially ECSS-E-ST-40C, DO-178B/C
* Software development and test automation, including continuous integration

h1. About the job

We're ideally looking to employ someone full time, although this is negotiable. Salary will be in the range of £38k-£48k+, depending on experience, with 30 days of holiday per annum and a 6% employer's pension contribution. We have offices in Edinburgh and Dundee and this role could be filled in either location, although a certain amount of inter-site travel may be required. We are currently looking for two embedded software engineers, one of whom would be required to spend a proportion of their time on a customer site in city-centre Glasgow, both roles may be required to spend time on other customer sites. All applicants should have the right to work in the UK.
As a member of the Bright Ascension team you would have a stake in the business through our Employee Benefit Trust which will own 20% of our business. We are in the process of establishing this structure, with completion expected in March 2017.

h1. Bright Ascension

We are a young, innovative company changing the way that software is developed in the space industry. With customers across the world, ranging from universities and space agencies, to commercial organisations and start-ups, our core technologies enable our customers to develop and operate space-based systems and services faster, cheaper and more reliably. Innovation is at the heart of what we do and it is our team which drives that innovation; this is reflected in our commitment to employee ownership, which gives all of us a voice, and a stake, in our current and future success.

items.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
items.content:
At Tallarium we are working to change the way financial oil and commodity markets are traded by corporates via the introduction of the latest technologies and making the currently manual processes electronic and seamless.
Our market includes multinational trading houses, which generate over $3tn p.a. turnover and deal with moving most of the commodities globally. We help these companies to make better and smarter trading decisions via real-time data for decision making, communication, analytics and visualisation tools.

The CEO of Tallarium is an Oxonian who previously worked as a trader for one of the world’s largest oil hedge funds. The CTO is another Oxford University grad with a PhD in Computer Science and worked as a quantitative developer at a London hedge fund and as a full-stack web developer at two Silicon Valley tech companies.

If the thought of joining a fintech startup, shaping the engineering culture, making far-sighted architectural decisions, automating processes and taking pride in writing clean, unit tested code excites you, we'd love to hear from you.

What we offer:
- Product focused company
- Engineering focused culture
- World class engineering team
- Work with modern as well as more established technologies

We would love you to have:
Computer Science (or technical degree) from top 10 UK university or equivalent in another country
Experience with JavaScript and/or Ruby
Experience with web technologies and frameworks (ideally Ember.js, alternatively React or Angular)

items.title: Insurtech Full Stack / Back End Developer
items.content:
Location:

Artificial Labs London office or Artificial Labs Warsaw office (TechHub Warsaw)

Benefits:

Apple laptop if required
discretionary bonus
generous holiday
screen if required
relaxed working environment
conference budget
Remuneration:
Very attractive depending on quality

Artificial Labs require a full stack or back end developer to join the team. Immediate start.

We are a growing team looking to change the way the insurance market operates by building innovative platforms that insurance professionals and consumers love to use. The insurance industry is undergoing a technological revolution and we want to be at the forefront of it. We already work with a couple of large insurance companies and we need someone to help us work with many more.

If you want to work with like-minded people, in a relaxed but driven environment, where you are given the tools and responsibility you need; please get in touch. We are currently recruiting for a senior back-end or full stack developer, but have roles for front-end developers, designers and project managers.

Our primary requirement is for a back end developer, however, we will welcome applications from full stack developers as there is an opportunity to deliver front-end as well as back-end code.

Our Backend Stack:

Linux, PHP, Laravel, MySQL, AWS

The Role:

You will work with the growing team to deliver excellent platforms and sites across all areas of the business. Your work will be varied and you will be expected to deliver high-quality work with capable colleagues from day one. We have a very friendly culture, although you are expected to set and meet your own deadlines, and communicate clearly at all times.

Primarily, you will develop back-end applications in Laravel in either an API-first manner, or as an integrated solution. You will be provided with specifications/requirements, bringing these to fruition using test driven development best practises, incorporating your colleagues and clients’ feedback. That being said, you should care about good performance and security.

You will report directly to the head of development - Artur Kisiolek.

You will be able to demonstrate examples of code that you have written to a very high standard, executed as part of high-quality applications.

We are not concerned with your educational background and will make our decision on your ability based on talking to you and your examples.

Essential skills:

Linux, Experience working with modern PHP framework like Laravel or Symfony, MySQL, TDD, MVC architecture, API design and development, JavaScript, GitHub, regular clear communication, ability to find answers to problems yourself.

Nice to have skills:

BDD, Domain Driven Design, AWS administration, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SASS, Sketch / Photoshop files, GitHub, regular clear communication, ability to find answers to problems yourself.

items.title: Senior Tech Lead - Frontend
items.content:
Crowdit is the world’s leading app and platform for the On-trade sector. For those who might not know, On-trade is the $750bn drinks service industry, where any business who serves a drink as part of its business is considered on-trade. This can be pubs and bars, but it also includes hotels, airports, coffee shops and more.

Crowdit provides an all-in-one platform that connects this world – linking venue owners, brands and consumers to the same data.

- It helps venues understand who their customers are and helps them sell more, and retain consumers for longer.

- It gives brands eyes into this world, where they’ve previously been blind – helping them craft new strategies for the sale of their products.

- Last, it connects consumers into a global directory of places to go, based on their preferences and availability.

- And soon, it will be the full end-to-end data platform for this sector.

We're looking for a senior tech lead who can help make our frontend system world class. We're in the process of building out our tech team so we're looking for a self-starter with the following skills:

- JS
- AngularJS
- SaaS (grunt)
- English + 1 other language
- iOS ( Obj-C or Swift)
- Android

About the job

You will support our young company to become the leader in on-trade data and marketing services, by learning about and working with some of the leading drinks brands, bar and hotel chains in the world. With clients like Red Bull, Pernod Ricard, Coca-Cola and Carlsberg to name a few you’ll get really exciting insights to how some of the world’s best loved brands operate in digital.

Working in the team, you will work closely with these brands as well as creating strategic approaches to new craft brands from around the world, sharing the exciting benefits that Crowdit can bring as a platform. You’ll be involved directly with the day to day growth of the business built around the learnings that come from a global roll-out.

Who we’re looking for

Crowdit looks for people who have a get-up and go attitude, who believe passionately about the sector we’re aiming to become world-leaders in and have strong personable and relationship building skills that are core to developing strong relationships within this industry.

Need to haves:

- JS
- AngularJS
- SaaS (grunt)
- English + 1 other language
- iOS ( Obj-C or Swift)
- Android

Nice to haves:

- PHP / Laravel
- MySQL
- Advanced domain knowledge
- Google Cloud Service knowledge.


We are looking forward to receiving your application

Crowdit is managing the recruitment for this position directly and will get back to you as soon as possible.

items.title: Frontend Developer (@ Techstars AI startup)
items.content:
We’re Seldon, a disruptive data science start-up with a purpose to make the world a better place with machine intelligence.

We believe that machine learning will soon be at the core of every business as processes become increasingly automated. That’s why we created Seldon, an open source platform for deploying artificial intelligence and machine learning models that help organisations build intelligent services and making better decisions.

Seldon is alumni of Techstars Barclays Accelerator — the world’s #1 fintech accelerator. A global community of thousands of developers and several multinational companies are already using our platform, meaning the work that we do impacts millions of people around the world. And that gives us a warm fuzzy feeling inside :-)

We’re experimenting with deep learning, machine learning, computer vision to create cutting edge technology that will become the future of business. And to succeed on our mission we believe it's critical that these complex technologies and concepts are made accessible through design.

Finally, we’re an engineering-led organization that puts company culture at the centre of everything we do. So you’ll feel right at home amongst a passionate team of fellow technologists and product builders.

*Where do you come in?*

Seldon is looking for a front-end developer to take responsibility for the UX/UI product design and front-end development. Play a key role in building the user-facing features from scratch for Seldon's next major product release.

*REQUIREMENTS*

Essential

You are excited about machine learning and have practical experience using the following processes, languages, tools:

* JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery, AngularJS and React.
* CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap, Less and YAML.
* Design experience with proficient understanding of Photoshop, Illustrator and other design tools.
* Testing the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs.
* Optimising applications for maximum speed and scalability.
* Collaboration with other team members and stakeholders.


*Highly desirable*

* Familiarity with Java, Python, Node.js or Go.


*Bonus points*

* Contributions to open source software.
* Experience with machine learning and recommender systems.

*BENEFITS*

* Work directly with stakeholders across our community, clients, and team including CEO, CTO, tech and commercial.
* Share options to align you with the long-term success of the company.
* Exciting fast-paced start-up challenges with an ambitious team and unlimited potential for professional growth.
* Satisfaction of knowing that your efforts, in partnership with some of the world’s most exciting and prestigious companies, will help to impact millions of people.
* Work at a vibrant office in Farringdon opposite Smithfield Market.
* Career development with training and representing Seldon at industry events.

items.title: UX/UI Design Intern
items.content:
Creatify helps businesses reach their customers by creating incredible websites. Using human powered artificial intelligence, we’re able to deliver a traditional agency service and create websites faster than ever before with no upfront costs.

We’re a small entrepreneurial team based in Glasgow, with a culture that puts customers at the heart of everything we do. We pride ourselves on innovation, implementing principles we’ve learned from some of the world’s biggest tech companies and startups we’ve previously founded. Meet Creatify, the smart new way to get your website built.

Our UX/UI Design Intern will be responsible for creating website design components using industry best practice. This role is for a 10 week paid internship.


*WHAT YOU’LL DO?*
• Conceptualise, design and execute responsive website design components.
• Research and implement industry best practices for UX/UI.
• Work with our CEO & CTO to develop a discuss the role of UX in our AI tools.
• Create style guides, developing colour palettes and type pairings.
• Design creative assets for digital campaigns, marketing emails and social channels.
• We’re a startup, you’ll do a little of everything!


*WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR?*
• Previous experience in responsive website design.
• Strong understanding of interaction design, UX & UI principles, processes and data driven best practices.
• Good knowledge and experience in Photoshop, Illustrator.
• Strong attention to detail and mastery of typography, colour and layout
• Focused on results and deadlines.
• Experience with WordPress is a bonus.
• Self-motivated. A self-starter, passionate and a hustler.
• Innovative. You challenge the status quo and make your own ideas known.


*WHAT WE’RE OFFERING?*
• Work with a highly motivated, skilled and fun team of young entrepreneurs with experience in delivering major tech products.
• Professional training and development.
• Insight into building a scalable startup, with access to global entrepreneurial networks.
• Competitive Intern Pay (10 Week Internship)
• Monthly gym membership.
• Blinkist subscription (check it out)!
• Monthly team lunches.
• Be based in a fun, creative co-working space around other entrepreneurs and startups.

To apply get in touch and we'll send your application!

Thanks,
Rory

Co-Founder & CEO
Creatify

items.title: Graphic/ Web Design
items.content:
We’re a startup based in Clerkenwell, London. There are six people working here. You would be numero seven. But we pack a punch, and with the background, skills and experience of the team, we’re taking on a big challenge: the ‘Housing Crisis’.

We believe that by using technology to crack open the land market like a Christmas walnut, we’re in the process of making a big business that will unlock the land needed on which more houses can be built. This vision is backed the same investors behind Love Film, TransferWise, Zoopla, Shazaam and Property Partner. Real issues, real tech, underpinned by a real economic opportunity.

We hold it in high importance to build a team. In working for us you’ll be in constant contact with the company founders, as well as engineering and business development, so you’ll be in environment where you can learn about the conception of and running of a startup company that is scaling up. More so, you’ll be invited into the vision. Goalposts move all the time, we need help from other bright people that can build on the firm foundations we’ve put in place. This isn’t just a design role, this is a problem solving role. Adopt our (proverbial) child, and help to mould and grow it. In return, we’ll stretch you and give you the space to thrive.

It is important for our employees to be people we want to spend a lot of time sitting next to and therefore we’ve often found ourselves parting company to hit the last tube when work turned into dinner or a beer. London is a great city, your work should not stifle your enjoyment of this. It should be part of what makes your life here good.

As for the the day to day stuff:
This job is about making the front end of the Land Insight web app simple to operate and a pleasure to experience. You will understand the behaviour of the users and help them be more effective. You'll align our brand internally and externally.

About you:
* Solid design skills and understanding of UX
* Can demonstrate skills in your portfolio
* Minimum of 2 years product design experience
* Comfortable working with HTML/CSS
* Up-to-date knowledge of the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies
* Clear and accessible communication skills, especially in presenting designs

Please get in touch: jobs@landtech.co

items.title: UX Developer
items.content:
UX Developer

Overview

The tech team at viagogo is focused on building a platform that will revolutionise the way fans across the globe buy and sell tickets for live events. With buyers and sellers using our website and mobile applications in over 60 countries, 30 languages and hundreds of delivery and payment options, we're constantly taking on tough, exciting engineering challenges - and we're doing it at scale! We are looking for passionate, skilled UX Developers who want to make meaningful, measurable improvements that impact millions of users.

How we work

We work in a start-up like manner and we work in small scrum teams of 4-7. Every team member is encouraged to take full ownership of their part of the platform but also to contribute ideas, suggestions and code to other areas of the business. We believe that features have no value until they are in production adding value to our customers so teams deploy fast and often. The tech team is building something that has never been built before so we're always trying to think outside the box. We hold monthly hackathons where team members inside and outside of tech bring their most creative ideas for the product; some of which even make it to production the same night!

This role will give you full ownership of the work you do from idea to execution. You will be responsible for all the work done across our e-commerce sites and internal products. You will need to bring your creativity and problem solving skills to connect with the users to be able to make the necessary changes across our high volume transactional websites.

What we’re looking for

• Super strong coding skills in HTML, CSS and SASS (responsive/mobile design should be a given).
• Work well in small, agile teams delivering incredible results.
• A passion for design with strong UX skills and the ability to work closely with designers to create sites with a great experience for the audience.
• Basic understanding of front-end performance tuning, best practices and techniques
• Extremely thorough, detail-oriented, organised, with the ability to be effective with your time.
• Exceptional written and oral communication skills to convey ideas in an effective manner
• Passionate about technology, willingness to learn and try new things.
• Comfortable with the basics of Photoshop, Illustrator or similar software

items.title: Front End Engineer at Launch Potato, South Florida or Remote, engineering
items.content:
Launch Potato - Front-End Engineer, Marketing <>
* About <>
* Contact <>
* Careers <>
Front-End Engineer, Marketing

You'll be responsible for developing and testing compelling user experiences
for an existing, highly successful B2C brand with millions of visitors per
month. If your passion for metrics and analytics compliment your knowledge of
web development, a full-time position awaits you in our Delray Beach office --
remote possible for the right team member.

Who We Are

Launch Potato is a profitable startup studio that incubates and launches
mobile and web companies on our proprietary technology stack.

We are building teams that can solve complex issues in product development,
engineering, creative, and data science. Now we need you!



This position would work on a product that is already existing under the LP
umbrella and optimally poised for high growth over the next year.



We have flexible architecture and an adaptable Engineering Team that is
supportive of new ideas and developer styles.

The Role - TL;DR

This is an amazing opportunity to implement robust front-end abstractions and
systems for a proven digital brand.



You’re a product-focused engineer who loves the freedom and ownership to take
over a project and grow it.



You’ll be responsible for ensuring the user experience is extremely sticky and
take full ownership of delivering clean code that renders quickly and
beautifully across browsers, devices and email inboxes.





Still Interested? Read On



Among your core responsibilities will be testing new user experiences,
assessing performance, and quickly making changes to increase user engagement.



You love innovative user experiences that also meet marketing and business
goals, and you’ll use the freedom given in this role to aggressively research,
develop and implement new ideas.



As an expert in HTML5, CSS3, JS and responsive design techniques, you’ll look
at cross-browser/application issues with a positive attitude, and more
importantly you’ll identify and creatively resolve coding challenges to work
around them.



You’ll work directly with the Engineering & Marketing Teams. Because you’re
highly motivated and enjoy working in a tight-knit group, you’ll proactively
communicate progress and challenges to the team.



You’ll also be aware of changing trends so you can contribute intelligently to
our team of highly trained and passionate professionals.





The Perks

• Create delightful user interfaces for an existing profitable business with
high-volume traffic

• Energetic, fun startup culture

• Work directly with founding team, 4 young Internet execs who successfully
developed and scaled double-digit million dollar online businesses from the
ground up in the past decade

• International exposure working with an amazing, talented team distributed
across US, Europe and Asia

• Unlimited career growth





Who We're Looking For



• 3+ years of engineering experience with a proven track record of building
consumer web applications or services

• Self-starter who is passionate about meeting marketing goals and proactively
implements new ideas

• Ability to traverse the entire "front-end stack" from PSD to code

• Excellent understanding of web markup including HTML5, CSS3, and responsive
design techniques

• Deeply familiar with JS frameworks and other libraries, including jQuery

• Good knowelge of analytics and tracking platforms (Mixpanel, Google
Analytics, Snowplow, email platforms)

• Experience using testing tools such as Optimizely

• Passionate about high-quality code; proficient understanding of
cross-browser and cross-device compatibility issues and ways to solve them

• Comfortable making in-code visual design decisions in order to ship code
faster

• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

• Proven ability to manage project plans & adhere to deadlines

• Excellent project management skills and comfortable working in fast-paced
environment

• In-depth knowledge of current UI trends and strategically planning for future

• Fluency in English





Know A Bit About These? Even Better.

• Ad Serving Technology and Tags (Google Adsense, Media.net, Adzerk)

• Familiar with server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS

• Strong command-line skills

• Familiarity with Photoshop

• Experience working for an online B2C company

• SQL





Availability

Our normal team work hours are roughly 10am-5pm ET M-F. However, we are a
distributed digital team and there may be late/early meetings due to different
time zones. We always try to work with everyone's schedules but at times there
may be meetings earlier in the morning and later at night.



We communicate throughout the day using Slack and Asana and several times a
week using Google Hangouts. You'll be expected to actively participate in these
discussions and be an active, awesome contributing member of our team!





Want to be a Part of a Successful, High-Growth Company? Join the LP Team!



Send your resume and the information below to ilovejs@launchpotato.com with a
subject line that includes “{Your Name}”



* Applications without the information below will not be considered.



1. Brief cover letter that explains Why You're Qualified For This Role

2. Link to your public code repository (GitHub, Bit Bucket etc)

3. Provide links to your portfolio and attach samples of pages and/or emails
you’ve personally built yourself

4. Rank yourself 0-10 (0 being completely unfamiliar, 10 being expert in your
field) on your skillset with the following:

* HTML5

* CSS3

* Javascript

* Advanced CSS animation

* Python

* Photoshop

* SQL

5. Which parts of marketing and analytics excite you the most?

6. Describe a recent technical challenge you experienced and how you solved it.

7. List 3 websites whose UI/UX you like. Include a brief description why.
<>
South Florida's fastest growing startup studio leveraging data, science, and
fun to build awesome, profitable digital companies.

Made in Delray Beach

*
*
*

Full stack Node.js developer
Home » Full stack Node.js developer
Location: 1 from China, 1 from EMEA or European countries

Are you a backend or full stack Node.js expert? Ready to do the best work of
your life? Here is your chance to shape the direction of the world’s #1
enterprise, open source mobile analytics, push notifications and user profiles
platform.

In Countly, we work on what we love. We launch new experiences fast, iterate
often, and deliver better a UI experience for both small businesses and
enterprises. Your business is not different – just like us, you will be
creating the core of what makes Countly successful – a platform that mobile
product managers love. Working with Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB and more than
35+ popular open source libraries, you’ll have a direct impact on the customer
experience for our customers and 600+ millions of end users.

Questions to ask yourself

We wanted to make sure what kind of candidates we are looking for.. So if you
think you can be honest with the answers of these questions with a positive
“yes”, then this job can be fore you.

* While I am coding, do I have a sense of awareness of security?
* Do I have an understanding of multithreading and race conditions?
* Am I the right person to printout useful error messages and logging ?
* Do I like working with a data model before I start, complete with keys,
views, lookup tables and more?
* Do I like working with open source software, and try not to be repetitive
with my work?
* Do I have the ability to write clear, consistent and simple to use
interfaces?
* Do I understand how to create a readable layout or acknowledge the need to
get help from artists and graphic designers?
What you’ll be doing with us:

* Build core Countly infrastructure
* Design and scale API endpoints
* Write good documentation for what you are doing
* Write unit tests
* (Optional) write enlightening, impressive blogs of what you have been doing
here
Requirements:

Pretty lean and simple. We are looking for friends to work with us,
with at least 3 years experience with the following:

* Node.js
* MongoDB
* HTML/CSS/JS
* Linux knowledge is a plus
If you are ready to do the best work of your life and shape the mobile
revolution in Countly, apply now. Please send your CV, together with your
Github account tohello at count.ly and we’ll reply in 1 business day.

Careers

At Nvestly, we are excited to be a part of the revolutionary technology-driven
changes taking place in the global financial industry. We operate at the
intersection of finance, technology and design. If you are just as excited
about the changing investment landscape as we are, please take a look at the
current career opportunities at Nvestly below.

Senior Software Engineer

You will be responsible for architecting and developing software for Nvestly’s
social investment platform, investment analytics and data analysis. Ideal
candidates will enjoy designing and implementing systems that scale seamlessly
to support our growing user base.

You will work as a core member of our team and will develop high-priority
features that impact a growing user base. You will be challenged to think
outside of the box by collaborating with a world-class team of investment
managers, designers, engineers and technologists. It’s important to us that
everyone at Nvestly shares our intensity, intellectual curiosity and passion
for empowering people to become better investors.


What You Will Do at Nvestly

* Architect, develop and release new features and services
* Design and develop a APIs to support mobile, desktop and tablet web and
native apps
* Solve challenging client performance and scaling issues
* Make quick, continual improvements to support user engagement
* Prioritize a wide variety of work tasks with your teammates
What We Expect

* Fluent in multiple programming languages
* Comfortable with front-end and back-end development
* Strong understanding of system design and data structures
* Comfortable processing and analyzing very large data sets
* Familiarity with Agile and Kanban development
* Great communications skills and passion for learning
* Ability and desire to be part of a world class team focused on achieving
amazing user experience
* Background in computer science, engineering, math or statistics preferred
* Familiarity with investments and financial markets not required, but a plus
Skills

* High proficiency in C# and ASP.NET MVC
* Strong set of front-end skills including AngularJS or ReactJS
* Experience designing clean and maintainable APIs
* Knowledge of relational databases and SQL - SQL Server experience is a plus
* Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills
* Familiarity with Python and MongoDB is a plus

To be considered for this position, please email contact@nvestly.com
. Let us know why you are interested in working at
Nvestly and tell us about something you’ve done that you’re most proud of.
Please include your LinkedIn, Github, résumé and/or any prior projects.

Community Manager

We are seeking a community manager to grow and support the Nvestly community
and help with investor relations. As a community manager you will play a
central role in how users connect with each other and engage with the Nvestly
platform. You will also have a unique opportunity to support our investor
relations team and interact directly with our senior execs.

The ideal candidate will have deep interest in the financial markets, possibly
trade their own account and be conversant in crowdfunding. Knowledge of vaping
and cannabis industry is a plus. We are located in Los Angeles, but you may
work remotely – so location isn’t important.

We are seeking self directed experts that can help us grow the social media
aspects of our companies and also help grow the user base at Nvestly.com –
through curated and created content.


Responsibilities

* Interact with traders and investors to drive conversations on and outside
of Nvestly – be the users' advocate
* Grow communities with other investors, influencers, bloggers and within
social media channels like Twitter
* Stay on top of latest investing and trading trends
* Assist senior executives with investor relations
* Manage and coordinate social media strategy
Requirements

* Excellent communicator
* Fluent in social media including Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and other
platforms
* Quick learner and self-sufficient
* Entrepreneurial spirit, quick to adapt
* Prior experience with financial markets or investment-related field not
required but a plus
* Exceptional organizational skills
* 4-year degree from an accredited university
Benefits

This is a part-time opportunity with competitive pay and ability to work
remotely. To be considered for this position, please email contact@nvestly.com
. Let us know why you are interested in working at
Nvestly and tell us about something you’ve done that you’re most proud of.
Please include your LinkedIn and résumé (cover letter optional).
