items.title: Front End Developer
items.content:
*
Front End Developer

TrendyMinds

We’re on the hunt for our next Front-end Developer, but not just anyone will
do.

We’re looking for a candidate who is passionate about building fast,
accessible, modular and responsive websites—whether that’s using HTML, CSS or
JavaScript. We want someone who understands the latest in front-end technology.
We’re searching for a bright, energetic person who can work closely with our
creative and development teams to bring complex websites to life. This means we
want someone with experience that can help our clients win in their competitive
fields. While we are open to having this be a remote position, you’ll get bonus
points from us if you live in the Indianapolis area.

Here’s a snapshot (but not all) of your technical responsibilities:

* Is proficient in HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Is proficient building responsive, mobile-first websites
* Is proficient building client-side applications using libraries such as
React, Vue.js, Angular and Ember
* Is proficient with module bundlers, such as Webpack, Browserify and
rollup.js
* Knows how to scale HTML, CSS and JavaScript as websites grow exponentially
* Is familiar with front-end patterns, such as BEM and object-oriented CSS
* Has experience with Craft, ExpressionEngine, Wordpress and/or other CMS
platforms
* Is comfortable writing and debugging PHP
* Is proficient with Git and using GitHub
* Is conscious of site performance—during the initial request and on-page—and
wants to reduce HTTP requests, browser repaints and deliver lightning fast
websites to any and all browsers
* Understands the importance of progressive enhancement and graceful
degradation
* Is vigilant about web standards, performance, accessibility and usability
* Is capable of collaborating with the UI/UX team to build interactive
prototypes
* Has intermediate knowledge of Adobe Photoshop
* Can provide technical insight to designers
Here are some of your general responsibilities:

* Be flexible enough that you can juggle multiple projects while also being
focused enough to remain committed to projects that span multiple weeks to
complete.
* Be dedicated and meticulous while taking great pride in delivering the
highest quality work.
* Be comfortable providing and receiving constructive criticism with the goal
of bettering everyone involved.
* Must possess excellent troubleshooting skills.
* Appreciate, enjoy and critique design.
* Be able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Provide reliable estimates for development deliverables.
* Communicate well both internally with other team members and externally
with clients.
Here’s what you’ll need:

* At least three years of professional, post-collegiate experience
* A B.S., B.F.A. or equivalent work experience
* Must be a U.S. resident. Bonus points if you live in Indianapolis.
To apply:

If this all sounds right to you, please apply below. A phone call will not
increase (and may decrease) your chances, so give us some time to look over
your materials. If we think you might be a good fit, we’ll reach out to you.

items.title: Senior Erlang Developer
items.content:
*
Senior Erlang Developer

Scrapinghub

Scrapinghub is looking for an Erlang software developer to join our Crawlera
team.

Crawlera is a smart downloader designed specifically for web crawling and
scraping. It allows crawler developers to crawl quickly and reliably by
managing thousands of proxies internally. It is part of the Scrapinghub
platform, the world’s most comprehensive web crawling stack which powers crawls
of over 4 billion pages a month.

Scrapinghub helps companies, ranging from Fortune 500 enterprises to early
stage startups, turn web content into useful data with a cloud-based web
crawling platform, off-the-shelf datasets, and turn-key web scraping services.

Join us in making the world a better place for web crawler developers with our
team of top talented engineers working remotely from more than 30 countries.

Responsibilities

* Develop, maintain and support a high load distributed system.
* Analyze our current and historical Crawlera usage to augment and enhance
its routing and rotation logic.
* Leverage the Scrapinghub platform to provide extended functionality, both
to end users and for internal purposes.
* Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues with distributed
crawling at scale.
* Liaison with other platform teams to provide Crawlera with the best
possible integration to the growing Scrapinghub platform.
About you

* 2+ years of production experience with Erlang.
* Good communication in written English.
* Strong knowledge of Linux/UNIX, HTTP and Networking.
Bonus points for:

* Python Knowledge.
* Familiarity with techniques and tools for crawling, extracting and
processing data.
* Knowledge of ELK, Graylog, Docker and Mesos.
* Good spoken English.

items.title: Digital Campaigns Specialist
items.content:
*
Digital Campaigns Specialist

Best Friends Animal Society

Location: Open

Position Summary: Reporting to the Manager of Digital Campaigns and Email
Marketing, The Digital Campaigns Specialist plays a key role in ensuring that
digital fundraising and engagement campaigns launch completely and on time, run
smoothly, and are effective. This role is crucial to our success in
fundraising, new donor acquisition, email acquisition and stewardship.

The ideal candidate is a collaborative and confident project manager who can
juggle multiple tasks at once, working with stakeholders across teams under
tight deadlines. They are comfortable creating pages and forms within Luminate
or another CMS using basic HTML/CSS and have a good eye for detail, including
proofreading and testing. They are excited to learn new tools and technologies
and proactively look for process improvements and new strategies to try. This
person is energized about the mission to Save Them All and understands the role
of digital in saving the lives of animals.

Responsibilities

* Support digital fundraising and engagement campaigns through project
management, creative development, launch and reporting back results
* Manage campaign deliverables from start to finish, including creative asset
request and collection, donation form creation, analytics setup, and reporting
* Creation of basic digital assets including standard signup and donation
forms, autoresponders, and basic pages in a CMS.
* Coordinate email, social and other channel needs from stakeholders and lead
review process
* Support campaign implementation with database queries and source code
setup, link building and basic QA/troubleshooting
* Interpret data from multiple sources and create reporting to be used for
decision making and driving better results
* Work with stakeholders across the digital team and organization to
coordinate campaign needs and set timelines and project plans.
* Proactively improve processes to help digital fundraising program launch
more campaigns faster and easier.
* This position requires travel of up to two weeks per year via various forms
of public transportation and accommodations on behalf of organization business.
Skills and Experience:

* BA/BS degree
* 3-5 years of experience in digital fundraising and digital marketing
* Hands-on experience using an email service provider (ESP) and donation
management system (Luminate preferred, but others include Blue State Digital,
Salsa, NGP Van, etc).
* Experience seeing projects through successfully from initial concept to
completion.
* Project management experience, including working with stakeholders across
teams and setting and maintaining deadlines
* Basic HTML/CSS coding and troubleshooting experience required
* Experience using databases for query and reporting
* Strong analytical skills with experience interpreting engagement and
fundraising metrics from multiple sources
* Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to work
collaboratively, build positive relationships, and manage conflict
constructively
* Meticulous attention to detail
* Self-starter with ability to operate at a hands-on detailed level, take the
lead on complicated projects and anticipate strategies through to the end
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to anticipate needs, innovate, multi-task, lead and excel in a fast
paced, rapidly changing environment with a positive attitude.
* Ability to learn new technologies quickly
Physical Requirements:

* Extended periods of time working on the computer
Thank you for your interest in pursuing a career at Best Friends Animal
Society.  Best Friends Animal Society is an equal opportunity employer.  All
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to their race, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation,
age, disability, marital status, domestic partner status, or medical condition.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer - Microsoft - Redmond, WA
items.content:
<> Senior Software Engineer
Microsoft 2,688 reviews <> - Redmond, WA 98052
The Azure Stack Bridge team is looking for a Senior Software Developer who is
passionate about building V1, large scale, highly reliable and secure online
services to join our newly formed team.
Our team’s charter is to design, implement and operate online services which
enable private/public cloud hybrid scenarios. We are the pipeline between Azure
Stack deployments (private cloud, also known as Azure on-premise) and Azure
(the public cloud). We enable scenarios such as Azure Stack registration and
activation, online billing, marketplace syndication, remote updates and more.
We deliver to both on-premise and online Azure, so you get to enjoy both worlds
and experiment with many technologies.

By joining our team, you’ll get the chance to build a set of V1 (micro)
services nearly from scratch, while using latest industry technologies. If you
like designing distributed systems, writing a lot of clean quality code,
learning, mentoring, experimenting, collaborating and influencing, then this is
the team for you!

We are looking for solid developers to help us drive design and
implementation of various services that run in Azure and Azure Stack. As a
team, we are interested in smart, motivated individuals, with positive can-do
attitude, who come to work with a smile and enjoy writing clean and elegant
code. We value passion, creativity, team work, agility, accountability and
desire to learn new complex technical areas.

items.title: C++ Software Developer (Contract) - Tool Development - Vogler Limited - Bourne End
items.content:
<> C++ Software Developer (Contract) - Tool Development
Vogler Limited - Bourne End
£300 - £390 a day - Temporary, Contract
Renesas Electronics is one of the world's leading microcontroller companies.
This role is a C++ software development contract working on the creation of our
e2 studio environment, which provides the environment on which our customers
develop their embedded code for our processors..

This is our new IDE and is being developed using the Eclipse framework. It
supports most of our device and toolchain line-up. (Renesas, GNU, IAR and Green
Hills)

Skill Set Required:

* Strong C++ developer in the client Windows application development domain
(ie developing software products)
* Good strong engineering background. (NOT financial services, embedded
applications, IT etc)
* Strong object orientated design skills.
* Multi-threaded application development experience
* Some experience or knowledge in embedded software development. (Developers
sometimes have to view device manuals to check which pins should be set for a
certain function or tweak linker section addresses based on device memory maps
so some knowledge of this is required)
* Solid verbal and written communication skills. We are working in a team
environment where communication is critical. The contract is initially for 6
months with extensions highly likely. Daily rate up to c£375

NB: This is not an open invitation to agencies to send CVs. If we want to use
you we will contact you!!

About The Work

Our European team is responsible for the product in total. Our development
team manage the product requirements and roadmap.

There is a worldwide development team with different areas of responsibility.

Primarily in Europe we are working on the debugger development.

The actual product uses the Eclipse CDT plugins and GDB (GNU Debugger).

The user interface is developed in Java as you would expect from an Eclipse
IDE.

We have different versions of GDBs for each device. We support nearly all
Renesas devices in the IDE. (RL78, RX, RH850, SH and RZ)

We have developed a GDB server that uses the GDB remote debugger protocol.
This communicates with the GDB for each device to perform the low level debug
commands.

The GDB server does not have UI and is developed in C++. The design is OO.

From this development we are using Visual Studio 2010.

Primarily this role focuses on the GDB server development. What we would
consider the debugger back-end.

However we interface with low level DLLs to communicate with the emulators
and hardware.

The development is multi-threaded and this is important to show experience in
this area.

Renesas devices and emulators have hardware debugging features which can be
considered proprietary and are not well supported by GDB.

We have special views within Eclipse that use a special Renesas protocol to
unlock these features in e2 studio.

The mainstay of our work is adding this functionality to the IDE. Items such
as hardware trace, event points, performance analysis, coverage, etc.

We also continually support new devices and families within the IDE.
JustEngineers.net - 1 day ago

items.title: Frontend UI Engineer - OptioPay GmbH - (Berlin, Germany) - FullTime
items.content:
Frontend UI Engineer

* OptioPay GmbH <> (Berlin, Germany)
* Feb 08, 2017
* Fulltime Job
* Tweet
About OptioPay

OptioPay is a payment processor with a difference. Our software increases the
value of any payment received by consumers from companies, by combining bank
transfers with higher value gift cards. By integrating payments to employees or
customers with effective marketing we aim to create a completely new,
performance based, advertising channel. We are looking for an experienced
Frontend UI Engineer to start as soon as possible. If you share our vision then
look no further for your next career move!

Our Philosophy

The OptioPay way isn’t easy. We work hard, and push ourselves to the limit. We
challenge the orthodoxy and seek new frontiers. We accept only the brilliant
and expect brilliance. We’re looking for people who want to change the world.
Our aim is to fundamentally change the nature of B2C payments. To do this we
need your talent, creativity and drive. What we offer in return is a
challenging but supportive environment, with a shared vision and passion. As an
equal opportunities employer, we seek talent from anyone and anywhere. Our
diverse team in Berlin hail from all around the globe; a fun and friendly group
with a multitude of talents. Though sales and customer satisfaction are the
ultimate focus, our decisions flow from data. By understanding how OptioPay
users and partners interact with our product we aim to anticipate their needs
and reduce the complexity of payments.

Your Role

* To help us continuously improve our user experience, creating an intuitive,
brand-consistent and engaging web interface. You will be expected to be up to
date with industry best practice in web development/design; but also to analyse
user data and use creative thinking to deliver tangible results
* To be part of an empowered and self-organizing SCRUM team
* To help improve the reliability, usability and resilience of our platform
by analysing user data and being conscious of code maintainability. You will
also help resolve and prevent cross-browser layout issues and bug
* To help maintain our living style guide, enhancing the reusability of your
work and contributing to our culture of learning
* To develop our customer facing UI and help to develop, prototype and
implement new features with a strong focus on usability and responsiveness
* To implement customised, brand-consistent frontends for our business
partners and various OptioPay departments
Your Profile

* You have 3+ years of relevant experience and demonstrable ability with
HTML5/CSS3,CSS preprocessors (Sass, Less, Stylus). You also have a good working
knowledge of Javascript
* You have experience of creating responsive, intuitive websites and
optimising their accessibility from a variety of browser and mobile devices
* You have experience working with modern frontend workflows/pipelines/tools
like Gulp, Grunt, Yeoman, etc.
* You are capable of maintaining your code, modularising and organising big
codebases with Atomic Design,BEM, SMACSS or similar
* You have experience working with living style guides and pattern libraries
* You have experience with some UI testing tools/frameworks
* You keep track on recent trends within IT and like to explore new
technologies
Our Offer

* Individual responsibility and the opportunity to grow professionally
* Work directly with our founders and gain experience of an international,
venture backed, startup
* Access to a global network of successful entrepreneurs
* Become part of a multinational, talented team of 50 working in Berlin
* Prime office location – on the 30th floor of the Allianz Tower in Treptower
Park
* Free breakfast, drinks and fruit to keep energy levels high
* Various fun team events (weekly team lunch, Friday after work drinks and BBQ
, monthly Women Power Lunch, Girls Night etc.)
* EUR 2,000 cash if you don’t like us and decide to leave after 2 months
* Semi-monthly OptioAcademy – our internal knowledge sharing project
* EUR 2,000 annual training budget – Train Your Brain
* Free educational books
* Your choice of hardware
How to apply
Please apply through this link: http://grnh.se/bm3s5o

items.title: Teamwork Projects Software Developer at Teamwork.com (Cork, Ireland) (allows remote)
items.content:
Our Technical Stack

Don't be deterred if you are not familiar with everything in our tech stack or
if you feel as though you are stronger in one area than another. We believe
that a passionate and talented developer can learn new practices and
technologies. Similarly, we don't place a lot of importance on educational
background - as a developer your experience, portfolio, and abilities are key,
not your grades :). We do need to see some experience of working in web
development and creating or contributing to web applications. 

* HTML
* CSS
* LESS
* JavaScript
* CoffeeScript
* Knockout.js
* Gulp
* Git
* Require.js
* Bower
* Go
* ColdFusion
* MySQL
* Redis
* Vagrant/Docker
Our entire team works daily with HTML, CSS/LESS, JavaScript (particularly
Knockout.js),RESTful APIs, and integrations, and so, experience in full stack
web development is important. However, if you are particularly skilled in
front-end developent or you are a highly experienced back-end developer, we'd
love to hear from you.

More Info

Teamwork Projects is our flagship product and is used by many of the world's
biggest companies, with over 370,000 installations, two million daily users and
more than three million unique projects. Despite the vast array of features
available in Teamwork Projects, it has been built entirely by a small team of
talented developers. We pride ourselves on giving our users what they need and
are constantly working on new features and improvements for our customers.

By joining our team, you can be assured not only that your work will be seen
and enjoyed by millions of users worldwide, but that you will learn and grow
continuously, in a friendly, open environment.

We care about all our teams, and they care about when their teammates will be
online, what their timezone is and where they will be working from. When you
apply we will ask you about where you intend to work from. We will also ask you
whether or not you are open to considering spending some time in our Irish
office, if you would like to work remotely, if you would like to relocate or if
you're already here and ready to start work at Teamwork HQ in Cork, Ireland.

Skills & Requirements

Must Have:

JavaScript: Much of your work is front-end focused and customer-facing, so
it's important that you are confident in your abilities and able to contribute
to new and existing features. While we work in Knockout.js, it isn't pivotal
that you are experienced in any particular framework, although knowledge of any
popular MV* framework is hugely beneficial.

Coding best practices: We work closely as a team on many features, so writing
clean and extensible code is a must. Your code should be easy to debug, while
you code, you consider the impact your work has on other developers, the
product in general, and our testing department.

RESTful API experience: We currently have an extensive API, which is
constantly evolving and growing. Therefore, experience in designing and/or
integrating with APIs is extremely important to us. Our application is
data-driven, so you should be aware of how to work with large collections of
data while maintaining a great user experience.

The right attitude: We want you to take as much pride in your work as we do
and strive to find the right solutions for our customers. The right applicant
should be able to think on his or her feet and adapt to new technologies.

Help us grow and improve: At Teamwork.com, we are always open to new ideas
and, more importantly, open to change. We are aware that new technologies and
approaches will come along that need to be embraced. As a Teamwork.com
Developer, your voice rings loud and, if you know of ways that we can improve,
we want to hear your ideas.

Nice to Have:

CoffeeScript

Build tools: Gulp, Grunt, Lineman.js, etc.

Front-end testing 

Go/ColdFusion: Our API is written in Go and ColdFusion. As we build new
features, we often need to update our API. Having experience in eitherGo or
ColdFusion would help you hit the ground running.

Responsive/Adaptive applications: Having experience in building responsive or
adaptive web applications is a big plus.

Samples of your work: Do you contribute to open source communities? Have you
developed any plugins, extensions, etc.? Do you have an interactive portfolio?
Show us some of your work and let us see what you are capable of.

About Teamwork.com

Teamwork.com is an online and mobile application that is used by hundreds of
thousands of businesses world-wide to help them get work done. Customers
include Walt Disney, Forbes, Puma, Harvard and many more. We are based in sunny
Cork, Ireland but also have staff scattered throughout the world. 

Check out our Perks and Benefits here.


The business is highly successful with sales heading towards $16m in 2015 and
extremely ambitious plans for the future...which could include you!

Joel Test score: 11 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? Email apply now <> more jobs at
Teamwork <>
Join us at Teamwork

We have great benefits
Happiness Initiatives Generous Gym Memberships Subsidy Only the Best Tech
Competitive Salaries Regular Staff Lunches No Clock Watching, work on your own
time. Discounted Travel Wellness Days/Massage Days Own Door Office After 12
months you get 6 Weeks' Holidays

Who you’ll work with

items.title: TrendyMinds: Front End Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Indianapolis, IN)

We're on the hunt for our next Front-end Developer, but not just anyone will
do.

We’re looking for a candidate who is passionate about building fast,
accessible, modular and responsive websites—whether that’s using HTML, CSS or
JavaScript. We want someone who understands the latest in front-end technology.
We're searching for a bright, energetic person who can work closely with our
creative and development teams to bring complex websites to life. This means we
want someone with experience that can help our clients win in their competitive
fields. While we are open to having this be a remote position, you’ll get bonus
points from us if you live in the Indianapolis area.

Here’s a snapshot (but not all) of your technical responsibilities:

* Is proficient in HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Is proficient building responsive, mobile-first websites
* Is proficient building client-side applications using libraries such as
React, Vue.js, Angular and Ember
* Is proficient with module bundlers, such as Webpack, Browserify and
rollup.js
* Knows how to scale HTML, CSS and JavaScript as websites grow exponentially
* Is familiar with front-end patterns, such as BEM and object-oriented CSS
* Has experience with Craft, ExpressionEngine, Wordpress and/or other CMS
platforms
* Is comfortable writing and debugging PHP
* Is proficient with Git and using GitHub
* Is conscious of site performance—during the initial request and on-page—and
wants to reduce HTTP requests, browser repaints and deliver lightning fast
websites to any and all browsers
* Understands the importance of progressive enhancement and graceful
degradation
* Is vigilant about web standards, performance, accessibility and usability
* Is capable of collaborating with the UI/UX team to build interactive
prototypes
* Has intermediate knowledge of Adobe Photoshop
* Can provide technical insight to designers
Here are some of your general responsibilities:

* Be flexible enough that you can juggle multiple projects while also being
focused enough to remain committed to projects that span multiple weeks to
complete.
* Be dedicated and meticulous while taking great pride in delivering the
highest quality work.
* Be comfortable providing and receiving constructive criticism with the goal
of bettering everyone involved.
* Must possess excellent troubleshooting skills.
* Appreciate, enjoy and critique design.
* Be able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Provide reliable estimates for development deliverables.
* Communicate well both internally with other team members and externally
with clients.
Here’s what you’ll need:

* At least three years of professional, post-collegiate experience
* A B.S., B.F.A. or equivalent work experience
* Must be a U.S. resident. Bonus points if you live in Indianapolis.
To apply:

If this all sounds right to you, please apply below. A phone call will not

items.title: Back-end Engineer
items.content:
DESCRIPTION

ManageFlitter is a multi-award winning SaaS social
media management product. ManageFlitter is used by over 3 million people around
the world with paid customers from over 100 countries.

We have huge plans for the next couple of years and some exciting new projects
are close to fruition - including our new producthttp://ManageSocial.com
.

ManageFlitter is headquartered in Sydney and with customer support based in
the United States.

We are looking for someone with outstanding technical experience and a
preference for working with a small smart team.

Whilst this role is remote you will need at least 4-5 hours per day time
crossover with the Sydney Australia timezone.

REQUIREMENTS

* 5+ years commercial experience with Linux and Open Source Technologies
* Has experience building and configuring a LAMP stack
* Has DevOps experience and can architect solutions that scale
* Has experience working with large datasets in MySQL (> 5 TB)
* Has experience working with configuration management tools such as Puppet,
Chef, but specifically SaltStack
* Is proficient with shell scripting and the Unix / Linux CLI
* Has experience debugging, refactoring and improving legacy, monolithic PHP
applications
* Has a strong background in OO development in PHP with a proficient
understanding of fundemental principles such as SOLID, DRY and KISS
* Has a working knowledge of OO design patterns and architecture patterns
(e.g. ETL)
* Has a practical knowledge of modern frameworks and libraries (Symfony2,
Silex, Doctrine, etc)
* Has experience working with AWS cloud services including EC2, S3, RDS,
CloudSearch and DynamoDB
* Is familiar with Redis, Memcached, PostgreSQL and Beanstalkd
* Is experienced writing unit and integration tests with PHPUnit
* Excellent English written and verbal communication skills
BONUS SKILLS:

* Strong working knowledge of the Twitter API
* Experience with other scripting or OO laguages, e.g. Python, GoLang
* Experience working in Agile / Scrum workflows
* Experience working with Rackspace cloud services
* Experience writing technical specifications and documentation
* Has contributed to open source projects (give examples if available)
* Experience using Vagrant
* Proven commercial experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
BENEFITS

Our company culture is easygoing but hardworking. We believe in work-life
balance but we also all enjoy being part of a fast moving focused and
productive team.

If the above sounds like a role you may be interested in please apply! We
would love to hear from you.

items.title: Software Developer
items.content:
PhishMe is seeking experienced Rails developers to join its expanding software
engineering teams.
If adding features, extending capabilities, and delivering working and fully
tested software excites you, then we want to speak with you! WeÃ¢Â Â re looking
for enthusiastic people, not just coders.
The successful candidate will have professional work experience (internships
or professional jobs held as a student are valid). This is a full-time position
working for PhishMe, Inc.

Successful Applicants Must Be:

* A self-starter who is willing to take a task from gathering requirements to
completion
* Able to work effectively and be pragmatic as part of both collocated and
remote teams in a dynamic business environment
* Comfortable working alone or paring with other developers
* Able to communicate effectively
* Eager to learn and apply new knowledge quickly
* Willing to mentor team members kindly and constructively
* Detail-oriented
* Willing to work for eight hours per day where at least five overlap with
8am to 6pm EST
* Available to work off-hours occasionally
* Happy to travel occasionally for team meetings and events
Your Experience Should Demonstrate That You:

* 3+ years in Software Development
* Have solid production Rails experience (1-2 years minimum)
* Are proficient with full-stack web development (HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript)
* Can comfortably work outside the boundaries of Rails (SQL, basic system
administration, etc.)
* Can comfortably use advanced git features such as rebase, rebase -i, merge
no-ff
* Read and generally agree with the ideas in Sandi MetzÃ¢Â Â s POODR / 99
Bottles etc.,
* Adhere to best practices
* Can write code that is intentional and readable rather than magically
obscure
* Stay on top of current Ruby, Rails, and programming news
* Are fluent in SQL
* `echo Azj mjzi bksnkzftxwj ue fcj Ueur bksstey wuej | tr
ekmgiphabvnydqlxwtfrsczjou novgypqzcjfdskublatxmhrewi`
* Are comfortable with the RSpec test framework
* Have worked in an Agile/Scrum environment
It Would Be Outstanding If You:

* Have experience in more than one programming language
* Have built or maintained a large SaaS application
* Have attained a four-year degree
* Have customer support experience (retail, help desk, consulting, etc.)
* Have professional experience with server configuration and deploying Rails
applications
* Have experience with distributed programming using message queues
* Have a bookmark to https://github.com/styleguide/ruby

* Have experience with Amazon Web Services
Compensation

* Competitive salary and stock options
* 401k plan with company match
* Health, vision, dental, disability, and life insurance
* Telecommuting expense reimbursement
* Peers who enjoy appropriate use of internet memes
Location

* Leesburg, Virginia or Remote
The above statements are neither intended to be an all-inclusive list of the
duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be a
listing of all of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they
are intended only to describe the general nature of the job. This job
description is not a contract of employment, either express or implied.
Employment with PhishMe will be voluntarily entered into and your employment is
considered at will. PhishMe reserves the right to alter the job description at
any time without notice.
PhishMe is committed to equal employment opportunity. We will not discriminate
against employees or applicants for employment on any legallyrecognized basis
[protected class] including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniform
service member status, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age,
physical or mental disability, genetic information or any other protected class
under federal, state, or local law.

items.title: Pirate Studios: Full-Stack Programmer
items.content:
Full-Stack Programmer

Posted Feb 9

Pirate Studios
Headquarters: London, United Kingdom
https://www.piratestudios.co.uk
Pirate Studios is a rapidly expanding music rehearsal studio company,
currently based in 8 cities in the UK. We're planning on at least doubling that
in the next year. A big part of our business is our online booking system,
however we're also working to integrate technology into lots more aspects of
the business, such as automatic power on/off, light controls, video/audio
streaming etc.
We're looking for an enthusiastic programmer who is willing to learn new
things, throw around ideas, and work as part of our small development team on
various projects. Our current web stack is built in Ruby (Rails, Postgres,
Redis), but knowing Ruby isn't a hard requirement; anyone willing to learn new
languages is welcome. We are working on rebuilding our main application into
separate API and client components to allow us to build for new platforms more
easily, such as mobile applications and integrated components inside our
studios.
We work remotely, although we do have an office in London and a workshop in
Bristol if you're in those areas. We sometimes do R&D and testing on-site in
the studios, and we work alongside a large team of people who design and build
the studios. We also meet up every few weeks for a day at either the workshop
or elsewhere to chat and plan stuff out. As we do meet up semi-regularly, this
position is (most likely) based in the UK.
We have loads of projects lined up for you to get stuck into. We're working on
moving from our monolithic Rails app to separate API and client applications so
that we can branch out into other platforms, as well as working on internal
systems and IoT devices that are used in our studios.
You should be/have:

* Experienced in at least a couple of different programming languages
* Good communication and personal skills
* Enthusiastic about security, optimisation, performance, and solid code
* Comfortable working with other people via code reviews, on Slack, and on
voice chat (occasionally)
* Excited about working with physical devices
* Self-motivation when working remotely
* Happy to meet up every now and then
Useful to have but not required:

* Ruby and JavaScript experience
* Varied database experience (we currently use PostgreSQL and Redis, with an
experiment using RethinkDB for one project)
* Linux systems administration
* Networking experience (for our R&D work we sometimes install kit ourselves)
* Creativity is encouraged; we love sharing ideas for solutions
* Experience in some form of project-management system, such as Agile or Scrum
* As a music startup we obviously have a lot of staff who are excited about
music, performance, or production. It's not a requirement but if that's your
sorta thing then our project may be more exciting for you!
Benefits

* Salary between £28,000-£35,000 depending on experience
* 22 days of holiday leave (not including public holidays)
* Company laptop if needed

items.title: Pathable, Inc.: Expert JavaScript, NodeJS, and React Nomad
items.content:
Expert JavaScript, NodeJS, and React Nomad

Posted Feb 9

Pathable, Inc.
Headquarters: Seattle, WA
http://pathable.com
Pathable, Inc. is hiring expert JavaScript developers to join our nomadic team
of software craftspeople. We're building from the ground up the second version
of our industry leading mobile/web application in Meteor and React. Live and
work from anywhere, while learning new things, working on a product thousands
of people love to use every day. Our company is successful, self-funded,
profitable, twenty people strong, and growing. We've developed a fantastic
culture that embraces adventure in business, engineering and lifestyle. Please
join us!
Specific Responsibilities:

* You're an expert with deep programming experience using a variety of tools
and languages.
* You'll write beautiful, well tested JavaScript both in the browser and on
the server.
* You'll use your intimate knowledge of React, NodeJS and related technology
to develop our second generation Meteor based web and mobile application.
* You'll dive into Apollo as part of our continuous commitment to paying down
technical debt.
* You, being a polyglot, will occasionally dive into our Ruby/Rails
application to develop features and bug fixes.
* You'll deploy code weekly, sometimes daily, to our AWS and Galaxy clusters. 
* In addition to clear and frequent written communication, you'll video
conference daily with team members to design and refine new features for the
product, marketing websites, email campaigns and more.
* You have strong opinions loosely held; you enjoy vigorously defending what
you know to be right as much as you enjoy being wrong when the best answers
wins.
* You enjoy the challenge of accurately estimating your work and ensuring
its on-time completion. You're loath to have your co-workers discover bugs
you've missed.
* You thrive in a remove working environment where you define completely your
own setup and interact with exclusively via computer; you go wherever you want.
About Us:

* Pathable (http://pathable.com ) is the leading
provider of mobile event apps and online community platforms for conferences,
tradeshows, events, and associations. From 10,000 doctors at a convention
center to 200 community organizers meeting for a weekend, our software improves
the entire experience of attending in-person conferences and events. 
* Though we develop products delivered over the Internet, as a nearly 10
year-old profitable company, we're not quite a startup anymore. We're fortunate
to have room to innovate and experiment as we develop new products and services.
* Managed and majority owned by the original founders, we've got the freedom
to chart our own course -- our only influence is what's best for our customers. 
* From the beginning our culture has supported and embraced remote workers.
We don't have an office and the Pathable family lives or is traveling in over
10 countries. Our members enjoy more time with their children, living in remote
and unusual places, or exploring the world; all while growing professionally
and building things about which they are proud.
* We're building a new product, from the ground up, using the latest tools,
integrated everything we've learned from nearly 10 years of product development
to the same market. 
Benefits:

* Accrued paid vacation
* Paid holidays
* Full medical+dental benefits for US workers
* Medical insurance stipend for non-US workers
* Yearly self improvement stipend
* Monthly stipend for co-working space

items.title: GetTechTalent: ReactJS Developer
items.content:
ReactJS Developer

Posted Feb 9

GetTechTalent
Headquarters: Berlin
www.gettechtalent.com
GetTechTalent is a new and fast growing network of Europe’s best freelance
developers, designer and product managers. We empower our clients to build
outstanding digital products with remote freelance teams. By joining our
network, you’ll work on eye-level with top-notch peers on exciting projects for
clients ranging from renown start-ups to Fortune 500 companies. 
Your opportunityWe are currently looking for React.js Developers (Freelance)
who loves to create high-quality web applications with beautiful, well-designed
UIs. Your core responsibility will be the implementation of web front-ends. Our
ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, innovative and good at „getting things
done“. You will work with both front-end and back-end developers and play an
active role how the entire application looks and functions.
Your responsibilities- Develop new, user-facing features using React.js
- Build reusable components and front-end libraries
- Translate designs and wireframes into high quality code
- Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
- Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders
- Challenge established thinking and 
Skills- Strong proficiency in JavaScript (including DOM manipulation and the
JavaScript object model), HTML5, (S)CSS3
- Thorough understanding of React.js and its core principles
- Knowledge of nodeJS, serverless and AWS infrastructure are a plus
- Familiarity with RESTful APIs, AJAX, JSON Web Token, etc.
- Proficient knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work
around such issues.
- A knack for benchmarking and optimization
- Proficient understanding of tools like Git, Grunt, Gulp, etc.
- Excellent communication skills
- Fluency in English (spoken and written), German skills are a plus
Your benefits:- Flexibility: Choose your own schedule from a variety
part-time, and full-time projects.
- Remote work: Pick your favorite work place—no matter if you like to work
from an exotic location or from home—the choice is yours. 
- Long-term commitment: get into a topic and work on projects that last
minimum one month
- Interesting projects: work on interesting projects from renown startups to
international enterprises, primarily in Germany/Western Europe
- Shared values: work with experienced peers that are as dedicated reliable
and quality-oriented as you are

items.title: TrendyMinds: Front End Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Indianapolis, IN)

We're on the hunt for our next Front-end Developer, but not just anyone will
do.

We’re looking for a candidate who is passionate about building fast,
accessible, modular and responsive websites—whether that’s using HTML, CSS or
JavaScript. We want someone who understands the latest in front-end technology.
We're searching for a bright, energetic person who can work closely with our
creative and development teams to bring complex websites to life. This means we
want someone with experience that can help our clients win in their competitive
fields. While we are open to having this be a remote position, you’ll get bonus
points from us if you live in the Indianapolis area. No recruiters please.

Here’s a snapshot (but not all) of your technical responsibilities:

* Is proficient in HTML, CSS and JavaScript
* Is proficient building responsive, mobile-first websites
* Is proficient building client-side applications using libraries such as
React, Vue.js, Angular and Ember
* Is proficient with module bundlers, such as Webpack, Browserify and
rollup.js
* Knows how to scale HTML, CSS and JavaScript as websites grow exponentially
* Is familiar with front-end patterns, such as BEM and object-oriented CSS
* Has experience with Craft, ExpressionEngine, Wordpress and/or other CMS
platforms
* Is comfortable writing and debugging PHP
* Is proficient with Git and using GitHub
* Is conscious of site performance—during the initial request and on-page—and
wants to reduce HTTP requests, browser repaints and deliver lightning fast
websites to any and all browsers
* Understands the importance of progressive enhancement and graceful
degradation
* Is vigilant about web standards, performance, accessibility and usability
* Is capable of collaborating with the UI/UX team to build interactive
prototypes
* Has intermediate knowledge of Adobe Photoshop
* Can provide technical insight to designers
Here are some of your general responsibilities:

* Be flexible enough that you can juggle multiple projects while also being
focused enough to remain committed to projects that span multiple weeks to
complete.
* Be dedicated and meticulous while taking great pride in delivering the
highest quality work.
* Be comfortable providing and receiving constructive criticism with the goal
of bettering everyone involved.
* Must possess excellent troubleshooting skills.
* Appreciate, enjoy and critique design.
* Be able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
* Provide reliable estimates for development deliverables.
* Communicate well both internally with other team members and externally
with clients.
Here’s what you’ll need:

* At least three years of professional, post-collegiate experience
* A B.S., B.F.A. or equivalent work experience
* Must be a U.S. resident. Bonus points if you live in Indianapolis.
To apply:

If this all sounds right to you, please apply below. A phone call will not
increase (and may decrease) your chances, so give us some time to look over
your materials. If we think you might be a good fit, we’ll reach out to you.



Job Perks: New equipment, Ongoing Education, Snacks, Happy Hour, Health
Insurance, 401k, Training, Swag, Bike Racks and Showers, Philanthropy, Paid
Time Off, Parties, Lunch and Learns, Coffee/Tea/Soda, Flexible Schedules,
Rooftop with a Grill and Outdoor Kitchen, Modern Environment

Apply: If this all sounds right to you, please email us your resume and your
GitHub account. A phone call will not increase (and may decrease) your chances,
so give us some time to look over your materials. If we think you might be a
good fit, we’ll reach out to you.

Salary: Up to £40,000 per annum (Depending on experience) + excellent benefits

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent

Job Role:

Our Client is an award winning employer and is the UK's leading provider of
multi-channel customer service and secure payment solutions. Due to continual
growth, they are seeking a talented Web Application Developer to join their
team of remote based Developers and Engineers.

They provide website owners and e-tailers across the Globe with a range of
business enhancing services that allows companies to interact in real time with
their customers while they are on their website. Their intuitive solutions are
cloud based so there is no intrusion into a customers' IT environment. Their
suite of Live Help and Customer Engagement Services consists of Web Chat,
Instant Call-Back, Knowledge Base, Social Media Monitoring and Engagement, Full
Workflow and Email Management offered in real time and accessible through one
Omni-Channel Console.

NOTE: Our client can only accept applications from candidates eligible to live
and work in the UK.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

* User Experience for graphical interfaces using PHP, HTML5, JavaScript, and
other elements.
* Generate documentation and adhere to ISO working standards.
* Create rich graphical documents.
* Write secure client-side code (OWASP), develop prototypes quickly.
* Develop and automate internal reporting and monitoring mechanisms.
* Respond to QA and technical issues in a timely and professional manner.
* Be able to train out use of the interfaces to other members of
staff/clients.
* Liaise with customers regarding projects and support issues. Essential
Skills & Experience required for the role:

* Expert familiarity with PhotoShop, Illustrator, InDesign and other Adobe
design tools.
* Experience developing rich user frontend environments using HTML5, AJAX,
JavaScript, jQuery,
* Highcharts, Bootstrap, Angular, CSS3, WYSIWYG/Rich Text Editors.
* Successful candidate will need to be security checked by home office and
therefore must have been UK resident for at least 5 years - previous/current SC
clearance would be of benefit.
* Excellent written and verbal communications.
* Strong customer facing skills. Desirable Skills & Experience:

* Comfortable with asynchronous network programming, server frameworks, fault
tolerance and scalability.
* Familiarity with HTML, PHP, MySQL, NGINX, Apache setup and configuration.
* Familiarity with API Integrations, JSON/XML, SOAP etc.
* Experience with version control systems (GIT/SVN).
* Experience with social networking integration (Graph/Rest API).
* Exposure with linux server systems (Ubuntu, Debian, CentOS) at command line.
* Exposure to Virtualization tools such as OpenVZ, Docker etc. Competencies
as Web Application LAMP / LEMP Developer:

* Analytical thinking, ability 'deconstruct' problems and then understand how
to make them work.
* Ability to organize time effectively oversee multiple concurrent projects.
* Highly motivated self-starter to join a dynamic team which is growing and
evolving quickly.On a personal level, you will be a great team player with
excellent communication skills and a desire to build great internal relations
and with our clients to deliver on goals.

What's on offer?

* Life insurance.
* Share incentive scheme.
* Free tea, coffee, fresh fruit and snacks.
* Simply Health & private medical insurance group membership (eligible after
probationary period).
* Pension scheme.
* Well-being initiatives, such as in-house Reflexology and Sports Massage
(when in Head office).
* Focused on education and training (technical talks with internal and
external speakers).
* Discounted offers.
* Team days and Volunteering events.
* Employee Recognition schemes.
* Christmas & summer company events.
* Discretionary annual bonus. Please click the APPLY button to send your CV
and Cover Letter for this role.

Candidates with experience or relevant job titles of; Web Application
Developer, Software Developer, . NET Engineer, . NET Support, LAMP, Microsoft
Engineer, SQL Developer, SQL Support, SQL Engineer, . NET Developer, IT
Engineer, IT Support, HTML Developer, Web Design, ASP. NET Developer, Web
Development, PHP, JSP, Java, JavaScript, SQL, framework. NET, Web Technician,
Web Engineer, Skilled Web Developer, Senior Web Developer, Web Developer,
Senior Web Design, Lead Web Development, MySQL, PHP, LAMP stack, HTML/HTML5
CSS/CSS3 , Java, JavaScript, SQL, Web Technician, Experienced Web Developer
will also be considered for this role.

items.title: Senior Software Developer- Central Birmingham - Up to 45k - Xpertise Recruitment Ltd - Birmingham
items.content:
<> Senior Software Developer- Central Birmingham - Up to 45k
Xpertise Recruitment Ltd - Birmingham
£40,000 a year
Senior Software Developer- Central Birmingham - Up to 45k
My Client is looking for a senior developer to join our award-winning
engineering team.

Although they currently build mainly in NodeJS, Angular and PHP (with a
smattering of ObjectiveC, Java and Ruby) My Client are happy to accept
applicants with experience in any multi-tier web app stack. What is more
important to them is that you can demonstrate strong problem-solving skills and
critical thinking - regardless of language.

It is also important that you have experience working on web based
applications (rather than just websites) and for us, this means experience with
automated testing and continuously integrated code environments.

Exposure to working in an agile team-based environment, breaking down
technical complexity and story estimation is also an advantage.

Although this role is in our enterprise applications team, building their
flagship applications in use by over 2M students worldwide, engineers here are
adaptable and are able to work in other areas. We often rotate engineers
between our four teams - in line with people’s growth, and the business’
requirements.

BENEFITS

Offices are based in central Birmingham, however, the engineering team is
distributed as far afield as the US, and are well set up for remote and home
working. It should not be a problem if you’re based out of the area or need to
spend a portion of your week at home (or work flexible hours) to suit family
life.

Every employee shares in the value of the company through our options scheme.

In addition to a very competitive salary, for every £1 you contribute to your
company pension my client will add an extra £2 (up to a defined limit). They
also offer private medical insurance (after induction period) and immediate
cover on an exceptional Health Cash Plan, making trips to the dentist and
optician free or heavily subsidised for most employees.

If you feel that you have the relevant skills for this position, please apply.

Xpertise are acting as an employment agency and Business.

items.title: Full-Stack Programmer
items.content:
Pirate Studios is a rapidly expanding music rehearsal studio company, currently
based in 8 cities in the UK. We're planning on at least doubling that in the
next year. A big part of our business is our online booking system, however
we're also working to integrate technology into lots more aspects of the
business, such as automatic power on/off, light controls, video/audio streaming
etc.
We're looking for an enthusiastic programmer who is willing to learn new
things, throw around ideas, and work as part of our small development team on
various projects. Our current web stack is built in Ruby (Rails, Postgres,
Redis), but knowing Ruby isn't a hard requirement; anyone willing to learn new
languages is welcome. We are working on rebuilding our main application into
separate API and client components to allow us to build for new platforms more
easily, such as mobile applications and integrated components inside our
studios.
We work remotely, although we do have an office in London and a workshop in
Bristol if you're in those areas. We sometimes do R&D and testing on-site in
the studios, and we work alongside a large team of people who design and build
the studios. We also meet up every few weeks for a day at either the workshop
or elsewhere to chat and plan stuff out. As we do meet up semi-regularly, this
position is (most likely) based in the UK.
We have loads of projects lined up for you to get stuck into. We're working on
moving from our monolithic Rails app to separate API and client applications so
that we can branch out into other platforms, as well as working on internal
systems and IoT devices that are used in our studios.
You should be/have:

* Experienced in at least a couple of different programming languages
* Good communication and personal skills
* Enthusiastic about security, optimisation, performance, and solid code
* Comfortable working with other people via code reviews, on Slack, and on
voice chat (occasionally)
* Excited about working with physical devices
* Self-motivation when working remotely
* Happy to meet up every now and then
Useful to have but not required:

* Ruby and JavaScript experience
* Varied database experience (we currently use PostgreSQL and Redis, with an
experiment using RethinkDB for one project)
* Linux systems administration
* Networking experience (for our R&D work we sometimes install kit ourselves)
* Creativity is encouraged; we love sharing ideas for solutions
* Experience in some form of project-management system, such as Agile or Scrum
* As a music startup we obviously have a lot of staff who are excited about
music, performance, or production. It's not a requirement but if that's your
sorta thing then our project may be more exciting for you!
Benefits

* Salary between Ã Â£28,000-Ã Â£35,000 depending on experience
* 22 days of holiday leave (not including public holidays)
* Company laptop if needed
To apply: Send us your details and any questions to systems@piratestudios.co.uk


. Give us an outline of who you are, what you do, what you enjoy, and any
examples of your work or open-source projects you have/contribute to.We look
forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Web Developer
items.content:
We Launch are an award-winning brand communications agency based in central London. We are looking for a talented and passionate Front End Developer with a good understanding of responsive web development, with WordPress and Shopify experience, to help deliver a variety of digital projects for clients across a wide range of industries.

The role will be the only development position in the agency, which will require a real ‘go-to’ attitude that can take ownership of projects. You will be working alongside designers and project managers giving your suggestions for improving the user experience and taking the static concepts into working browser. We’re looking for more than just a developer, we’re looking for someone who will provide solutions and want to improve the user experience for all our clients digital presence.

items.title: Freelance C++ and Qt Developer
items.content:
Cosneta is an innovative and award winning early stage software company based in Glasgow, Scotland. Our mission is to provide natural and easy to use collaboration tools for the events and education sectors. We are determined to push technology boundaries, introduce disruptive services to our target markets and make a big impact.

We are looking for an experienced and talented freelance software developer, prepared to get their sleeves rolled up and help us deliver an app using C++ as the core programming language within a Qt framework. The software is already at an advanced stage and we estimate that it will take about 10 days of work to complete. You would be expected to work in a Windows environment in our multi platform codebase alongside a native iOS developer to provide changes and development work within the Qt cross platform environment. That work would then be converted to an app on the Apple App Store. Someone with C++ and experience in using Qt is a must.

You must have the following skills
• Programming knowledge in C++
• Adept with Qt and Qt creator for graphical user interfaces
• A whizz with OOD (object oriented design) and Git
• Comfortable developing for Android and IOS platforms.
• Enjoy problem solving and developing creative solutions.
• Experience in software testing.

Nice, if you have them
• Experience in developing user interface designs.
• Understanding of working in an Agile / project management environment.
• Educated to degree level in software development or a related discipline.

Please respond with your CV or profile outlining your experience . We look forward to hearing from you.

items.title: Full-stack Developer
items.content:
Tenzo (www.gotenzo.com), a Techstars company, is a retail intelligence platform, delivering insights to in-store employees in real time on their mobile device to improve bottom line performance. Using advanced analytics and big data techniques, we improve performance across multiple levers, specifically focused on optimizing labor, customer experience and forecasting demand.

As we grow, we’re looking for full-stack SaaS engineers lead to help our company scale. We’re looking for someone who has the enthusiasm to help us build new features, and the drive to deliver a high-quality product to our customers. You should be able to seamlessly jump from back-end to front-end development, and a machine learning background definitely helps.

In addition to understanding the core technologies, we are looking for someone to help us shape the engineering team and overall company culture. Hackers and hobbyists welcome!

Our overall stack is a Python/Django backend, with React/React Native on the front-end, all hosted on AWS. We’ll also look for someone that can help us think through business critical issues like security, reliability and scalability.

items.title: Android Engineer
items.content:
Onfido delivers next-generation identity verification and background searches (Criminal Record, Right to Work, Anti Money Laundering etc.), helping businesses verify that their customers are who they claim to be and may be trusted in a digital world.

Founded in 2012, Onfido now works with over 1,000 clients worldwide including Uber, Deliveroo, JustGiving, GoCardless and BlaBlaCar. Our mission is to build the trust engine to power human interactions worldwide.

Having raised over $30m in funding to date, our focus is on continuing to develop our technology as well as expanding our global footprint.

Our engineering teams work on several interesting challenges: detecting physical forgeries, verifying people without documentation or central records, and making complex verification data easy for our customers to use and understand.

The Role

We’re looking for an experienced Android Engineer to help us design and build our groundbreaking identity verification platform. You'll join a talented and friendly engineering team who pride themselves on delivering great code in an industry where privacy, security and reliability are crucial. We are an agile team that regularly release code into production. It's a critical time at Onfido as we aim to scale and evolve our product without sacrificing robustness and quality.

You’ll help us

Work on important new features of our industry-leading document and identity verification;
Design and implement seamless and elegant mobile components;
Ship an innovative solution for our worldwide clients and see it being used by thousands of users;
Share your knowledge and experience to help us keep growing London’s best engineering team.
Our stack

We aim to stay flexible and agile while delivering code in an industry where privacy and security are crucial. We primarily build in Ruby, with and without Rails, and our stack also includes PostgreSQL, Redis and RabbitMQ. We’re not dogmatic about technology: we try to make sure we’re choosing tools that are the best fit for the problems we’re solving.

Our next challenge is to make it easier for our customers to integrate our solution into their existing workflows so they can provide their users with a seamless, streamlined and efficient authentication and verification process.

REQUIREMENTS

Significant Android experience having contributed towards the development of a variety of different applications
Can provide some great examples of Android applications you've helped deliver
Can navigate complex challenges and you are capable of solving interaction problems
Ability to interface with end clients to understand technical barriers for further iteration and implementation
Have a strong understanding the Android SDK and are comfortable writing code to be used by someone else;
Believe that good code must be well-tested, clean, readable and easily maintainable;
Understand engineering principles and use data and metrics where appropriate to guide development and ongoing improvement.
Are both passionate and practical: you know when to balance idealism and pragmatism;


To be a great fit with the Onfido team, and to really enjoy working with us, you'll be:

A person passionate about their work and also their wide ranging personal interests, we like people who are interesting and interested!
An innovative thinker - the kind of person who is always experimenting with new tools/ systems/ approaches to do things better and faster
A caring and sensitive team member - generous with your own time and highly considerate of your colleagues'
Able to manage time and prioritise tasks effectively, ability to multi-task is a must
Able to think critically, draw upon previous experience to make decisions independently, and exercise good judgment

BENEFITS

We're committed to making Onfido a fantastic place to work, so we go to great lengths to give you what you need to succeed. The whole Onfido team benefits from:

Share options
A fully stocked kitchen with unlimited breakfast, drinks, snacks and fresh fruit every day
Unlimited budget for any software or books you need
Subsidised gym membership, free yoga classes and company 5-a-side football league
Quarterly socials (including cookery classes and private cinema trips)
Friday afternoon drinks
Relaxed & informal office environment

We call ourselves Retrimaniacs. That's because we are fanatical about our
product, our customers, our company, and each other.

We love what we do. And we have fun while we're doing it.

Plus, we're building something that our customers love.

We're growing super fast. We've already had a direct impact on teamwork across
hundreds of companies worldwide.

But we're not done. Not even close. In fact, we've just scratched the surface
with what's possible.

Join us to help build the future of agile teamwork.
Applied <> Apply Now <> Apply
Job Description

* U.S.-based applicants only please! *

About Us

We're a fast-growing startup that's helping software development teams work
better together. In particular, we help agile teams achieve the promise of
continuous improvement through better retrospectives.

What We're Looking For

Our ideal candidate thrives in an unstructured work environment. In fact, one
of our core values is "Default To Autonomy". That means you have to be a
self-motivated, problem-solver.

If you're looking to get in at the ground floor of a funded, growing,
post-revenue startup, this is the job for you.

We strongly believe in running a "good" company. That means we treat each
other well and we aim to be happy and fulfilled with what we do. It also means
we're a small family -- if you have trouble getting along with others or have a
big ego, we're not the right fit for you.

We care about the developer experience just as much as we care about the user
experience. As a result, we regularly pay off our tech debt and review new
technologies that makes development enjoyable and effective. We are a
functional programming shop and fully embrace the Redux ecosystem and paradigm.

Tech Stack

We run on some seriously cool tech, including:
NodeJS, BabelJS/ES6, React, Radium, Material-UI, Redux, Recompose,
ImmutableJS, RxJS, ShareDB, MongoDB, Redis, and ElasticSearch.

Responsibilities

You'll be working on building out our retrospective platform. That means
front-end and back-end.

You'll be working directly with our CTO and we'll be relying on you to work
with him to push new features & functionality on a regular basis.

To Apply

IMPORTANT! To be considered for this position, please email jobs@retrium.com
with the answer to 3+4. Shouldn't be too hard :)

items.title: High Horse: Front-End UI Master - React Engineer
items.content:
Front-End UI Master - React Engineer

Posted Feb 6

High Horse
Headquarters: London, United Kingdom
highhorse.agency
Front-End UI Master - React Engineer Use your strong React experience to lead
front-end development, implementing beautiful user experiences for web apps.
Join us at High Horse, a product focused startup development agency run by
developers. You will work with our founding Product Director, creating
fantastic user experiences for products you are proud to put your name to. 

What you will be doing
* Build web apps from scratch as part of an agile team
* Create pixel perfect, high performance interfaces and animations
* Work alongside back end and redux developers
* Help launch lean startup products working in weekly sprints
As a react engineer you will be building front-end react apps for exciting
startups. An example of what we recently built is floown.com. This required a
keen eye for detail and an obsession with pixel perfect development. We will
always be here to listen to you and support, everyone’s ideas and feedback are
always well received. We are a product company that values the input and of
efforts of our engineers. 

About you
* Experience building complex web app
* React, Redux and Node.js experience
* Strong communication skills
* Motivated to build fantastic products
Enthusiasm towards react and javascript should be evident in your past work
and Git history. It is important you follow best engineering practices
including writing thoughtful, maintainable code. Your ability and willingness
to communicate with the rest of the team is essential. Communication is one of
our core philosophies, we are always communicating through either Slack or
Skype and we also sit on Sneek.io while we work. 

Working remotely
* We have distributed engineering teams
* We operate with high levels of communication
As individuals, the ability to engage remote work has made us happier and more
productive. Remote work has also provided us with access to every tech-hub
across the globe. This is why as a company, we have been early adopters of
distributed teams. To maintain a strong culture we put a strong emphasis on
communication and the the sharing of ideas. 

Benefits
* £50,000 salary
* 28 days paid leave annually
* Generous education and training budget
* Travel allowance to attend core team meetings
* Fantastic culture, support and room to grow in a young company
Your ability to perform at the best of your ability is our first priority. We
believe the best craftsmen require the best tools. We ensure that every piece
of software our engineers need is expensed and available. We also provide an HD
Logitech webcam for daily use as an essential cultural tool. Keeping your
knowledge base and skill set up to-date is a key priority for us. We provide a
generous training and education budget. We also provides 28 days paid leave
with generous sick and travel allowances.

About us

as soon as possible.
Best,
Oliver and James, High Horse Founders

items.title: Full Stack Developer for Resin Supervisor (JavaScript + Rust) at Resin.io () (allows remote)
items.content:
Resin.io provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and
manage the code that runs on connected devices. In short, we make IoT work.

Our technology is open, standards-based and proven in production across a wide
range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal
turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE,
and Ericsson.

Resin is a highly distributed, remote-friendly company. We rely on clear
communication and the rule of “assume positive intent” to help us work together
across time zones, cultures and first languages. We are looking for people who
want to bring us even more diversity, and strongly encourage applications from
people underrepresented in tech.

About the role

We are hiring full-stack coders to help develop the Resin Supervisor
, our open-source on-device agent
that manages how we run containers on embedded devices. Working on the
Supervisor requires writing code for reliability and resilience, while enabling
complex features that must interact with our cloud services.

We’re looking for someone who would enjoy these challenges:

* Writing JavaScript code that tackles complex problems: code that supports
mission-critical applications, works in harsh network conditions, and recovers
from unexpected power failures.
* Helping to define and implement the Supervisor's future architecture and
features, bringing in Rust to improve reliability and performance.
* Working with teams supporting other resin products and features to ensure
compatibility between the Supervisor, our cloud services, and resinOS.
* Being an evangelist for Rust adoption inside resin.io.
* Working directly with users to unearth bugs, refine features and make
informed architecture decisions.
* Occasionally, writing features for some of the cloud services and even
resinOS, especially to support new Supervisor features.
Skills & Requirements

* Proficiency in JavaScript and Rust, and a desire to learn more.
* Solid understanding of Linux – like knowing what the boot process looks
like.
* Experience using Docker, including a firsthand knowledge of images,
containers, and Dockerfiles.
* Understand security best practices and strive to apply them in your work.
* Can’t imagine starting a new project without version control.
* Highly motivated to do good work and are driven to write good code.
* An excellent written communicator, fluent in English.
* Can effectively communicate with people from disparate backgrounds.
* Comfortable taking a project from idea all the way to production
environment.
* Have a dependable internet access available so you can join a video call
without trouble.
Bonus Points

* Extensive experience in Rust, including have built and deployed Rust code
into production environments.
* Experience with embedded Linux, anything ranging from personal projects
with a Raspberry Pi to commercial or industrial scenarios with custom devices.
* Knowledge of Docker internals like namespaces, groups and layers.
* Experience with Node.js
About Resin.io

To apply...

Send us your CV, with a focus on what you can bring to the team. Including a
link to a repository of code we can review is a definite plus.

The first step of our hiring process is a brief online coding test. The best
candidates will find this test fairly easy (some have completed it in under 30
minutes), but it helps us focus our interview time, so we appreciate if you can
take some time to complete it.

Benefits

* Work with talented, diverse team
* Equipment of your choice
* Remote-friendly
* Flexible working hours
* Flexible vacation policy
* Annual company gathering in an international location
Resin.io provides a software platform that helps
developers build, deploy and manage the code that runs on connected devices. In
short, we make IoT work.

Our technology is open, standards-based and proven in production across a wide
range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal
turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE,
and Ericsson.

Our team is highly distributed and we embrace a remote-first culture with
flexible hours. This means that team members can be highly productive while
still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. We value diversity. Our team
spans many countries, first languages, and backgrounds. We are always
interested in connecting with great candidates regardless of background or
prior experience. If you’re not sure if you’re the right candidate for us, ask
us! If you are interested in a role with resin.io but do not see it listed,
please fill out our open application.
apply now <> more jobs at Resin.io <>
Join us at Resin.io

We have great benefits
Flexible vacation policy Equipment of your choice Work with extremely
talented, distributed team Work from home and remote working Flexible working
hours Snacks, coffee, beverages at the office Annual company gathering in an
international location

items.title: Senior Media Software Engineer at Railroad19 (New York, NY) (allows remote)
items.content:
Senior Media Software Engineer

At Railroad19, we develop customized software solutions and provide software
development services. We are currently seeking a talented senior level  Media
Software Engineer with strong back-end development experience in JavaScript and
Python in a Rhino environment. You will be responsible for developing software
related to media asset management systems, automated metadata management and
media delivery capabilities. This role requires the ability to customize
workflows for their Global Media Operations globally.

As a Railroad19 employee, you will be part of a company that values your work
and gives you the tools you need to succeed. Our headquarters is in Saratoga
Springs, New York, but this position can be remote. Railroad19 provides
competitive compensation and excellent benefits.

Core Responsibilities:

* Customize workflows for their Global Media Operations (GMO) around content
prep and delivery for US domestic & international content delivery.

* Develop software related to media asset management systems, automated
metadata management and media delivery capabilities.

* Integrate various software platforms through vendor APIs.

* Work with vendors on API implementation and troubleshooting, suggesting
necessary features and identifying enhancement opportunities.

* Engineer integrated software solutions to anticipate and enable business
growth, productivity, and reliability.

* Identify automation opportunities within media workflows, and develop
appropriate software solutions.

* Coordinate with internal operational & technology and vendor support teams
to isolate issues and drive resolution.

* Configure test, QA and production environments with proper packages and
dependencies to enable development.

* Work with client user groups to ensure operational needs are being
appropriately met.

* Provide 24x7 On-Air systems support and daily operations support; some
overnight shift-schedule support will be required during on-air roll-out and
special broadcast events.

* Other duties as assigned.

Skills & Requirements

* BS in Engineering/Computer Science and experience within the broadcast
industry.

* 5+ years of experience managing a GNU/Linux environment for development,
including package management and basic system administration.BS in
Engineering/Computer Science and experience within the broadcast industry.

* 5+ years of experience with Java and on scripting languages in JavaScript in
a Rhino environment. Some experience with Python and shell scripting
proficiency. Agile & Scrum methodologies and software development tools such as
JIRA, GitHub & Jenkins

* 5+ years of experience managing a GNU/Linux environment for development,
including package management and basic system administration.

* Familiarity with broadcast production or video production systems, ideally
working knowledge of Asset Management Systems (Evertz Mediator or others)

* Experience with high-volume data migration projects.

About Railroad19

As a Railroad19 employee, you will be part of a company that values your work
and gives you the tools you need to succeed. Our headquarters is in Saratoga
Springs, New York, but this position is remote. Railroad19 provides competitive
compensation and excellent benefits and 401k.
