items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
#### Job DescriptionSamasource provides sustainable pathways out of poverty to
underprivileged youth throughout Africa and Asia. We're an award-winning
nonprofit that works with major Silicon Valley companies to provide dignified
online work across Kenya, Uganda, Haiti and India.As the 7th member of the
engineering team, youÃ¢Â Â ll be responsible for full-stack development of the
Samahub - our online platform that receives 2 million work submissions each
month. YouÃ¢Â Â ll help build and scale a site that allows workers across
Africa & Asia to support themselves and their families through online work.
WeÃ¢Â Â re based in San Francisco, but happy to consider remote applicants.Our
platform is built on Ruby/Rails 4.2, with Postgres and Redis sharing data
duties. Our code is tested with RSpec/Capybara/Jasmine, continuously integrated
via CircleCI, and run on Heroku. AngularJS takes care of our JavaScript needs.
We collaborate through GitHub, allocate work through Pivotal Tracker, swat bugs
with JIRA & bounce ideas in Slack.#### Skills &
Requirements__Responsibilities__* Write elegant, test-driven, performant
web-based software in solo and remote-paired agile environments* Contribute to
discussions regarding design and prioritization of upcoming features* Review &
provide feedback on peer code* Implement off-platform tools to facilitate
operation of client-specific projects__Requirements__* A degree in software
engineering/computer science, or 3+ years back-end development experience* 1
year test-driven Ruby/Rails development experience* 1 year JavaScript/jQuery
experience* 1 year SQL (Postgres preferred) database experience* Familiarity
with OS X/Linux development environments* Comfort in both remote-paired and
solo work environments* Strong written & verbal English communication
skills__Nice-to-Haves__* Experience with an established JavaScript framework
(Angular preferred)* An understanding of agile workflow* Familiarity with
Apache/Nginx server setup & maintenance* Basic understanding of Git & GitHub*
Heroku experience* An understanding of New Relic performance monitoring

items.title: Software Engineer
items.content:
Come work with Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves at your day job! LeTote is looking
for great Engineers to join it's growing team. Are you getting bored building
web app after web app? We're solving problems that used to be reserved for big
industry players. We're aiming to revolutionize traditional distribution center
processes with custom hardware and software. If that sounds like fun, come join
us! Work alongside innovative technologists including some prominent, long-time
members of the Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves communities. Candidates local to San
Francisco are preferred, but remote work is an option. __Qualifications:__-
Expert knowledge of Elixir and either Phoenix or Nerves (Knowledge of the Ruby
on Rails ecosystem is a plus.)- Solid grasp of OTP Behaviours - GenServer,
Supervisor, Application, etc.- Reasonable knowledge of JavaScript and preferred
exposure to popular front-end js frameworks and tool-chains- Experience
building highly scalable solutions- 3-5+ years of full stack production
development experience __Responsibilities:__* Work with Product Management and
other cross functional groups to develop and enhance the features of our
operational systems, build and deploy clean and elegant code.* Code reviews and
pair programming to grow your individual and peer's skills.* Collaborate on
process optimization and strategy to increase overall productivity and accuracy
of managing our supply management solutions.* Collaborate with other team
leads, and the development team members to refine requirements, estimates,
deliverables, and milestones. __About Le Tote:__Le ToteÃ¢Â Â s mission is to
make fashion accessible for everyone, every day. Our unique model gives
customers access to an unlimited closet of clothing and accessories for a
monthly membership fee. We feature hundreds of top brands including House of
Harlow, Sam Edelman, Free People, Vince Camuto, Max Studio, Tahari and French
Connection. Each shipment includes a personalized selection of three pieces of
clothing and two accessories, curated using Le ToteÃ¢Â Â s proprietary fit
algorithm and recommendation engine.We're using a highly analytical,
data-driven approach to fundamentally transform the way women shop. To turn our
dream into a reality, we're looking for highly motivated and skilled people
just like you!Le Tote has customers in 48 states and the company has seen 500%
growth year over year for the past 2 years. The Company has raised $30mm to
date and is backed by top-tier venture capital firms including Andreessen
Horowitz, Google Ventures, Y Combinator, Azure Capital and AITV.

items.title: Full stack Web Developer Passionate Clean Code
items.content:
¿Quieres trabajar en la start-up lider del mercado secundario de ticketing,
abierta al trabajo en remoto?


¿Te consideras un developer altamente cualificado y quieres trabajar con los
mejores, desarrollando producto propio? 


Si has respondido afirmativamente a las preguntas anteriores te recomendamos
seguir leyendo, ahora en inglés...


MAIN FUNCTIONS


How we build...



* Test Driven Development: we work on own tests to guarantee future
developments.

* Continuous Integration: we execute our tests with each push to detect
quickly any possible bug.

* Continuous Deployment: we deploy often during the week. Our QA processes
validate each release candidate.

* Bi-weekly iterations: we work in sprints with well-defined user stories.

* Data Driven: we use metrics to guide our developments and validate new
functionalities deployed in production.

* Pair Review: we do peer review of code before each merge.


Our technologies...



* Groovy as the programming language. Nontheless, any experience with dynamic
languages is more than OK.

* Python in many of our projects and scripts. We are fans of this language :)

* Grails as a framework, although experience with MVC frameworks is enough
(preferably Spring).

* JQuery as JScript libraries (if you have used some others, we would like to
hear your opinion).

* ORM Hibernate, although if you have experience with iBatis or any other
similar, you will fit for sure.

* We work with Agile methodologies, in projects with intern customer.

* Continuous integration with Jenkins (Hudson).

* Cloud with Amazon AWS.

* MySQL as the relational database.

* Redis to manage NoSQL data.

* Elasticsearch.


Other components of our stack...



* Slack.

* NewRelic.

* JIRA Agile + FishEye.

* Sonar.

* Sensu.

* Google Apps.

* Chef.

* Ansible.


WE OFFER



* The chance of developing a professional career within one of the most
important European startups. 

* Young & dynamic working environment. 350 employees from more than 30
countries.

* Your customer is your own company. Projects that have relationship among
themselves.

* You are free to use your own development environment. The more comfortable
you feel, so much the better for everyone.

* Flexible working day. We trust your responsability. We work at Bilbao's
headquarters for a closer relationship but we feel comfortable with occasional
teleworking.

* You will have responsability quickly: we hope that you will be deploying in
production from day one.

* You will take part in decissions for the next sprints and developments.

* Indefinite contract.

* Initial and continuous training.

* Real possibilities of professional development.

* Yearly budget for training and participation in some of the most
interesting events and conferences in technology in our area.

* Negotiable salary, based on the candidate’s experience and qualifications.
If you are the one that we are looking for, we will reach an agreement.

items.title: Rails Programmer
items.content:
Dear programmer who cares about doing meaningful work,
If your dream is to grow a product with a small team that already has its legs
under them

, and have a big impact on a problem that matters, IÃ¢Â Â ve got some good news
for youÃ¢Â Â¦weÃ¢Â Â re hiring a Rails programmer atKnow Your Company
.
First, a quick introduction.
My name is Claire Lew , and IÃ¢Â Â m the CEO of Know
Your Company . ItÃ¢Â Â s nice to meet you. My
company, Know Your Company, is a tool that helps business owners with 25 to 75
employees get to know their employees better. Companies like Airbnb and
Kickstarter use Know Your Company each week to improve their company culture.
Our software was originally built by Basecamp (formerly
37signals) in early 2013. Know Your Company ended up becoming so successful as
a product, Basecamp decided to spin it off into its own company. In 2014, I
became the new CEO of Know Your Company.
Our mission is to help people become happier at work. We believe this happens
when people can communicate openly and honestly at work. As the CEO, this is
also my ownpersonal mission. IÃ¢Â Â ve felt the pain of working in a company
where Know Your Company didnÃ¢Â Â t exist. Since then, IÃ¢Â Â ve made it my
lifeÃ¢Â Â s work to help others not feel the same way.
So whatÃ¢Â Â s the job?
YouÃ¢Â Â ll be a one-person product team. As our sole programmer, responsible
for building, improving, and maintaining Know Your Company as a product
end-to-end. WeÃ¢Â Â ll riff on feature concepts together, drawing from
conversations you and I have had with customers. YouÃ¢Â Â ll uncover the
underlyingjobs-to-be-done in the situations theyÃ¢Â Â re
facing and ensure the concepts weÃ¢Â Â ve discuss align with our overall vision
for the product. Then youÃ¢Â Â ll take those concepts from sketches to code to
production. What you ship will be used by over 12,000+ employees in over 15
different countries every single day.
ThereÃ¢Â Â s no project manager, no design team, and no user research team
here at Know Your Company. ItÃ¢Â Â s you and me thinking, experimenting,
playing detective on how to help CEOs and employees get more out of the
product. No marching orders here either Ã¢Â Â itÃ¢Â Â s ustogether deciding
what to prioritize, what to focus on, and what to improve.
You will also serve as the primary technical caretaker of Know Your Company.
YouÃ¢Â Â ll be our only line of defense when it comes to the stability,
reliability, and efficiency of Know Your Company running smoothly.
WeÃ¢Â Â d bring you on first as a contractor, to make sure you enjoy working
with us and vice versa. Then if it was a good fit, weÃ¢Â Â d bring you on
full-time. Eventually, weÃ¢Â Â ll hire another full-time designer for you to
work alongside with. As the company grows, weÃ¢Â Â d continue to build a team
around you. And if things worked out well, you would grow into a CTO role.
We recently brought on a Head of Business Development Jess Singer a few months
ago. Thanks to her, we just had our record high number of sales in December.
With your help, weÃ¢Â Â re excited to build on that momentum in 2017.
Together, weÃ¢Â Â d grow Know Your Company to be a tool that improves the
lives of hundreds of thousands of CEOs, managers, and employees every day.
Who am I looking for exactly?
IÃ¢Â Â m looking for someone who works fast and smart. Someone who is a clear
thinker and communicator. You write clean, tidy code. While you donÃ¢Â Â t
consider yourself a pure designer, you have an eye for design. YouÃ¢Â Â re
always up for learning and becoming better in everything you do.
You know what it means to hustle. It doesnÃ¢Â Â t matter what youÃ¢Â Â ve
studied (or if you graduated from school at all), or how many jobs youÃ¢Â Â ve
worked at previously. All that matters is what youÃ¢Â Â ve built. ItÃ¢Â Â s
likely youÃ¢Â Â ve shipped your own product (or several). You mightÃ¢Â Â ve
even started your own business (or several!). Throughout your life, youÃ¢Â Â ve
noticed that where other people have failed, youÃ¢Â Â ve succeeded simply
because you stick with things longer than most.
YouÃ¢Â Â re a problem-solver at heart. To you, thereÃ¢Â Â s no greater thrill
than building something that helps other people. You love the process of taking
an idea thatÃ¢Â Â s just written on a sheet of paper, and turning it into
something real and useful. You know what it feels like to be obsessed with what
youÃ¢Â Â re doingÃ¢Â Â¦and you canÃ¢Â Â t wait to feel that again.
You exude humility. You never believe you have all the answers, and are the
first to admit when youÃ¢Â Â ve made a mistake. YouÃ¢Â Â re always eager to
teach or explain something in a way thatÃ¢Â Â s simple and friendly to others.
In fact, your day is made when you watch someoneÃ¢Â Â s face light up when
something Ã¢Â Â clicksÃ¢Â Â for them, or when you surprise them by doing a
favor that makes her or his life a little easier.
Most importantly, you believe in the vision of Know Your Company

. YouÃ¢Â Â ve personally felt the pain of communication breakdowns in the
workplace. Or youÃ¢Â Â ve previously had a boss who you never felt comfortable
giving feedback to. Either way, youÃ¢Â Â re passionate about what Know Your
Company stands for, and how we can help as many people as possible become
happier in the workplace.
I want to hire the best person for this role Ã¢Â Â so it doesnÃ¢Â Â t matter
where youÃ¢Â Â re located. If youÃ¢Â Â re in Chicago, thatÃ¢Â Â s fantastic.
But if not, no worries. IÃ¢Â Â m open to working with you from anywhere. (Being
in a North American timezone is preferred though, given how closely you and I
will work together).
IÃ¢Â Â d love to hear from you.
If youÃ¢Â Â re interested in working together, please send me an email at
claire@knowyourcompany.com . Tell me a little
bit about yourself, share your personal story, and include any relevant work
and links. Writing samples are a plus too.
This is a unique opportunity to shape a product from the first floor and up,
and to help solve a significant problem. If youÃ¢Â Â re the right person for
it, IÃ¢Â Â d be honored if we got to tackle it together.
Looking forward to hearing from you,
-Claire Lew
CEO of Know Your Company
---
If this doesnÃ¢Â Â t sound quite like you, but someone you might know, please
feel free to pass along this post them! And, IÃ¢Â Â d really appreciate it if
you clicked the Ã¢Â Â¤Ã¯Â¸Â below tooÃ¢Â Â¦ That way, someone who might be a
great fit will see this, too. Thank you!
PS: You might recall us hiring for this role a few years ago. Matt, our
original programmer and first employee, served this role incredibly well and
recently accepted a position as a partner at another company that his friend
runs. WeÃ¢Â Â re thrilled for him! And, even though of course weÃ¢Â Â re bummed
heÃ¢Â Â s leaving Know Your Company, we are excited that this role has opened
up to bring in a fresh perspective. Matt will be sticking around a bit to help
around with the transition, and even is pitching in to help screen applicants
for us. He, Jess, and I look forward to hopefully meeting you Ã°Â Â Â
To apply: Please send me an email at claire@knowyourcompany.com

. Tell me a little bit about yourself, share your personal story, and include
any relevant work and links. Writing samples are a plus too.

items.title: Online Games Backend Ruby On Rails Developer
items.content:
Change with us the Fantasy Sports landscape. We were the first company to
bring Fantasy Sports games into Czech Republic four years ago. Now we are
storming the market as the only Fantasy Sports solution provider in Central
Europe. We work with the biggest lottery company and others to provide the
audience with the best Daily Fantasy Sports game there is. Take a look for
yourself at www.starliga.cz and www.sazkafantasy.cz.



We are still a young team, though filled with industry veterans. We have made
3 online MMO games in the past. Our Fantasy Sport game was played by over 200k
players in Czech Republic alone.



We have a gorgeous office in Prague. It’s full of things that make our life
easier from perfect coffee, awesome machines to variable height tables. We like
to enjoy our time at work.



The job is certainly suited for a fulltime presence at our office. But remote
may work, it mainly depends on you. We already have remote colleagues, so
everything is set up. Working hours depend on you, we want to see the work done
well. If you like to do it at 3 A.M., it’s your choice. But we meet physically
every day, so remote work means a lot of calls. 



It is also important to point out that we work on games that may be considered
gambling by some people. 



We seek a senior developer, you will have a lot of responsibility. Your code
will work with money, so you need to know your stuff well.



We like to use cutting edge technologies, learn new skills and do our work the
best way we can. Our team is very highly motivated and we only look for people
with the same attitude.


If you are interested, send us your references || C.V. || github link or
anything else you think we might be interested in. Be creative ;).



We are looking forward to meeting you.


Martin & Allodium Crew





FOREIGN INFO: If your don’t live in Czech Republic, we can help you relocate
after some initial good remote experience. You would need fluent in spoken and
written technical english. We also use many online collaboration tools. Anyway,
we strongly prefer people with EU/US/Commonwealth citizenship.

items.title: Java Software Engineer
items.content:
Java Software Engineer
We are looking for a Java Software Engineer that ideally has experience with AWS. We are a small development team, with remote and onsite members, that works following Agile principles. You will be working to develop new features for our custom-built, internally used digital marketing platform, as we move out of a beta stage and take it to market. This is an exciting new SASS product and you will have the opportunity to shape it as part of a growing development team.

Our platform is currently hosted on AWS, with a Java backend and Node.js front end. We make use of several additional AWS services, such as Cognito, CodeDeploy, CloudFront and CloudFormation. We are very open to different and new technology; it is very much a case of using the right tools for the right jobs. We encourage experimentation with new technology if it fits within our user-centric development approach.

We use JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket and Slack as part of our development workflow.

As we look to the next release, we are looking to harden our existing platform and infrastructure whilst continue developing new features.

Role
- Development of new features for our backend services
- Increase performance of existing application
- Give input into key architectural decisions
- Take part in Agile ceremonies (sprint planning etc.)

Required skills
- 2 years or more Java development experience.
- Strong experience of DevOps environment
- Strong knowledge of RESTful API design
- Knowledge of Agile methodologies
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Source control

Further details
Start date: as soon as possible
Location: Camden Town, London
Salary: Competitive (depends on experience)

About Wizzed Media
Based in Camden Town, we are a growing digital marketing company that is looking to begin to offer its custom-built tools as a SASS product. We are a small, ambitious team working within a relaxed environment. We are a young company so there is the opportunity to very quickly gain a large amount of responsibility.

items.title: Full Stack Javascript / Games Developer
items.content:
Full Stack Javascript / Games Developer, with experience in Instructional Design

We’re looking for a Javascript / Games Developer (preferably a UX expert in edtech) based in London to work with two co-founders on a revolutionary coding game, starting on a 3 month contract. You'll be part of a social enterprise business which is gaining huge momentum globally (the demo is used in 145 countries), working full-time, with the view towards becoming a core, permanent developer on the team.

We're looking for someone highly creative, open and reliable, and as motivated as us to make this unique game a huge success.

Product: https://eraseallkittens.com/
(currently 45-60 minutes gameplay content)

Your role:

- Applying Javascript (Node/Backbone) to help design and implement levels and educational content

- Working on the overall direction of the product ­- learning content, gameplay, features to include, etc.

- Helping to invent an effective way to teach JavaScript to children aged 8+ (collaborating with others, e.g. the Director of Education, Code Club)

Skills Required:

- JavaScript
- HTML
- CSS
- Backbone.js
- Node.js / LiveScript

Why build a career with us:

Code education is a new and exciting area, which is currently booming. You will be working on a unique, highly creative product in a new market, which has already been invested in and is gaining momentum globally - the first coding tool that teaches young children professional languages, and successfully inspires both boys and girls to code.

You will be working with people who are passionate about games and encouraging children to become creators rather than consumers of technology. Since we're a social enterprise business, we have a lot of support from many highly respected organisations and individuals.

Solely through word-of-mouth, E.A.K. is being played in 145 countries - in schools and in homes. We aim to bring coding into the mainstream and to show children how to create their own levels and simple websites, using HTML, CSS and Javascript.

We're a small, creative team and everyone who works with us has an equal amount of creative input. We work at EdSpace, a co-working space in Hoxton, London.

Recent Press:
- http://europe.newsweek.com/gender-gap-tech-widening-stem-coding-gaming-546899
- http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jimmy-leach/the-solution-to-the-loomi_b_13168608.html
- http://dailygenius.com/computer-sciences-needs-change-image-approach/
- http://www.techandlearning.uk/download/kids-save-kittens-to-learn-coding/

items.title: Full Stack JS Blockchain Developer
items.content:
*NO RECRUITERS*

*Come join the Blockchain Revolution!*

_Here at Tallysticks, we are revolutionising invoice financing through blockchain technology and are now looking for to grow the team. Tallysticks is a young start up, around since 2015, and we have developed an exciting and industry-changing solution to a problem many SMEs that work in big supply chains face: cash flow and invoice financing. Our solution is a portal that SMEs, large corporates and financiers can access to help with this funding gap by utilising blockchain technology._

We have developed an award-winning product and now want to tweak the the product and further develop our portal based on user feedback. We are looking for a full-stack developer who:
* Has a proven track record with JavaScript, Node.js, HTML 5, CSS3 (existing projects on GitHub or elsewhere)
* Has experience of web paradigms such as REST, WebSocket
* Is prepared to work closely with the agile team in Canary Wharf, London
* Can take ownership from the get-go and work with minimal guidance
* Ideally has experience of building enterprise applications in FS

_*RESPONSIBILITIES*_
* Primarily, to deliver the product a number of clients ranging from SMEs to large corporates
* Deliver bespoke UIs for each client who uses our product
* Further develop the back-end of the product based on user feedback and
* Work with the Operations Manager and Product Manger to consolidate the build and product
* There will be some travel involved so be able work independently but be mindful of the core product and our core aims

_*ADDITIONAL, BENEFICIAL SKILLS*_
* Linux command line
* Modern JavaScript: ES6, Babel
* CSS pre-processors: LESS, SASS
* Build, testing and automation tools
* DevOps tools: Docker, Ansible, Kubernetes
* Cloud computing platforms: Azure, AWS
* Bootstrap 3 or other CSS frameworks
* React and relevant stack: Webpack, Immutable.js, Redux, etc
* React native, mobile
* Redis and other SQL or NoSQL databases
* Distributed ledgers, decentralized applications, blockchain platforms such as Ethereum and Hyperledger

_*THE DETAILS*_
* Immediate start but we’ll wait for the right person
* Salary & equity negotiable and based on experience
* The position is London-based at Level 39, Canary Wharf with some travel required
* We offer flexi-time but cannot offer remote work currently

_*HOW TO APPLY*_
* Hit "Apply Here" below with Cover Letter, CV and examples of your work
* We are hiring on a rolling basis
* Applications welcome in English, French or German

items.title: Symfony Developer (Remote or in-house)
items.content:
Proofer is the simplest social media management platform in the world, it helps you free up time and money so you can improve your business.

We are a start-up based in London that is going to change the way that businesses interact with their social channels. We’re on a mission to be the world’s go-to social media management platform.

At Proofer we want to build something that can reach millions of people, that means we need to create a scalable architecture as well as a secure and robust platform. We will be building our product from the ground up, so you’ll be involved in everything from deciding what technologies we use, to architectural design, to building REST services and much more. You’ll also get to work with highly experienced, world class developers as well as some bright young talent in a newly formed, high-energy team.

To succeed in the role you will need to have a strong foundation in web systems and enjoy working on a wide range of diverse and challenging problems in a missions-driven team. You will have the opportunity to tackle the complex problems of scale & performance, while using some of the most exciting technologies such as Docker, AWS, PHP 7, SOA, React and more.

We believe that you should work in the place that makes you happy, whether that’s at home or in our London office. Regardless, we have a get together on Friday, pizza & beers all round. Even if you’re at home, we’ll send a pizza to your house!

We are looking for highly talented and driven individuals who want to be part of an exceptional team, in an inspiring and collaborative environment.

Must haves:
* Experience with Symfony
* Worked with a LEMP / LAMP stacks
* Understands how to create scalable REST services
* Experience in a range of AWS technologies

Extra points for the following:
* Symfony 3
* PHP 7
* Either Angular 2 or React
* CSS / SASS
* Micro-service Architecture / SOA
* Docker & Vagrant
* Experience in a start-up

items.title: Backend (Ruby) Developer
items.content:
Bloom & Wild are looking for a Ruby-on-Rails developer to help take our tech stack to the next level. You’ll be a passionate techie who cares about building great products and taking ownership to ensure quality.

We’re using technologies such as Docker, Rails, PostgreSQL, Sidekiq, Stripe, Heroku, Pusher and JSON API to power a best-in-class shopping experience for our customers. Our APIs are used by native iOS and Android clients, as well as our Angular website.

We’re taking a mobile first approach to design and performance as we build up our tech stack to support Bloom & Wild’s ambitious growth plans. Personalisation, internationalisation and conversational commerce are among the many ambitious projects in the pipeline.

You:

- Are be eager to learn, fast-moving and pragmatic, favouring working and usable MVPs, and using real customer feedback to continuously iterate and improve our tech
- Have 1-3 years of using Ruby on Rails in a production environment, with experience of test-driven development with RSpec/Cucumber or a similar tool
- If you’ve built APIs for single-page applications that’s a plus, as is previous Docker and AWS experience
- Experience in a fast-growing (preferably consumer-facing) startup, interacting with both technical and non-technical teams
- Have a passion for learning and staying up-to-date with the latest technologies
- Have used version control tools such as Git and CI tools such as Codeship

Benefits

- Professional expertise/challenge - you’ll be joining a young team and get the chance to help shape how we work, while using the latest tools and technologies, becoming an expert in your field

- Working environment - we’re relaxed, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative team culture

- Product - you’ll be working on an app and website that is being used by thousands of people every day, and is growing fast

- Startup life - you’ll get first hand experience of fundraising, rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business

- Technologies - the main ones we’re currently using are Angular, Ruby on Rails, Objective-C, Android, Git, Redis, Codeship, Docker and Postgres. This will continue to grow

- Tech culture / team - the best bits of Agile, regular retros, stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems (no specs here)

- Kit - a new computer of your choice, widescreen monitor to plug into, comfy chair and whatever tools you need to get the job done

- Social perks - we’re very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and Bloom & Go Wild trips (we recently went to Stockholm for the weekend)

- Material perks - 25 days holiday, competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), potential for a stake in the company (you’ll be helping us grow, so it’s only fair)

items.title: Junior or Intern Python developer
items.content:
We are looking for a Junior or Intern Python developer to join our team

ABOUT US

YesWeStock is an ambitious start-up passionate about making self-storage easier, based on the Airbnb model.  We’re all about finding the right person who shares YesWeStock’s vision for what’s possible in this industry.

VALUE

Working at YesWeStock means taking ownership from day one and giving everything for our projects to make a meaningful and sustainable impact. For our businesses to go from zero to launch, we remain focused while being confident.

THE ROLE

As a Python Developer, you will be responsible for the development of a wide range of products oriented to scale and optimise the online marketing operations of YesWeStock.

At YesWeStock, no two days are the same. The following tasks will be part of your new role:

- Building RESTful APIs and help migrate our infrastructure to micro services; – Starting and taking ownership of new projects; – Working with external APIs (Google, Facebook); – Working with technology stack consisting of Python, AngularJS, Postgres, Redis, NGINX, RabbitMQ, Docker, Ansible, AWS.

To be successful in your new role, you should bring along these skills:

- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience; – Know how to build complex but robust asynchronous tasks; – Big fan of Test Driven Development, and PEP8 advocate.

WHAT WE OFFER

In return, YesWeStock offers you the opportunity to work at an office with colleagues from various international backgrounds, in central London. The access you get to latest technologies, knowledge sharing and training will allow you to develop rapidly during your time at YesWeStock.

EQUITY  Absolutely on offer – we want this to be a beautiful long term relationship!

LOCATION  Camden, London (5 mins walk from Warren street, Euston-square, Euston or Mornington Crescent)

Are you interested?

We welcome your application in English / French to join our team!

items.title: Full-stack developer - NodeJS, TypeScript, MongoDB, Express, Azure
items.content:
At Silicon Rhino, we help launch amazing companies.

Silicon Rhino is a growing start-up studio. We are looking for a talented individual to join the team to help bringing to life ideas through technical solutions.

We have a start-up friendly focus, working largely with non-technical founders. Your role will be working with our tech leads.

Silicon Rhino's office is based between Southwark and Elephant & Castle's station. We allow for remote working but you must be available for occasional meetings in London in person.

Desired:
- NodeJS
- TypeScript
- MongoDB
- Express
- Azure

Bonus:
- Cordova
- AngularJS 1

We also work with these technologies:
- AngularJS 2
- AWS
- DynamoDB
- Lambda
- React Native

Interviews and start date: immediate

Please send through your CV for consideration.

No agencies please

items.title: Backend Developer Ruby / PHP
items.content:
At Wando, we believe that there are better ways to research and compare products and services in the digital age.

We are a technology driven company focused on collecting, interpreting and visualizing data on hundreds of different topics offering the most convenient, comprehensive and intelligent solution for product and service comparison for consumers across topics, channels and devices. For consumers, Wando operates a number of data-driven research websites, spanning from consumer products, to travel, and personal finance.

Since 2014, Wando has grown from a small Berlin garage start-up to a 12 employee company with rock solid funding backed solely by 25 of the most successful Berlin Internet Entrepreneurs serving as Business Angels and Advisors. The company is managed and majority owned by its founders and is long-term oriented.

Our founders are serial entrepreneurs with over 10 years of experience in company building and development and madly in love with creating new things and solving complex problems on the quest to make the search and comparison of any product and service worldwide an intuitive, transparent and enjoyable experience while empowering consumers to take an informed decision.

Join our brilliant, international and experienced team at our head office in Berlin as Backend Developer!

This is an exciting opportunity to join and participate building a cross-functional team tasked with improving our price comparison website. We are incrementally improving our system, from making our user interface more efficient and beautiful to customizing our search logic. As a backend developer for our price comparison website, you will ensure that products data and meta information are always kept up to date and highly available. This include building and maintaining tools to download, aggregate, map, index and retrieve product data. You will also use your expertise to bring new ideas.

*From day one you will:*

* Work with production code
* Create own pull requests and contribute to our code base
* Be responsible for your tasks
* Collaborate with smart and funny folks

*You bring:*

* Work experience with Ruby and PHP (another object-oriented programming language will be a plus)
* Experience with REST-based APIs and the underlying technologies
* Solid software engineering skills (code quality, testing, design, automation, version control)
* Fluency in English
* You are always looking for elegant solutions

*And this on us:*

* A really warm, international and experienced team
* Flat hierarchies and a chance to make a real difference shaping the future of our company
* A competitive compensation package (with a bonus program for all full time employees)
* Great opportunities for professional and personal development through a personal development plan & quarterly feedback talks, presentations from team members & externals and our company library guaranteeing a steep learning curve
* 5 weeks of paid holidays and flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
* A modern office in the center of Berlin, Europe’s most fascinating city with low cost of living and high quality of life
* Great team events, weekly team lunch, Friday afternoon drinks and free fresh fruits, cereals, coffee & juices

We look forward to your application in English or German, including your cover letter, CV and relevant references. Please also add your preferences regarding a possible starting date and your salary expectations.

items.title: Senior software engineer – possibility of founder options / remote working
items.content:
The company is currently based in Manchester and London.

Kindly.com enables the creative community and their fans to raise money and fund campaigns for the causes and Charities they love.

This is an amazing opportunity for a talented software engineer to join a growing start up in a position to influence, direct and, for the right candidate, to become part of the founding team.

We have just taken on a second round of funding to further develop and grow the product of an already launched and tested MVP. The initial customer feedback has helped create a more focused and exciting proposition that will be launched in 2017. More importantly, our investors believe 100% in our vision and are willing to continue backing it.

We are looking for an experienced full stack software engineer to initially help re-focus and stabilize the existing platform, before taking ownership of the architecture and product roadmap going forward. This really is an all-encompassing role with a lot of autonomy, the ability to shape the team, and the need to be active and hands-on in developing and owning the product. For the right candidate – one that can combine technical skills with passion for growing the business - the company is willing to offer founder share options.

The ideal candidate would have deep knowledge and experience of working with:
* C# and .NET 4
* Scalable Javascript
* CSS/SaaS
* NET MVC and WebAPI
* Amazon Web Services (AWS), SQS, RDS, S3, Elasticache
* MYSQL Server with strong knowledge of SQL
* RESTful API development in AWS
* Continuous development and integration, including tools like TeamCity and Octopus deploy
* IIS administration

Work experience:
* At least 3 years experience working as a Senior Software Engineer using C#
* Experience of designing and maintaining N-Tier architectures
* Experience of designing and developing systems for both high availability and scalability
* Experience of test-driven development where change is expected, writing automated tests (both unit and integration tests)
* Experience of working on the full stack including database, the server and the front end
* The ideal candidate would also have experience of growing a technical team from 1 - many

Personal attributes:
* A desire to write clear maintainable code (including principles like KISS/ DRY)
* Pragmatism over perfectionism - we're a startup and things change pretty quickly round here
* A desire to wear multiple hats

Benefits:
* Competitive salary
* Equity (possibly founder equity for the right candidate)
* Option to remote work with flexible hours
* Working with a team that prides itself on honesty, transparency and a willingness to support one another. You never know, we may even do our bit in helping to make this world a better place.

Please note that this vacancy is only open to residents of the United Kingdom. In addition short listed candidates will be asked to complete a code test. No agencies please.

items.title: Full stack Javascript engineer
items.content:
We’re Codified Security, a London-based company that is growing quickly. Our mission is to answer the question ‘Are our mobile apps secure?’ for our clients, by using cutting edge technology building on our years of mobile and cybersecurity experience.

After launching around a year ago we’re seeing rapid growth and an increasingly demanding product roadmap.

You’ll be responsible for developing new features and ensuring our platform is as stable and performant as possible through good quality code & best practice development methodologies.

Our stack is primarily Node.js-based. You’ll be detailed orientated and excited to get stuck into a big problem and take ownership over it. If you’re interested in cyber security, that’s also a big plus.

*Technical skills we expect:*

* 4+ years experience developing web applications and backends
* 3+ years experience with Javascript
* Relevant experience with Node.js
* Experience using both NoSQL and SQL databases
* Front end experience in a relevant framework (ideally React)
* Experience in cloud deployments
* Help us automate everything as much as possible: deployments, QA, etc

*What we can offer you:*

* Central London office location
* Possibility of some flexible/remote working
* Good salary
* Generous options in a fast growing startup in a booming industry
* Ability to really make a difference

STRICTLY NO RECRUITERS/AGENCIES – ANY RECRUITER CONTACTING WILL BE OBLIGED TO MAKE A £100 DONATION TO A CHARITY OF OUR CHOOSING.

items.title: Mid-Level Full Stack Developer
items.content:
About City Pantry
City Pantry is at the forefront of transforming the way businesses view culture – helping companies work better, by eating together. We believe that good food makes a great company, and that sharing a meal creates an environment where better communication,
productivity and health are nourished.
After two years, we’re growing (quickly) and are delivering thousands of meals each day across the heart of London to some of the world’s newest and most exciting brands – Google, Facebook, Spotify & Buzzfeed (amongst many, many others). Working with the best independent chefs, street vendors, specialist caterers, restaurants and supper clubs in London, we give companies access to varied and exciting food providing an easy and reliable way to organise lunches, meetings and events.
We’re a friendly group, passionate about our work and serious about creating a great user experience with awesome food, useful tech products, and best-in-class service. We have a fantastic work environment that encourages creativity, risk-taking, growth and autonomy. You will be a great fit if you love to get stuck in, learning new things and get a kick out of making things better.

The Tech Team
As a small team, we believe in agile engineering culture and are naturally motivated by autonomy and a strong sense of project ownership. Everyone participates in feature planning, implementation decisions and shaping our practices to get a good balance of challenging work and fun. We follow scrum but believe that rules are only a good start and should be broken when needed. We deploy new feature almost every day, celebrate success and love to learn from mistakes that take us forward.

Who we’re looking for
Maybe you once worked for a smaller company and miss the feeling of being on an exciting growth trajectory? Or you’re a die-hard computer science grad who taught yourself to code during your GCSEs? Great! We have a lot of big ideas in the pipeline that we can’t wait to work with you on.
We are looking for developers hungry for a challenge, with strong opinion but keen to learn from others. Developers that “won’t sleep until that bug is fixed”, ones that inspire product and strive to innovate to provide a seamless user experience.

Our Tech Stack
Our backend ecosystem consists of Symfony, Mongo and a series of Node microservices deployed on Docker. Front end is an Angular SPA. We develop on Vagrant and are enthusiastic about “dockerizing” our stack and fully automating our deployment pipeline, step by step. As a team, we are constantly on a lookout for tools that can do the job better, faster and make the dev experience more enjoyable.

We want a developer who:
• feels at home in both frontend and backend
• is excited about working with Angular, Node, PHP, Docker, Kubernetes, document and relational databases, etc.
• gets the kicks from anything tech
• writes a high-quality code
• can demonstrate knowledge of industry “best practices”
• is keen to learn from other more experienced team members
• wants to innovate in the technical space
• is comfortable working in Agile, startup environment
• holds our customer values at heart of what they do

You’ll have:
• experience with PHP and Symfony (or other MVC frameworks)
• experience with Angular (or other frontend frameworks such as React or Ember)
• experience of integrating services
• track record of interesting side projects
• solid knowledge of OOP

A taster of what you’ll be doing:
• work on challenging project with other senior developers
• help to build every aspect of the new City Pantry product, including apps, website… the whole circus
• actively contribute to the discussion about what is being built and why
• contribute to the architecture and design of the full technical solution

What are the perks?
• competitive compensation package, plus performance-based salary increase and equity
• free team lunch each Monday, Wednesday, and Friday
• £2000 learning allowance
• monthly tech innovate day (mini-hackathon)
• unlimited holiday
• flexible working hours

items.title: Full Stack Developer for Fit Link App
items.content:
*PLEASE, NOTE*

1. No recruiters, please
2. This is an unpaid / sweat equity role

*Welcome to Fit Link*

Fit Link App is a global fitness community powered by wearable tech and fitness trackers. Users download the iOS app, log in with Facebook or email and connect their RunKeeper, Strava or Apple Health to the app. Their activity data is then used to compete with like-minded athletes in private or public leagues, users can exchange tracked miles for fitness rewards (like air miles) and users can follow or be followed to see each other's activities.

*The story so far...*

2015

* Jan to May: idea to MVP
* Jun: Live in the app store. No marketing or promotion as beta launch
* Jul: Improvements and bug fixes from user feedback
* Aug: Improvements from user feedback
* Oct: Additional functionality (Apple Health)
* Nov: Apple Health bug fixes

2016

* Jan: Additional functionality, improvements and bug fixes and UX and UI improvements
* Oct to Dec: User research and feedback, backend migration, web version build started

*The next chapter...*

2017

* Jan: Build founding team, grow product
* Jul: Seed round
* Aug: Take over the world

*About me...*

I’m a serial entrepreneur with multiple start-ups resulting in sales and/or fails. I have a passion for business, embrace lean startup methodology and love solving real problems with technology. Fit Link is a solution to a problem I experienced and I spent a few months researching before deciding to start Fit Link.

*About you...*

We've just recently moved the back-end from a DAAS solution to Heroku + mLab so having experience of this would be essential. You'll work closely with me and the app developers to grow and improve the platform. The back-end is the guts of the product and getting this right will result in successful scale and growth of the platform. FED would be an advantage but not necessary.

Start-up experience plus health & fitness industry experience is preferred but not necessary. If you run or ride and use an activity tracker then you are potentially a user, so even better!

I need passionate, driven, motivated, and talented people to join me in building a cool and successful product. I want you to believe in the product, see its potential and help shape its future.

Remote work is ok but regular weekly face-to-face meetups in London and Norwich are key.

Tools used include Hangouts, Slack, Google Docs, Gmail and Bitbucket.

*Money...*

Pre-seed this is a sweat equity deal so it’s a side project gig. I've self-funded and bootstrapped to this point and that will continue for the next 4 to 6 months until seed investment. Shares will be allocated to founding members based on the amount of time they can commit to Fit Link. After seed investment then this becomes a paid role (full and/or part-time).

*Contact/apply...*

Get in contact for further information and send me your profile/cv/twitter/linkedin/instagram etc

items.title: Front-end developer needed for fast growth company in Chester
items.content:
We are looking for a talented front-end developer to join our fast growth technology business.

Bikmo is a technology company run by a diverse team of bike geeks who's purpose is to make life easier for people who love riding bikes, water, mountains and snow.

We're currently making waves in the UK bike sector and need an ambitious and creative individual to help accelerate our growth.

So if you have the technical nouse, a creative approach to the way you work, and a passion for adventure sports, then read on.

*The role*

Under the guidance of the CTO, you will be taking the lead in developing, from the ground up, an industry busting application to allow riders to take up membership, purchase policies, and manage their cover with ease and efficiency. The experience for the riders is key to the application and should be the highest priority.

Alongside the core Bikmo experience, you will also work on improving our WP based CMS in order for the rest of the team to publish engaging and useful content for potential and existing customers.

You will work with RESTful APIs created by our CTO, who you'll sit near and be in daily conversation with. You won't need to write any of these but, so you know, our middleware is written in PHP and our database is MySQL.

We're looking for a developer with a solid foundation in front-end engineering, with a minimum of 3 years experience. A degree is not a requirement, but a desire to learn and grow, and a passion for the work you do is essential. No experience of the insurance / finance sector is required for this role.

*Skills*

Essential;

* HTML, CSS (Sass too!), JavaScript
* Developing with Web Standards in mind
* Responsive Web Design, Mobile-first, Progressive Enhancement
* A passion for User Experience Design and Research
* Proficiency in at least one modern Javascript framework (e.g. Angular or React)
* HTTP/URL, DOM knowledge and browser understanding
* Cross-Browser / Cross-Platform / Cross-Device Testing
* Accessibility / WAI-ARIA
* GIT

Desirable;

* Mobile Web Performance / Load / Performance Testing
* Data APIs
* Microdata/Microformats
* Task Runners, Build Tools, Process Automation Tools
* Application Architecture
* Dependency / package managers
* Templating Strategies/Engines
* Unit Testing / Code Quality / Coverage Analysis
* Browser Developer Tools
* Experience of efficient remote working
* Familiarity with Wordpress
* Although we're looking for a front end dev, knowledge of the server side is also important. At the very least, we'd like to see knowledge of MySQL and PHP.

*Salary + benefits*

This role is a full time role at 38 hours per week, Monday to Friday.

As stated above, flexible working is a requirement with 3 days per week in the head office at 7 Abbey Square, Chester, CH1 2HU, and the remainder at your home office. During the initial period, it will be near full time hours in the office for training and system familiarity.

The starting salary for this role is £28,000 - £32,000 per annum, dependent on experience, with bi-annual reviews and no annual cap on increases. As a growing business, our benefit structure is under review and will include a share options scheme and holiday entitlement boost.

Holiday is pro rata at 28 days per year, inclusive of bank holidays. You get an additional days leave for your birthday, and may take 1 day per month for riding adventures / 12 days per year - in return for content for our magazine.

items.title: Junior iOS developer innovating mobile platform technology
items.content:
THE COMPANY

Cotham Technologies is known for innovative technologies and products in the mobile application development space with its ground breaking patent-filed FloFrame platform. Our Engineering team develops the next generation FloFrame platform products and also uses the FloFrame IDE to rapidly develop creative mobile app solutions for our customers.

We are looking for at least one junior iOS software engineer preferably with at least 1 years commercial experience, for our Engineering team to start asap. As a key member of the team you will be developing quality software, in an agile manner. You will gain exposure to the latest cutting edge tools and technologies (Internet of Things, wearables, smart TV etc) and work in a very innovative and dynamic environment. This is a unique role creating a disruptive and pioneering mobile application development platform.

Our team embraces new technologies and products and have a penchant for solving complex and challenging technical problems in a creative manner.

Please note we are only accepting applications from EU nationals or those with an existing valid work visa to work in the UK.

ABOUT YOU

You’ll feel at home within an agile team with its open communications, emphasis on innovation, commitment to quality, focus on getting things done and having great fun doing it. To succeed in this role you will need the following skills:

• Passionate about developing excellent products and high quality code
• Self-starter, motivated and results driven
• UX and UI Design Experience
• Experience collaborating with team members and clients using agile processes
• At least 1 years post University production level iOS development experience
• Experience with GIT, reviewing/ pushing code using GitHub and merging code branches

WHY WORK FOR US

We set our hiring bar high – you will be working with the best. The company is growing fast; you’ll have a lot of opportunity to make a real impact on our platform and our brand, and learn and develop fast from day one and contribute and share in the company’s success. You will benefit from;

• Competitive salary and stock options
• Flexible working arrangements including working from home
• Pioneering: Be part of a movement to fundamentally change an industry, liberalising app development
• Ownership: Enjoy the trust, independence and responsibility required to allow you to deliver quickly and effectively
• Passion and talent: Work with a nimble, passionate and dynamic team capable of lightning quick manoeuvring and execution
• Rewarding: We are a tech start-up, we’re unique and we reward by giving you a stake in our successs of audience

items.title: Junior Android Developer for pioneering mobile app platform
items.content:
THE COMPANY

Cotham Technologies is known for innovative technologies and products in the mobile application development space with its ground breaking patent-filed FloFrame platform. Our Engineering team develops the next generation FloFrame platform products and also uses the FloFrame IDE to rapidly develop creative mobile app solutions for our customers.

We are looking for at least one junior Android (Java) software engineer preferably with at least 1 years commercial experience, for our Engineering team to start asap. As a key member of the team you will be developing quality software, in an agile manner. You will gain exposure to the latest cutting edge tools and technologies (Internet of Things, wearables, smart TV etc) and work in a very innovative and dynamic environment. This is a unique role creating a disruptive and pioneering mobile application development platform.

Our team embraces new technologies and products and have a penchant for solving complex and challenging technical problems in a creative manner.

Please note we are only accepting applications from EU nationals or those with an existing valid work visa to work in the UK.

ABOUT YOU

You’ll feel at home within an agile team with its open communications, emphasis on innovation, commitment to quality, focus on getting things done and having great fun doing it. To succeed in this role you will need the following skills:

• Passionate about developing excellent products and high quality code
• Self-starter, motivated and results driven
• UX and UI Design Experience
• Experience collaborating with team members and clients using agile processes
• At least 1 years post University production level Android development experience
• Experience with GIT, reviewing/ pushing code using GitHub and merging code branches

WHY WORK FOR US

We set our hiring bar high - you will be working with the best. The company is growing fast; you'll have a lot of opportunity to make a real impact on our platform and our brand, and learn and develop fast from day one and contribute and share in the company’s success. You will benefit from;

• Competitive salary and stock options
• Flexible working arrangements including working from home
• Pioneering: Be part of a movement to fundamentally change an industry, liberalising app development
• Ownership: Enjoy the trust, independence and responsibility required to allow you to deliver quickly and effectively
• Passion and talent: Work with a nimble, passionate and dynamic team capable of lightning quick manoeuvring and execution
• Rewarding: We are a tech start-up, we're unique and we reward by giving you a stake in our success

items.title: Staff Software Engineer
items.content:
*Simply put; Skimlinks is a big data technology and product startup, building cool stuff, at scale.*

We build highly transactional, high throughput platforms that connect publishers, merchants, and audiences; which allows some of the most popular sites in the world to efficiently and easily monetise their curated journalistic content. We partner with companies like Huffington Post, The New York Times, The Independent and Hearst to diversify their content monetisation strategies; which helps them create more of the journalistic content that we all consume and enjoy, without relying upon additional banner advertising.

We’re also leveraging our massive amount of anonymous behavioural data to create greenfield data platforms. We employ a diverse array of advanced Machine Learning and Classical Statistical methodologies to interrogate our dizzying amounts of data. Though our platforms, we have a direct view of the browsing and shopping behaviors of over 650 million users; amassing over 1TB of data daily across over a billion incoming events.

As Staff Software Engineer, you’ll work closely with the CTO to provide inspirational technical and architectural leadership and mentoring across the company, and you’ll own some of the most strategic and challenging efforts from concept through implementation and evolution. For those with both desire and aptitude, this role could include both team as well as technical management. Whether you’ve built APIs; or systems that scale to billions of requests daily; or worked with terabytes of incoming data; or integrated with complex partner ecosystems; we have a lot of different problem spaces that you will enjoy. Our primary language is Python, but we look for amazing engineers and computer scientists (not just programmers), so we welcome and expect people to have a range of backgrounds - we particularly favour intellectually curious, polyglot engineers who have built platforms of high scale and high complexity and who love to solve hard problems.

*Responsibilities:*

* Design, build, implement, and own systems across all parts of our platform; from high-volume data collection, enrichment and automated analysis, through to backend services and RESTful APIs
* Keep on top of the latest and greatest developments in distributed systems; the cloud; and data science fields.
* Motivate and inspire the team to deliver the Skimlinks technical vision
* Lead by example to foster a culture of Engineering excellence and craftsmanship
* Contribute to overall technical strategy and lead the teams on architectural design and decision making
* Mentor and guide team members to deliver better software, faster
* Lead on technology product, practice and tool selection
* Obsess over non-functional requirements such as performance, security, testability, maintainability and reliability
* Contribute to the product roadmap and ensure the technical and product visions are aligned
* Help define our development environment, and communicate the best development practices within the organisation (i.e. code reviews, testing, etc).
* Sharing your knowledge across, and possibly outside, the company in your areas of expertise

*Requirements:*

* Degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering (or equivalent)
* You have deep experience building enterprise-grade software with several languages, such as Java, C#, F#, Scala, C++ or Python
* You have been an Architect or Lead Software Engineer previously in your career, in brilliant software development teams working in technically challenging environments
* You are familiar with building systems that efficiently scale with very large data volumes
* You’re obsessed with how your applications will hold up in production, with real users doing bad things to them
* You’ve led and mentored teams, such as in the use of design and integration patterns, domain modelling and engineering best practices
* You have (or are at least receptive to) running and participating in industry events

*A flavour of our Technology Stack:*

* Python
* Java
* Spark
* Hadoop
* Hive
* Google Cloud Platform
* AWS
* S3
* Tensorflow

items.title: Startup in need of software engineer
items.content:
Looking to join an exciting startup?
Want to potentially become a CTO?
Have an extensive experience as a mobile app developer?

If you have answered all yes, look no further. I am the founder of a soon to be app, Great Deal App. I have a great concept for a mobile app which i strongly believe has potential to challenge other competitors in the market. Therefore what I am seeking is an individual who is skilled and has previous experience in developing IOS apps. I also require for you to contribute in the development of the app and actively take part in suggesting any room for improvements.

A little background on my startup app idea is that I intend to create the app so I can partner up with small businesses and provide them a service which will help improve their costumer relationship and the growth of their business.

Your short term goal will be to build the app and to maintain it, this will then be hopefully used as our prototype, if to the standard which I need it to be at. If you do decide to continue working with us, you will have the opportunity to put yourself forward as a CTO on our board!

The most important thing I am looking for is for my potential partner to be comfortable in leading the technology strategy and to be willing to put 100% of their effort in sharing the same vision and expecting the same result as the founder. You will also have to share the same start-mentality and be committed to work hard. Our team is very small, currently consisting of 3 members a CEO,COO and you a possible CTO, this meaning that we are relying on our developer to create an excellent prototype to increase our success with securing a promising funding.

As you will have the chance of becoming our CTO, you will be immediately assigned a vesting equity+ 1 yr cliff date from when you start working with us. Furthermore will be discussed in person if you become a successful applicant.

We would like anyone who fits the criteria above to apply as soon as possible.

items.title: Lead Javascript Developer at Planity (Paris, France) (allows remote)
items.content:
Do you feel like working with cutting-edge technologies and having a decisive
impact on how we organize, test and ship our code ?

We are looking for an autonomous and adaptable full-stack software engineer to
work on all our projects : our Android React Native app, our end-user
web-platform and our microservices. 

Our online booking platform raises really nice technical challenges:
delivering to our end-users real-time availabilities based on business rules
that can be arbitrarily complex, handle concurrent bookings conflicts, offer
salons a fast, reliable, real-time app that works offline to organize their
planning.

You will have a chance to participate in the overall architecture decisions
and in the choice of the tooling/languages in order to build a product that is
reliable, scalable and adapted to quick evolutions.

Your first responsibility will be our end-user web-platform, which includes
our booking microservices, and the organization of our testing/continuous
deployment process for it.

Please do not apply if you are not located in our timezone (Central European
Time)

Skills & Requirements

Basic requirements

* 3+ years of programming experience in front-end and back-end development
* Modern web technologies: HTML5, CSS3, NPM, Webpack, Babel,...
* Solid experience with React and Redux
* Practical knowledge of shell scripting and at least one scripting language
* Interest in data structures, algorithms and software design
Not required but would be a plus

* experience with redux-saga
* experience with immutableJS
* experience with React Native
* experience with Android development
* experience with AWS
* experience with Firebase
About Planity

Planity is an online booking platform for beauty, hair, nail salons and spas.
We have raised €1M in VC funding and are located in the heart Paris. Join a
team of young yet experienced entrepreneurs and take part in revolutionizing
the market of beauty services!

Make sure you check our company page on StackOverflow
!

items.title: Sr Rails Software Engineer at Whitespectre (Barcelona, Spain) (allows remote)
items.content:
Our microservice architecture of 17 loosely coupled Rails services (http REST,
async queuing etc) has been developed for the last 2 years. It's in production,
supporting multiple brands and driving millions of dollars of revenue every
month from US sales.

We are looking for one more smart developer to join a new team and help us
deliver more features, faster for our long-term client. Are you an experienced
engineer looking for a new challenge? Does working in a company that
specialises in high performing distributed teams sound exciting?

What do we offer?

* Work as part of a talented, globally distributed, successful team
* A focussed adherance to our agile/scrum processes (we really believe it
helps getting good work done)
* Hard problems to solve (you won't find all the answers on Stack Overflow) -
and the opportunity to own the solutions
* A great working atmosphere where you can share and learn with other smart
people
* The best-in-class toolsets: Slack, CI/CD with Docker etc
* Meetups in our Barcelona offices for our remote folks
* Competitive rates
* A long term working relationship: at least a year working on this project,
then others.
You'll be:

* Working within a fast moving team (working 11am - 8pm Central European time)
* Solving hard business logic with elegant software design
* Identifying bottlenecks, using tools to diagnose and refactor code for scale
* Ensuring the robustness, performance and failure characteristics of the
system.
* Writing well tested (rspec), defect free code with CI/CD
* Taking ownership of production applications - managing issues, releases and
ensuring quality
* Occasionally going full stack and also building functionality for the SPAs
in javascript (experience in node/react/backbone is useful) 
Good english verbal and written communication skills are essential. 

This is a contract position with a long term outlook (12 months+ full time
project) for the the right candidate. We are looking for remote workers (most
of the company is remote) or have openings based in our Barcelona office.

About Whitespectre

Who are we? Whitespectre is a growing, globally distributed, software
development company, focussed on building elegant solutions with Ruby on Rails
in the backend, and Javascript SPAs plus native IOS and Android apps. 

Why is it good to work with us?

We know that big ideas and big results only happen when you have the right
people, working together smartly - whether that’s across the room or across the
globe.  We make the work fun and rewarding.

Because we work on cool projects. Sure, we can list the latest set of
technologies that we use, but that is a given. What's more interesting is how
they are used - the design, the architecture, the approach to solving business
problems. And we do that across multiple clients - each and every one we're
excited to work with.

Because we believe in constant learning and exploring - whether that’s a new
skill, a new role, or a new way of seeing.  And because we've found that we
learn the most when we take on new challenges as a team.  We’re proud that
people love working with us (and still have lives outside of work).

items.title: Backend Developer (m/w) at grandcentrix GmbH (Köln, Deutschland) (allows remote)
items.content:
Über 80 dedizierte Frontend- und Backend Entwickler, User Experience Designer
und agile Projektmanager machen uns zum erfolgreichsten auf App-Entwicklung und
mobile Großproduktionen spezialisierten kreativen Systemintegrator im
deutschsprachigen Raum.

Als Partner für führende Premium-Brands der Industrie sind wir die Köpfe
hinter den spannendsten und innovativsten Produktionen im Umfeld des Connected
Home, Internet of Things, Retail und Mobile Commerce. Zur sofortigen
Verstärkung in unserem familiären Teamdeutschlandweit erfahrene und
leidenschaftlicheBACKEND DEVELOPER (M/W)

Was dich erwartet

* Wir realisieren IoT- und Dienste-Plattformen als Bestandteil digitaler
Produkte, die von Millionen Nutzern geliebt werden. An diesen hoch
skalierenden, sicheren und professionell deployten Lösungen arbeitest du
maßgeblich mit.
* Wir verwenden keine monolithischen Enterprise-Architekturen. Unser Team
nutzt vor allem Elixir, Python und JavaScript.
* Wir glauben an die Wahl der richtigen Werkzeuge und sind frei von
religiösen Technologieentscheidungen.
* Du wirst Teil unserer hochqualifizierten und passionierten
Entwicklungsteams und übernimmst eine tragende Rolle in der Entstehung von
innovativen, skalierenden und sicheren digitalen Produkten.
* Unter Deiner Mitwirkung entstehen Lösungen, die in unseren eigenen
Rechenzentren betrieben und von unserem DevOps-Team rund um die Uhr betreut
werden.
* Unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen sind keine Mitarbeiter, sondern
Mitgestalter in einem Unternehmen mit unbürokratischen Strukturen und kurzen
Entscheidungswegen.
* Wir glauben an kontinuierliches Lernen und fördern den aktiven
Wissensaustausch mit regelmäßigen Lightning Talks und internen Hackathons.
Skills & Requirements

Was wir uns von dir wünschen

* Du blickst gerne mal über den Tellerrand hinaus und kennst mehr als eine
Plattform oder Programmiersprache.
* Bei uns zählen deine Fähigkeiten. Ein abgeschlossenes Studium der
Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation sind ein Pluspunkt, aber keine
Voraussetzung.
* Dir sind Tests, Clean Code und Struktur bei der Software-Entwicklung
wichtig.
* Du kennst Dich mit HTTP und beim Design von REST APIs aus.
* Weiterhin sind Erfahrung mit automatisierter Provisionierung und Continuous
Integration von Vorteil.
* Du liebst die Arbeit in interdisziplinären, agilen Entwicklungsteams und
übernimmst gerne eigene Verantwortung.
* Du schätzt und förderst den offenen Informationsaustausch unter Kollegen.
* Mit unseren Kunden als auch unseren Mitarbeiter kommunizierst du problemlos
auf Deutsch sowie auf Englisch.
About grandcentrix GmbH

Was wir dir bieten

* Attraktive, leistungsbezogene Kompensation abseits von statischen
Gehaltstabellen oder Betriebszugehörigkeit.
* Gerne unterstützen wir dich bei deinem Umzug und bieten dir eine
Umzugshilfe in Form eines individuellen Relocation-Packages an!
* Raum für persönliche Entwicklung und Karrierepfade in einem stetig
wachsenden und dynamischen Unternehmen.
* Ein Angebot für die betriebliche Altersvorsorge (BAV) sowie ein JobTicket. 
* Brandneue Entwicklungshardware (MacBook Pro/Thinkpad) und den Zugriff auf
unser eigenes Developer-Operations-Team, das dir hilft, selbst die komplexesten
Deployments perfekt und professionell zu automatisieren.
* Ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld in attraktiver Atmosphäre mit Dachterrasse
(Köln) und direktem Seeblick (Dortmund), das von unserer Softdrink Flatrate,
unserer prall gefüllten Eistruhe und frischem Obst abgerundet wird.
* Vertrauensarbeitszeit und eine Home-Office-Regelung, bei der du für den
Termin mit dem Telekom-Techniker keinen Urlaub einreichen musst.
* Und natürlich das beste Team der Welt!

items.title: Fullstack Developer at AhaWorld (Uppsala, Sweden) (allows remote)
items.content:
Vill DU vara med och skapa aha-upplevelser?

Vi söker nu en fullstack utvecklare att stärka vårt team med. Du kommer delta
i utvecklingen av våra spelplattformar vilket inkluderar både backend och
frontend. Arbetsuppgifterna kan variera mellan allt från att skapa nya
backofficeverktyg, integrera mot en ny samarbetspartner, skapa nya funktioner
eller underhålla och förbättra existerande kodbas. Vi bygger ofta för webben,
men också appar för både Android, iOS och Windows Phone. För oss spelar det
ingen roll vilket av dessa du är mest intresserad av. Vi letar ständigt efter
duktiga utvecklare och för dem kan vi erbjuda spännande uppdrag inom de flesta
områden.

Personen vi söker har ett brinnande intresse för programmering, är inte rädd
att tackla problem och lära sig nya saker. Du som person är nyfiken och driven
i ditt arbete, jobbar bra både i team och individuellt, och trivs med frihet
under ansvar. 

Beredskap ingår i tjänsten samt möjligheter att över tid även få arbeta
utomlands. 

Ditt ansvar

* Utveckling av/inom backend plattform som innehåller extremt mycket
transaktioner
* API design för back-end services
* Utveckla våra produkter bingo och casino samt utveckla nya spelvertikaler
* Säkerställa hög kvalitet och leveranssäkerhet
* Kompetensförsörjning/förmedling
* Högst involverad i alla nyutveckling
Skills & Requirements

Kvalifikationer

* Erfarenhet av utveckling inom högintensivt transaktionssystem
* Goda erfarenheter av flera programmeringsspråk, design, best practices
* Erfarenhet av RESTful APIs design
* Färdigheter inom SQL och design av databaser
* Erfarenhet av versionshanteringssystem som GIT och SVN
* Kunskaper inom frontend utvecklare som HTML5, PHP, Javascript, Scala, Java
* Administration av Linux-servrar
* Du måste ha befintligt arbetstillstånd för EU/SE
Meriterande

* Casino domain kompetens
* Stark analytisk förmåga och utpräglad lösningsorienterare
* Fullstack kompetens
* Verbal kompetens
* Genomförare
* Noggrann och metodisk
About AhaWorld

ahaWorld AB är moderbolaget i koncernen, Bolaget grundades i slutet av 2007
och investerar inom internetbaserat spel. Kärninvesteringarna är nätcasinot
ahaCasino.com, MoboCasino.com, SwedenCasino.com och ahaBingo.com som levererar
den bästa spelunderhållningen på nätet i en unik paketering,
aha-upplevelsen. Våra kunder spelar casino, slots och bingo med en
aha-upplevelse.

ahaWorld's affärsidé är att via sina dotterbolag bedriva internetbaserat spel,
och investera i nätbaserade spelföretag som har en lönsamhetspotential och
skapa ett långsiktigt aktieägarvärde

Koncernens operatörer drivs av Malta-baserade Aha Limited och dess dotterbolag
med licens från Malta Gaming Authority (MGA) och Curaçao eGaming.
apply now <> more jobs at AhaWorld <>

items.title: Senior Back-end Engineer (Ruby) at Tooploox (Wrocaw, Poland) (allows remote)
items.content:
CALL TO ARMS

Our recon squad is on a mission to recruit the best of the best Senior
Back-end Warriors to join Tooploox’s Ruby team. We are working with one of our
strategic partners operating on a US territory.NowThis
is a leading distributed media company which
produces, distributes and validates short-form video specifically for an
audience that lives at the intersection of mobile and social.

Your role, as a Senior Back-end Engineer and core member of the team, will be
about building state-of-the-art foundations, infrastructure and suite of
technological products as part of our partnership with a social-first media
startup.

Skills & Requirements

MISSION OBJECTIVE

Disrupt the way high-quality content is produced and distributed to audiences
living at the intersection of social and mobile.

* Design distributed systems using CQRS and Event Sourcing.
* Take ownership of a set of micro-services and frameworks.
* Implement new APIs, libraries and tools.
* Develop complex metadata and content distribution platforms.
* Design and implement real-time analytics system handling millions of events
per second.
* Work in cross-disciplinary teams to deliver products that help content
producers deliver stunning experiences.
* Learn new skills and technologies as you go.
AREA OF OPERATIONS

CQRS-powered, event-sourced, microservices-oriented platform located around
10,000 miles to the north of the monolithic Rails territory.

THE SQUAD

SEAL Team Bravo comprising of battle-tested, extremely efficient Ruby rebels
you can find. The intelligence, such as computer vision, audio recognition and
machine learning, is provided by Data Science Team. Air support is provided by
SysOps/DevOps team.

We run over marshes, swim through oceans and fly in space.

We Scrum, we iterate, we deliver.

ARE YOU UP FOR THE CHALLENGE?

Are you one of elite few? Have you got what it takes? Do YOU kick ass too? Our
recon troops are waiting for the proof. Provide your file, point us to your
GitHub projects, send us the code you wrote in your free time and show us you
care about the Cause.
