items.title: Full-stack Web Developer, Passionate about Clean Code at Ticketbis (Bilbo, Spain) (allows remote)
items.content:
¿Quieres trabajar en la start-up lider del mercado secundario de ticketing,
abierta al trabajo en remoto?

¿Te consideras un developer altamente cualificado y quieres trabajar con los
mejores, desarrollando producto propio? 

Si has respondido afirmativamente a las preguntas anteriores te recomendamos
seguir leyendo, ahora en inglés...

MAIN FUNCTIONS

How we build...

* Test Driven Development: we work on own tests to guarantee future
developments.
* Continuous Integration: we execute our tests with each push to detect
quickly any possible bug.
* Continuous Deployment: we deploy often during the week. Our QA processes
validate each release candidate.
* Bi-weekly iterations: we work in sprints with well-defined user stories.
* Data Driven: we use metrics to guide our developments and validate new
functionalities deployed in production.
* Pair Review: we do peer review of code before each merge.
Our technologies...

* Groovy as the programming language. Nontheless, any experience with dynamic
languages is more than OK.
* Python in many of our projects and scripts. We are fans of this language :)
* Grails as a framework, although experience with MVC frameworks is enough
(preferably Spring).
* JQuery as JScript libraries (if you have used some others, we would like to
hear your opinion).
* ORM Hibernate, although if you have experience with iBatis or any other
similar, you will fit for sure.
* We work with Agile methodologies, in projects with intern customer.
* Continuous integration with Jenkins (Hudson).
* Cloud with Amazon AWS.
* MySQL as the relational database.
* Redis to manage NoSQL data.
* Elasticsearch.
Other components of our stack...

* Slack.
* NewRelic.
* JIRA Agile + FishEye.
* Sonar.
* Sensu.
* Google Apps.
* Chef.
* Ansible.
WE OFFER

* The chance of developing a professional career within one of the most
important European startups. 
* Young & dynamic working environment. 350 employees from more than 30
countries.
* Your customer is your own company. Projects that have relationship among
themselves.
* You are free to use your own development environment. The more comfortable
you feel, so much the better for everyone.
* Flexible working day. We trust your responsability. We work at Bilbao's
headquarters for a closer relationship but we feel comfortable with occasional
teleworking.
* You will have responsability quickly: we hope that you will be deploying in
production from day one.
* You will take part in decissions for the next sprints and developments.
* Indefinite contract.
* Initial and continuous training.
* Real possibilities of professional development.
* Yearly budget for training and participation in some of the most
interesting events and conferences in technology in our area.
* Negotiable salary, based on the candidate’s experience and qualifications.
If you are the one that we are looking for, we will reach an agreement.
Skills & Requirements

REQUISITES

* Academic background in Computer Science or STEM fields is OK but not
exclusive. Advanced programming skills is the key factor. Anyway, strong
academic credentials are a plus.
* At least one year of experience, although we are searching for various
profiles (from 1 year of experience to... no limit above!).
* Some knowledge of J2EE, Spring, Hibernate technologies is a good point.
Experience in web applications developed in Java.
* Good knowledge of presentation technologies: HTML, Javascript, CSS, AJAX.
* Good knowledge of relational databases such as MySQL. You speak SQL
fluently, right?
* Experience with version control tools.
* Some knowledge of application servers.
* Experience using Javascript frameworks such as JQuery.
* We give a great value to interesting Github / Bitbucket / Stackoverflow
profiles, or personal portfolios.
* Strong interest in writing clean and maintainable code is what we would
love to find in your repos.
* Ability to solve complex problems and develop complex applications.
* You are comfortable using Technical English, of course.
* Participation in social networks, (open source) communities, local groups,
personal projects... interest in technology in general is valuable.
* Excellent interpersonal skills. Willing to improve your performance each
day.
About Ticketbis

Ticketbis is a Spanish internet start-up which operates in the secondary
market of the ticketing industry. We cover a wide range of events and shows:
sports, concerts, bullfighting, cultural events, congress, etc. Despite of only
existing since 2009, Ticketbis has experimented an out- standing growth since
its creation, we have offices in Madrid, Bilbao, Mexico D.F, Sao Paulo, Buenos
Aires, Chile, Colombia, Japan, Hong Kong, Korea, China, Singapore and operating
in more than 40 markets, such us: Spain, Portugal, Italy, United Kingdom,
Germany, Russia, Ukraine, Poland, Greece, Turkey, Norway, Sweden, Netherlands,
Korea, Malaysia, Indonesia...

Ticketbis offers an innovative solution for buying and selling online tickets
through its global ticketing platform. Its aim is to create a transparent
market where fans can exchange their tickets with a full guaranty and security.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer (Chicago Loop) at Instructure (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
items.content:
Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use
software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated
to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more
usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually
use). A better connected and more open education technology ecosystem. And more
effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries,
share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by
giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So
here’s your opportunity. We’re hiring senior engineers, who are passionate
about technology and education, to help build new features into our existing
products (Canvas, Bridge, and Arc). Our product team doesn't throw specs over
some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over
some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. We highly value
innovation, so much so that we have quarterly Hackweeks.  A week each quarter
to work on relevant pet projects and features. Most of our work is open source,
even our primary product (Canvas). Check us out on Github:
http://www.github.com/instructure . Join us
at our downtown Chicago office. Address: 1 Prudential Plaza, 130 E. Randolph
St. Suite 1800, Chicago, IL 60601
What We Do:

* We are full stack engineers with experience building web scale services in
a loosely coupled but highly integrated system, as well as developing web scale
single-page web apps with modern web technology.
* We are a mixed stack and polyglot team with a deep commitment to quality
and to using the right tech for each problem we solve.
* We use Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, Node.js, Go, PostgreSQL, Linux, and our
platform runs on AWS.
Skills & Requirements

What We Look For:

* Breadth of experience (and interest) in different languages and frameworks.
 
* Skilled full stack developer, or an expert back-end and DevOps developer.
* Ability to solve complex problems requiring in-depth analysis.
* Over 7 years of professional software engineering experience.
* Demonstrated experience as the go to person and in mentoring others.
* Mastery of your chosen tools.
* Knowledge of Agile best practices.
* Capable Communicator.
* Crazy passionate about learning new stuff.
* Strong knowledge of, and adherence to, coding best practices.
* Ability and desire to work in an open and team-oriented environment.
* BS in Computer Science or related degree preferred.
About Instructure

GET IN ON ALL THE AWESOME AT INSTRUCTURE.

* Competitive salary, equity, and 401k

* HSA program, vision, voluntary life, and AD&D

items.title: Full Stack Developer
items.content:
ABOUT URBAN MASSAGE

Our purpose is to connect people with high quality health and well-being professionals for convenient treatments that meet their needs, wherever and whenever they want them. We make this possible by our slick technology platforms (apps and website) and brilliant people. Since our start-up formed in 2014 we've grown significantly and now make over 7,000 bookings a month possible with exciting plans to grow. As a place to work, we provide those who share our passion with big roles with huge scope to impact our success, the freedom to apply their talent and ideas however they see appropriate, really fun colleagues and an engaging work environment.

THE ROLE

We are looking for a great front-end focused Full Stack Developer to join our Product team. We're working hard to take our product to the next stage as our start-up expands in the UK and internationally so it's a really exciting time to join us and be part of that experience!
Our product team presently has 10 highly-skilled employees working across design/engineering and testing. You'd work closely with other multi-discipline engineers. Our fast-moving team bring together strategy, creative and technology in agile programmes of work. We embrace strong development standards, TDD, continuous integration, peer review, test automation and replicable deployment processes.
Within this role, you'd be encouraged to explore new technologies where good business value is evident. We currently use two well-known front-end frameworks, React and Angular. We'd like you to have experienced and be comfortable with both.
You will also get to work on our leading-edge backend platform, formed of an api-gateway + microservice architecture, and written in Typescript (running on Node.js). Our data layer uses a combination of different storage engines (typically picked for the best fit to each individual use case + service), including MySQL, PostgreSQL, Neo4J, MongoDB and Redis.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Code in Javascript + Typescript
Apply industry standard best practices
Collaborate with colleagues across various areas of the business
Lead within your discipline – architect using modern front-end stacks and help coordinate delivery
Contribute to our overarching technical architecture and vision

REQUIREMENTS

We expect our Engineers to have experience in:
Using front-end frameworks - both React and Angular
Good knowledge of source versioning
Modern development processes – TDD, Code-reviewing, Agile
Picking up new technologies when appropriate for the task in hand
We also expect you to genuinely enjoy your craft, to take initiative, and want to help do things better

BENEFITS

Competitive salary (based on experience)
Join a fast-growing and exciting start-up with excellent growth opportunities
Working with a fun, international and highly-motivated team where there's never a dull moment!
Well-speced Apple hardware
A generous conference and training budget
Free weekly yoga sessions
Discounts on at-home massages
Fully stocked fridges
Central London office with great transport links

items.title: Front End Developer
items.content:
ABOUT URBAN MASSAGE

We're very proud to be a fast growing start-up making our mark on the well-being industry. Our world-class platform enables brilliantly talented therapists to provide caring treatments to customers wherever and whenever they want a well deserved treat. In the past 2 years we've launched in 3 international locations, provide over 7,000 massages a month. We're now looking at many other international locations this year and a range of different wellness services.
As a team, we're just under 50 global employees. We do all we can to make our work environment one we love, can be ourselves in, and can be really successful in. This means lots of working and playing hard (at our Friday drinks and socials) and a chilled office full of ping-pong tables, free yoga classes and pets. Our roles come with a lot of responsibility and empowerment - we like to employ brilliant people and give them the freedom to achieve brilliant things. You can find more passionate detail about working here on Glassdoor - or just ask us!

THE ROLE

We are looking for a great front-end focused Front End Developer to join our Product team. We're working hard to take our product to the next stage as our start-up expands in the UK and internationally so it's a really exciting time to join us and be part of that experience!
Our product team presently has 10 highly-skilled employees working across design/engineering and testing. You'd work closely with other multi-discipline engineers. Our fast-moving team bring together strategy, creative and technology in agile programmes of work. We embrace strong development standards, TDD, continuous integration, peer review, test automation and replicable deployment processes.
Within this role, you'd be encouraged to explore new technologies where good business value is evident. We currently use two well-known front-end frameworks, React and Angular. We'd like you to have experienced and be comfortable with both.
You will also get exposure to our leading-edge backend platform, formed of an api-gateway + microservice architecture, and written in Typescript (running on Node.js). Our data layer uses a combination of different storage engines (typically picked for the best fit to each individual use case + service), including MySQL, PostgreSQL, Neo4J, MongoDB and Redis.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Code in Javascript
Apply industry standard best practices
Collaborate with colleagues across various areas of the business
Lead within your discipline – architect using modern front-end stacks and help coordinate delivery
Contribute to our overarching technical architecture and vision

REQUIREMENTS

We expect our Engineers to have experience in:
Using industry leading front-end frameworks - both React and Angular
Good knowledge of source versioning
Modern development processes – TDD, Code-reviewing, Agile
Picking up new technologies when appropriate for the task in hand
We also expect you to genuinely enjoy your craft, to take initiative, and want to help do things better

BENEFITS

Competitive salary (based on experience)
Join a fast-growing and exciting start-up with excellent growth opportunities
Working with a fun, international and highly-motivated team where there's never a dull moment!
Well-speced Apple hardware
A generous conference and training budget
Free weekly yoga sessions
Discounts on at-home massages
Fully stocked fridges
Central London office with great transport links

JM 24 reviews <> - Cheshire

a permanent basis in Cheshire to work on an exciting programme.

the following: J2EE, JEE, JSF, JBoss, XML. JDBC, SQL, Jasper Reports, Swing

dispersed team.

to understand and communicate complex technical information.
* Demonstrated ability to solve moderate to complex application problems
independently.

Java Developer with the required skills, please respond in the first instance
with the most recent version of your CV.

The JM Group is operating and advertising as an Employment Agency for
permanent positions and as an Employment Business for interim / contract /
temporary positions. The JM Group is an Equal Opportunities employer and we
encourage applicants from all backgrounds.

items.title: Happiness Works: Full stack developer
items.content:
Full stack developer

Posted Feb 9

Happiness Works
Headquarters: London
http://jobs.happinessworks.com/full-stack-developer/

You’re a product-obsessed software engineer. You can work in all layers of the
stack. You’ve worked on a number of fully-formed software products that have
been released into the wild. You’ll be working with the entire team in creating
new customer-facing features, from idea, through prototype, to release and
maintenance.
About us
At Happiness Works we're passionate about creating a better world of work. We
believe if more people genuinely enjoyed their work then everyone would
benefit, including employees, customers and shareholders. 
Founded by Nic Marks, a world expert in well-being measurement and TED
speaker, we’re taking over ten years experience of applied research and turning
it into products to help make better workplaces.
About the job

* You’ll be joining a friendly high performing team who are passionate about
what they do.
* You’ll be working closely with the CTO building our innovative online and
mobile applications.
* You’ll get to work with the latest methodologies and tools.
* You’ll have the opportunity to help develop our product roadmap and shape
the company strategy.
* You’ll be able to make a direct impact on the world, making people’s
working lives better.
About you

* You need to be self-motivated and enthusiastic about both technology and
social science.
* You should be experienced with Ruby on Rails (our backend runs on Rails
with PostgreSQL and Redis on AWS).
* You should have a good understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript (we use
Coffeescript, SASS, and HAML).
* Strong JavaScript fundamentals, solid understanding of the JavaScript type
system, prototypes, scopes, ES6
* You should have experience of writing unit tests and test driven
development (we write automated tests for all our code).
* You should understand SQL database design and know how to write and
optimise queries.
* You should have experience of Linux server administration.
* You should have an appreciation of good design and high attention to detail.
Ideally you will have one or more of…

* Experience of building Single Page Applications with REST services using
React or similar frameworks.
* Experience building mobile apps for either iOS or Android.
* Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS.
What we offer

* Salary 50k-60k.
* 30 days’ holiday a year.
* Flexible working hours and locations.
* Choose your equipment
No recruiters please.

items.title: Ruby on Rails Ninjaneer at AgilityFeat (Buenos Aires, Argentina) (allows remote)
items.content:
AgilityFeat is looking to hire an exceptional to be software developer on our
team person.Full time. Telecommuting. 're looking for someone who values
​​diversity in itschallenges daily and someone who is comfortable programming
and talking to others about your code. We are looking for someonebright with a
proven track record in developing software highquality , easy to use: beautiful
applications.


Skills & Requirements

The Software Developer is responsible for developing the front end and back
end of opensource stacks. This is a full time position.

Essential Functions:

* Make daily commit and merge code using Git.
* Develop software front end with Javascript and CSS frameworks.
* Communicate through web services.
* Develop back end software using Ruby on Rails.
* Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks in real time [Architectures Pub /
Sub] is desirable.
* Familiarity with Responsive Design, HTML5 and CSS3.
Job Requirements

* Linux PC or Mac with fast and stable connection to the Internet.
* Account Skype and Google Hangouts, headphone and microphone for everyday
communication.
* Availability via audio / chat / videochat entire workday.
* Ability to communicate both verbally and written with Costa Rica team
constantly.
About AgilityFeat

About AgilityFeat

AgilityFeat was founded in 2010 by Arin Sime. Arin lives in Virginia, and
travels around the companies American training methodologies agile and Scrum
and Kanban.

In 2011, Arin was associated with David Alfaro of Costa Rica to begin
providing development services software nearshore to customers AgilityFeat in
the USA. David is a leading IT experience in Costa Rica, and well known in
Costa Rica as one of the first to bring Agile to America Central.

David and Arin ensure that AgilityFeat always strives to deliver high quality
services and high efficiency for our customers.  But our team full command so
that really makes us special. Read our Commando's Creed to know the values that
have made us successfulhttp://www.agilityfeat.com/creed


Our team builds communication applications for the web and mobile, using real
time technologies like WebRTC, TokBox, PubNub, and more.

We do one thing: Product Development. But we do that one thing in three
different ways: Design, Development, and Training. It's the joy of creating
better software products that run as a common thread through everything we do.
Through design assessments and implementation, to development projects, to
training client teams on how to build better software, our goal is always to
help  create products customers will love.


Oh..we actually do like long walks on the beach, and annually take our team on
trips in Costa Rica or other interesting places in Latin America.
apply now <> more jobs at AgilityFeat <>
Join us at AgilityFeat

We have great benefits
100% Remote - Work From Home Paid Company Outings Flexible Work Hours
Passionate People Cutting Edge Technologies Ideal Environment for Creative Minds
Learn more about AgilityFeat <> more jobs at AgilityFeat

items.content:
<> C++ Developer - Java, Multithreading, Low Latency
Oliver Bernard - London
£65,000 - £80,000 a year - Permanent
One of the world's most successful financial service companies are seeking an
experienced C++ Developer to join their market leading team. Their multi-award
winning services have separated them from the competition in recent years and
consolidated their position as the market leader.

This is an opportunity for a talented C++ Developer to join an established
company to work on its cutting edge, real time, low latency, highly
multithreaded software.

The ideal C++ Developer will have:
Extensive commercial experience with C++ including STL, OOD/OOP
Solid commercial experience with Java
Real-time multi-threaded software development experience
Experience of the full software development lifecycle.
Strong analytical abilities and experiences in algorithm design, software
design and implementation.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a C++ Developer to work in a team of
highly skilled people, all with strong opinions about various technologies,
frameworks and approaches to delivery.

There will continually be new challenges as the company strives to maintain
its position as the market leader.
The environment is focussed but not corporate, they pride themselves on being

There is a high degree of flexible working and remote working opportunities.

and you understand that work/life balance is important please send your CV .

items.title: Start-Up Full Stack Developer - Graduate to Experienced - ChilliFrog Ltd - London
items.content:
<> Start-Up Full Stack Developer - Graduate to Experienced
ChilliFrog Ltd - London
£36,000 - £90,000 a year
Full Stack Developer. Graduate/Junior level - Experienced.

Founded in 2016, Jazz Networks is building new sensational technology in the
enterprise space. Our foundations stem from previous massive success stories
where we have been involved in ventures in the UC industry. With an enormous
private investment, we are now set to disrupt enterprise architecture. Success
will mean pushing the boundaries of security and machine learning and making
the world secure one data centre at a time. Our means are not just great
technology, but to radically rethink the UX of the security administrator to
engage them in a way that augments machine with human intelligence.

- Are you a passionate full stack software developer who wants to build the
next breakthrough in enterprise data technology?
- Are you into Big Back End Distributed systems, Machine learning, AI, Fault
Tolerance, Performance Optimisation and generally just thinking about BIG
architecture?
- We are looking for extremely bright engineers from graduate level up to
experienced architects to join us as full stack developers in our R&D team in
either London (West) or Oslo, Norway.

Candidate Profile

You will be a passionate technologist, with impressive programming abilities.
You will have no fear jumping into any dark cave in the entire software stack.
You're not committed to any one tool, but like to use the right tool for the
job. Like a scout, you always leave the cave a little cleaner than you found
it. You're interested in software building as a craft, and get as much pleasure
from implementing airtight tests as you do from implementing shiny new
features. You get immense pleasure from using chaos-engineering principles to
make the entire system robust.

You will have achieved excellent academic results from a leading university
and additionally done well at A 'levels or high school stage, with AAB grades
at a minimum. You will want a career where your creative abilities will make a
difference to the world of technology and you will be part of a truly
impressive R&D environment.

Essential skills sought

Strong competence as a Full Stack Engineer with an affinity for the backend.
Your Language experience isn't a primary search but you're not phased by having
to pick up a new language or two along the way.

Desirable experience sought

· Designing REST APIs, using server-side events (SSE), gRPC or other protocols

· Knowledge of golang, java, swift, C, javascript

· Knowledge of PKI, SSL/TLS, enrolment and other crypto concepts

· Appreciation of test-driven development, continuous integration/deployment,
kanban

· Knowledge of nosql databases such as mongodb, cassandra and graph databases
such as neo4j

· Machine learning libraries for logistical regression, SVM, matrix
factorization, PCA and DNN

The offer: Bleeding edge technical challenge, flexible work environment with
remote working feasible, exceedingly competitive salary, shares, roller coaster
ride in a fun-filled environment, a career move you will remember
The Independent Jobs - 12 hours ago

items.title: Graduate Full Stack Developer - Start Up - ChilliFrog Ltd - Uxbridge
items.content:

ChilliFrog Ltd - Uxbridge
£36,000 - £45,000 a year
Full Stack Developer. Graduate/Junior level - Experienced.

JAZZ NETWORKS is a tech start-up, founded in May 2016 following an
acquisition in January 2016, where our previous company was bought for $716
million after 3 years of product development in the Unified Communication
space. We are now set to tackle a new problem, the challenge of solving Data /

approach that will drive Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning across
the guts of data flow and user behaviour to add effective management of
security layers. This is a new idea and has not been solved yet, so we will be
creating a product that will challenge the industry norm and break boundaries.
Nothing new for us though based on our past activities.

We are still very young and growth will be constant and rapid. Our offices

items.title: Lead Web App Developer Tropical Agriculture Start Up
items.content:
We are looking for a talented web app developer to help us deliver scalable
solutions to some of agriculture's biggest problems.


By working with us you will start by applying your skill set to the complex
world of Tropical Agriculture, creating a web app to visualise environmental
data to help coffee farmers battle Climate Change.


You will be working within a multi-disciplinary team and directly communicate
with your users. If you choose to continue with us you will also be
encouraged to join us (all expense paid) during our work abroad with our users
in the fields of Central America, Africa and Asia. 


The position would be initially for a contract with set deliverables, giving
both parties an opportunity to get to know each other. However, we are also
looking to employ on a longer term basis and, if desired, would look to extend
into a longer term salaried position. 


We are flexible to both full-time and part-time applicants and happy for
remote working (with regular communication), but we would prefer to work with
you in person.

items.title: Junior Front End Developer
items.content:
New opportunities now available to join the Dream Random team in 2017. We are looking for a new Junior Front End Developer to join the Dream Random team. You are the person we’re looking for if you are able to demonstrate skills undertaking front end build in a responsive approach. You will be no stranger to creating or evolving designs in browser and should be comfortable working with Sass, JavaScript & WordPress.

THE PERSON WE ARE LOOKING FOR WILL HAVE
· Strong skills in hand-coded HTML5 and CSS3
· Strong knowledge and practical experience of responsive design techniques
· Skills in working with WordPress for use as a CMS
· Understanding of progressive enhancement and modern approaches to browser support
· Skills working with JavaScript
· Experience with PHP

SKILLS FOR MORE BROWNIE POINTS
· Obsessive (bordering OCD) when it comes to clean, efficient code
· Creative design & illustration skills.
· Experience with server administration and deployment – particularly cPanel.
· Experience of other open source CMS applications.
· Above all, you live and breathe technology, experiment at home/work and share your knowledge and experience with the wider community (via blogging).
· Experience in version control via Git/Github.
· Experience with Sass for CSS-preprocessing.


The role also gives the opportunity to branch out into various other aspects of the business, depending on Dream Random’s needs and your own personal aspirations.
